And sure enough, at five they managed to make it into the music industry. Just kids songs at first, yet they became hits around the country. The camera loved them, with the amount of different sorts of appearances they'd make. 

Of course, the joy of stardom was mostly faked. Draco would force themselves into the perfect child role to please their parents, or a beating would be imminent. And that wouldn't please the crowd.  

They skipped another grade, landing themselves in the same year as their sister. They managed to get into Zios High at fourteen.  

And at Zios High, they chose to hide their life of stardom except to those who recognized them. The place was across the country anyway.  

Zios High was the only place they could act out. They could let their temper out without them losing their status. 

Then the day of the fights came. They weren't in that club, sure, but they were mad. They were mad cause their sister, and so many others, had died or were going to die. 

And it was all at the hands of Liza.

They couldn't fight Liza, though! That would cause scandal all over the world! Outrage!

They could fight the kid who murdered zer, though. They could beat them into a pulp and then at last, gain their revenge. 

Because their life was crazy, and they had to roll with the punches. Sometimes, they had to make the punches, too.
[[Category:Downwards-Upz-Mist]]

''FAT NOTE THE ART ISNT MINE ITS JUST THE PROJECT SEKAI COVER FOR THE SONG. COLORFUL PALETTE DONT KILL ME''

''Picture this as your life: You're a high-school student, running through an odd school with someone chasing you throughout the halls. As you go up the stairs, you see the mysterious person.. only saying one word to you As they push you off the stairs with a strange object.. But.. suddenly you end up back in your bed where you were before that strange dream without remembering the very dream you had.''  

''As a new girl in school appears, you cant find records on her: Nothing of her seems to exist, and is only referred as "she." But, when entering a dream-like world after you slept. it would be the same day.''   

''everyday.''  [[File:Kagerou Daze (pjsekai cover not my image).webp|center|thumb|389x389px]]
[[File:Kagerou Daze music.ogg|center|thumb|original version: listen to this as you read along[[File:Kagerou Daze (Project sekai version).ogg|center|thumb|project sekai version if the original isnt for you ^_^]]
[[File:Kagerou daze full (prosek vers).mp3|center|thumb|full version incase the first two weren't enough (pro sekai version)]]]]
== Author's note ==
Hi, so this is a small story I would be working on incase I am bored. I had gotten this story idea from project sekai when I listened to the song "Kagerou Daze" which translates into "Heat-haze daze." Its about a guy stuck in a time-loop trying to save someone from getting hit by a truck or something among the lines of that. This version will be different however since it's my own take on the story. 

To see all character sheets, please go to [https://wildworks-writing.fandom.com/wiki/User_blog:L%C3%B8vey_petals./kagerou_daze_characters Kagerou Daze Characters.] It will contain brief summaries for each character that will be added in the future. It is best to check these out for an infographic on each character. 

But the catch here is he did not die, but he would be repeating the loop over and over again, meet some people who also have this loop, but does not know who had put them in a never-ending time loop, to which they have to break it before it is too late.

Disclamer: this is simply a version of the story I had thought of because i listened to the song and thought, "hey, why not write a story on it?" Since i got fascinated with the concept of time loops. also, the story takes place on the first of September instead. since I live in North America, some schools here actually start in September instead of august: i know some schools can start in august but i prefer to make it September, so i apologize if it kills the point of the song anyways. Since it starts on the first of September, the weather can still be extremely hot during that time because summer has not officially ended yet. 

some small warnings: '''this will contain a lot of blood, some swear words that are obviously censored, and alot of stuff that is not child friendly so if youre sensitive to this content, please click out immediately and read another page.''' this will also be very dialogue heavy so please beware that theres not gonna be alot of description scenes + alot of first perspective thoughts. Some metaphors, similes and dialogue will sound extremely wonky its because im still trying to practice and all. So yeah, enjoy this piece of garbage fire. yes this idea was better in my head, not for writing at all.

one more time: this is just a story i basically made in my head when I listened to the song, specifically the project sekai version. no, its not based off of the kagerou project except the time loop part where someone dies and they keep having to live the same exact moments everyday but they still try to find a way to break the loop.  

also i added two versions of the song. so if you wanna listen to either one when reading some of this, please do. its a good song and all but if its too short ill upload a full version.  

its essentially about trying to break the loop that someone had put them in, and not trying to save someone from dying. Of course the story of Kagerou Daze is about someone trapped in a time loop trying to save someone from meeting the same fate. i am not really familiar with the Kagerou Project story but please let me know about more of it and if the other songs connect to this. 
----

== 0. Kagerou Daze ==
[[File:??.png|center|thumb|663x663px|Blinding blue skies (credit: moronicSY Kagerou days music video)]]
''Ergh.. Hrr..'' 

''Agh.. What just happened..''

''I feel so drowsy.. And tired..'' 

''My head hurts.. maybe it was the coffee I-''

''W-Wait a second..''

''.. W-Where.. am I?''

''How did I even get here?''

''This.. looks like a school hallway..''

''But.. why am I in school so late in the night?''

''They're usually closed at this time of day.''

''Just a couple of hours ago, I was asleep in my bed after a long shift at work..''

''Is this just a dream?'' 

''Or some stupid prank someone had pulled on me by taking me to the school?''

''Well- the second one is unlikely.. I do not have much friends of my own..''

''Though.. this place does look rather fascinating to the eye..''

'''''*''Peeking in pocket*''' ''Well-'' ''Atleast I still have my notebook..''

''I might as-well just explore for my own benefit, since theres nothing to do inside of here..''

''Hmm...'' 

'''''NOTEBOOK''':'' 

''Observations:''

''- Many windows, showing the stars and the moon''.

- ''A large window for a better view of the outside scenery.''

- ''Old lockers without any lock.'' 

''- A strange scent that arouses the entire school.'' 

- ''Odd silence that echoes throughout the building.''

- ''Hot temperature in the building despite being the first of September.''

- ''No air conditioning, No doors that lead to an exit.''

- ''Many stairwells, a lot of stairs.''

- ''Classrooms with no one inside and untouched equipment, all locked doors.''

- ''No security guards that patrol the area.'' 

''- Weird notes that fill the front of the lockers.''

-''Many overhead line''s ''neatly lined up outside, a set of train tracks underneath, triangular signs mixed with red and white following.'' 

''There was no train passing by.'' 

-''The sound of cicadas that echo throughout the building, despite none being outside, or even in the building.'' 

''-Even though it is night, the sky is a blinding blue color, but the aspects apart of the night are still apparent.''

''I can't seem to get out at all.''

''I cant even see the body of the locker anymore.'' 

''It's just notes that cover everything..''

''Not even in the front of the school..''

''My energy is running out.''

''Just somewhere in this d*mn school''

''Come on.. Come on!'' 

''She keeps chasing me..''

== I. Wren ==


''⇄ ◃◃ ⅠⅠ ▹▹ ↻''

''....''

''Everything..'' 

''is spinning.'' 

''Spinning,'' 

''Spinning,'' 

''Spinning.''

''I feel like i'm going down a'' ''rabbit hole.''

''One that does not seem to end..'' 

''I cannot tell what is going on now..''

''It's like I'm falling in an endless void.''

''Plunged in absolute darkness.'' 

''Is this.. some stupid dream..?'' 

''Or is this reality?''

''This is all so confusing..'' 

''Why is everything reversing?''

''It's like a record player reversing the same song.'' 

''over and over again..''

''No.. this cant be real..''  

''This has to be a dream..'' 

''But why am I not waking up?'' 

''Why am I still falling in this endless hole?'' 

''I'm still alive, but I feel.. dead..''

''Am I dead?'' 

''Am I alive?''

''What could be possibly going on?'' 

''Why can't I wake up..?''

''Wake up.. Wake up..''  

''Come on.. Agh.. JUST..''

'''''WAKE THE H**L UP ALREADY!''''' 
----KYAH!

'''*Heavy breathing that lasted for multiple minutes.*''' 

Gah.. hah..

Hah.. 

W-What.. was that..?  

What.. j-just happened?  

And.. more importantly, w-what.. happened to me..? 

I appear to be fine, but..  

I cant remember what had just occurred..   

Was it another dream?  

I can't remember or recall anything that took place..  

It was all so blurry and- strange...   

It was a fast dream too..  

I cant seem to comprehend what happened in my mind..  

Oh well.  

Perhaps it was just-  

One of those night terrors I keep having more and more frequently.. 

It was probably nothing..      

But.. i'm.. shaking..     

I cant.. stop..     

Perhaps i'm tired..     

I should get more rest..     

I'll just go back to sleep. its four in the morning, so I still have two hours of rest..     

and I'll make sure to wake up on time for once.   
----Zzz.. 

Zzzz.. 

Zzz-

'''&lt;nowiki&gt;*&lt;/nowiki&gt;RING!*'''  

AAAAH!   

'''*Bumping head on the headboard of the bed.*'''  

Yeowch..!    

That hurts like h**l..    

Ow.. Oww.. Owww!   

'''*Rubbing the back of his head*'''   

Argh.. What even was that?!-  

'''*Glaring to the left, where the noise came from.*'''   

Oh- It's just my alarm clock.  

Wow..   

That rung rather quickly..   

Almost gave me a heart attack..!  

'''*Time shown: 6:00 AM.*''' Wait, It's already six?  

was just four in the morning a minute ago.. 

How did the time go by that fast?  

Oh well.  

I guess that's how the world works, apparently.  

When going back to sleep thinking you have enough time, you wake up again and boom! It's already six.  

But any-who, I better get up and go to school..  

I can't fall asleep again and wake up at seven in the morning again, otherwise I would be late.  

The alarm on my table was going off and on like a bomb, my hand reaching towards the counter next to me and slouchily turning it off. It was September First, meaning it was the first day of school after a two month summer break, The rays of warm sunshine  coming from my window hitting my face. Summer still had not ended much to my dismay, but the good thing is I would not be freezing to death when walking to school!

As I got up from my bed, I stared at the clock for a few minutes with a blank expression on my face, but it lit up soon after, rubbing my eyes tiredly.  

Good job, Wren! You woke up early this time without going back to sleep like you usually do. Yay me! Now, I need to get ready for school.. Haha, I cant be late again, Otherwise I'd get more tardies than I have ever gotten. It did, after-all, make my schedule somewhat bad and dragged my grade down by a huge amount.. God, attendance grades suck...   

I went over to the bathroom and washed my face with hot water, a towel slinging over my neck so I didn't get my shirt wet, then drying my face off. Looking at myself in the mirror after washing myself you can only see me: Wren Saetang, even though I just said my name seconds ago while I mumbled pointless platitudes to myself.  

Yep, that's me right there!      

Ever since I had that conflict with my family, I fled my own home, moving to a farther district and taking everything with me: Important documents, records of my existence, the little ounces of money I had left, everything. I had the documents professionally forged so I could get a small full-time job as a café attendant and living off of a decent wage that could afford me a small apartment; Even though it's small, it's still very nice and easy to live in, and I dont have to worry about much.     

When I first started working, I had to study how rent, bills and taxes work since I was unfamiliar on how to do those things back then. I discovered they were rather easy and began paying off everything with ease every-time I had a paycheck, never spending money on unnecessary things, and if I ever did, it would only once in a while, like a small Christmas gift for myself because I don't have anyone else around to celebrate holidays with.     

With bills and school on my plate, It began to become a hassle and I then taught myself how to become a responsible person without the aid of those around me, but it is rather difficult balancing school and working at the same time, because of exams and studying and having to pay all of my bills on time.. It's a real pain in the a** if you think of it, because it is like I am an adult that is trapped in a students body: I'm someone trying to pass ninth grade and attempting to find out what I want to be in life, but i'm also an adult during the afternoon and most of the night-time, working for long hours each day, even more when I need to stay for overtime to clean the place up, wash the dishes, and of course keep many of the desserts and food in stock by making them myself with the help of a co-worker.    

Whats even worse is I have work a couple hours after school, not directly but somewhere in the afternoon.. I technically can work with such a schedule, but I usually forget the part where I had forged all of my documentations so I would have to be working for a long time, and for the rest of my dull life- I oftentimes have nightmares that they find out about my forged documents, but after a year with them I can technically say that they didn't suspect anything from them-  

But enough of my stupid monologues! I gotta get ready for school! I can't be late again, no?  

Crappp.. that sweat from that small nightmare I had made me smell weird.. Aaagh.. Groossssss! Now I feel like someone drenched me in salt water mixed with other unpleasant scents..   

Aaagh.. Why does this always happen to meee..?!    

I always get dirty after working such long shifts or having a nightmare..   

It's always so much sweat too.. practically drenching my shirt..    

Well then, I better go shower now. I can't fall asleep again and then be late to school..   

or even worse, being late AND a sweaty mess, and be the butt of another joke in school.   

I quickly got undressed as I was already in the bathroom, speeding towards the shower and turning it on almost immediately- My puffy brown hair immediately being more flatter than an ironing board. Why does water even do that? I like my fluffy hair.. It takes so long to dry and puff back up again unless if I scrub my towel hard enough on my head.. As soon as I felt the then cold water touch my skin, I instantly flinched: Why is it so cold?!  I put it on the hotter settings but it still comes out like it had just came out of an icebox! Brrr... I hate it so much!   

Though.. as soon as the water became a nice and warm temperature, I felt relieved.. My muscles in my body had eased up and I let out a sigh of relief. As the minutes passed by, I dimly saw the warm mist that filled the tub as it traveled outside of the tub and into the rest of the bathroom.      

Ahh.. This feels so good.. I can find solace in my showers every-time. They always make me feel like i'm finally at peace with myself after so many years..    

The perk of living by yourself is you don't have someone to boss you around on when to get out of the shower, or even have a short time to clean yourself. Before I lived by myself, when I was showering back then, my mother always told me to get out of the shower after ten minutes when I didn't even get started on cleaning myself yet, but just sitting in the hot water and observing every drop that makes contact with me skin.     

She told me to leave the shower so often, it was to a point where I couldn't even be hygienic, let alone take a shower for the proper amount of time: My hair after had looked like it was covered in oil.. drenched in it to be more specific, and my hair then began smelling like vegetable cooking oil you use to fry foods. It was embarrassing since I had gotten berated for not being as hygienic when I just had parents who were so overbearing with everything I did, and sometimes they'd restrict me from showering for a couple of months.. Even worse was the scent on my body, as it started to become unpleasant: I was covered in dead skin mostly, specifically around my neck and maybe on my face because of how filthy I was to those around me..    

Though after leaving my toxic household, I began cleaning myself much more often because I grew a dislike for being dirty, even when its just a bit of sweat that spreads around my body. I always like to be clean wherever I go, It just makes me feel so much better about myself. The hot water flickering on my skin feels like heaven.. It's so pleasant.. I wish I could stay in here forever, but I forgot water bills exist.. I wish they never did, because if those bills were never invented, I would stay in the small shower all day while imagining what I would want to be in the future when I retire from my job..

Well- speaking about my job again, due to cafe jobs not really requiring any degree of any kind, I got the job as a waiter with ease and due to most of my hard work, I had gotten many raises because I was one of the few who stood overtime and did most of the work, and I was becoming a favorable attendant since I was able to clean up conflicts almost instantly, and managed to keep the café a pretty friendly environment- 

Oh..    

Sh**..   

I forgot about the limited time I have, so I need to get myself cleaned, and fast- Quickly, I got the bottle of shampoo on the shelf in the shower and began scrubbing my body to get rid of the unpleasant stench that my body was full with. Instantly, I felt like a new person, straight out of heaven to be precise- Even though it' will only be a quick shower, the feeling still lasts for a pretty long time, until it wears out: then, I started scrubbing my hair rather roughly instead of going gentle.  

'''*Scrub Scrub*''' I have' to make sure that i'm all clean for the day, haha.. It sucks that I always feel dirty, even when it's always the slightest things that make me unclean, like dirt, sweat, anything that is considered unclean in modern cultures.. I know showering too often can be more of a negative impact than a positive one, but oh well! I think it is normal to feel that way..   

W-wait.. is it normal?   

Is it not?    

Never-mind that!   

The shower always feels so pleasant.. Everytime I step inside, it just feels like a paradise in a bath-tub.. The water-pressure in these small apartments are really good, too. I guess that's explains the slightly high price for the water, so I limit my use of showering at times but I still try my best to remain  as hygienic as I possibly could..      

Lalalalala..~    

I started to make some random noises in the shower, either humming a song or just creating my own melodies that come in my head. It is somewhat enjoyable to do since I need to also entertain myself in the shower by just humming some songs under my breath or making melodies while scrubbing my body with a soft sponge that soaked my body with soap. Scrubbing my leg, I carefully balanced by leaning onto the smooth, tiled wall, nearly covering my upper thigh in soap: The water immediately washed it away and I put the sponge back on the shelf after a few more minutes of scrubbing and seated myself in the bathtub as the water harshly flickers on me.        

I cant wait to see Julie today at school! I have so much things that I need to tell her when i'm there..  

She's the only person I ever talk to since.. well.. Never-mind that. I don't actually have that much friends of mine- A majority of the people in my school dislike me, but I never found out why.. I wasn't sure if it was because of my personality, or how I act around people in general.. but they all don't seem to like me, except Julie, who is more acceptant and tolerant of people than half of the people I go to school with.   

Julie is my only friend, and when I mean my only one, she is the only one. I met her in kindergarten when we were doing a small drawing assignment together and we hit it off there and then because the both of us are the same, but in a sense different since we share some similar interests and hobbies, but Julie has different ones instead of ones similar to mine. I don't like her romantically, but she's the most amazing friend I could ever ask for!    

Whenever i'm off from work, we'd do fun things like explore the town, get ice-cream, go to the park at times, prank call some of our classmates and much more! We practically do most things together.. since.. well.. She's one of the few people that seem to give a s*** about me, and doesn't seem to find me as an oddity.. she cares for me, defends me from bullies in our school, she studies with me, and she even spends all her free time with me. we practically are glued together, or like what some people say, two peas in a pod.    

Never leaving each-others' side, no matter what the cause could possibly be, even if it was a huge argument that we had: We will still come back to each other in the end.    

Not many people seem to acknowledge my feelings, most people don't acknowledge my existence at all.  

They always see me as lesser than them and everyone treats me like a scapegoat for all their- 

Never mind, I don't want to get too ahead of myself in my own past. 

Did I talk a little too much?   

Ah.. S-sorry. My bad.. it's a bad habit..    

I'll stop now.  

I tend to ramble frequently about things for long hours, and I should work on not doing that too often..   

But don't worry, it's not a big deal! I can do just fine without any friends. I'm able to work better and I wont have the need to distract myself with pointless conversations.. I can focus on work more without having friends that constantly bombard me, except Julie of course, I don't mind when she bombards me with texts during work, since I usually mute my phone and check my messages later during my break..     

She'd sometimes show up to the place I work at and would talk to me while I make her a coffee, and we'd talk about new drama that happens at school or talk about personal experiences that we're most comfortable sharing, when the café is not busy of course-  

Wait- What's the time?  

'''*Peering out the curtains to see the clock in the bathroom.*'''  

Huh?  

6:30 AM? Already? It was just 6:00 not even a second agooo... 

Aww crap..  

Since the time's going by fast again, that means I have to get dry and get dressed.. 

do I have to get out of the shower now? 

I wanna stay in here foreverrrr.. It's too relaxing to not leave, and It's going to be super cold when I do leave!  

But it looks' like I have no choice but to leave since I can't risk being late yet again.. I can't have the teacher give me another tardy this time or else I'll get an in school detention.. God, I already had three tardies this year and a fourth one can lead to another long scolding..   

After a couple of minutes showering, I grabbed the towel from the small hanger near the bath tub and stepped out quickly, drying my hair and body thoroughly, then wrapping the towel around my body while I rushed to get my school uniform, lying on the ironing board near the bathroom. I know it's optional to wear them, but most people tend to wear them since it's an easy pick for an outfit.. I'm too lazy to pick a new outfit everyday, it's more of a hassle when I have to chose something new all the time..  

After I got in my uniform, I finished tying my tie and dried my hair off with the towel again, then went back to the bathroom to pick up the clothing thrown messily on the floor to put the in the washing machine nearby, folding the towel on top of the machine to wash it later. When I get home I usually have to do the laundry or deep-clean my house incase if it's a mess.. Especially this time around.   

I quickly sped over to my kitchen and open the cupboards, looking for something quick and simple to eat for the day.. Inside there was raisin bread, some cereal and a bag of oats. Shoot.. I should have went grocery shopping the day before but I haven't received my check yet so I was unable to spare anything.. It always takes so long for the checks to come in..  I checked in the fridge to see if I had anything in there: Only a half-full gallon of water, a tub of cream-cheese, some grapes and a carton of milk with some peaches lying around.  

Well, this is not that bad as I anticipated it to be! At least I have some things to work with, like cream cheese to make a sandwich with, and just enough water for me to drink- So then, I guess today's meal for the week is a sandwich with a glass of water! I grabbed the raisin bread from the cupboard and the cream-cheese from the fridge, retrieving a small, plain-white plate from the other cupboard that holds all the dishes. 

I took out two slices of raisin bread from the package, then flicked open the cream-cheeses lid from the container, then from the drawers I took out a butter-knife to spread the cream cheese on one slice of bread, placing the other slice on top. Tada! a cream-cheese sandwich! One of my favorite meals incase if I'm hungry~ I don't know why, but it's always so filling and good.. I can eat so much of these sandwiches in one day! 

I walked back to the cupboard and got a small cup that lied around the shelves, then heading over to the fridge to get water and poured it in the cup, putting it back in the fridge soon after. 

I sat down in my dining room and began eating the rather simple meal I prepared for myself. Even though it was simple, its still so tasty... Goodness, whoever made raisin bread needs all the praise they could get,  because they never fail to make it so good..! Especially the ones with cinnamon mixed inside of the bread, it makes the taste of the sandwich so much better..   

'''*Nom Nom*''' So.. hungry..   

It tastes..  so good.. I feel like i'm in heaven already~  

I felt like I haven't eaten in days at this point..   

It could be because of all of those shifts i've been on lately.   

Though, it's good that i'm off on the weekends from time to time!   

But.. thats rare nowadays for me..   

Since i'm one of the people who deliver orders much quicker, i'm wanted for almost every shift.    

It's so tiring.. But, whatever gets the money flowing' in for me..!   

I wish I hadn't forgotten to make myself dinner last night.. But I was so exhausted after those long hours at work, especially since it was such a busy day.. Serving customers left and right is no joke- It's almost over-whelming at times, but the customers seem to take interest in how quick I am with orders and getting them on the table in time- It did raise my wage by a decent amount, so thats a perk! As long as I'm getting paid, I don't mind my job being too over bearing.   

And now checking my cupboards and fridge, I dont think I would be able to cook myself anything- maybe only eat cereal for dinner with a peach as a small dessert for myself.  

'''*Peering outside the window next to him*''' The weather looks nice today, though I have a feeling it will be oddly hot outside. The sun beaming down on my face when I walk outside is always so annoying and even makes me sick at times.. The sun gives me a headache.. It always does.. So annoying when it gets in your eyes when trying to look up at the sky, or do outdoor sports..   

Oh, I forgot that summer is not even over yet!

Though, I wish it were.. I want to feel the cool breeze on my shoulders, no more having to feel the sickening heat that beams down on the streets almost constantly.. I wish autumn would come earlier, It would be so much better if it started now-

Enough of my stupid thoughts.. I need to go now! These thoughts are what get me in trouble in class half of the time since they always cause me to doze off.. After I put my plate and the glass in the sink, I rushed over to my room and packed up what I needed to school as quickly as I could, then grabbing my phone and tangled ear-plugs from the counter after it was charged. I untangled my ear plugs quickly and folded them neatly in my pocket. 

Hmm.. I guess I'll go on my phone for a little bit since there's some time to spare.. 

Lets see whats new-  

Oh! I got a message from Julie.. 

''hey wrench, I got something to tell ya!"''

Hm..

''"also no."''

''"incorrect again!"''

''"Aww.. Why not tell me nowww? :(("''

''"It would defeat the purpose!"''

''"What purpose exactly?"''

''"I- Umm- Never-mind that!''

''Anyways, when we're in first period I will tell you.''

''I'll see ya at school, wrennie :D"''

''"You also, Julie :)"''

What does she have to tell me now?   

She always has something new to tell me everyday.. 

Whether it'd be school drama, fights or the latest gossip, she seems to have something fresh everyday to talk to me about. You ask her about any trash being spread around through the halls, she has all of the details. Haha, classic Jules!  

But now, I better get going to school- Otherwise the teacher will kill me for sure since.. But, let's all hope I arrive on time without getting another tardy. 

After spending a few more minutes on my phone, I slipped it in my pocket and plugged in my earphones, grabbing my bag  and went to the front of my door to put on the tan boots that sat near the shelves. After putting my shoes' on and buckling them, I swung the door open and then locked the door outside. Off to school we go! A few minutes after going down the stairs and exiting the apartment complex building.     

Welp, it's best I play music to keep myself occupied when walking. I hate silence.    

I played some music that flowed through my ear-plugs, minding my business and quietly humming the tune of the song I was listening to under my breath. I love listening to music, It's almost like an addiction at this rate.. I just cannot seem to live without it.. Without music, the world feels strange: I feel weird without listening to odd melodies.  

But enough music talk-  

The weather is incredibly nice today, so much better than I expected it to be.  

The sky is pretty blinding with its tacky hue of blue, but still, very nice weather for the first of September.  

Though.. the sun still makes me feel ill as it beams down on my face..  

But at least the heat is not that over-bearing like I had expected, it's actually just fine.  

It's not like the time where it was so hot to a point where I began seeing a heat-haze..  

Haha, I almost fainted from exhaustion that day because of the immense heat outside.. Haha, yikes forever..    

summer, am I right?    

When walking to school and listening to the music still flowing in my ears, I waited to cross an oddly familiar railroad with power-cables neatly lined up with each-other, blending in the crowd with other individuals..   

The school was straight across from a town with a couple turns here and there, making it a fairly short walk.. But I remember this being an old, wide road, and not a set of train tracks with overhead wires that magically appeared out of the blue.   

Hm, thats weird. I don't remember seeing this railroad before, was it just built?   

I remembered this was just an old street where cars would pass by and usually had a boatload of traffic.  

I feel like I've seen this from somewhere else, but from where?  

It does look oddly familiar to me-

Eh.. maybe it was just recently built, nothing too serious: Cargo and transportation is increasing, so surely they must need more trains to transport the goods to other districts, along with countries,  and to carry passengers so they can travel where-ever without having to pay half of their savings on a ticket that flies them across the globe. 

There's always some new construction in the district I now live in, so it isn't that uncommon, but there's no way a train track system was made just now, or even in a few days-  

Meh, its whatever..  

Perhaps Im overthinking again, like I usually do.. 

This has been happening with me much more recently and I can't see to figure out why- They began popping in my head since last year after running away.. Maybe it's just because of me balancing work and school.. I always have to be on time for both occasions and it always causes me to have some stress on my shoulder- well, I'll say a huge amount of stress to be more specific, like a heavy rock that people expect me to carry and be okay when doing so. 

I'm always overthinking about getting laid off or potentially getting fired, and my boss finding out about my forged documents, or having to be late to school on an almost constant basis. I already work enough hours that cost me my hours of sleep, especially on days where it begins to get extremely busy- specifically the weekends, since I hardly get free-time for myself and limited time to rest- Even though I wish I could get more free hours to myself, I still have to work very frequently to maintain my lifestyle, even if it means working overtime- 

As the train quickly passed by, The traffic light turned green and the other individuals around me began walking across the tracks while I treaded heavily to get to school, my pace quickening by the minute. The town I was walking by was eerily quiet, every building was of swarthy colors with high gates with the street becoming more and more narrow. power-cable wires surrounded the area. The saturated blue sky was getting covered by the tall roofs. The clouds covered up the sun and begun  

This is.. somewhat unsettling..  

I know it is just a town where ordinary people live, but it's always so quiet.    

I don't even hear birds chirping..    

I hardly see anyone walking around here, no teens walking to school or adults going to work..     

Gee, even thinking of that gives me the chills..     

This place is so unsettling, It reminds me of a ghost-town..!      

It's like no one lives here..      

It feels like it has been completely abandoned..     

The sound of ravens echoed above my head, seeing them fly in a pack to probably sit down on the overhead wires in groups like they usually do to observe the cars and people walking.      

My heart began pounding, faster than the sound of light. The narrow passageway in the town I was crossing filled me with panic, discontent, all of those queazy and negative feelings, my pace starting to quicken while transitioning from walking to running while hearing the faint squawks of crows that rest upon the overhead wires: But I slowed down in order not to end up all drenched in sweat, like how I was this morning.       

I cant take this place..         

I feel dizzy..         

My heart is pounding..         

And my stomach is churning..         

Bleurgh.. Now these feelings all have me somewhat queazy.         

Why is everything so narrow and crammed together?       

I know it's just a tiny little town where people live..       

But something about it makes my stomach quench..       

It's too creepy..!            

Switching between walking and running, after a few minutes I managed to get away from the narrow passageway and the small, yet somewhat creepy town. My body finally relaxed and I gave a sigh of relief, continuing to walk at a normal pace as I turned on my phone to play music again to ease my nerves..              

Thank god..             

That was a bit tense..              

It was like I was in a horror movie-              

Where the passageway would begin to get more and more narrow until I cant walk any further.             

Now, wouldn't that be scary to you?              

To me, it definitely would!              

After a couple of minutes of walking, passing by small towns and villages alike, I arrived at school, and surprisingly, I arrived on time for once: two enlarged gates situate in the front as an entrance, symbolizing a cage at most. In the middle is a gold crest that is used as a lock so no one can leave or enter, unless you're late, perhaps.   

These sorts of gates always looked so intimidating to me, and I'm still not sure how to explain it..   

They're so tall.. so grand, too.. They look like the gates of a mansion to say the least.. but..    

It symbolizes cage bars, too..     

School is essentially like a prison from what I could see it as: Why do we have to learn so many unnecessary things?    

What am I going to do with pythagorean theorem in the future?    

or using zenith to see stars in the sky?    

Or a better one:    

How would finding Polaris have any use for me in the future?   

I don't even know what I want to be when i'm older!    

I have nothing to achieve in life- not just yet..     

I'm sure i'll find something I take interest in someday..        

Someday..        

Walking on school grounds at last after the quick, yet seemingly long walk, I ripped off my ear plugs and unplugged them, putting them in my pocket and dashed towards the murky green metal doors and opened one of them with the weak force of my hand, rushing inside to get to my first period class as soon as I could, hoping to the gods above that I get there on time instead of dozing off at the bulletin boards and being late.  

Eeee! I cant be late again, not again not agaaaaiinn!  

The teachers' going to absolutely slaughter me if i'm even one minute late! 

Hah.. Gah..   

Why do my classes have to be at the other side of the f**ing hallway?!   

Cant my life just get easier instead of always being a big pain in my a**?!?   

After making it to first period, I swung the door open as it created a loud noise, inhaling and exhaling heavily as my hair looked like lightning bolts had just struck me and my bag nearly falling off my shoulders. "I-Im here..!" I began to fumble on my words. "I-If I was late, I apologize!" I looked up at the others and saw them stare at me, whispering to their shoulder partners while hearing soft murmurs from the crowd.

Shoooot.. 

The teacher put down the book he was reading and gave me an odd glare as he let out a hefty sigh, the other people in the classroom giving me a stink eye or an odd stare to me, laughing softly so I didn't notice.     

I heard people whispering to each-other and chuckling about how I had looked: After all that running, I was out of air and my uniform became somewhat messy. All I could do then was lower my head and ignore it.     

Please.. no tardy this time..     

Please.. I cant get an in school detention..     

Not now..      

Definitely not now!     

"Wren, you're fine." The tone of the teacher sounded exhausted and unamused by my presence and did not seem to bother with me because I came in on time.    

"This time you aren't late, so I'll let you pass.   

Just sit down wherever. Don't be a bother, though.   

Complete whatever work you need to finish."  

I gave a sigh of relief, absolute relief: All I could do was sigh.   

Thank god..   

Thank you god..  

I didn't get a tardy either!   

No in school detention!  

And most of all, I wasn't late!   

Yay me!  

I nodded and looked around the room for a second, trying to decide where I should sit. I began looking around the room until I heard a cheerful, yet smooth and optimistic voice coming from the corner: It was Julie, and she seemed to have reserved a seat for me..   

How kind of her..!  

"Wrennie!" She shouted across the room, pointing at the seat in front of her. "Over here!" Of course, my eyes darted towards her and I walked over to the desk and sat down: Thank god almost every single class I have has Julie in it- If she weren’t in my classes, i'd be screwed.. As the chatting in the class increased, I began drawing little flowers on a sheet of paper that was near the small paper-holder in the classroom, quietly making a rhythm with my fingers in an attempt to occupy myself from all of the murmuring and talking in the classroom.  

It's too addicting to make rhythms with my fingers, especially when i'm bored.. It makes me somewhat happy!

Drawing random flowers on schoolwork and paper too.. I love drawing small petal-like shapes, It always keeps me occupied whenever i'm in a boring class, especially during the morning and in my skills class where i'm able to do whatever work i'm missing, as long as I wasn't on my phone. But, at least I  get to work with Julie! 

I always found first period rather dull to me: theres almost no life in the classroom whatsoever.. Whenever i'm in a bit of a bad mood, I find the class that has the most perks boring and almost draining at times.. Even though it's only a skills class, i'm already tired and exhausted from running and rushing myself to get ready.  

Since classes, especially first period, always tend to start early in the morning, everyone is slouched on their seats, exhausted and tired due to their lack of sleep.. Most people my age nowadays go to parties or spend time with their friends up until midnight even.. I know most outings don't last that long, but it does happen..     

Does it?     

Does it not?     

Whatever.. At this point I cant remember what i'm rambling about.. Hehe..     

But aside from my thoughts, that is usually the cause of their constant fatigue and drowsiness, so they'd only get six hours of sleep. Sometimes, they get even less because they stay up more and they get less hours of sleeping, resulting in their drowsy behavior.    

Man, I wish I would do something similar to that someday: Hanging out with friends or going out in general seems so fun, but if i still lived with my parents, they'd refuse all the way..  they'd rather see me isolated instead of having a social life, trapped inside my room with no one to talk to.   

And of course, my only friend is Julie.. Nothing bad about having only one friend, since you can have one friend and be happy about it! But, I don't have a pack of friends like the popular kids here, or even the time to spare because of my full-time job since my boss would get upset with me if I ever did that.. Even though my boss is a kind man, he would get upset if I tried taking off on a work day..       

As I was drawing, I stopped for a moment to take out my folder to do some homework- It was not really much, just some math work that I forgot to make up and a small reading assignment that was due today.        

My work schedule doesn't even allow me to do my homework in peace..       

I wish work didn't get in the way of everything for me..         

I always have to go after school, during breaks, even during the weekends-         

I don't mind, but it has this sense of pressure that is weighing me down from doing things I've always wanted to do, like go to an amusement park or go to a festival with Julie someday so I can enjoy my life for a little-        

But it looks like i'm going to be working until my older ages as nothing but a café attendant, saving every check I have and putting it in my bank account to save for a nice home someday..           

Somewhere where I can finally live in peace, away from all of the toxicity from my parents.           

Even though I ran away from them, I could still feel their expectations and pressure weighing on my shoulder..            

It's almost like a cold sore that occasionally comes back but never goes away, even when i'm already better..           

For the first few minutes, it was just sheer silence despite the slightly loud chattering in the classroom.    

I took out my binder and started to catch up on some more work, specifically work that was due before but I didn't get to finish it because of work. It was mainly science, english, math, and some other assignments. Math is something i'm unable to do, and I usually fail most math exams or small quizzes, but I do fine on my homework: Other subjects, though? I can pass them with ease. I'm able to complete the rest of my work that isn't math in just a couple of minutes.         

Math always gives me a headache..          

I cant do any form of it besides one and two step equations.          

It's always such a pain in the a**..         

So many numbers, shapes and inequalities..          

Not only that, but graphs too..           

Triginometry is also a big pain, almost failed fourth quarter last year because of how difficult it was..           

God, the graphs are more of a pain than anything.. we don't even need them, unless it's for economic or demographic things.           

I cant even get the numbers on there right!          

Even when I went to tutoring or extra help, none of it made any sense!         

During the next few minutes, I was able to complete half of my missing science work that was due months ago!          

Yay me! Now I have less work to do..           

Well.. not technically. I still have a bunch of essays to finish, math work I need to make up..          

And.. Ah, what else now.. Oh! Some greek work I forgot to do because of my overtime work shifts since it was a special event that night, and required some overtime work that included alot of food and drink making, cleaning.. So much stuff to a point where I nearly passed out due to exhaustion.           

Haha, work, am I right?          

Always' getting in the way of anything I want to do..          

Even my own school work..!         

Aaaah.. This isn't fair.. Why can't I do my own schoolwork in peace when my job is always peering over my shoulder? It's like im being closely monitored by it to make sure i'm on time and working my a** off to make a few bucks to pay everything..            

(Editing)          

I piled up all my work from my folder on my desk and began doing each sheet one by one. On my desk was over ten different greek assignments, nine math assignments, at least six english assignments along with a thick packet full of science work, about three inches thick to be a little more specific. It's partially my fault for not doing the work, but I can't really blame myself either since work had me all stressed out and rent was due very soon, so I have to make sure I do my best to get another raise..            

With about five different pencils and assignments towering over my head, I began doing each assignment one by one at a slow pace. I'm a rather slow worker and I take my time, but I still manage to get everything done without difficulty and I end up having more time for work than my studies, but I always managed to get pretty good scores on each test I seem to take.             

I usually do my things much slower so I can get good grades and maybe into a good university when i'm older incase if I ever decide to attend college, but I don't prioritize my grades so much over everything: I still prioritize work over most of my things since bills are more important than school and having to maintain the way I live is almost essential too..               

The school is not technically aware of my job, let alone me leaving my parents. I had to lie to them saying that my parent's are very busy and they don't have much time to pick up the phone for phone-calls, mainly because I created two false phone-numbers that had automated voicemails to them, with the help of Julie of course since she's a big tech nerd and knows how to make fake phone numbers and how to pitch their voices.                

Julie stood up from her desk and walked over to mine, one hand on my desk and one hand on her hip while I was in the middle of finishing some greek homework that I needed to owe up after two weeks of not doing it because of my grueling work schedule.  

I perked my head up to see her in front of my desk, her gaze as friendly as always, looking back down at my homework and paper with the drawings of flowers, then at her brown eyes.  

Well, At-least I have her to occupy me now!  

I despise half the people here, except Julie..   

Since we're in the same skills class, she can help me with some of my work..  

If I help her do some of her's of course.   

It was a deal we made a long time ago in fifth grade after she helped me with my math homework after I wasn't able to complete most of it on time, and I helped her with her english work due to her not being the greatest in the subject..    

But, let's hope everything goes swimmingly and we dont have to get scolded at by our teachers for not having our work done.     

== II. Julie ==
----''"Oh, hello!"''   

"...''H-Hello.."''   

"''I think you're my buddy for the drawing project?''   

''You know, the one where we would have to draw little animals and present them?"''   

''".. Perhaps..?"''   

''"Wren, right?"''   

"''Y-Yes.. that is me.."''   

"''Well, nice to meet ya! I'm Julie, and i'm your buddy!"''   

''"M-My buddy?"''   

''"That's right! You're my buddy for the drawing assignment!"''

"''Oh.. do you mean a partner?"''

"''Tehe- Yup!"''

"''Oh.. Well, It is nice to meet you, Julie."''

''"Nice to meet you too, Wrench!"''

"''Wr-Wrench?! Thats.. not my name.."''

''"Heheh, calm down.. It's my nickname for you.'' 

''Get it? Wren? Wrench?"''

''"U..Um.. I suppose I can understand it.."''

''"Great! Wanna be friends?"''

''"Friends? You? Friends with me?"''

"''Yup!"''

&lt;nowiki&gt;*&lt;/nowiki&gt;''I've.. never had friends before..'' 

''no one in this school was willing to be my friend by any chance..*''

''"U-Um..'' 

''Sure..?'' 

''Pardon my tone.. it's just- I've never had friends."''

''"You've never had a friend before?"''

''"No.. Not many people are willing to be friends with me..''

''and I find it odd someone wants to talk with me.."''

''"Oh.. I see..''

''Well then, I am now your friend!"''

"''Really?"''

''"Yup!"''

''"Alright then, Julie.'' 

''"Let's start with drawing..~"''
----



Julie is by standard very pretty, ethereal at most.     

She is what people in the school describe as a beauty. Many of the guys in the halls and class talk about their crush on her and how she shouldn't be friends with me and she should be with them- but, I don't mind. She does not really care on what they say about her, but if it's about me she would defend me until she would die of exhaustion by sputtering out so much words in my defense. Thats' why people seem to love her so much: She has a unique charm to her that many girls in the school do not seem to have.   

Julie has these big, brown eyes with a nice, dark complexion and somewhat messy, ash-blonde hair with some brown mixed in her long locks. She too also wears the uniform, and around her neck is an ivory, silver locket that hangs below her stomach and bandages that wrap around her arms neatly with rouge red and black sneakers. She is quite short, around one to two inches shorter than I was, but by definition she is taller than most of the girls and even some of the guys.  

"Yo, Wrennie." Julie casually blurted.   

"Oh, Hello Julie!" I answered softly, my voice being much more quieter than usual. "How are you today?"

"Oh, just fine." She responded casually, letting out a quiet yawn. "Just rather tired. How about you, Wren?"

"I feel great, actually! I managed to wake up early this morning."

"Well, thats good," Julie went over to her desk for a moment to get some bottled water and began drinking from it, walking towards my desk again. "You're usually late for class almost every-day, so it is somewhat surprising to see you here on time.."

We chatted for a little bit, just talking about random things that came to our minds, Whether it'd be school drama or my weirdest work experiences, maybe about the guys that Julie had told off whenever she heard trash-talk about me-

Oh.. right! She told me she had to tell me something.. I almost forgot about that.

"Uh.. J-Julie?" I asked sheepishly, burying my face into my homework out of shyness. 

"Yeah, Wren?" She answered. 

"What was it you had to tell me today?" I referred back to the text message she sent me before leaving the house. 

Julie shook her head and came to realization after a few minutes. 

"Oh, right!

There's a new student that just transferred here!" She told me casually, her voice displaying a hint of excitement despite trying to remain calm about the situation. 

"A new student?" I looked at Julie with a curious gaze while tilting my head slightly.

"Yup!" Exclaimed Julie. "They transferred here a couple of minutes ago, todays' their first day here."

"Oh, Interesting!" I remarked. "What's their name?"

Julie looked at me silently, somewhat iffy about my question, like she did not know how to answer. She always has the answer for most things, but this time she did not seem to know how to answer as I noticed her spacing out.  

"Julie?" I asked, waving my hand in front of her face. "Is there something wrong?" 

Julie then shook her head as her gaze returned to me. "Oh! No no, nothing is wrong.." 

"Its just- about their name.." She began her sentence, talking in a rather sheepish tone. "I tried to find it through school files, but.. there was not a name present when I asked." Julie does some sort of work for the school we go to: She organizes folders and files in the storage room, where they keep data on students, so it was how she got access to the folders, so she knows everything about everyone if that is how you word it.   

"That's strange.." I raised my eyebrow for a moment, looking down at my paper and stared at Julie. " Aside from that, are they in any of our classes?"

"Not that I could recall," She answered. 

"Did you not receive her schedule to put it in the portfolio?" I questioned. 

"No," Riposted Julie. "Not yet."

"How odd.."  

I tapped my pencil on the desk, focusing on it for a little while before turning my gaze back to Julie. 

"Yeah.. but, I bet its nothing too big, though.." She spoke. "It's probably not processed yet." 

"Yeah, it could be that.

Just try not to overthink it, alright?"

"Eh, I'll try not to stress it." She reassured me.   

I had a smiled of relief that came across my face: I hate seeing Julie upset or stressed out..   

It gives me a sense of pain in my heart when thinking about it..  

She does overwork herself sometimes, but I don't want her to stress about something to a point where she'll try to get whatever she needs to do done. 

She's my best friend, and I care so much for her!   

I always look out for her, and so does she.    

Julie and I began speaking a little bit more about random things: Random work experiences I had or school fights that happened for unnecessary reasons. I even told her how I almost fainted on the job. Just news that was rather old, but she did tell me some recent things though- About the new student- We started to talk about them after we ran out of topics to discourse about.    

"Yeah, everyone want's to get to know them," She began explaining to me while I was finishing up my science work. "Even the guys are falling for them despite their plain and ordinary appearance."   

"Really?" I looked back down at my science work. "Do they always do that?"   

"Do you seriously not keep up with the latest news here?" Julie asked curiously.    

"N-No- Not really.."   

"They've always been doing this every-time a new student, especially a girl transfers here.    

They gain their trust and either turn them into a copy of themselves, or use them until they no longer are seen as amusing to them."   

I blinked, looking at her in utter shock and nearly dropping my pencil.   

They really do that?    

That sounds so cruel..       

They only use the new students as puppets..       

To make them seem wanted when they really aren't..        

"Oh.. I.. wasn't aware of that!" I stuttered. "That does sound awful.."         

"Sort of is," Replied she. "They want to do that so they grow in power."         

"They think they're these big and high powered people when they're all just a bunch of wimps." She whispered with a rude tone. "You aren't a wimp though. You're my favorite~"         

I looked at her dumb-founded, my small hands covering up my face, flushing red. "R-Really..!? M-me? Your favorite?" I stammered and fumbled on my words shyly. Julie looked over at me confused, but her expression soon turned into a cheerful one with a giant smirk on her face.          

"Psssh, isnt it obvious?" Blurted Julie, coming over to my desk and putting her long arm over me, using her elbow to squish my face against hers. "You are my favorite! Well, it's obvious since you're my best friend~"         

"Oh-" I suddenly shook my head and stared at Julie, abashed and flattered by how close our faces were to each-other. "That is true.. But-"         

Julie suddenly had a confused face. "But what?" Asked she curiously, her head tilting.          

"I- dont think i'm worthy enough to have a friend so kind as you.." I mumbled, my facial expression suddenly turning more mellow. Julie glared at me in shock and started to shake my shoulders rapidly.          

"Aaaah!" My facial expression changed rather quickly, my mellowed face turning extremely shaken up because of Julie rapidly shaking me, sort of like how a rocking horse would go back and forth.          

"Don't say that!" Julie quietly sputtered to me. "You only say you're unworthy because it's what other people think of you as, but I promise you Wrennie, you aren't unworthy! Don't listen to those b***es who call you that, it simply isnt true!"                    

(Editing) 

The next few minutes of class were pretty simple to say the least.  

When the murmuring in the class became louder, me and Julie joined in on the talking since we stood quiet for a bit of time. While we we're conversing back and forth to one another, after that we helped each-other do some homework together on what we were struggling with: For me, it was with certain math equations that Julie was good at, and I helped her with some ELA homework she didn't seem to understand.  

In ELA, we're observing Shakespeares' writing, and learning about his use of figurative language.   

Julie is not the best when it comes to analyzing Shakespeares' writing.. And she's not too fond of it either.   

She is not the biggest fan of his works, and finds his use of figurative language odd because it is difficult for her to understand.     

She usually prefers comics over plays, and likes stuff packed with adventures, romance and fantasy, even horror too. She had been working on a comic for the past year or so and often uploads it to a blog.     

Of course, she is aware that it was from the Elizabethan era and understands why the language is used in the play, but she still sees it as hard to somewhat understand, despite her high intelligence.   

And I can agree..    

Shakespeare made Romeo so..    

over-dramatic.. And a little bit desperate      

It makes me dislike him more than I already have..     

And all of this dramatic crap for what?   

Not getting the girl he wanted for himself?  

Or- Never-mind, again.   

I can't spoil anything from the play, cant I now?  

"What is this?!" She softly muttered, holding the book of "Romeo and Juliet" in different angles before flipping it back to the front and smacking it down on the desk.     

I peered my head over to the loud bang, seeing it come from Julie's desk, immediately walking over and putting my hands on her desk, seeing her putting her hands on her face and scrunching parts of her hair in anger. "What is it you're struggling with now, Julie?"     

"What does this line mean?!" She softly sputtered in my ear, taking her hands off of her face and letting go of the parts of her hair she was holding onto, flipping her book to my direction.      

"Which one?" I asked confusingly. "Could you point to which one is the line you're struggling with?"     

Julie calmed down, and dragged the book back in front of her, pointing at one line that seemed to have her confused.      

"This one here!" She shouted, her voice not being too loud nor too low, but at a good tone so I could hear her. "This is the one I'm having trouble with."      

"Here, let me see.." I told her. "I Think I'll be able to translate whatever quote in old english." Gettiing up from my seat, scooted over next to her seat and observed the small book that laid flat on the desk, Julie's finger pointing at the following words on one of the chapters:      

''“Hath had no power yet upon thy beauty.”''       

"Is this the line you're having trouble with?" I asked her, pointing at the sentence after reading it out-loud in a moderate voice to her.        

"Yes.." She murmured quietly, angrily twirling her long, blonde hair around her finger. "I cant' seem to understand what it means.      

S-Sorry.. i'm just not really-"      

I looked over at Julie, softening my gaze and trying to focus on both the book and her frustrated face.               

"It's okay, Julie." I chortled softly while smiling to her, organizing all the messy papers that scattered across her desk. "We all have our flaws."              

"I need help to identify what it means." She requested sternly with a hint of anger in her voice, still looking at her paper in confusion, her book placed on her desk as the words begin to stare at her. "It's so confusing.. it says to write the sentence out modernly after identifying the old english words."              

"Well.." I started my sentence, taking her book one more time and staring at the quote. I started to analyze each word carefully and looked over at some english notes in my notebook that I still had with terms and definitions in old english.               

"''Hath'' can most certainly mean have..               

and the word ''thy'' is an old english work for you..              

So in conclusion,  the line means "Have had no power, yet upon your beauty."                            

"Oh..                              

Oh! Now I seem to understand it." She reiterated, looking down at her already busted book and then at me. "Thank you, Wrennie."                              

I looked at her, my face flushed and as red as a tomato with a nervous expression on my face. "O..Oh! It isn't a problem, really.." I mumbled softly.                                                                 

"Do you still need help with anything? I can help you with other subjects too-"                                                                

"I'm starting to understand how to translate old english now," Julie spoke. "I think I'll be fine for now. But, I'll let you know if I do need help." I nodded at her and smiled. "Alright, then. Fine with me."  I then turned my gaze away from her and focused on my science work, trying to figure out how to calculate eccentricity without messing it up like I did the last time-                                                                 

It was in an earth science lab we did together, and even though the both of us tried to calculate eccentricity, it came out all wrong and a big mess.. Gee, this lab dragged my grade down drastically.. Luckily, Julie managed to help me on some of it as compensation for me helping her with her english work- She managed to help me measure the distance between the foci- and something else I sort of forgot about..                                                                   

Julie, after a few minutes, did need some help with translating more quotes here and there that I managed to assist her with and she started helping me with some of my graphing homework that I forgot to do last week. It was similar to plotting points, which despite it being easy for most, for me it is rather difficult because whenever I plot the points in the correct order, it's always incorrect whenever it's on a test.                                                                   

"Now, where is the point of (0,4) on this graph?'" Julie asked, her pencil pointing to the graph on the paper. I leaned my head closer, using my eyes to try and find the point before seeing the numbers zero and four. I got my pencil and before it even touched the paper, I hesitated: I was scared of getting it wrong again, even though I believe it is right. After a few moments of just staring and zoning out, I put my pencil on the paper and dotted the point.                                                                       

"Over here." I answered, my pencil pointing at the dark dot on the paper. "Here is 0,4-"                                                                      

"That's 4,0." Julie interrupted me quickly after observing the paper for a mere two seconds. "It's not supposed to be on this side of the graph." She snatched the pencil from my hand and erased my confident plotted dot, putting it on the top of the y-axis on the four. "That's 0,4." I looked at her in disbelief, then decided to count the blocks that were present, and realized that she was right. I looked at her, almost in an ashamed manner and started to shake.                                                                         

"Wh-Whaaat?" I stammered under my breath, my hand still shaking in a sense of being shocked. "B-But its on the four, and it's near zero-"                                                                                                                                                

Julie glared at me for a moment or so and laughed it off. "Well, even though it's connected to the four, it would make an entirely different product, because when your Y value is zero, you dont move up nor down, so it situates on the number that is the X value, but if it's the opposite.." She moved her pencil towards the zero and counted up four, leading up to the dotted area. "You move up four. Do you know why it's wrong now?"                                                                                                                                                

"I- I suppose.." I answered in an uncertain tone. "I- I didn't realize that.." After saying those words, I lowered my head and put my hands on the side of my head gently, ashamed by my wrong answer.. "I'm sorry, Julie.."                                                                                                                                                 

I hate getting answers wrong.                                                                                                                                                 

It's like..                                                                                                                                                 

Oh, I don't know..                                                                                                                                                  

It feels like all the time and effort of working and all that was just put to waste.                                                                                                                                                   

When I feel like I did really good on a test, I end up getting a low score, and it sucks..                                                                                                                                                    

Especially if it was a subject I was struggling in..                                                                                                                                                     

I feel proud when I thought I did the equation right, but it ends up being wrong.                                                                                                                                                    

Why does math have to be this way?                                                                                                                                                    

Looking down ashamed, I wanted to cry at that very moment. I felt stupid that I got the answer wrong without knowing and- well.. I guess you could say that I almost broke down about it. Julie saw my expression and then tapped on my shoulder, my hands off of my head and immediately looked up to see a smile on her face. "Don't apologize, not everyone understands a new concept right away." She assured me, rubbing my shoulder softly. "We can always practice more, you know?"                                                                                                                                                   

Looking down solemnly for a moment, I smiled at her awkwardly, holding my breath for a moment before sighing. "I.. I guess that's right.."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              

"Hey, Wren." Julie spoke. "Listen to me.'

      <text bytes="3618" sha1="1risd023nayn2kg9pr5e0z4ekivpbrp" xml:space="preserve">hi sillies here are the kagerou daze characters so far! :D

to see the designs, click on the "read more"

ˏˋ°•*⁀➷ wren saetang
[[File:Updated wren.png|left|thumb|378x378px]]













info:

age: 15

pronouns: he/him

grade: freshman

gender: male

occupation: café attendant

likes: talking with his only friend, working, drawing

dislikes: people scolding him, bugs 

ethnicity: thai (🇹🇭) 

small description on wren: 

wren in the old english language means "small bird," and is a kind of bird species he takes a keen interest in and always feeds a baby wren outside of his house.  

he does not live with his parents because of personal issues, but he lives by himself in a small apartment where it is affordable while still working as a café attendant. he does find it difficult to juggle work and school, while also having bills to pay by himself. Even though he is not of legal age, he had to forge his IDs and work papers so he could get a job in order to survive. it is unknown why wren had left his parents, as he never discusses anything with anyone, but i'll say it will be revealed later in the story. 

personality wise, wren is very eccentric, observant yet timid and shy. he can only socialize with one of his closest friends, Julie, who he had been friends with since kindergarten. he is seen as an oddity because of his profound interests and was seen as an outcast for the majority of his life and was bullied heavily. due to having no social skills, he is seen as introverted and has a fear of judgement.      

But, however he has a very bright mind and is fluent in greek, english and thai because of him taking several language classes when he was younger and has been shown to have a decent amount of intelligence, meaning he is not dumb nor super smart like everyone thinks he is. julie describes him having the average intelligence.      

ˏˋ°•*⁀➷ julie satō            

[[File:Julie lol.png|left|thumb|331x331px]]


      
      

      
      
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                  
info : 
                  
age : 15

pronouns : she/her      

grade: freshman      

gender: female      

occupation : none      

likes: wren, candy, listening to music, socializing      

dislikes: overbearing people, too much school work      

ethnicity: somali and japanese ( 🇸🇴/ 🇯🇵)            

small description:      

julie is a cool character to say the least. i really love her design and shes fun to write about. Her full name is actually julianna, but she would rather be called julie since she does not like her full name too much. Julie is somali and japanese, her mother being somali while her father being japanese: i'm not gonna reveal her past yet until the story further progresses because its something i keep doing with my role-play ocs: i reveal their backstories when they were quite literally never revealed.                            

so, Julie is wrens only friend because she's the only one who accepts his oddities: initially she was made fun of for being his friend but she didnt really mind since she didnt give a f**. In the high-school she usually puts stuff in the student portfolios (aka school files), such as their names, schedules etc so she practically knows everything about everyone, whether it'd be the detentions they had, serious drama, personal life etc.

    <title>File:Hikage Gacha.png</title>
    <ns>6</ns>
    <id>162171</id>
    <revision>
      <id>256065</id>
      <timestamp>2022-11-20T15:25:15Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Auryze</username>
        <id>43449826</id>
      </contributor>

  <page>
    <title>Don't Stop Me Now</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162177</id>
    <revision>
      <id>256233</id>
      <parentid>256199</parentid>
      <timestamp>2022-11-23T23:45:57Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Downwards-Upz-Mist</username>
        <id>47196321</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>256233</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="1534" sha1="9rwgonvd10zeqrlnfhhc2ptyw07tmsr" xml:space="preserve">== He Had Blue Eyes ==
It all started with the letter. The letter had arrived long before the robbery, and it was there merely to mock, for the detective could do nothing to stop him now. 

After all, he was only able to find it after the fact. 

''To Mr. Watanabe Hiro.''

Hiro himself was shocked the letter was addressed to him. How could a thief know who he was? It could have been chance, but Hiro didn't believe so. He had a theory, and it was that he'd somehow managed to find out that he was the one tracking... whoever this was. 

''By the time you're reading this, I've taken a ruby and a sapphire from the Conservation Museum in the Appondale District, quite obviously, from Jamaa. I do advise you see to such a scene, as by four in the afternoon your boss will call you to check it, and I highly advice you be there already.'' 

Okay, so they knew he had a boss. Great. They also revealed their place, and he could easily go there and find clues. 

First, a drink. 
----He arrived to the scene. It was quiet. The museum was the same as ever.

But something was off.

They scanned the paintings uninterestedly, looked at the garish multicolored floor, and stared at a bat statue. Nothing seemed amiss.

Except there was, and he noticed it after staring for an extended period. The bat statue was missing something, which was noticeable from how there were metal holders in place in order to hold it in.

Eyes. It had no eyes.

(WIP)

[[Category:Downwards-Upz-Mist]]
