He stared blankly at the wall and felt himself drop down to the floor until he was facing the ceiling. He didn't realize he'd even done so until he felt something.

A presence. A person. A dead person. 

He got up and looked around. Ghosts sometimes took a bit to appear, especially recent ghosts. They couldn't really control it, but Zenith could feel their presence if they were close. He couldn't describe it. It was on another level of understanding only people who got to experience it first hand could know.

It helped to push something out of the spirit plane, but he didn't know how to. He knew it was possible. 

It also helped to push something into the plane. That was easy. As long as he found a small creature he could... 

An ant on the floor. He crushed it with his finger, and felt as its soul left its body. Tangible yet not. Perceptible at the very least. He put his hands around it, encompassing it. Then came some words. "K'thrani n'kin ter'corrtsa al in kor n't kiros," He said, pronouncing the words just as he'd written them long ago. It had taken him months to make the spell, after all. He knew what he was doing.

This was now a creature that was of the human realm, yet now dwelled in the spirit realm. Like entering a forbidden area. 

"Whoever's near me, take this bein' as your own kin, an' do as ya see fit," He said. Ancient words for sure, but he modernized them a little and summarized the whole paragraph in the process. It was inviting the ghost into his world as the ant went into their world. An eye for an eye.

Something wrapped its hands around it, and he felt it exit his grasp.

"Okay," they said gently, and purple magic crackled from their arms, from where their veins once were. He knew it was because since the spirit of the ant had been infused with his own magical energy, and the spirit was now passing through the ghost's body. If he could even call it a body.

"You know, Anna, you could try a little harder to make yourself presentable for this person," Another ghost said. Slowly, it formed into a being, a person around Zenith's age with curled hair and lynx ears, and many different tattoos of nature along their body. Their dead eyes must have had colored sclera- "Like Mercury's," Zenith thought-  which Zenith recognized due to them being a slightly darker shade of white than the average ghost's eyes, although barely so.  

"Kay," Anna sighed, and formed as well. 

Zenith smiled, then tried to gain more trust from them. "So, what's it feel like t' be dead?" He asked, though a bit rushed. 

"It feels like you're going over your death repeatedly. It feels like you're just flying. You're nebulous, a paradox. At least you're intangible if you want to be," Wren answered.

"'Right. I need a favor," Zenith said.

"What?" The two asked at the same time.

"One of my friends' been goin' with Cherie- This girl who fought in th' first event- Somewhere..."

"Who?" Anna asked.

"Cressida. Blonde w-"

"That girl who talked to Antares sometimes before we died?" Wren looked at Anna.

Zenith flinched a bit at the mention at the name. He didn't really expect it coming. "Oh. Y'haven't been followin' him anymore after dyin' have ya?" 

"Nah. There's lots to see. But yeah, probably. Stay here, I'll try to find her," Anna flew through the wall (and Zenith).

"Anything else you need from us?" Wren asked.

"Just outta curiosity, where did they put your bodies?" Zenith wondered. He knew they had to be somewhere in the castle, or else why would the ghosts be here? Ghosts didn't roam around the place they died, they roamed near their bodies, or else graveyards would be empty. They could travel the world if it wasn't for the fact that their bodies remained stationary, and leaving them behind too much would hurt the ghosts more than their own deaths.

"That's something me and Anna are trying to figure out. I... can't find the bodies anywhere, and I've been dead for four days. The castle doesn't take that long to inspect from top to bottom, and-" Wren put on an oversized pair of glasses, floated quickly and back from a nearby bookshelf with a book in hand, and flipping through it continued, "In fact, we've investigated towers A through F, gone through every classroom and every corridor, and even been in the rooms of the alphas and their children. The only place we can't understand is Liza's room, since it's completely blank- Must be for creative purposes."

"Tower G is magically locked- We can't enter it, it's locked using a caelumelody, an obscure source of magic which involves playing an instrument in order to create magic, as if the magic was a verse in a song, and can only be done by few people in this world. There's a student here who can use it, and Liza, of course, can. We know there has to be something in there. Then, there's the grand rotunda, which is not only quite far from campus- we had to float all Saturday through the forest just to get there because Anna distracted me and made me forget to bring the book with the full campus map- but locked with a caelumelody as well," Wren continued.

"Full campus map? Didn' they give that t' us at the start of th' year?" Zenith kept that in one of his clothes drawers, but he'd forgotten which one.

"No. They gave us a very small view of the entire thing. This isn't just a high school, it doubles as a college, so it's to be expected it'll have a larger amount of land than normal, and since the land does belong to a group of war heroes, there's areas you wouldn't believe are around here. This place oversees the ocean, so apart from our rocky cliff and large amount of water on our left, we've got a small beach area. We have a volleyball team. Did you see all the pamphlets for clubs? There's kids from all over the country here. It wouldn't be an understatement to say from all over the ''world.'' Anna and I have been kind of playing Nationality Bingo," Wren chuckled at that last bit.

"But the beach is just a fraction of the entire thing. The forest sure obscures a lot, but there's been a lot of tiny things you wouldn't detect, like small decorations, art projects, or activities left behind, remnants of picnics, one time I even found a shoe strung up from a tree. Swings. Deeper in there, there's an abandoned building, meant to be a future middle school but eventually left on hold. There's an abandoned basketball court, which they eventually built into the school. There's a soccer field, but the team won't start up until November."

"Of course, there's the rotunda. There's a building filled with documents, but we aren't going to check them out yet, they labelled it Room Seventeen. There's a small shelter for graduates who can't buy homes yet and don't have jobs. There's even a small shop for supplies at the very end of the forest, but it was abandoned because Liza discovered how to make the school create things. There's a waterfall nearby it, and below there are more acres of land, but we haven't gotten to those yet, and they aren't in the map," Wren said. "But part of that land is the school's property. Not all of it, but some of it. This is the book I'm using-" Wren showed off the cover of the book he was holding- "It has everything in here! There's probably another copy at the library"

"''&lt;nowiki/&gt;'Jarvis Taberni's History and Guide to Surviving Zios High'.'' Seems a'ight t' me. I'll keep it in mind," Zenith nodded.

"If you ever have the time to, try and help us get into Tower G and Room Seventeen, okay? Not that we need help for Room Seventeen, but it might be useful to have someone who's still alive in case there's something people need to see, like a conspiracy," Wren requested.

"Sure thing," Zenith accepted.

A few minutes passed, and Zenith felt that familiar sensation of having a ghost pass through his skin. 

"She's in Tower D. The beige one with the weird religious motifs," Anna said.

"Alright, I'll take him so you won't have to go through the whole ordeal again," Wren smiled. 

"Thanks," Zenith sighed, letting his feeling of worry wash away. Yet this was only replaced by a new feeling of terror over what she was doing there, why she was in a religious place considering what she'd gone through. If Anna had seen her in danger, ze probably would have told him, but ze didn't mention any of that, so he could only assume she was in risk.

Wren floated in front of him, and Zenith followed.
----Zenith watched the tower silently for a moment, trying to figure out a plan. Wren floated in front of him, their head inside the wall, peeking. 

"There anything useful?" He asked, putting his hand inside the ghost.

"There's something like a rose window with a crystal image of a blue-grey heron. I can't say I've studied enough about windows to say what kind- But you ought to check it out, maybe it's reflective," Wren said. 

"Aight, but how do I get up there?" Zenith asked.

Wren seemed to think about it for a moment, calculating it in their head, and then mumbled, "...''Magic..."'' 

"Fair 'nough," Zenith laughed, and went to the back of the tower to examine it.

He couldn't scale the wall, and he didn't have a spell to, so he cracked his knuckles and- A plan flashed into his mind. He made a large tombstone underneath him, raising him up until he could see through the tall window, and tried to peek through. 

Everyone inside was distracted, and he was unnoticed by pure luck. It was dark, so his reflection wouldn't be seen. 

Candles lit up the room as an ominous liquid bubbled from a cauldron. The people inside were circling it, chanting in tongues, in unison. He knew that clearly, there was something wrong, so he let his hands use magic, formed a few skulls- Which weren't real- and let them fly against the glass...

''Crush. Shatter.'' One of the people noticed, and turned around, and soon the others did, but Cressida, Aisumi, and two others who Zenith did not recognize (one a bird, although whether or not they were actually one was debatable considering their wings were made out of flames yet clearly corporeal,) and a boy with red, curly hair. The others quickly got in a position to be able to attack.

"Huh, so I was right, Cherie," Zenith stared coldly at the woman in question, "Ya ''are'' puttin' Cressida in danger," He said, standing on the ledge, dodging and crushing pieces of glass left on it as he did so. He figured if he was about to fight someone, if he was about to put himself in the danger for the sake of his friend, then he may as well have a little fun with it and deal with the nerves, too. It wasn't like he could turn back now.

"I'm not. I'm simply allowing her to see things from a different perspective. Perhaps you would benefit from doing so as well," Cherie groaned, stretching, then quickly walked up the stairs. which led to a floor which was close enough Zenith could jump down onto without any issue.

"That's jus' gaslightin', and ya know it. I don't know what you're really doing here, but I don't think somethin' like ''witchcraft'' is a good thing," Zenith figured a cauldron would indicate towards such a thing.

"Witchcraft isn't real. You out of all people should know as much, considering how you do have power over death, the dark, and so on," Cherie smiled gently, "So try and tell me what I did wrong other than teach them of my goddess and let them join in, obviously an accepted goddess considering her- now destroyed- image on the tower."

"It's not really teaching if you're forcing them. It's propaganda," Zenith grumbled.

"Yes, alright, then. Why don't we get you out of here, stubborn oaf?" Cherie rolled her eyes, and let a shotgun appear, which shot at Zenith, but its bullet missed him by a few inches.

"I will, when I know Cressida, and ev'ryone else here's safe," Zenith said.

"I'll guess we'll have to agree to disagree," Cherie said, and pushed Zenith out with a baston. Out the multiple story tall tower.

Zenith, in a split-second decision, let a skull appear below him. The fall was still hard, and he clenched, his teeth, but climbed onto it regardless, feeling some new bruises on his body. The skull flew back to the window, and he tapped it gently, watching the horror in Cherie's eyes. He wanted Cherie to suffer for what she was doing to his friend, but knew it was just a momentary feeling. He hated having to hurt them. He didn't want it to amount to this, but...

The skull moved to his will, and tapped the window. The window shattered.  Cherie let out a scream, and her minions rushed to her aid, except for those who were still near the cauldron. Three of them turned into direwolf beings on their back paws, with long fangs and messy blue fur, which got darker depending on the one he was looking at, and clawed viciously at the skull. The other tried to constrict itself into the skull's eye, and bash it from there. 

Zenith let it lower until they could only hope to grasp him by the ankle, and let it open its jaws. A ball of pure magic started to form, bright. But it wasn't bright magic at all. It'd cause pain to anyone who touched it, like a gigantic punch, and it aimed right towards Cherie, with a hum.

It fired, and Cherie dove away, rolling on the floor. Zenith hummed, noticing how scared she looked now despite her behavior earlier. He materialized multiple small skulls and let them charge up as well, while aiming some at the tower itself. Maybe if he did it right, it'd collapse, but wouldn't harm the people as long as he didn't forget to add skulls above their heads so they would protect them. 

The snake-like one wrapped itself around Zenith's neck after a few seconds, and tried to choke him like a constrictor, so he decided to give it a quick, non-lethal stab with a rib. Of course, it wasn't really a small stab, as they were clearly in enough pain to fall back onto the floor, letting out a groan, and they held the area under their left kidney as they bled profusely, eyes squinting. Zenith threw some bones over them, just so they'd be safe within the chaos.  

Zenith didn't know how to free Cressida from her spell, but there wasn't enough time to think about that as Cherie was already charging up what looked to be like a huge attack, so he had to use the skulls he'd prepared at Cherie, which she didn't see coming. She lost enough concentration for her spell to backlash against her, quickly causing bruises, cuts, and scratches all over her body, collapsing to the floor. Weakly, she pointed at the wolf girls, who lunged at Zenith, dragging him to the floor.   

They started scratching his body with their powerful claws, prompting Zenith to make as many bones as he could to protect himself, buying him some time. Tears started welling up in his eyes as large gashes appeared on his body, the pain was dizzying, and as the wolves tried to reach him, he created some larger charged skulls, such that they would aim at the wolves from above. He grunted as he let it fire, and watched as they all collapsed on top of him. They were ''heavy,'' and threatened to crush him, but knocking them out made them loose grip on their forms, quickly turning back into teenagers, making it easier for him to push them off with the bones on top of him. The ache was insane, he was bleeding, and he covered them in bone so he wouldn't die, too.    

"Damn, at least make this... hard..." He mumbled, trying to play the injuries off. He quickly realized what a bad idea that was, as he found himself surrounded by guns from all sides. He didn't ever think there were that many gun models. "Ah, f***."   

"Should I take that as you surrendering?" Cherie gave him a sour look.   

Zenith got onto one knee.   

"Good job. I knew you would realize you cannot keep going on for-" And he let the skulls facing the tower fire.    

In a split second, Zenith realized five things.   

For one, death truly was horrifying to cause.   

For another, this didn't have to happen.   

Third, he would not be able to pass this off easily as an act of self defense if he erased the evidence.   

Fourth, he had to save himself and the people around the cauldron, so in an even faster movement, he placed huge skulls above them.   

And finally, he wasn't going to be able to save many of those who were there that day.   

The tower crumbled down, so loudly he couldn't hear anything but noise.   

Then, there was silence. And the silence was worse than the noise.    
----Zenith didn't know whether to clean up the scene or not. He'd been planning to- it would be sloppy if he didn't- but now, if he touched the bodies, he would be taken in for questioning not for self-defense, but for murder. 

"Damn, why am I even thinking of this as if I was..." He started thinking out loud, but he held his tongue. Cressida! "S***!" He exclaimed, as he ran over to uncover the bodies, thankfully easily spotted due to the cracked skulls around them.

She had large gashes over her face and skin, some of which he ''knew'' would be permanent, but she was ''breathing.'' Zenith's eyes started to well up with tears. The situation instantly pulled all its weight on him. He didn't know how many cult members were gone, but he also knew that Cressida was alive. He cared deeply for her, and as her eyes fluttered alive, he smiled as if he was witnessing the birth of his own child. 

"Huh... wh..." She mumbled, right eye looking about aimlessly. She had her left eye closed. 

"Okay, uh, uh..." Zenith stuttered as he tried to figure out what to check if she was safe. "Oh! How many fingers am I holdin' up?" Zenith held up two fingers in front of Cressida.

"Two..." Cressida said softly.

"Okay, now how many?" He asked. He held up four fingers in front of Cressida's left eye, and put his right hand just over Cressida's right eye, so she would only be able to distinguish if she opened the other one.

"...I don't..." Cressida murmured.

"...Don't what?"

"Can't tell..." Cressida closed her eye again. 

"Oh s***, Cressy..." Zenith whispered. 

Her left eye was no longer golden hazel. It was a milky white. "You've gone partially blind from the whole... God..." Zenith connected the horrifying dots out loud. Maybe her vision could come back in the future, but for now...

He left her on the ground for a moment, so she could take a rest. Then, he rushed to check up on the other bodies.  

"Aisumi has to be alive, she was right... next to me" Cressida said behind him, voice cracking.  

"Alright, d' ya think ya can help me dig 'er out?" Zenith responded. 

"I guess..." She said. Her hands shook as she picked up pieces of stone...  
----Their hands were coated in dried blood, dirt, and dust. They rode through Ètares instead of walking in public, which got rid of that. Zenith didn't regret sparing Cressida from any judgement, but he did regret having the evidence on his body wiped. He wasn't sure what to do. Cressida was acting relatively calm. He was, too. 

They kind of had to act calm. People here didn't panic over death for some reason or another. Fear of getting in the game next, fear of attention, or in their- especially Zenith's- case, fear of getting arrested and executed. The entire had seen many classmates kill others at this point, so it wasn't that bad for Cressida, seeing as she didn't have to see the bodies or how they all died, but... Zenith did. 

Zenith dug the dead ones.

He could ''sense'' their forces- or lack of such.

And every time he had to touch the recently deceased, he felt a bit drained, he could practically see their last moments (though not literally, most of the time), and he'd never forget the looks on their faces.

Out of the twelve members of the club, six of them had made it out. The flaming bird, one of the crystal girls, a snake-like one, the shady kid who looked like Cherie's right hand mate, and of course, Cressida and Aisumi. The rest of them would only remain in Zenith's memories, their blood tainting his eyes (metaphorically). 

One of the kids didn't even have a head.

He hated himself for being so careless.

"We might need a cover story," Zenith said, as they walked. 

"We should just tell them what happened," Cressida thought out loud.

"What d' ya think they'd say t' ''&lt;nowiki/&gt;'so 'pparently there was a cult here and we killed half the members'?"'' Zenith asked sarcastically.

"Yeah, I see what you mean. But lying's never the answer. My parents did it all the time, and that's basically living proof that lying equals bad," Cressida asserted. 

"...Look, I'll figure it out," Zenith groaned, frustrated. This whole day only went from bad to worse. 

The rest of the day was completely blurred to Zenith. He knew that he had to have immediate medical care. He wasn't entirely sure what he told the nurses. He asked Cressida, over and over again, if everyone was alright, and Cressida had to remind him that no, not everyone is okay, and then he'd let out an exasperated sigh and say "I thought that," but five minutes later the interaction would repeat again, because it brought him some comfort, it brought him some understanding, it brought his confused, clouded mind to a temporary light before flooding back into nothing, and he didn't comprehend anything. 

Cressida somehow understood everything. The roles were reversed, Zenith was normally the one who overthought everything, whose mind was running faster than a freight train, but now her mind was going on the same track, and she'd ask the nurses a lot of questions, and wrote the answers down on a napkin. Zenith's freight train of a mind had crashed.  

Of course, eventually he'd regain some sense of control.  

But Cressida's mind would never go back to the same sense of innocence again. 

== Pentaptych ==
"Pentaptychs are conformed of five panels, or sections, a centerpiece, and double folding doors, or wings. Think of them as what you could place over an altarpiece," Miss Karrot said, while a presentation behind her showed an image of the aforementioned pentaptych. 

In the hubbub of constant death and personal issues, Antares often forgot that he was at school and not just a death trap. School was basically a death trap itself, though. Mercury normally talked to Polaroid in Reviewal and Art, so Antares was stuck next to Caelum. He only knew him through Cressida, kind of, since they were both kind of friends with each other. Reviewal was usually spent with the occasional "so what do you do for fun?" "try not to die," followed by a giggle, or otherwise meaningless dialogue accompanied by meaningless quips. Speaking of Reviewal, Ms. Karrot was talking to them about pentaptychs for a project. Apparently, they were supposed to make one in assigned pairs for their exam score. 

Caelum seemed distant. More than usual. They usually did their own thing, but he just didn't seem responsive. At all. The first phase was conceptualizing, and the clock ticked by, he realized they hadn't gotten anywhere, while everyone else already gotten out sketches, and was seriously considering telling Ms. Karrot some lie about how they just weren't in a good mindspace or something like that... It wouldn't be the first time Antares lied to get out of working, but he was actually kind of looking forward to this one, since he'd been thinking about implementing fire. 

Regardless, he'd need to have a talk with his classmate.  

He had more things to deal with, too. 
----During recess, he noticed Solaris usually patrolled the school, unless this one locket he owned beeped, which meant someone was in trouble or there'd be an incident. Mercury knew about it, but Solaris told Antares further in detail... After a few dozen questions, he found out it worked more like a magical, mechanical smartwatch (smartlocket?) built by Graham, and he could call and text through it. 

He also noticed that there wasn't much security around the dorms. It was... obvious, and yet things seemed to rely a lot on student morality, and teachers occasionlly patrolled, sure, and Solaris was around, but students could sneak into others' dorms easily.  

So instead of going to Solaris' room today, or his own dorm room, he went to Apollo's room. Antares... needed to deal with the feelings left over. He'd gotten a bit better at expressing himself. He'd noticed that speaking with Solaris kept him on edge, and uncomfortable, but Solaris could coax emotions out of him so easily, like a mist laid over his eyes, and he wanted it, but at the same time he felt a need to push away, and Solaris hadn't wronged him, so the problem was him, and now the depressing thoughts were back, so he opened Apollo's door. 

He was becoming more strategic. Thinking things out a little more. Sure, he used to make schedules, but now, he had schedules for those schedules... More of Solaris' subconscious doing, he supposed. 

Where Apollo's artstyle was mostly abstract, focusing more on color, shapes, and feelings, Antares focused mostly on realism. Except he wasn't that great at it, so his style inevitably lead towards a mix of both, where if he were to draw a bull, the head would be lines and pieces and one of the hooves would have all the detail he could. He just couldn't sit still enough to complete a masterpiece, but the people who cared usually thought it was quite creative. He considered it a bit of an issue... He could never focus on the full image.  

This time, he wanted to paint an ocean. That was how he felt like- Like a tumultuous ocean neath a thunderstorm. He wanted to have a pirate's ship and a man looking at the waters in the crow's nest with a brave face on.  

He soon realized painting murals was way harder than doing drawings on his notebook. He'd just finished about a quarter of the base sketch for the whole piece, and he realized the bell was already ringing in the distance. It was time for English. So he gave up on it, believing he'd never complete it anyway, and ran.   
----"Slightly late, Mr. Mercier. You've kept us waiting," Ms. Muriel said.

Antares mumbled an apology- Normally he'd get furious at himself and the teacher for calling him out, but at ''least'' he only heard a handful of giggles instead of having the whole class burst out laughing. It was a possibility!

His brother, once again, was sitting next to Polaroid, so he slid next to Solaris and let out a little sigh as the other students resumed their usual murmuring- Ms. Muriel didn't let them speak, but she couldn't hear that well if the volume was low enough.

"How likely do you think I'd get caught if I brought some chips in here?" Antares asked Solaris, accompanying his question with a swift poke to Solaris' left arm.

"Very. I'd make a minor exception for you, though," Solaris smiled gently.

"Yeah? What kind of exception?" 

"You must stay in the basement for two weeks and have to help me snuff the lights out at night," Solaris joked. 

They were on decent terms... Antares didn't like the way he was serious about ninety-nine percent of the time, but at least he got to tap on his nicer side after last night. And here, he thought he'd have to deal with some sort of mortal enemy... Something just seemed to make them click.

"Mmm, not bad, Abramowicz. Okay, what can you get away with in this school? Not, like, us in general, ''you,''" Antares asked another joke question.

"Hmm. Skipping class, if I planned it ahead," Solaris considered the question completely seriously, thinking up about twenty ideas to get out of the classroom in just a second.

"Bet," Antares grinned.

"Wh- ''oh.'' What do you want to do?" Solaris asked. They could make up this class, they were just learning about Animal Farm, which Solaris could easily teach and discuss with Antares, who didn't seem too interested in the first place. Solaris had actually read the book, after all- Most people in the room had looked up a summary instead. He'd found out through the babble, picking out lines such as "I ran it through AI, I didn't get it," and "So does Old Major die or something?"

"I dunno. If I wasn't in the expensive private high school to college for magical teenagers, I'd probably go throw rocks with my friends. What do kids here usually do?" To be fair, he didn't really have friends, he just had dudes he occasionally hung out with until they committed a minor misdemeanor and had to flee the scene. 

Solaris noticed Antares was opening up a little to him, which was quite the overnight advancement from not wanting anything to do with him. He thought about what they could do for a moment, and answered, "How about we practice fighting?" 

"Good idea. It's a Monday, so..." Antares sighed, thinking about all the deaths that were bound to come up. The class's numbers had slowly lessened. 

"The times are... tough. I do hope we don't get paired up together... We'd know our weaknesses, and we'd die from exhaustion..." Solaris watched Miss Amelia keep reviewing their essays from The Great Gatsby.

"On other notes, Group A is making a group chant... My father wants us to make one too, but... I'd much rather save myself the embarrassment." Solaris thought out loud.

"Wait, there's other ''groups?!'' Also, aren't we gonna skip?"

"Oh, sure, you've convinced me, but how did you ''not'' notice there's other groups? I mean, we don't even all share the same classes all the time," Solaris was a bit shocked.

"...I'm... Wow. Okay! There's a lot of people here! How many groups are there?" 

"Four per year. We share most of the same classes, but occasionally we switch it up to promote interaction within students. Your friend Anna, for example, used to be in Group D. If someone in our class dies, I'll try to hold a funeral for them," Solaris' thoughts were morbid at the moment, and it was reasonable given the circumstances. All conversations in this school eventually circled back to death within the first years. Even older students were trying to help, to no avail.

"Wow. I met Anna after PhysMa... You should, mmm..." ''"Teach me how to be more aware of my surroundings,"'' he wanted to say, but he knew he was just looking for an excuse to... Well, he didn't want to accept it. 

"Yes, Antares, I'd love to spend some time with you," Solaris said, understanding Antares' intent perfectly. 

Sadly, so did the rest of the class, who'd gone quiet when Solaris said that. 

Then, they exploded in excited cheers and screams, believing the pair to be on a date. 

"Settle down, or I ''will'' give you all detention!" Solaris exclaimed, which quickly shut them up. 

"Thank you, Mr. Abramowicz," Amelia glanced up to smile at Solaris, and then went back to reviewing.

Solaris rubbed the back of his neck, and said, "It's not a date."

"No, they're just teasing us," Antares clarified.

"Where you lack academically, I lack in social skills... I wouldn't even know what to do on a date. For years, Polaroid was my only friend..." 

"Am I your friend?"

Solaris' ears twitched, and he took in deeper breaths. "Well, uhm, I mean, if you want to be."

"I would very much like that, Mr. Abramowicz," Antares smiled, giving his most gentle smile he'd ever given the bear. "Or should I say, Solaris?"

His voice was quite sweet, yet retained its natural rasp when he said Solaris' name, and Solaris' ears twitched further, a small blush forming onto his face. He wouldn't have admitted it at the time, but he found Antares somewhat charming...

"Heh," Antares chuckled, knowing exactly what he'd done.

"Oh, well, would you- Would you look at the time? It's time for math! Let's get... going!" Solaris said, embarrassed.

"No skipping?"

"I suppose not..."
----After Math, Cressida slid into her bed, tired. 

Zenith had told the hospital some strange lie that she hadn't fully heard, but whatever it was, was a lie nonetheless. She lamented the losses of the people in the building, but in this school, you had to move on from those as fast as possible. She didn't want more death in her life. 

"I could leave the games..." She whispered to herself, "But I want to prove to my parents that I'm worthy of... living..."  

She still couldn't process the fact that her own parents wanted her dead. 

She couldn't process many things. Academically, she was doing extremely well for someone with her previous knowledge, and the teachers went very easy on her, but emotionally, she was struggling a bit. 

And she bottled it up so she could make sure Zenith felt better, because he was struggling too, and so was everyone else, and maybe, just maybe, if they saw her smiling, they could smile again too, just for a moment. 

She dreaded the thought of PhysMa. Everyone was ''implied'' to need to be there. She did not want to be there.  

As she lost herself in her thoughts, she didn't notice Zenith had walked into the room, carrying a few books. 

"Cressy, you alright?" Zenith asked, patting her hair gently. He left the books on the side of the bed, and had sat down next to her. 

"Mmm... No, I don't think so. I don't wanna kill anyone. And I don't feel okay with you right now. But, uhm, I'll get used to it. And, uhm, I'm gonna go look for... someone." 

"Okay." 

Cressida sat up, and looked at the books. "''The Canterbury Tales'', Marco Polo's ''Travels, The Mabinogion, Beowulf...'' Did you get these from the library? Can I read them?" 

"Actually, they're for you. I couldn't make sense of all the books, got a bit overwhelmed, so I just ordered them in. The butterfly system- ZAHBS- has been malfunctioning for some reason. Butterflies keep turning up dead. People don't receive letters. I'm probably gonna ask Solaris about it. After all, he is kind of like a little teacher." Zenith let out a small chuckle, but his face was clearly that of concern. Perhaps he'd ordered the books much sooner... 

"I guess you're coming with me, then." She mumbled. 

"So. Do we have anything else t' talk about?" 

"...I can't really think clearly right now. Just a few weeks ago, I was just praying, singing, and trying to avoid punishment. Now..." 

"I see what ya mean..." Murder was a nasty word that was nastier in act. 
----Mercury didn't just walk, he zoomed. He knew that his brother was not sleeping in their dorm, and often, not even staying there. It would have been cruel of him not to notice. Frustrated, he grit his teeth, but yelped when he accidentally bit his tongue. 

He was deeply concerned for him, he knew he was probably doing fine, but he just knew he ought to try to talk to him, and somehow, he'd reached Polaroid's room.

He knocked quickly, gently.

"Polaroid, are you there?" He asked, nervously.

Polaroid unlocked and opened the door, confused. "M-Mercury, what's go-going on?" He asked, but Mercury only rushed inside and gave him a hug, squeezing him. 

"O-oh... Well, come here..." Polaroid said.

Over the course of the last few weeks, they had gotten quite close to each other. "Do you know where Antares is?" Mercury twiddled with his hair nervously. Polaroid always got him a little nervous. Could be because they'd kissed before.

"Okay... What's wrong?" The wolf asked, holding Mercury's hands as to try and calm him down.

"I'm just really worried, and he's never around anymore, and I feel like I need to know what's going on or else he might..." Mercury held himself back from saying something he'd regret later.

"...Okay, well, ma-maybe he's staying with Solaris?"

"Why with Solaris?"

"He- he has been for so-some time, you know..." Polaroid's tail bumped against Mercury's, making him blush a little.

"Oh, I'll need to check on him before then... I don't want him getting in trouble..." Mercury watched Polaroid as he ran his fingers on his nails, and his heart raced a little... He quickly planted a kiss on the other boy's right ear, swift and soft and gentle, and got up. The other boy was stunned, and didn't say anything, only pressing his hand to the aforementioned ear. 

"Well, uhm, I'll be back soon!" Mercury exclaimed, and left the room, leaving a shocked, blushing Polaroid behind.

He could hear a dreamy little sigh through the door as he closed it, and his heart was racing. ''"Oh god, I actually did that,"'' he thought. 

Relationships in Zios High progressed fast.

He heard the door lock behind him, and walked to Solaris' room. It wasn't too far, but he'd never been, and the only reason he knew where he slept was because he'd asked Polaroid a long time ago out of his own curiosity. Polaroid...

Polaroid was wonderful, handsome, adorable... He wanted him to be his boyfriend, but then there was someone else that charmed him...

He knocked on the door to Solaris' dorm. "Excuse me, is Solaris here? Is this your room?" He asked, somewhat feigning innocence, knowing exactly where he was going.

The door quickly swung open, revealing four people inside. Solaris himself, at the door, and on the sofas nearby, he could see his brother, Zenith, and Cressida.

"Antares is here." He quickly said, and practically pushed Solaris out of the way (who didn't seem to mind the slight rudeness of the act), and walk right up to the other one. 

"Like, what ''are'' you doing? You do realize this ''isn't'' your dorm, do you? Why did you stay here last night?" He said, with some anger in his voice. Antares was on a sectionary sofa- Mercury hadn't cared much about looking around, he had a goal in mind- on the right seat of the right wing of it. Zenith was directly across of him, Cressida sitting next to him like a little winged ball. 

"Take a seat, Mercury. I'm sure we all have a great deal of information, and issues we ought to resolve. The best thing we can do right now is talk." Solaris said, as he locked the door. It was less of an invitation and more of an order, and he walked to the sofa, electing the middle part of the middle seat. 

"You're right. Let's talk." Mercury let out a small "''Hmph",'' as he crossed his arms and took a seat. 

Antares and Zenith were giving each other the death stare, but they stopped as soon as Mercury sat down, Zenith giving him an awkward smile and wave, while Antares mouthed him an ''"I'm sorry".''

''"It's fine... ish."'' He mouthed back, as Zenith started to work some magic. He formed a string from the palms of his hands, facing each other, but it trembled and danced with the danger of snapping in two. Cressida decided to try and put her own hands, unsure of the purpose of the string, but attempting to help, so their hands formed a square. Her face turned to that of frustration as she forced a string out as well, this one bright like the sun, and they interlocked. 

Zenith grabbed the string of magic, rolled it into a small ball, and stretched it out, actively adding more of his own power into it. The amount of effort this seemed to take was insane, his eyes turning pitch black, his hair moving from invisible wind as he shivered from an unknown cold, and yet he was sweating as if he was in a heatwave, and the ball expanded, and expanded, and was cold but hot at the same time, like a piece of ice when it stops snowing and the sun peeks through, but passed through everyone, and soon, covered almost the entirety of the room as if it was a clear fabric or sheet, with only the slightest tinge of purple with yellow swirls. 

And then, Zenith collapsed onto the sofa, breathing heavily, eyes slowly fading back from black to white and purple, wind gone, sticky from the sweat. "Oh god, I'd... never cast a spell that big, I..." He shivered, his body still not used to the warmer temperature of the place that was neither freezing nor scorching, "I never did a spell w' two people, it's... stronger..." 

"What was that all about?" Antares asked. He'd quickly sprung to his feet, and was already checking out how the spell worked. It wasn't a shield, because he could poke his fingers through the corner of the room he was testing, near Solaris' bed.

"Cloakin' and silencin'. Even if Liza managed t'-" He let out a sneeze, it sounded like a kitten, Cressida broke out in a little giggle, Zenith continued; "Find a way t' hear us in here, because a ''certain'' genius never thought she'd do that..."

"Guilty as charged. I never thought someone could invade such boundary. I ought to have expected it, though. It was a huge oversight from my part, and I apologize." Solaris explained.

"It's okay, you don't have to be perfect, having someone super smart like you really helps," Cressida tried to comfort him, even though Solaris didn't really ''need'' comforting.

"Well, anyway, I had to do somethin'. This spell is completely new, an' Cressida gave me the idea from one of her books, but I had to change up some o' the elements cuz' I knew it'd take way more power than I can muster... an' also, I had to make things easier since I had to cloak the whole room an' for a long time, too." Zenith's eyes were nearly back to normal, but he was still breathing heavily, and if one put their ear to his chest, they'd be able to tell that his heart was pouding heavily.

Antares walked back to his part of the sofa, as Mercury looked at Solaris, and asked; "How about we start off by talking about the magic here?" The bear nodded, and he gave a quick glance to Zenith, so he could voice his problem, which he'd explained earlier, but not with Mercury around.

(WIP)

    <title>Message Wall:Miss icyfox</title>
    <ns>1200</ns>
    <id>162200</id>
    <redirect title="Message Wall:Icyfox Houndz" />
    <revision>
      <id>256538</id>
      <timestamp>2022-12-15T22:25:54Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>FANDOMbot</username>
        <id>32794352</id>

    <title>Glass</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162208</id>

      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="534" sha1="syr8ry1vl06pbn2zvsibhb1tmmivv5v" xml:space="preserve">'''''WARNING: SEMI-MINOR TO MAJOR SPOILERS FOR [[Universe|UNIVERSE]], WHICH HAVE NOT APPEARED IN THE STORY YET.'''''

NOTE: Alternative Universe where Antares' father is still alive. I'm not willing to talk about the implications it would have in the canon universe again. Shut your cakehole and read.

== Glass ==
Antares was bleeding. 

After the events of two years ago, he was used to the feeling of having the liquid drip down his skin.

He was also used to his father's temper, as sober as drunk. It always got worse when drunk.</text>

  <page>
    <title>Mannequins (2022 rewrite)</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162209</id>
    <revision>
      <id>256635</id>
      <timestamp>2023-01-01T00:58:12Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Mothman Believes in You</username>
        <id>39086312</id>
      </contributor>
      <comment>wrote story</comment>
      <origin>256635</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="9108" sha1="r47znfkthlgwb1zvfq3d8p0whemoln9" xml:space="preserve">It has been so long since ive been active here lmao 

So in lke 2018 I wrote a god awful fan fiction called Mannequins

it was the first one I ever wrote and it was horrible 😭

SO I decided to rewrite it years later to show my writing improvement 

So without further ado here is mannequins rewritten (it is literally a completely different story with the same premise lmao) 


Hi, if you are reading this, please read the whole thing. My name is Shelly, and this is a warning from me to you. DO NOT buy the new animal jam mannequins. If you won't just heed my warning and move on, please read my story. Then maybe you'll listen. I don't have much time, I can feel my consciousness slowly fading, so please, listen....

A few days ago, animal jam had an update. This update included a new feature: mannequins. They are den items that appear to be blank, statue-like, version of different animal jam animals. If you click on them, you can customize them as if they were your own playable animal. When I saw this update, I thought nothing of it. I was very excited, in fact. I rushed to the diamond shop and blew all my diamonds on multiples of every variant of the mannequins. I quickly clicked on my den to place them and start customizing them. After I did so, I had an idea! I should role-play with them! See, I was desperate for role-play. As my buddies got older, along with most of the active animal jam players, nobody wanted to role-play anymore! It seemed I was the only one left who had any interest in doing so, and these mannequins seemed to me like the perfect role-play partner. I decided to role-play that me and my wolf mannequins were secretly living in a volcano, so I thought the volcano den would be perfect! I switched my den to the volcano den and placed down 5 wolf mannequins, all customized with fox hats, head feathers, bow and arrows, and worn blankets. Stereotypical  role-player outfits. After a while of roleplaying, I got bored and decided to change it up. 

"Oh no! Flame-Paw fell into the lava! Leaf-heart, HELP!" 

I moved one of the wolf mannequins, "Flame-Paw," who wore a red fox hat, and red bow and arrows, with brown fur and fire patterns, into the lava. After a while of pretending to try to rescue Flame-Paw, I noticed that his expression looked almost... pained? But that couldn't be. It was my imagination surely. I looked closer and realized that the mannequin was... blinking? Strange. I was startled out of my focus by the sound of a jam-a-gram notification. I had received a new jam-a-gram from my buddy, Puppiesarecute3453. It read "Hey! did you see the update? Come to my den to check out my mannequins!"

I decided to take a break from my role-play to check out my buddy's den. When I arrived in her den, her and at least 50 mannequins were there to greet me. 

"Hi, Pup!" I said excitedly. "Hi, Shel!" She replied. "Cool mannequins!" I said. "Yeah!! I spent over 400 diamonds on these!!" She replied. After discussing diamonds and mannequins for a little while, I decided to get back to my role-play. 

"Hey, I'm gonna get back to my den to role-play with my new mannequins." I told her. "OOH! Can I join you?" She asked. I agreed. 

When we returned to my den, I immediately noticed something was off with Fire-Paw. His expression was still the same, however, his eyes looked extremely pained. Not even subtly, even a small child could see that something was off. Puppy seemed to notice this too. 

"Whoa! I didn't know mannequins could do that!" She said. 

"Um... I didn't either..." I replied, very confused. 

Ignoring this out of fear, I suggested we resume the role-play. I filled her in on what was going on, and she seemed to understand. We both agreed to kill off Fire-Paw. 

"Hey! Shel! I got him out of the lava! But.... he's... not breathing.." 

I clicked on the mannequin to change his eyes to the X-eyes, but when I did, his expression changed again. His eyes looked scared. It was almost like he was telling me not to change his eyes. This freaked me out, so I didn't. 

"Pup! You spoke too soon! He's still alive! Just barely, we have to act fast." 

I placed some "healing herbs" in my den, and pretended to heal Fire-Paw. After a while of roleplaying, Pup told me she had to go soon. I decided to buy a new mannequin, a fox to match Pup's animal for after she left. After I bought it, I placed it in my den and began customizing it to match Pup's look. After I exited the editor, Pup had left. Or so I thought..... 

I continued my roleplay like normal, but then I heard the sound of another jam-a-gram. For a split second, I swear it said "I'm scared," but then it changed to being a normal jam-a-gram from my other buddy. 

"Come to my den to role-play with mannequins!" 

It seemed I wasn't the only one with this idea. I decided to join my buddy, Sharkyshark56472, to role-play. I arrived in his den and we began role-playing. Soon after we started, I got a text from my mom saying dinner would be ready soon. I told my buddy this, and to buy a mannequin that resembled my animal that could replace me when I had to go. He did exactly that. When he began editing the mannequin, I started to feel strange. I brushed it off, but as soon as he exited out of the editor, everything went black. When I came to, I felt strangely stiff. I opened my eyes, and what I saw shocked me, and confused me. I saw peck's den, the den we had been roleplaying in, and all the mannequins involved in the role-play, only, it wasn't on a computer screen. I was seeing all of this through my own eyes, as if I had been sucked into animal jam. At first I thought I was dreaming, but the longer this "dream" went on, the more I realized this was, in fact, real. I was in shock. I couldn't comprehend what was happening. As I was trying to make sense of the situation, I was pulled out of my focus by a strong tugging sensation. My whole body was moving without me moving it. Then, my body turned, and I stopped moving. I could see a speech bubble above Shark's head. 

"(Keels Shelly)" 

Suddenly, Shark rushed over to me and started jumping. It hurt. It hurt so bad and I couldn't even scream. I couldn't cry, I couldn't run, I couldn't move at all. All I could do was stand there until it was all over. To my relief, he stopped jumping seconds later. Suddenly, everything went black again. When I opened my eyes, I realized I was in the editor. Shark was putting "blood splatters" on me. I braced myself, but all I felt was a strange shifting sensation in my fur. Then, everything went black again. When I opened my eyes, I was back in the den. I could see the other mannequins being moved around. I was staring at them when I noticed something that make my stomach churn. All of the mannequins were blinking. 

Now I realized why Fire-Paw's expression had changed, and why Pup had vanished when I made a mannequin copy of her. Every mannequin in the game was another player. I felt so guilty I wanted to throw up. Why had I tortured Fire-Paw like that? Why did I even buy mannequins in the first place! Oh god I'm a terrible person..... I wanted to cry, I wanted to scream, I wanted to apologize to every mannequin I owned, but it was too late. Suddenly, I was snapped out of my spiral by the recycling screen popping up in front of Shark. By the time I realized what was going on, I didn't even have a chance to brace myself. I was being recycled. I felt a horrible sharp pain all over my body. I just wanted this all to end. I wished I had just gone to eat dinner when I had the chance. It hurt so bad I wanted to rip out all my nerves. Suddenly, it all stopped, and I blacked out again. When I opened my eyes, I was looking at the diamond shop. I saw a wolf walk in. She clicked on me, which felt very strange, and she bought me. Suddenly, I was in her den. Then, before I could even have a thought, I was being edited, and that's where I am now- Oh god...  I'm fading fast... I have to hurry... Wait- is she... oh god... she's changing me to look like her! I can't warn her, I can't do anything except for blink... I think she noticed... I can hear her talking! 

"Oh that's so cool! They blink!"

NO! STOP! PLEASE! PLEASE NO! SHE'S PRESSING THE X... OH GOD-- PLEASE OH GOD IT HURTS SO BAD MAKE IT STOP PLEASE I CAN FEEL MY SKIN PEELING OFF AS I WRITE THIS... PLEASE HEED MY WARNING... I BEG OF YOU... I DON'T KNOW WHAT'S GOING TO HAPPEN NEXT BUT IM SCARED. 

Update: Hey! It's Shelly! Sorry about that, its been about 2 days since this happened. After she hit the x, I was freed. If you want to free your mannequins, all you have to do is change them to look like your animal. Just know, if you do this, it comes with a price. 

wait- I just got a jam-a-gram! It's from... Pup? 

"please help" 

Update 2: I decided to free pup, and I am back inside the mannequin. I'm currently trapped in my den, with nobody to recycle me or rescue me. It's been 3 months. The only website I can access is this one because it was open when I was trapped... I can feel myself fading again... so please.. before I'm gone... please do not buy the new mannequins...</text>
      <sha1>r47znfkthlgwb1zvfq3d8p0whemoln9</sha1>
    </revision>
  </page>
  <page>
    <title>User blog:Auryze/3rd person test (for writing out my roleplay)</title>
    <ns>500</ns>
    <id>162210</id>
    <revision>
      <id>256849</id>
      <parentid>256836</parentid>
      <timestamp>2023-01-18T02:36:15Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Auryze</username>
        <id>43449826</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>256849</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="9713" sha1="mpwr5fsugi4u7vrm6233tze40wy7gw2" xml:space="preserve">Note: Court = Floors. 

Note II: "saya, saya, saya" means "Blah blah blah" in demonian.  
----''"..%#$@#? What are you-"''

''"%#$@#.. What are you doing?!''

''Why do you have our gems?!"''

".."

''"Yeah.. What's going through your head?!''

''Please.. think this over! You don't know what you're doing."''

''"%#$@#, You shouldn't be acting so reckless!'' 

''You know what will happen when all gems are merged together!''

''It can kill us all!"''

''"..''

''I know, I'm very aware about what I will do."''

''"But what? What is it that you're planning to do? Why?!"''

''"Because you chose a side that defamed me.''

''Those who defame others will eventually be so immersed in the lies, almost to a point where the victim that is genuinely telling the truth will be seen as a liar."''

''"You killed that man, and we have a right to be mad at you, %#$@#. What makes you think you were the victim in all of this?"''

''"Because I was. Yet, you chose not to believe me, even after many times I tried to fess up the truth, you never seemed to take my side."''

''"You killed someone when YOU'RE a government official. You know it makes you seem corrupt."''

''"I'm aware. But, you realize that the clock is ticking, right?"''

''"What could you possibly mean that the clock is ticking?"''

''"Oh, silly Arlo. How innocent you must be..''

''It means that your end is right around the corner."''

''"Wait.. W-What? D-Don't kill me..! We- We had such good times together-''

''Why must you do this? Why?"''

''"...."''

''"No.. don't do this-"''

''"Spare us all.. P-Please.."''

''"Please.. %#$@#.. Tell us.. If they falsely accused you, we will prosecute them! W-We promise..!"''

''"Why should I tell you? The accusations already got to you all."''

''"So.. So we could know the truth."''

''"I've tried telling you the truth, many times, to be exact. You never listened.'' 

''It is a moral to believe the victim at all costs of course, but when I try to reveal the account of what happened to me, it was like a stab to the back by not only my own council, but the people.''

''I tried bringing Runia back to it's glory. I helped and helped, overworked myself until my eyes bled, isolated myself in order to keep everything in balance..'' 

''Only to be destroyed by a mere claim."''

''"B-But.. Please! Tell us now! We'll believe you, we promise!"''

''"It's rather too late to say that now, Isn't it?"''

''"..."''

''"Exactly the response I had expected.''

''You chose who to believe.'' 

''So, if you want to keep spreading this further, I'll have to eliminate you."''

''"E-Eliminate? You're out of your mind, you wouldn't do that to your own council.. R-Right?"''

''"Wrong."''

''".. Please, don't do this! You aren't thinking straight about this! STOP!"''

''"Saya, Saya, Saya. You keep blabbering the same thing over and over again, to think this through and not to actually eliminate you all.''

''Why's that? so I can suffer in the face of the public where I now have a tarnished reputation?"''

''"NO!"''     

----In the kingdom's of Leidenschaftlich, Or Leiden for short, and Myria, both conjoined by a large piece of land, The two of them seemed to have never gotten along with one another, despite their many differences they could easily accept.          

To many, Leiden was everything Myria was not, all due to the way both are presented.           

Leiden was lavish, pomp and very beautiful in architecture: Ivory columns with vines that surround it, furniture made out of silk with many flowers that surround the military waiting room, and a rather pomp throne room, surrounded by roses and guards, only for there to be a king and queen throne, but no queen ever took her place. The library in the second court could be seen as rather sluggish and messy with swarthy colors, but it contained knowledge that the rest of Azuren begged to seek out for.         

Surrounded by such elegance in the courtyards and the fine entrance, near the library is just a quiet area where individuals could sit and take a breather after a stressful day. Outside, a meadow is present, wide and full of trees and greenery with some areas set up by settlers due to the high living expenses. The meadows are seen as rather plain due to it being relatively untouched, but the marvelous kingdom's architecture, outside and inside of the walls, seems to captivate the tourists and those in other kingdoms.       

But, behind such lavishness opens a tarnished reputation in between the holes of lavishness, extravagance and elegance. Leiden is only ruled by a king who does not seem to care for the people around him, causing a relatively high poor population where they would have to tithe what they had left in order to supply the kingdom. Prices of food, specifically staples like rice and bread, began to skyrocket. Once being around ten runes per pound, it is now fifty per pound. King Helios, the supposed mighty king of Leiden, seemed to not do anything about the rapid inflation of goods, letting his population starve and allowed their skin to fall off their bones.           

The treatment of other species, specifically demons by the king, was not too stellar, since he was not the most accepting person an average folk would want to be around. He had ordered many soldiers to kill demons, including rarer kinds that were already on the verge of extinction and not only being endangered, all for the sake of keeping the kingdom "safe," when in sheer actuality, he is only putting a population closer and closer to extinction. The treatment of the people were a large concern, and many other officials checked to see these claims, but everything seemed to be wiped. It looked like all the people were happy, living their lives as normal humans and every need was being met for everyone.. But, when they set foot outside of the kingdom, everything goes back to inequality.             

Myria, however, was not as grand as Leiden, but less problematic by all means. Myria was like a forest, a large and lush one, abundant in many resources with small tents and homes reside in. There was no official castle, but only two, large stone thrones with a sapphire in the middle of both of them sit there with two, off-teal steppes that sit next to them. Despite their rather poor kingdom, the people were happy: They were free. They did not have to fight or protest to get rights, but they already had their freedom.             

Of course, they had their positives and used to get along fairly well with their fair share of disagreements here and there..       

But it never lasted for over a few years, since Leiden had begun stealing Myria's supplies from their abundant kingdom.       
----


It was a lovely summer afternoon, a nice day where the breeze was never too hot or ever too cold, but was just right as most said so. Nothing was burning the soil and drying up the crops, nor was anything covered in ice and withering the wheat, but it was similar to that of a nice spring morning that only happens once in a while. The breeze was a warm wind, blowing smoothly on the crops and trees alike. For the first time in over many years, the summers were not like the heatwaves that had occurred back then.    

The sky was clear and blue, the clouds were swirling in the sky and moving a  a slow pace, the sun beaming down brightly. Below was what seemed to be a rather sacred village, or that was what some people might have assumed. It was actually a hideout, one that was hidden in the lush forests of Azuren. The continent was rather large inside, incredibly large to be more precise, but very little of it was cities, or even kingdoms: It was only mountains and mountains of land surrounded by thick trees and swampy lakes.   

In the sky above is a bird soaring, an odd one to be more exact. A gray, bald eagle with a lighter underbelly with swirly, purple markings and bird armor that is sharp on the edges. On board the large bird is two people, Soul Kawasaki and Cereza Almazan, both desperately trying to find a potion to help her younger twin sister, Arcana, break free from Lilith's control after a squabble gone wrong. Of course, Cereza had made a base for the potion, but something was wrong with it: It did not seem like enough to defeat Lilith entirely.   

Lilith is a different person, stuck inside of Arcana. She is similar to that of another soul inhabiting ones body, and even though she was able to keep this side hidden.. Lilith got the upper-hand, and took over her body, making her fight the people she not only loved the most, but also her allies: And both Soul and Cereza were looking for a way to separate Lilith from her. Lilith was a handful, she was always spontaneously getting more and more out of control and Arcana's body could not seem to take control over her own body, but she did not succumb to her control: She kept fighting and fighting for control over her body, but she lost. Lilith lost herself, and took over her.   

The bird, after getting closer to the land, transformed into a tall man with a deep, brown complexion with ghostly white eyes with a faded brown pupil in the middle, his hair long and beige, extending to his lower back in a curly ponytail. His armor was different from what lieutenants usually wear: A gold helmet shaped like a crown with two large feathers that stuck from the side, all being held by two purple gems, the sides having feathers that dangled down, nearly touching his ear. He did not speak one word to those who talked to him, because he simply could not hear nor speak one word out of his mouth. He was mute, similar to that of insects and younger animals.      

no i cant continue this rn

      <text bytes="59452" sha1="0ssi9vt8w344z4rf7qnmbco20katb7o" xml:space="preserve">'''BAHAHAHA if the title sounds really cool, then sorry, you should've been keeping your expectations low. This story is kind of goofy and not really overly serious, there'll be some humor and stuff (at least, if my sense of humor isn't outdated). That's mostly because I just want to write a book suitable for children-preteen once I get the hang of this writing thing. Story starts off in an awkward spot so feel free to ask questions in the comments :P'''
