      <text bytes="14680" sha1="bywolru177afkmtjte0x9yizv5njc90" xml:space="preserve">''Auryze made this article LMAO XD''{{Character idk|title1=Misaya Myat|image1=&lt;gallery&gt;
MISAYAAAA.jpeg|Drawing
Misaya_my_silly_pie!_.png|Gacha Club
Misaya WOOOOO.png|Animal Jam
&lt;/gallery&gt;|nickname=Saya &lt;small&gt;(by customers)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Ghost man &lt;small&gt;(By Shay)&lt;/small&gt;|age=23|height=6'2|species=Ghost Demon|status=Alive|job=Bartender to Luckyside Tavern|residence=North Desolates, Azuren|affiliation=Unknown|alignment=Neutral|relatives=?|allies=?|enemies=?|gender=Male|Ethnicity=Burmese &amp; Filipino 🇲🇲 🇵🇭}}

'''Drawing credits go to xxayoaprilxx or known on the wiki as XxLucidFøxesxX. Thank you so much for drawing him!'''

'''Misaya Myat''' is a minor character in a Good Vs. Evil Roleplay. Living in the North Desolates of Azuren, he runs the Luckyside Tavern that situates on top of a steep landslide who often serves his customers without charge. He is later revealed to be a mist shard user, but does not exhibit his powers often.  

== History ==
Little is known about Misaya's past, as he never seems to bring up much of his origins, let alone where he had first came from. He does not have recollection of who his parents were and how he had been brought to the Desolates, but it is implied he never had parents, but was created by an unknown source that had mixed with ghost magic. Misaya is a primordial demon that wandered Azuren for over thousands of years without aging, capturing many people and turning them into his arms that spawn out of his back by absorbing their souls for amusement, causing his arms to have mouths. Due to this, he can only see and hear his arms unless he snaps his fingers to make them visible and hearable.  

During his time in Azuren and roaming the world as a whole, Misaya settled in a steep landslide in the Northern Desolates, full of resources and much of what he needed and started the Luckyside Tavern, both rendering as a place to work and live in without having to pay for anything, happily working while being resistant to those trying to pay him due to him not wanting to take anyone's money, but sometimes accepts it in order to save it to someday visit one of the Five Kingdoms. During the group's time in the Desolates, they had stopped by to have something to eat and drink before going back to their current mission after the desolates resources were slowly starting to deplet. 

According to [[Yuna Hanamura|Yuna]], Misaya is a ghost demon, a rare and unique type of demon that has the ability of eternal youth and being incapable of dying, something that is uncommon in many demon species who are able to live for long amounts of time, but are not entirely immune to death. His abilities are described to be as dangerous as a shadow demons when their abilities are awakened fully.    

== Appearance ==
''(NOTE: this character has two appearances: one Animal Jam model, and one Gacha Club model. The Gacha Club model is supposed to give a more accurate sense of what they would look like as a person, and not in Animal Jam. The Animal Jam Models and Gacha Club Models are used to show them both In animal jam and as an actual person.)''

=== Gacha Club Model ===
Misaya is a tall man of both Burmese and Filipino descent with somewhat gray skin and ghostly white eyes that were able to terrify any individual with only one stare, but is described as "fascinating" by people who have met him. He has long, gray hair tied in a braid, although when let down it reaches his shoulders. Underneath his left eye is one beauty mark and on the sides of his head are two, off-hued blue horns with light blue arms that spawn out of his back. Each one of his arms have dark blue mouths with teeth shaped like needles. 

Misaya dons a more casual outfit than the rest of the characters in the series. Around his neck, he wears a light blue scarf with layers that stick down from his shoulders and a cool blue turtleneck with darker blue ending sleeves. Misaya also sports light gray sweatpants and dark blue combat boots. Under his scarf is a mist shard that is attached to the middle of his neck.  

In his ghost form, his body shifts into a white, translucent body with multiple arms and holes as eyes. On his neck are a mountain of tinted purple flowers. In a smaller variant, however, he looks similar to Veena's spirit form and uses this to enact as her.  

=== Animal Jam Model ===
Misaya's Animal Jam model consists of a gray colored arctic wolf with white eyes, a peach underbelly and gray star patterns all over his body. On his head are two, light blue horns that sit on the top of his head instead of the sides.

Misaya dons a ghostly worn spiked collar with a blue worn blanket that slouches over his back. On his ankles are a navy-like colored elf bracelets, and on his tail has a blue elf tailed armor with darker blue gems. His arms are shown to be hidden in his Animal Jam Model, but when he snaps his fingers, they become visible. 
== Personality ==
Little is known about Misaya's personality. Though, in many scenes, he is depicted as rather polite and calm when working his job at the Luckyside Tavern, usually serving food and drinks with a smile on his face while resisting the offer of being paid when customers offer to due to him having all the resources he needs. He, in a sense, lives rent free, not having to pay any bills or having to make salary to make ends meet with a hatred of relying on others for money because he does not want to be portrayed as greedy or a user, and seems to be more reliant on the environment around him rather than being reliant on money. Due to his charming demeanor, he manages to attract customers with ease because of the way he sets up his environment in the tavern he owns.  

Misaya has demonstrated to be an expert when it comes to bartending, being able to mix up certain drinks to concoct something new, similar to that of making potions while having the capability to cook good food according to many who have been to his tavern. Due to being a self-made individual, he has little to no difficulty surviving in extreme conditions, since he cannot die or age by any means and was able to survive many diseases that were seen as deadly because of being a ghost demon. Misaya has also shown to be generous and rather hospitable, allowing Locaster and the group inside of his tavern when it was raining heavily and even allowing them to stay in a spare room for a while until the rain will stop.     

He demonstrates that he sees himself as a god because of his eternal youth because of his immortality, but he has been shown to act agitated when his arms begin to argue with one another, usually saying "Tumahimik ka!" (lit. "be quiet" in filipino) to silence them in order to not deal with their antics. Being the sole controller of his arms, he has been described to have fluid movements when using his abilities. To many villagers, Misaya is portrayed as rather majestic and beautiful because of his youthful appearance, being able to captivate those with just a stare to the eyes and his friendly tone in voice. Due to his open mind, Misaya can express his opinions freely without any consequence or fear of being persecuted by any officials due to the place he lives in.      

Even though he is rather friendly on the surface when working at his tavern, Misaya is a rather cold and distant individual and shows little to no attachment for those around him. He shows no interest in those around him and demonstrates to get easily bored or unmotivated in less than a minute: He can come off as prudent to those he generally dislikes, and often gives rude glares to them. Misaya is a very boastful individual, often bragging at times on how he can live forever while Locaster can only live for a short time and get killed.          

== Abilities ==
'''Overall Abilities:''' Despite appearing harmless on the surface as a mere bartender, Misaya has been shown to be a very powerful, yet dangerous demon. Even though he can turn into a seemingly harmless ghost to pose as a spirit from the spirit world, he was able to possess many people and take their soles with ease in order to transform them into one of his many arms he has by using deception and posing as someone rather innocent and eager only to fully take advantage of them in the end by gaining their trust and taking their souls to turn them into one of his many arms. 

Due to having multiple arms not being viewable or hearable to the public eye unless he snaps his fingers, he is able to snatch and steal people without getting caught, further exemplifying his powers. He was able to easily have [[Ashton Khan|Ashton]] in a chokehold position without difficulty by using his arms to grab his throat and torso, despite him being an extremely skilled mercenary, and was able to bypass [[Shizuka Ikami|Shizuka's]] ability of mind manipulation by nearly crushing her left arm when doing so and almost crushing her body into shrubs.   

'''Apathy:''' Though, not entirely emotionless, Misaya has demonstrated to be somewhat apathetic. He is incapable of feeling emotions like grief and sadness, but uses this to his advantage by being able to calmly process any situation without much panic and remains in the same mental state after doing so. Due to his apathy, Misaya finds it more than helpful allows him to come up with a solution easily without having to stress out or start crying. Due to this, he was able to kill many demon hunters that were in an attempt to kill him. Though, he is still able to express other emotions as he is not completely apathetic, such as being delighted whenever he gets customers at his tavern.    

'''Immense Speed &amp; Reflexes:''' As a demon, Misaya has demonstrated to be very fast and extremely quick on his feet. Unlike most demons, he is able to enhance his speed through his arms by extending them and jumping from one place to the next without having to use his legs. According to Ashton, Misaya was able to catch up to him, even though he was going at a rather slow pace. Misaya is fast enough to outrun many common demon species, including Veena, who has demonstrated to be an extremely fast runner despite not being a demon. Due to his speed and his boost via his arms, he was able to catch many demon hunters without having to fight them hand-to-hand or  face-to-face. 

His reflexes are equally as fast and managed to avoid getting hit by a falling tree, along with being able to evade Hikages shadow vines she had sent after him. 

'''Immense Strength:''' Misaya has shown to possess an incredible amount of strength, throwing Shizuka off of him in merely a minute and kicking Locaster into a tree effortlessly. His strength is also exemplified when he went head on with Yuna, nearly fracturing her wrist when she was about to inject poison in him to hinder his abilities.  

'''Unlimited Stamina &amp; Endurance:''' Misaya has shown to have unlimited stamina and endurance, having a higher level than [[Damion Halloreen|Damion]], a founding demon himself and [[Hideko Inazuma|Hideko]], one of the strongest mercenaries in his village. He had managed to remain in the same mental state and bodily shape he was in the moment he starts to engage in combat. Misaya is also able to resist damage from natural disasters because of his ghostly abilities.     

'''Keen Intellect:''' Being alive for over thousands of years, Misaya is an intelligent and very knowledgable individual, having knowledge about every demon specie and power that can assist him in evading attacks and getting away with his misdeeds.      

'''Regeneration:''' As a ghost demon, Misaya has the rare ability to regenerate any body part of his that has been lost, including his ghost arms. He was able to regrow his arm after Ashton had sliced it off and his leg when Damion had teared it off. Even though he can regrow his ghost arms back, they come back slightly weaker than it was before. His regeneration abilities are slightly faster than Ashton and Locaster's due to him being mixed with a ghost and is one of the only characters who can regenerate without overusing.        

'''Multi-lingual:''' Misaya has demonstrated that he can speak Burmese, Filipino, and English. This is seen when he says "Salamat po," a polite way of saying thank you in Filipino to Shay when he compliments his tavern, and speaks mostly Filipino, as Burmese is one of his more harder languages to speak.         

== Magic Abilities ==
'''Ghost Arms:''' Misaya has a multitude of light blue ghost arms that can extend endlessly without any stop. He is able to control and manipulate them to his extent. Being able to control his arms, they contain extreme strength that was nearly enough to crack all of Ashton's bones. His arms are ultimately much stronger than Damion, a Founding Demon and former Lieutenant Colonel. Misaya can also control the visibility of his arms, making them hidden so he can only see and hear them due to their ability to speak. Though, when he snaps his fingers, he is able to make his arms revealed to the people around him.   

'''Soul Transfer:''' Misaya has demonstrated that he can take the soul's of people without difficulty by putting his thumb onto someones forehead and taking away their soul's so they can become one of his arms. As he is able to take soul's, it will add onto his lifespan. Misaya can also give life back by returning their souls to their original body, though he can only use this spell once every a thousand years and chooses to not use it.   

'''Ghost Form:''' Being part ghost, Misaya is able to transform into a ghost in order to remain invisible or to go inside of another being and control them, whether it'd be facial expressions, bodily movements or speech. With his ghost form, he becomes transparent and is able to fly through doors, windows and restraints, similar to [[Veena Lu|Veena's]] spirit form.   

== Weaknesses ==
'''Overuse:''' Like all demon's Misaya's main weak point is overusing his magic. His symptoms are a mix of both glitching and fatigue. He will start to glitch from his ghost form and his regular self, and his arms will start to become out of control, along with also becoming rather tired. If he overuses his magic to a certain extent, it will cause him to cough up alarming amounts of blood.   

'''Lavender:''' Misaya has demonstrated to have an extreme allergy towards lavender. When nearly possessing Locaster, he managed to consume Lavender in time in order to quickly shoo him away. As he is allergic, his reactions can range from typical allergy symptoms to his powers glitching.

  <page>
    <title>Ferox Amata</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162225</id>
    <revision>
      <id>258559</id>
      <parentid>258432</parentid>
      <timestamp>2023-08-19T21:45:46Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Auryze</username>
        <id>43449826</id>
      </contributor>
      <comment>Adding categories</comment>
      <origin>258559</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="6181" sha1="6upx40pja5g24m5pt9p49kwmkbbfjii" xml:space="preserve">''Article made by Auryze dont edit without permission LAWL''{{Character idk|title1=Ferox Amata|age=33|height=6'4|species=Demon &lt;small&gt;(Implied)&lt;/small&gt;|status=Alive|residence=Myria|affiliation=Kingdom of Myria|alignment=Good|relatives=?|allies=?|enemies=?|image1=Ferox the silly.jpg|gender=Male|Ethnicity=Mauritanian 🇲🇷}}

'''Ferox Amata,''' otherwise known as '''King Ferox of Myria''', is a minor, yet frequently mentioned character in a Good Vs. Evil Roleplay. Even though he has not made an appearance, he has been revealed to be the king of the kingdom, Myria, who the kingdom across from them, Leiden, had disdain for.  

Ferox is one of the main participants in the Leiden-Myria war, attempting to capture the shadow demon and spirit hybrid in order to get the rest of the land for his people that have countlessly suffered at the hands of the kingdom of Leiden.  

== History ==
Little is known about Ferox's early life, as he has never made an appearance in the roleplay, though he has been frequently mentioned by many of the characters throughout the series. Though, he was raised in a small kingdom as a child before his parents had mysteriously died. Ferox has blood of the Amata clan and discovered Myria after Leiden was created.  

Ferox is the king of the forest-like kingdom, Myria. Though it was not as vigorous as it's neighboring kingdom, Leiden, the people were happy and was described as being a determined and optimistic king, unlike the rather scornful and hostile king of Leiden, Acacius. It has been stated that both Ferox and Helios used to be rather close acquaintances when they were younger, but had fallen out due to their views on the world and their opinion on freedom, where Ferox had a mindset that everyone should be treated equally, the king of Leiden only wanted the people to be his subjects and does not see them as equal. This had caused a rift in their friendship and they slowly started to become rivals with one another. Even though the two became rivals, Ferox showed respect and never said anything foul-mouthed or disrespectful to the king, as he wanted to get back where they were before.     

When ruling Myria, Ferox gave more freedom and reasonable codes, but laws that would ensure no crime as they got to enjoy the freedom they had. He was described as a great ruler because of his leadership skills, and due to that, Myria was a peaceful kingdom with rather low crime rates, abundant in resources with people having enough to support their children and families and was described to be a kingdom that did not get into much conflict. In Leiden, however, it was much different than Ferox had hoped for: He had noticed  there was high poverty and extremely high crime rates with an alarming death count, despite being so extravagant on the outside with a rather high development scale in richer areas.       

As a result, many citizens of Leiden had managed to gain citizenship in Myria in order to live in peace, despite it being in a more developing stage and less wealthier than Leiden. Though, Acacius, the king of Leiden, had started to steal supplies from Myria that were being exported from both Elveria and Misterin. Ferox had confronted Acacius on the matter, but he dismissed the matter, saying it was delayed due to weather. Ferox found it suspicious, as the weather was said to be warm for most of the day         

== Appearance ==
Ferox is a tall man around the age of thirty-three with a slightly muscular build with brown skin and messy, black hair that goes towards his back. His eye's are shown to be two different colors, one being a dark gray tone and one being white with one of his hands having a black claw to replace one of his arms that he had lost. On the left eye, he has a long scar that goes across his face, and on the sides of his head are two, black horns that curl down to his ears.

Ferox's attire consists of a gray bodysuit shirt that has darker sleeves with two, dark gray armor-like padding on the wrist area with a cross necklace hanging down from his neck. Around his chest is light silver chest armor with white rimming and a dark gray belt with silver lining that goes around his hip area. Ferox also dons white, slightly baggy pants with a gray cloak that slings on his shoulders and black boots with dark gray patterns.  
== Personality ==
Even though Ferox was not seen throughout the roleplay, by many accounts of Myrian citizens, he is described to be a rather kind and gentle soul while having a strong sense of justice for those around him with a small distaste towards king Helios due to the treatment of his own people and his kingdom. According to Locaster, he has been described in some writing as being a good leader, always trying to fight for what is right with a rather positive view on the people around him and the world and seemed to have a similar personality to [[Damion Halloreen|Locaster's father]] during the time of him being a founding demon, wanting the better for his people and did not want them to suffer, doing everything he could to make his people live happily without conflict.      

Despite being enemies with the king of Leiden, Ferox has demonstrated to be a very respectful individual. Even though Helios has a distaste for Ferox and his kingdom after the both of them became rivals, he tries his best to never say anything that can come off as disrespectful to him, let alone disheartening or rude to him as he demonstrates that he has a desire to reconcile with king Helios to assist in helping his kingdoms. He shows an equal amount of respect for any individual around him, whether it'd be a merchant or one of nobility, and treats people with dignity and compassion.        

== Abilities ==
'''Overall Abilites:''' Though, not much are said about Ferox's abilities, according to many, he had demonstrated to be not only a powerful individual, but was one of the best fighters due to being experienced in combat because of his father being a general in the army for Misterin.

    <title>Áine Ashe</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162234</id>
    <revision>
      <id>258549</id>
      <parentid>258454</parentid>

      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="7919" sha1="9himbq6jt3h0mewspf37smp9r3hbwkd" xml:space="preserve">''Page made by Auryze :3 Don't edit without permission.'' {{Character idk|title1=Áine Ashe|nickname=Seal Boy &lt;small&gt;(By Ashton)&lt;/small&gt;|age=24|height=6'1|species=Selkie / Vision Demon Hybrid|status=Alive|residence=North Desolates, Azuren|alignment=Neutral|relatives=Saorise Ashe &lt;small&gt;(mother, deceased)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Unnamed father|allies=?|enemies=?|image1=&lt;gallery&gt;
Áine LOL.jpg|Gacha Club
Aine.png|Animal Jam
&lt;/gallery&gt;|gender=Male|Ethnicity=Irish 🇮🇪}}

'''Áine Ashe''' (Irish pronunciation [ˈaːnʲə] "Awn-ye") is a minor character of a Good vs Evil Roleplay. He is a vision demon and selkie hybrid that wanders the North Desolates of Azuren.  

A mute soul, he communicates through sign language after his voice was taken away by macha's owls, and due to this he cannot make loud noises, such as screaming, and commonly has to use a bell in order to make loud noises.   

== History ==
Little about Áine's past is known, as he usually does not interact with many of the characters. Though, what is known about him is that he was born to a selkie mother and a vision demon father, though his mother had left after being consumed by the sea when giving birth to him, and his father had to go out at sea to retrieve him from going with his mother in the ocean by going in the deep end and swimming down so he does not lose him as well. After retrieving him, he  became depressed and started drinking while attempting to take care of his child, but after a few years, he perceived his son as an evil being for taking his wife away from him.  

Due to his mothers absence, his father began to grow a hatred for Áine. He would neglect him at first when he was a child, not showing him the attention and affection that he wanted. Being deprived of affection, Áine only had a lyre that his mother was preparing to give him as a birthday gift, and with this he had developed a passion for music, often isolating himself in order to cope with his loneliness that he could not resolve on his own.  

as Áine grew older, his father began to act out by starting to abuse him verbally and physically because of his internal hatred for him due to him resembling his late mother much more than his father had expected him to. Because of the constant abuse at his home, Áine had attempted to keep distance from his father in order to not hear him screaming in his face. Unfortunately, the attempt had failed and he began to get dragged out of his room so his father could take his anger out on him because of his appearance reminding him of his mother.    

Even though Áine's father did not abuse his mother, most of his hatred turned to his son due to seeing him as the sole cause of his mother's disappearance when he was born. According to Áine, his father would at times attempt to kill him via strangulation, but he could not bring himself to do so because he would have a perception flip that would make it seem like he was strangling his wife when he was not, ultimately making Áine fear his father.       

After being abused for many years, Áine grew up mostly with no one to love him, not having a proper relationship with his father and often isolated himself by hiding under his bed or simply hurdling himself in the corner of the bathroom. He sometimes stayed outside to play his lyre, which created small, white sparks that appeared when playing his lyre float around him. However, when he was a teen, the tunes he made with his lyre had started to attract mysterious owls, often singing to the tune Áine would play. Seeing this, he found joy in playing music and              

== Appearance ==
''(NOTE: this character has two appearances: one Animal Jam model, and one Gacha Club Model. The Gacha Club Model is supposed to give a more accurate sense of what they would look like as a person, and not in Animal Jam. The Animal Jam Models and Gacha Club Models are used to show them both In animal jam and as an actual person.)''

=== Gacha Club Model ===
Áine is a tall man with a skinny build, standing roughly at 6'1 with long, white-beige hair that extends to his ankles and tied into a braid. He has ghostly pale skin with two colored eyes, one a baby blue shade and one white. At times, he is mistaken for a woman because of his facial features. 

Áine's attire consists of his selkie coat, which is pure white and extends down to his ankles. Around his neck are gray scarves layered on one another with white detailing. Under his selkie coat and scarves is a long dress that covers most of his body with white socks and black shoes.  

In his coat pockets, he carries multiple anesthetic needles that have the ability to knock someone unconscious without having to fight them. He often carries a white lyre, similar to Saorise's shell from the 2014 film, ''[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Song_of_the_Sea_(2014_film) Song of the Sea]''.    
=== Animal Jam Model ===
Áine's Animal Jam Model is a fox with a white outer-fur and beige underbelly with light blue eyes. On his body are light blue swirly patterns that cover most of his body. On his head is a white flower crown that is supposed to resemble his hood, his body being covered with a white cloak with a ghostly spiked collar around his neck. On his paws are a pair of gloves, and on his tail is armor that extends nearly to the tip. 
== Personality ==
When introduced, Áine demonstrates to be a quiet, yet very intellectual and gentle soul who has a small passion for music. He commonly plays his lyre whenever he is alone, but has a hard time opening up to others because of him not having a voice, often keeping to himself and keeps contact with those around him as minimal as possible and often resorts to running away when someone does a rather threatening gesture with their hands or body language.  

Due to his mutism, Áine mostly has to mouth his words or sign them with his hands, much to his annoyance and has a very strong desire to get his voice back. Even though he does not talk, he remains as polite and form as possible to not give a bad impression of himself to others through his facial expressions. He mostly uses body language and sign language to assist him in trying to get the words out.   

Despite being silent, he has demonstrated to be rather obstinate at times, making various rude hand gestures for those to leave him alone and refuses any help from those around him, and when annoyed, he often resorts to using one of his anesthetic needles so he would not have to deal with anyone's antics. Áine expresses his dislike for being mute, often yearning to receive his voice back.    

Áine has been described as having a rather charming beauty to him, as those who see him cannot resist to stare at him, and sometimes he could get mistaken as a woman because of his more feminine facial features. He uses his features to an advantage by getting the upper hand in many situations. With his looks, he is also a very intelligent man, using deception to trick others for falling for him.    

== Abilities ==
'''Overall Abilities:''' Being both a demon and a selkie, Áine is both very powerful, yet very dangerous at the same time. Even though he appears relatively harmless on the surface, his abilities as both a vision demon and selkie combined can be seen as deadly due to having an alluring appearance of a seal, but the powers of one of the rarest demons. With both his looks and abilities, he uses both of them to take advantage of any situation, whether it'd be a fight or a simple encounter with another person.        

'''Enhanced Speed &amp; Reflexes:''' Áine, like all demons, possesses a superhuman-like speed, but is hindered when underwater. He has been able to out-pace many bounty hunters and soldiers in the past by using his wits and speed

      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="4653" sha1="2kjtea1phm8nt5dcb1w1hxrpdienf0u" xml:space="preserve">== Book 4 ==
After the giant fight at the Jamaa palace, the town is overrun with jammers and foreign visitors, plus Jack is badly hurt. Junior will need a certain gray heron’s help.  Plus, Dash finally has an army to aid Zios. Oh Mira, what else could go wrong these days?

== Entering the Darkness ==
Junior struggled to drag Jack through the bushs and ferns. The young unconscious wolf needed help and fast. 

“JACK! Wake up!” Junior muttered through matted fur. The youngling remained unconscious. Oh Mira, may she have mercy. Junior trudged through the ferns, getting seeds and prickles stuck to his fur, Jack’s metallic leg scrapping against rocks and creating such an ugly noise. It hurt Junior’s ears. 

That’s when his hind leg slipped into wetness. He raised his paw, shaking the water that his fur had carried from the small encounter. 

“We’re here.” 

He pushed Jack into the river, his unconscious body heavy. The young wolf slipped easily among the riverbank and into the river. Junior hopped in after. 

Gosh, the experience was nauseating. How did he do this almost every day when he was younger? Slipping through darkness, that buzzing noise that never stopped, ugh. Finally, he flipped his body so his paws faced the direction he thought was down and he landed roughly into a black room, the floor shining as if made of crystal. Mira’s imprisonment area. Jack layed on the floor. Grabbing him again, Junior pulled him across the floor to a cage-like structure. 

Tears stained the floor, Junior seeing the salty tears falling down from the familiar gray heron’s beak. “Mira,” He murmured. 

“Junior?” She raised her head, standing upright. Her figure was tall compared to Junior, her stature beating him by a few feet. 

“Mira,” He bowed his head, lowering his ears. After a bit, he raised again, speaking, “Mira, I need your help. Jack, he… she…” He stammered a bit, panicking slightly. “The Phantom Queen. She used his body and he’s badly hurt.”

“Bring him to me,” So Junior did. He lifted the pup by his scruff and pulled him closer to Mira. Laying a wing on him, her brow furrowed. “She’s infected him with her magic.”

“Is-Is there anyway to help him?”

“The Lava Crystal. So powerful, it’ll melt away her magic.” Mira straightened. 

“The last time I saw it… it was in the Jamaa palace. I’m too badly hurt, I can’t get through a single hall without that idiot, Max, jumping me.” Junior growled under his breath.

“Then let me help you too. You’re a descendant of Void, plus one of my chosen ones. I can spare some magic on a regular wound.” She leaned forward. 

Junior flinched back, his ears pressed up against his head. “No!” He shook his head. “I mean- no. You’re too weak. You’re barely surviving down here and we still haven’t found a way to get you out! Not like we can anyways now that Zios’ dead and we don’t have his power. Plus… you’re all I have. Dad- Greely is who knnows where. My mom is gone too. Silver and Smudge…” He growled, digging his claws into the hard floor, leaving scratch marks. “Dash killed them. And Dare and DJ are on his side!” He barked. “And now Jack! And Flora’s dead too!”

“Calm Junior.” Mira breathed. “I have enough of my magic to spare. And I have an idea on how to free myself. But we need Jack for it. And for that, we need to crystal. As for us getting it, you need to get better. Come closer.” 

Junior caved and took a step forward. He was engulfed in darkness suddenly, letting out a yelp as he saw a bright light. Light blue. Curiosity got the best of him and he approached. His nose touching it ever so slightly. 

Frick. 

He jerked, opening his eyes in surprise. Standing over Jack’s mauled body. He let out a scream before, “Junior! Wake up!” 

Mira’s voice awoke him. Ugh, back where he was. And something felt off. Good. But off. He turned to see his wound on his side way better now. Looking just like brand new too. Nice! What wasn’t nice was the giant pair of wings he now donned, blue feathers like Mira. “B-WHAT?! Mira!” He whipped his head around to face her. “I thought you were giving me enough to heal! Not to have your powers!?”

“Yes, but you’ll need them. I can feel it.” She winced, weak.

“Feel it?! You can’t feel the future!” He frowned, his tail drooping and his new wings folding down, touching the floor beside him, too heavy for him to control just yet despite his strength from being with the phantoms.

= '''&lt;u&gt;NIGHT OF THE PHANTOMS&lt;/u&gt;''' =
&lt;u&gt;'''Written by:'''&lt;/u&gt; TheFateSpeaker

'''&lt;u&gt;Started:&lt;/u&gt;''' January 27th, 2020 (Abandoned for 3 years)

&lt;u&gt;'''Resumed:'''&lt;/u&gt; February 10th, 2023 

'''&lt;u&gt;Ended:&lt;/u&gt;''' N/A

* Just to be clear, I wrote this story in 2020 and never finished it, so I'm publishing the rewritten part here. If anyone reads it, cool, considering this wiki is dead af, I just hope at least someone reads it. 
* Not based off the Animal Jam Holiday
* Still is based off Animal Jam though (with my own twist)
*'''&lt;u&gt;WARNING:&lt;/u&gt;'''  This story will contain violence, mild swearing, character death, and angst. You've been warned!
*SOME human things will be referenced (Such as natural hair colors, height, and human ages)
*Updates will be inconsistent, I'm not good at remembering things and I lose motivation
*English isn't my first language, so some of what I write might not make sense to you. (please don't assume because English isn't my first language that I cannot comprehend writing it)

== '''&lt;u&gt;CHARACTERS&lt;/u&gt;''' ==

==== THE DUSKMOON FAMILY ====

* '''&lt;u&gt;Mom and Dad Duskmoon&lt;/u&gt;''' (Names Unknown)
* '''&lt;u&gt;Mira Duskmoon&lt;/u&gt;''' (Oldest Daughter, Main Character, Age 13)
* '''&lt;u&gt;Fawn Duskmoon&lt;/u&gt;''' (Middle Brother, Main Character, Age 10)
* '''&lt;u&gt;Daisy Duskmoon&lt;/u&gt;''' (Youngest Sister, Main Character, Age 8)

==== OTHER CHARACTERS ====

* &lt;u&gt;'''Vivian Bloodhound'''&lt;/u&gt;
* '''&lt;u&gt;Jay BirdWing&lt;/u&gt;'''
* &lt;u&gt;'''Oak Pinewood'''&lt;/u&gt;
* '''&lt;u&gt;Boreal Vinewind&lt;/u&gt;'''
* '''&lt;u&gt;Phantom King&lt;/u&gt;'''
* &lt;u&gt;'''Phantom Prince'''&lt;/u&gt;
* '''&lt;u&gt;Phantoms&lt;/u&gt;'''
* &lt;u&gt;'''Doctor #1 and #2'''&lt;/u&gt;
* '''&lt;u&gt;Scientists #1, #2, #3&lt;/u&gt;'''
*'''&lt;u&gt;Old Neighbors&lt;/u&gt;'''
*'''&lt;u&gt;Farmer&lt;/u&gt;'''

== LORE ==
'''&lt;u&gt;Author's Note:&lt;/u&gt;'''  ''Before you read the story, you need to know the lore or else literally none of it will make any sense. The story is based off Animal Jam lore with a twist.'' 

Jamaa was created by two entities, a God and a Goddess named Mira and Zios. They married, and had one child. Helios. Helios was a highly disobedient child with a record of causing drama in Jamaa, including scamming, bullying, and other offenses. His influence influenced Jammers' poor behaviors to this day, and he is nicknamed the God of Destruction. Helios didn't have any magic, yet. He wouldn't have any magic until he turned 13 and he knew this, and was very angry and jealous. He did whatever he could to make his mother cry and beg for him to stop, just so he would seem more powerful. Mira's tears created a harmful entity: Phantoms. Phantoms fed off of chaos and negative emotions, making them stronger. Zios did whatever he could to protect his wife and ward off these phantoms from harming other jammers and Mira, but couldn't prevail. Mira passed away from heartbreak due to Helios' actions, and Zios became infuriated. He summoned a group of the strongest and most loyal jammers he knew, today known as the Alphas to take down the Phantoms. Zios used what was left of his magic to create a realm for the Phantoms to be kept away in, and the Alphas did the remainder of the work of expelling the phantoms. Helios admired the phantoms, and was angry at his father for expelling them. He challenged his father to a fight, and due to Zios' weakness, he died in the fight as well. The alphas expelled Helios to the Phantom Realm, not knowing what to do with him, because they didn't want him in Jamaa. Helios, hurt by his father's actions, allowed himself to be taken over by sadness, and he too became a Phantom. 

Helios' story didn't end there. He turned 13, and suddenly, he had magic. He was already insane enough, and with this magic, he convinced the proclaimed king of the Phantoms to adopt him. He became the Phantom Prince, but with a heavy desire to become king, he soughts out a wife so he can succeed his "new father". Time significantly slows down in the Phantom Realm, so it may have been maybe 2 years in Jamaa (he was exiled to the Phantom Realm at age 11) however, in the Phantom Realm, it was about 6 years, and you do not age normally, but you age physically in the Phantom Realm as if you are in Jamaa, making Helios 17-years-old chronologically, however he was physically and nearly mentally of age. the phantom realm kinda defies the laws of nature

== &lt;u&gt;'''PROLOGUE'''&lt;/u&gt; ==

==== '''&lt;u&gt;Helios' POV&lt;/u&gt;''' ====
If you walked a moment in my shoes, for any time in my life, you'd immediately either love it or hate it. As for me, I love it. I worship it. This is me, and I'm never changing. At least, that's what my mother and father wanted me to do. However, that doesn't matter. They're long gone, and I should've been the one to succeed them, if it weren't for my actions. Do I regret them? Not at all. I'm Helios, prince of a much greater realm now, and my time to shine is coming so soon, the idiots on the other side won't even see it coming. 

I hear a rustling coming from the hallway, and I turn around to anticipate who is coming, likely a servant, a guard with updates.. or.

The door swings open, and a raven haired man of great height with dark black skin of a pure Phantom enters the room.  My father. 

I've committed my time to becoming someone that would make my father proud. I made all the plans. I did this.  

"Son, It's time for you to make me proud. the guard told me to tell you he's almost ready, for, you know.."

My eyebrows raise, a grin rises from my lips. "Well done, tell him I'm ready to give the all-clear whenever he's ready."

This could be the end of everything, but I'm ready to sacrifice it all. This was my one goal in life, and I will succeed. That's a promise. To my father and my slaves. And my future slaves.

Things are about to get interesting.

== '''&lt;u&gt;CHAPTER I&lt;/u&gt;''' ==

==== '''&lt;u&gt;MIRA'S POV&lt;/u&gt;''' ====
"Fawn, let me cut your fur! It's getting so freaking long!"

"Last time you did it you shaved me bald!"

"It was for a good reason!"

Yes, daily arguments with my 10-year-old brother, Fawn. At least Daisy was more cooperative. But there really wasn't much of a reason to cut her fur, she was very well groomed and didn't need it. I probably should've told Fawn to quit yelling so loud, or the neighbors in the den next door would come and "check" on us. Too late. I hear a knocking on the den door. Then a grouchy woman's voice.

"You kids better keep it down! Where are your parents?!"

Ugh, the old neighbors next door. The ones who live in the old burrow next to us instead of a den. I put down the scissors. "This is your own damn fault," I growl to Fawn, who sticks his tongue out at me. I walk to the door and open it, seeing my two neighbors, the two old ladies who were always up in our business. I begin to answer her question without haste.

"I've told you a million times, our parents work all day and come home late at night when you old bags are sleeping! Now leave us alone, I'm busy." I tell them, highly impatient. They usually come back. They're too old to suspect anything wrong. Except what I'm telling them is a big ass lie that I can't tell anyone or else we're all screwed.

The reality is, our parents went missing 3 years ago without a trace. I knew not to report them missing, or else my siblings and myself would be dragged away and put into the Bunny Burrow Orphanage. Speaking of Bunny Burrow, Bunny Burrow: A leisurely suburb where the population is 100% bunnies. Resting just in between Jamaa Township and Sarepia Forest, It's basically the best place to be. For bunnies anyways. There's a lot of old folk in Bunny Burrow, like my annoying neighbors.

Speaking of them, I'm snapped out of my daydream when one of them grouches at me again. "Well, keep quiet! Or I'll report you to the town government for being a danger to our ears!" 

"If you report us, I'll report you for harrasssment. Hmph!" I shut the door. I turn around, Fawn is standing behind me. "You freaking idiot! You see what would've happened if they realized we live alone?" I hiss quietly, just above a whisper, to Fawn. Fawn looked unphased. "Well, it's not my problem," he says. "Don't cut my hair."

"You'll regret this someday if we all get separated!"

"Maybe that's better because you're so grumpy," He retorts.

I decide not to fight with him any longer. I walk to the kitchen, noticing we're out of carrots. Crap, we run out of these all the time, and it's near end of Harvest Season so they'll be more expensive. I walk to our money jar and take out enough gems to pay for a medium bundle of carrots, grab my coat, and begin walking toward the door, when someone grabs my sleeve. It's Daisy.

Daisy, with her innocent green eyes and long bunny ears. I wish she didn't have to live in the circumstances, but she's 8 years old and already understands. She looks up at me, her bug-eyes widened and sad. "Is it true we'll get taken away if we're bad and loud?" She asks me. I don't want to answer the question, but I do anyways. "Yes, Daisy. If the neighbors find out we live alone, we'll be separated. Which is why we have to be quiet, or loud enough for the neighbors to ''not'' hear us. Speaking of, tell Fawn that both of you need to go in your rooms and play and shut up until I get back from the market."

Daisy grins. "Okay! I'll tell him," and she hops off. I make my exit, walking towards the market.

== '''&lt;u&gt;CHAPTER II&lt;/u&gt;''' ==
The 1 mile walk to Jamaa Township wasn't much for me. I was used to it, since we walked part of this path twice a week for school. School and I had a love-hate relationship, but I still went. I was always jealous of the children whose parents would kiss them goodbye and they'd happily hop off to school. Kids suspected things- but I told the usual lie of "they're always working". And they were too stupid to ask any other questions. Eighty percent of bunnies were too stupid or too caught up in their own business to worry. 

I arrive at Jamaa Township, Jammers of many animals, colors, shapes and outfits hurried around in different directions, most going home for the day because it was around 3PM. I pass the glorious Mira Bird Statue. 

Mira. The goddess of our life, the one who created Jamaa, the one who I was named after. Of course, I didn't have her long legs and her beautiful blue feathers or magic, but I have blue eyes, that counts, a little. I sometimes wish what it was like running a whole world before she died. I wish I could say a prayer to it, but I've got no time to waste, I don't like leaving my siblings home for too long.

I make it to the market, farmers restocking, calling out things like "Get your corn! Only 150 gems!" or other stuff like that. I walk to the one stall, the guy I always trusted with carrots, THAT Farmer. That farmer was an orange bunny with an orange beard who always had the tastiest carrots year-round. And he always sold them cheap to me.

He sees me and greets me. "Hey, Bird Girl!" Bird girl was his nickname for me, because of my name. "Hello, 3 bunches of carrots please!" I say in a usual cheery voice.

"300 gems," He says, pulling out 3 bunches of carrots, loading them into a bag. I pull the 300 gems out of my pocket and place them on the table, and he hands me the bundle of carrots. "Here ya go, Bird girl!" He says. "Goodbye!" I say, walking away from the stall and back on the path that lead to Bunny Burrow.

The mile-walk was a little harder with a somewhat heavy bag of carrots. It would be enough to feed us for about a week, give or take a few days depending on how hungry we are. I usually would hum a tune we learned in Music Class or something I heard on the Radio, like the music called ''"Jam On",''  my favorite song I've heard on the radio. 

As I get closer to the house, I begin to smell something, and the air grew heavier. This wasn't normal and I take this into account. I grow more suspicious, but what alarms me is a strange black substance trail as I get even closer to my house. The black substance amount grows as I turn the corner near our den. 

The first thing I notice when I finally see our den is that the door is open. I swear I locked it. Daisy and Fawn may be young and somewhat dumb, but even they don't open the door for anyone or leave the house when I'm gone.

The air is especially heavy, like fog, there is a highly suspicious green smog loitering by my house. There are large splashes of black goop on the front door and around my house. 

Something was very wrong.

== '''&lt;u&gt;CHAPTER III&lt;/u&gt;''' ==

==== &lt;u&gt;MIRA'S POV&lt;/u&gt; ====
I immediately put down the bag of carrots and run towards the door, running inside my house. I wasn't expecting what had happened inside.

It smells of death in my normally tidy and clean house. Foul, it nearly makes me gag. It makes me feel sick to my stomach, queasy and dizzy. That's when I see the mess. Dirt, black goop, broken plates and furniture. God, it would take weeks to clean this mess up. Did Daisy and Fawn get into a huge fight? How much noise did they make? What was this.. substance?

Where are Daisy and Fawn?

"FAWN! DAISY!" I scream, panicked, running through our den. I search their rooms. Daisy's first. That's when I see the blood. It's on the floor and on her bed. Her room is just as damaged, her toys sprawled everywhere- broken bed, plushies ripped in half, stuffing everywhere.. Black goop everywhere too. Panicked, I run into Fawn's room, his room is destroyed too, goop everywhere, and blood.

I scream at the blood, tears falling down my face. I run into the backyard in a last attempt, when I see Fawn's body laying in the grass, surrounded by a small pool of blood. I run up to him and roll him over.

"Fawn! Fawn! Speak to me, what happened?!" I cry out. He opens his eyes, groaning in pain. I examine his body for wounds, he's got gashes on his arms and a large one on his forehead. They're bleeding heavily- but not bleeding red. Purple instead. "Fawn, please tell me what happened!" I say to him.

He looks at me, dazed. "P-phantoms.. they.. they took Daisy.." His eyes roll in the back of his head and he falls unconscious in my arms.

Phantoms? They exist. Here? Impossible. I don't know whether to believe him, but I scoop him up and run back in the house, and out the front door. He's heavy, hard for 13-year-old me to carry. I begin screaming as soon as I get outside my den.

"HELP! HELP! SOMEONE HELP! MY BROTHER'S HURT!"

Jammers acknowledge my cries and begin coming out of their dens. Many confused, more horrified by the condition of our den and my brother. A bunny in a nurse's uniform, who I assume just came off her shift, runs up to us. "Put him down!" She commands me, and I obey. Anything to save him. The nurse begins quickly examining him, bringing out a medkit and taking out a stethoscope and listens to his heart. She looks at the nearest bunny she sees. "GO TO TOWN AND FIND HELP!" She yells.

I begin to panic. Please- please don't let my brother die. He's almost all I have left. I forget for a moment my sister's missing. But then I remember what Fawn said before he blacked out. Phantoms, they took my sister.

What if he's right?

What are they planning?

===== 2 HOURS LATER.. =====
The Jammer Paramedics and Police came quickly. They took Fawn away on a stretcher- and me to the police station. Before we left I saw many enter my house. Probably to investigate it. I now sit here on a chair, waiting for them to question me. A tiger woman comes out into the waiting area. "They're ready for you," she says. 

She directs me to a room, where two police officers sit. A blue rhino cop tells me to sit down, and I do. "Name?" he asks me.

"Mira Duskmoon," I say.

"Did you see anything? Hear anything?" He asks me.

"No! I came home and saw what happened. I left my 10 year old brother and 8 year old sister home for 45 minutes. My brother told me phantoms came and trashed the house, attacked them and took Daisy, my 8 year old sister!"

The rhino cop sighs. Like he doesn't believe me. "Look, kids make up stories all the time, he might just be covering for someone-"

"HE IS 10 YEARS OLD! HE ISN'T SMART ENOUGH TO DO THAT! No offense! Explain the freaking black goop then-"

There's a radio I should have acknowledged. And a TV. The radio begins crackling. "''Ladies and Gentlemen. This is a statement from the Alphas being released to you live. This is being broadcasted to all radios and TVs. If you are near a TV, turn it on immediately."''

The officer looks nervous, but he obeys, grabbing a TV remote and turning on the TV, which sits in a corner attached to the ceiling.

A red screen displaying '''EMERGENCY BROADCAST''' in bold white letters is what we see when we first turn this on. After around 8 seconds of this, the camera turns on, displaying 2 of the Alphas, Peck and Greely.

Peck's usually peppy voice sounds serious. "Jammers! This isn't a test or a drill. Reports from across Jamaa have been surfacing of alleged strange happenings! Over 40 jammers have been reported missing, and there have been 19 confirmed deaths. The thing is, we have no idea what's happening!"

Peck goes silent. Greely begins to speak in his usual gruff tone.  "We will do everything in our power to stop this. Jammers, do not try to play hero. Let the Alphas handle this, as we are the only ones who can stop this potential threat to our kind."

Peck continues. "Neighborhoods in Jamaa Township, Sarepia Forest, Appondale and Kimbara Outback have been placed on lockdown. Don't leave your homes for any reason. Jammer Police will be scouting the area. If you HAVE to leave, call the police and you will be escorted. This lockdown will last for 5 days. We will have the situation resolved by then! If you see something, say something! Stay tuned, Jammers!"

The screen goes black.

We all look at each other for a moment, the rhino cop's face is pale. So is mine, probably.

I was right.

''Oh, hell no.''

== CHAPTER IV ==
The Rhino Cop comes out of his trance, looking to me. 

"We're sorry, but we'll have to detain you for the time-being. You're a potential suspect and you were the only one at the scene of the crime," He explains, putting me in handcuffs.

"What?! Are you stupid? I told you, I was at the market! There's witnesses!" I yell, He shoves me forward and we start walking to the cells.

"Sorry, but unless you can name those witnesses, you're out of luck," He says, taking me to the cells and locking me in one of them.

As soon as he leaves, I sit on the bed and start thinking.

''Phantoms? But they're supposed to be in a different realm.. How'd they get here? Wait! But my brother and sister.. Fawn! I have to get him.''

I guess I'll have to devise a plan and get the hell out of here.

==== &lt;u&gt;PHANTOMS POV&lt;/u&gt; ====
"Another one?" He asks, tapping the table with his fingers. The tall individual comes out from the shadows, peering down at us.

"We just barged into a random house! We didn't know there would be too loudmouth kids alone in there! We just took the one who didn't fight back and killed the other one, we think," I say.

"Actually- He might be still alive-" My partner chimes in.

"WHAT?! WE HAVE A POTENTIAL WITNESS NOW, ARE YOU BOTH DUMB?!" He shouts, smacking my partner so hard he hits the wall and is left unconscious, leaving only me to deal with our aggressive master.

He looks to me. "Open that sack you got there," He commands me. I nod assent and open it, dumping the contents. One little girl, slightly bruised up, whimpering and curled in a ball. He grabs her by her ears and pulls her up to his level. He's tall. She's maybe half his size. She yells in fear and anger and starts kicking and screaming. He slaps her.

"If you cooperate with us and tell you everything you know about your inferior world, we'll let you go alive," He says, she doesn't look impressed. "What's your name?" He asks her, it's not a nice question. "Go to hell, you big damn poopyface butthead! STRANGER DANGER STRANGER DANGER STRANGER DANGER!! I wanna go home!!" She protests. 

"Swearing is bad, kid," He says, going to his desk, opening a drawer and taking out a metal rod, he slaps the rod and it turns on, shooting out lightning bolts. H''oly hell, he's gonna torture a little kid for information? Ruthless he is, but I didn't think he'd go this far!''

He holds the electric metal rod to show her. "I said. Cooperate. I won't ask twice. If you don't cooperate, we kill everyone you love and then kill you. Understand?"

The little girl gulps. She's in quite a lot of trouble, and it isn't because she was being too loud in the house.

''&lt;u&gt;AUTHOR'S NOTE:&lt;/u&gt;''  ''so it's been like 2 months since i updated this story- i forgot most of the plot but yeah i'll try to finish the book but if i lose motivation or forget about it again i'll discontinue it''

== CHAPTER V ==

==== &lt;u&gt;MIRA'S POV&lt;/u&gt; ====
It has been almost a day since anyone came to check on me. I thought maybe it was because they were patrolling the areas. Or they'd just forgotten about me. I don't know. By the time some random cheetah officer came to check on me, I was thirsty, and starving.

I wave her over. "Hey! I was detained for no reason like, a day ago, and nobody has given me food or water for that entire time! Can you either give me food, or let me out? I haven't done hella anything!" I say, as she looks at me. "You look like a kid.. how old are you?"

"13," I respond. She takes out her keys from her pockets. "They have no business locking up kids in here," she mumbles. unlocking the cage. "Go home, I'll escort you, it's too dangerous."

I agree. But little does she know, I've got a plan. I need to get Fawn out of the hospital and get the hell out of Jamaa Township and into the Canyons, where Phantoms avoid due to the altitude. If this is actually phantom stuff. 

We walk outside and as soon as we divert paths, crossing into the town square of Jamaa Township, I turn around and bolt the opposite direction toward the hospital. "Hey!" She shouts, chasing after me. I might be a fast bunny with long legs and youth on my side, but she's a cheetah, and she's much faster, and she catches me within a minute.

She pins me down, hissing in my ear. "Do you want me to lock you up again? Why don't you just behave and I won't have to hurt you?" I notice, she only has one of my arms pinned. I ball my right hand into a fist and punch her as hard as I can. She falls off of me and I get up and run into the wooded area between Kimbara Outback and Jamaa Township. I hear her yelling, but I don't really care. 

On my way, I see occasional individual cops, but almost all of them were in small groups, but I managed to avoid them. They probably would've knocked me unconscious and taken me away, and I can't afford that. Not when my sister could be in danger, more likely dead. I shove that thought in my head, but to be honest, she's more likely dead if she was really taken by phantoms. 

''But why did they only take her and not Fawn? Why didn't they kill Fawn? What are their motives..'' Are some of the many thoughts running in my head as I make my way. 

The walk takes nearly 3 hours of my time, if you include avoiding police officers and distance. By then I get there, it is sunset. The police officer patrols seem to be ramping up in the main places, but there aren't as many in Kimbara due to the fact there's really only one building (the hospital) and how isolated it is. There's still officers, but they're avoidable. 

When I arrive, I slip behind a bush until the police officers move away a bit, then I approach the door. Surprisingly, it's unlocked, and I quickly slip inside the hospital. There, I'm greeted by nobody, so I start walking down the main hallway that had rooms in it, peering into every room, usually finding sleeping patients. In the final room I check, There's someone sitting up.

It's Fawn!

I quietly run inside, whispering loudly. "Fawn! I was so worried! I thought you'd died!" I walk up to his bed.

Fawn embraces me. "Mira! I was so worried about you! I'm so scared for Daisy.."

I nod, before whispering: "Fawn, are you telling the truth? You can't be telling jammers that you saw phantoms unless it's true!"

Fawn looks at me. "But sis, you need to believe me! Cross my heart, hope to die! Phantoms came and took Daisy and hurt me!"

I begin to put two pieces in my mind together.. ''But the alphas.. they said that it was "unknown happenings". Are the Alphas hiding something? Why are they lying to us?''

Suddenly, I hear a male voice behind me. "Tsk, Tsk, You know little girls shouldn't be walking about during lockdown," it says.

I turn around to see a male arctic wolf in a lab coat, tall, with glasses, like a stereotypical scientist.

''Uh oh.''

== CHAPTER VI ==
"Who the hell are you?!" I say, getting ready to defend my brother.

Without a peep, the scientist shoves me over, and I fall to the floor beside the bed my brother sat on. The scientist pulls a needle out of his pocket and injects Fawn with it. Fawn's eyes widen, he suddenly blacks out. I yell in anger and swing at him. "Don't you freaking touch my brother, you old sicko!"

He seems to be unfazed by my outburst. He kicks me off of him, and I lay on the floor from the powerful kick. I'm short and scrawny and he is much taller than me, I can't fight him unless I have a weapon, which I do not. He looks down at me. "Oh, dear, you don't understand. I'm protecting you from your brother. You don't understand."

"Understand what?!" I say. "You injected him with some mystery solution and he's unconscious. Why are you doing this?"

The scientist frowns. "Let me show you," He lifts the blanket off of Fawn, grabbing his arm and unwrapping the bandage. I get up and stand beside him, when I notice what the scientist is talking about. The wound... it's a sickly purple. oozing.. blood? Goop? I can't tell. It makes me want to vomit, and I do gag. "What.. what happened?"

He wraps the bandage back up. "You see, this isn't a normal wound. The phantoms did this. I've studied phantom behavior for years. You see, we have.. phantom experiments in our lab. These phantoms attempt to infect jammers by scratching them and injecting a toxin into them, which turns them into a phantom."

I can't believe what I'm hearing. "No.. you're a liar, no.. My brother can't turn to a phantom.. He's 10!"

"I'm sorry you have to hear this. The good news is, I took a sample of his blood and he lacks the toxin, meaning he likely won't turn into a ''full'' phantom. More of a Hybrid, he'll be human, but have phantom attributes and possibly behaviors. He may have physical phantom characteristics, too."

I shake my head. "No, he's too innocent for this.."

"He cannot live in normal society, unfortunately. He could be kidnapped, killed, and more. I will take him to my lab and he will become a sub-"

From shock, I basically see red. His words anger me even more. "NO. You will not take him!" I impulsively say, shoving the man. "He's MY brother, I decide what to do with him! And-" 

He shoves me back, pulling out another needle and lunging at me with it. The needle stabs into my leg, and I forcefully pull it out, painfully, and throw it. I kick him in the face and grab a glass beaker that was sitting on the nightstand next to Fawn's bed, slamming it into his head. The scientist falls unconscious, laying on the floor.

I get up, going to my sleeping brother. I'm starting to feel dizzy, and it hits me that I was stuck with the needle. I knew, I had to get out of here, and fast. I unhook the IV drip and the monitors from him, and pick him up, carrying him bridal style out of the room, down the hallway and to the main lobby, when a nurse sees me. "Hey, stop!" She yells.

I break into a run, busting through the door and running outside. The nurse follows me, yelling "Escapee!" I turn my head around as I run, my brother in my arms, noticing two officers have acknowledged the nurse and are now chasing after us. I begin running toward the lost temple of Zios.  As I'm running, I hear my brother's voice. "Mira?" He asks. "Shh," I say, continuing to run. 

I begin to get dizzier, and I know the medicine is taking effect. Even though only a little has entered my system, it's strong enough to slowly knock me out, but I persistently keep running until we reach Zios.

I hear the loud voices of the officers, and things begin to blur. I hear a third loud voice, and I'm too dizzy to keep moving forward. I put Fawn down and suddenly everything goes black.

== CHAPTER VII ==
A crackling noise is what awakens me. As I come to, I can feel something decently soft underneath me. As I regain energy, I can identify the crackling as one of a fire now, and I begin to stir. I'm nearly fully awake now, and I can make out 2 voices. One that I know is my brother, and.. someone else. My brother, talking to someone else besides me?

My mind begins to think. Overthink, too. ''Where are we?! Is my brother hurt? He's talking to a bad person!'' I sit up and glare ahead, seeing Fawn, and a boy. This boy, a wolf, sitting next to my brother, looks at me. He appears to look only a little older than me.

"Who are you?" I say, staring at him. "And where have you taken us?"

Fawn pipes in. "Relax, Mira! This guy is the one who saved us from the officers! I woke up and found you sleeping so he carried you here. They're gone now!"

"You didn't answer my question."

The boy pipes in. "Sorry, an introduction seems to fit here, I'm Boreal Vinewind. I've been living alone for about a year now, camping, and such. I felt bad when I saw you two. Seems like you were in a pretty tough situation."

"He already knows your name and mine! I think we can trust him. You were asleep a lot longer than I was,. that's super weird! You must've been REALLY tired!" Fawn says.

"So, Mira, tell me, what happened?" Boreal says, looking to me.

"Well, our home got attacked, my sister is missing, my brother got hurt. Phantoms did it, he was hospitalized, I came back to free him and-" I cut myself off. Fawn, he's too young to know what he could and will eventually be capable of. "Actually, can we talk in private?"

"How come you two get to talk in private?! That's not fair!" Fawn protests. "You will listen to me! Now, go into that tent," I tell Fawn, and he hesitantly obeys.

I stand up, and I wobble a bit and nearly fall. Boreal suddenly gets up and catches me. "Woah there, whatever happened to you, you're not really ready to do too much stressful stuff for a bit," He says. He guides me to an area about 100 feet from his camp. "So, what did you want to tell me?"

"Before I tell you anything, you have to tell me about you," I say.

"Well.."

== CHAPTER VIII ==
Boreal seems to hesitate.

"My parents treated me right, and stuff. But they were really controlling. I wasn't allowed to just be a boy. I wanted to be free and do stuff, and I could never. I guess that's where my parents went wrong. Suddenly my parents decided to get fancy secret jobs and I knew they gatekept a lot of stuff from me, and they started to lie to me a lot. In plain sight, too. I decided to leave them at 14, about a year ago and live on my own. They never looked for me."

"So you're 15 now? Do you ever miss your parents?" I ask.

"Yes to the first question, no to the second,," He responds. "If they never looked for me, why? Did they ever love me? And how old are you?"

"I'm 13, and I'll be 14 soon. Fawn is 10," I respond.

I don't know what else to say. I felt bad for him, that's all. It's hard losing your parents. I know all too well how it feels. I'm glad one of my siblings doesn't remember and the other barely does. I look into his eyes and put a hand on his shoulder.

"Listen, they likely love you very much and miss you.. Putting their job first was a dumbass move, but love for a child never ends. They're somewhere, somewhere out there, possibly hoping their son comes back to them."

Boreal seems slightly assured. "You'd make a good therapist someday," He says. I notice he's still holding onto me. "Um.. you can let me go now," I say awkwardly, and he does.

He smiles. "So, tell me about you, why are you and Fawn out here? Where are ''your'' parents?"

"Missing. 3 years ago, zero trace. Nobody knows what happened to them. Basically, I left Fawn, and my sister, home alone. I came home and they'd been attacked. My sister is missing. Fawn was hurt, and someone took him to the hospital. I was detained under suspicion of having something to do with it. The Alphas came on TV and said something mysterious was going on. Fawn claimed it was phantoms, and I kind of believe him-"

"Wait- the ALPHAS have something to do with this, you're saying?"

"Yes. They might be trying to cover this up. For good or for bad reasons. I don't know. A scientist confirmed my theory- he sedated my brother, tried to sedate me, some of the medicine must've gotten into me but hadn't worked right away. I knocked him out but he could be sending out jammers to look for us-"

"Wait wait wait- you're WANTED?" Boreal says. "Gosh damn!" 

"Basically, which is why Fawn and I cannot stay for long. We have to get to the bottom of this, find my sister and possibly find out why the Alphas are covering this up, if we have time."

Boreal looks at me, intrigued. "You know what? I want to help you,"

I'm kinda shocked at this statement. "Really?" I say.

"Yes, let's figure this thing out, together."

''&lt;u&gt;AUTHOR'S NOTE: (4/4/2023)&lt;/u&gt;  damn i wrote 3 chapters in one night (it's 3:20 am rn) and i wrote all three in about an hour and a half. i decided not to discontinue the story bc i'm kind of invested now, i've also decided there will be a book 2. i already have a plan for it, and i plan to finish this first book in the coming months and have book 2 started by summer. i've got the concepts for the rest of book 1 and part of book 2 written so woohoo yay me for being productive''

== CHAPTER IX ==
''&lt;u&gt;AUTHOR'S NOTE: (5/25/2023)&lt;/u&gt; I completely forgot about the story again and abandoned it for another month and a half LMAO but without further ado let me at least try to finish another chapter before i forget about it for another month''

''&lt;u&gt;AUTHOR'S NOTE #2: (6/9/2023)&lt;/u&gt; LMFAO I forgot about this again but let me at least do this chapter but I have no motivation to actually finish this book because nobody goes on this wiki anymore''

"Together," I echo.

"Together" is a word that doesn't compute to me, since I have been left alone for so long. I'm scared I'll get abandoned again, worse, killed, betrayed by this individual. I find it hard to make sense that someone is willing to put their care into ensuring at least one of us gets out of a bad situation.

However, I find it quite comforting that someone is willing to do that for me.

Maybe this boy won't be so bad. "Deal," I say. We shake hands.

"So, what do we do now? We need to leave as soon as possible if we have any prayer of finding my sister alive. Time is money!"

"Don't worry, we'll figure things out. Just calm down. We'll sleep here tonight and then look for clues tomorrow," Boreal replies. 

We walk back to the tents, where Fawn is waiting. "Where were you guys?" He asks us.

"Umm. Talking about grown up stuff," I quickly reply.

Fawn snickers. "You forget you're still a kid, silly! Don't act like you're an adult," 

I give Fawn a smile. I can't let him realize the severity of the situation. Not yet. 

Boreal beckons me to the tents. "There's like four sleeping bags here. I used to have a few buddies with me. They left one day and never came back. I'm starting to wonder if there's connections to your sister and them."

I wonder as I grab a sleeping bag and place it next to where Fawn puts his. As we go to sleep for the night, I ponder to myself, my internal monologue and the crickets outside being the only things audible.

''Oh my god. What's happening? I'm so scared. I'm scared for both of us, all of us. What if the phantoms are hurting my sister? What if.. what if.. I don't understand. This is all too much. I'm overthinking, aren't I? Oh well, we'll get through this, I know it..'' 

''Oh, Daisy, I hope you're okay.''

Troubled sleep claims me moments later.

''&lt;u&gt;AUTHOR'S NOTE #3 (6/9/2023):&lt;/u&gt; time to disappear again for another 1-2 months but oh well it's not like anyone's even reading this anyways, and if anyone is don't be surprised if i discontinue it lol''

      <text bytes="1585" sha1="hwuz6mn9cq61bja634rlybvp0d8rla8" xml:space="preserve">NOTE: This is an Alternative Universe of, well, Universe, where the characters lives are swapped. This is not canon! Universe is my work, although Animal Jam is not. 

== i won't say it out loud ==
Cressida ran a comb through her pixie-cut hair again. She was a sweating mess after a morning with her girlfriend, Aisumi. No, it wasn't anything dirty, she wasn't into that sort of stuff anyway, she'd just gone on her motorcycle in the summer sun for hours on what she thought was probably the hottest day in the season, and prayed to Kah'le she didn't get a sunburn. 

She lived with her older brother Zenith in a small house, with only four rooms- Hers and her sister Atlas, who currently was at a playdate, Zenith's, and her parents. She was adopted, like her sister, which was way she looked so different from the rest of her family, from skin to hair to powers. 

Zenith had dark magic. She had light magic. Light magic was the reason she cut her hair so short- she wanted to shave half of it off, but accidentally singed part of it. Screw being unique. 

Apart from motorcycles and being overall cool, Cressida played electric guitar. Her parents wanted to get her into violin, but she objected. Thankfully they were understanding of her. It was probably because they thought she was in her "Rebel Phase". She wasn't in a phase. She'd been like this ever since she was a little kid. 

She let herself fall onto her bed, sighing. There wasn't anything too interesting now that she wasn't with Aisumi.  

(WIP)

  <page>
    <title>When Jamaa Was Taken Over (reboot)</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162246</id>
    <revision>

      <comment>another update… my writing style is so much different now lol</comment>
      <origin>257374</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="2730" sha1="pw6yl7im5nxg39x0a0fagk8pez1t7mv" xml:space="preserve">I know this wiki is in the abyss of inactivity but I thought I might copy-paste the reboot of [[When Jamaa Was Taken Over|this old story]], although it is highly likely I will forget this page ever existed. Okay, enjoy the better writing I guess.

== Chapter 1 - The Takeover ==
For centuries, the phantoms have failed, over and over again, to acquire the lush lands of Jamaa.

Of course, why would it ever happen? Us jammers have our ways, sometimes involving boomseeds. There’s also our renowned, acclaimed alphas there to defend us from any incoming phantom wave. We are safer than sound… right?

''Right?''

Swect and I have always not been more relaxed in the tranquil Sarepia Forest. Brimming with abundant greenery, thick verdant canopies, and the soft melody of crickets and other various insects, Sarepia is much more peaceful compared to the overcrowded, tumultuous mess they called Jamaa Township.

Well, Sarepia was. I’m not sure if any of Jamaa is peaceful anymore.

I wonder what happened to the alphas that day. Their absence during the incident. Where were they? Why were they even alphas if they weren’t even trying to save Jamaa that day?

Swect, my monkey friend, sat with me that day. We were relaxing near the campfire, discussing the usual–trading, the outrageous costs of clothing and furniture these days, and several other trivial matters. We did it pretty much every day. I suppose this is called a “normal day.” Pretty much the entirety of most jammers’ lives, including ours, can be summed up using those two words.

Today, however, was not a normal day.

It started when I detected a horrible stench. It was like Sarepia decided to take a bath in animal carcasses and rotting wood. Swect clearly noticed this as well, as I could tell from his face, which looked like he was about to release his insides.

“Damn… what is that sickly smell?” I could barely speak or breathe without taking in that foul effluvia. That was how terrible it was.

“I have no idea,” Swect mumbled, clapping his hands over his nose.

The other jammers nearby seemed to be nauseated by this smell too. One rabbit actually fainted, a brown  fuzzy ball limp on the ground. I felt as if I was about to faint too, despite being older and stronger.

Then came the fog. Thick and more purple than the alpha Peck’s pelt, it slowly accumulated around us, enveloping the entire forest. The campfire in front of us was the only reason Swect and I could still see each other, but the thickening fog continued to roll in, somehow diminishing the last of the flames. The peace.


Work in progress lol

    <title>Super idol de xiao VULF</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162249</id>
    <revision>
      <id>257191</id>
      <parentid>257190</parentid>

      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="2685" sha1="sf9hh41lxbemj3kdvr1nvzwpcjo2knf" xml:space="preserve">''She said where'd you wanna go? How much you wanna risk?''

Logic Wolf was sitting in &lt;s&gt;he&lt;/s&gt;his bed. He felt as he drew in breath and &lt;s&gt;elt&lt;/s&gt; let it out. He heard his heart beat more than what some Jammer countries would do when the &lt;s&gt;alpa&lt;/s&gt; alphas would come near.

The alphas were a bunch of jerks. 

They weren't there for him when he lost his wife, nor when a recent incident with some raccoon named Ryan and Bunneh demolished his house.

Zios, Bunneh got on his nerves. He &lt;s&gt;cound&lt;/s&gt; couldn't believe the stamina of the hare. The only thing they had in common was an enemy and the fact that they both had the most basic fur colors in Jamaa. 

He wanted a motivation to fight against Ryan, but wherever he looked, he found nothing.

He'd purchased a ticket to Balloosh, knowing fully well this wasn't a good measure against Ryan but hoping it'd at least buy him some time to get a passport to Fera (surely Ryan couldn't get one, right?)

That was when he heard the familiar drums.

He was socially obligated to step out of his house and bow, not that he liked it. People would look at you dirty if you didn't. 

So then he did.

He didn't get a good look at what was happening, but in the blink of an eye, an alpha had had an accident. A magical one. Tavie? He'd never met her. 

But he started to see things.

He blinked once, twice, and there she was.

His wife, lying next to him in his bed.

"Your paws are scratched up again, love," She said, as a memory played from so long ago.

"Well, that's what we factory workers go through. It's natural, really," He chuckled. He hadn't chuckled in weeks.

"Then I guess I'll need to buy you better gloves," She laughed.

"I love you, Sweetie."

"I love you too, Wolf."

A pause.

Wolf was sure there wasn't a pause there.

"But I need you to fight. Please. Remember what I used to do in college? Well... Taht wuz wahtt I deed! I fought against this crazed world. And I need you to continue what I did!" She pleaded.

"...Only for you. Sweetheart Arts."

His wife flinched when he uttered her full name.

Then, she was gone, and he was facing once again towards the dried up grass.

He ran. He ran like a roadrunner.

Then he saw them. Bunneh was fighting.

He had motivation now.

he HAD MOTUVIATON NAU!!!!!!!1!

Bunneh turned towards Wolf.

AND VULF DTURNED TOEARDS BUNNEH

AND SO DEY COMBINED INTO

VULFEH

AND WUIFLFEH WAS SO MCH MORE BUJFF THAN REIAN

AND SLAMME DINTO HIM

SNF HYRNTHNREN RYAN

FELL ASLEEP

4 A VRI BERRY LAUNG TAIM

But now they were stuck together.

IT BEURNT!!!!!!!1!

''Super idol de xiao vulf do mei ni de tian''

[[Category:Logik Wolf Tales]]</text>

  <page>
    <title>Hideko Inazuma</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162252</id>
    <revision>
      <id>258534</id>
      <parentid>258448</parentid>
      <timestamp>2023-08-17T18:16:53Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Auryze</username>
