      <comment>/* Abilities */</comment>
      <origin>258534</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="17292" sha1="f31bub16f564cw9jm8ejiizlrqyfcmg" xml:space="preserve">{{PG-13}}

''This page belongs to Auryze and is a work in progress. Please do not edit without their permission first.''

'''Thank you so much to phxcon for the drawing!'''

{{Character idk|title1=Hideko Inazuma|nickname=Deko &lt;small&gt;(By Ashton)&lt;/small&gt;|age=24|height=6'2|species=Flesh Demon|status=Alive|job=Freelance Mercenary|residence=Southeast Leiden|affiliation=Unknown|alignment=Neutral|relatives=Itari Inazuma &lt;small&gt;(father)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Unnamed Mother &lt;small&gt;(deceased)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Shizuka Ikami &lt;small&gt;(adopted sister)&lt;/small&gt;|enemies=Crow Watanabe, Locaster Helios, &lt;small&gt;(formerly)&lt;/small&gt; Akuji Hasegawa, Cassian Packard|allies=Locaster Helios, Kahori, Vivian Lu, Hikage Ishuko, Shay Hanamura,  Soul Kawasaki, Hideko Inazuma, Shizuka Ikami, Ashton Khanh, Nabi Haluška, Fēng Xu|image1=&lt;gallery&gt;
Deko deko.jpeg|Drawing
Hideko_deko_blah_blah.jpg|Gacha Club
Poopy stinky fart.png|Animal Jam
&lt;/gallery&gt;|gender=Male|Ethnicity=Japanese 🇯🇵}}

'''Hideko Inazuma''' is a major character in a Good Vs. Evil Roleplay. He is the illegitimate son of an upper rank official and the older brother of his adopted sister, [[Shizuka Ikami]]. He is a flesh demon that is a self trained mercenary who often acts more like a hitman than a mercenary.  

Hideko, at first, holds some hostility towards Locaster’s group after they had begun to show dislike towards his sister, who had both caused deliberate harm towards them and had also shown brutal hostility due to holding a grudge against them for insulting his sister after trying to tell him the truth.  

Though, throughout the roleplay, Hideko slowly started to warm up to his group and soon became apart of it in order to reunite the demon gems before the black vines take over Azuren and the rest of the world, and would often be a major support for them.  

== History ==
Hideko is the illegitimate son of an upper rank government official that governs the second sector of Lyakon, one of the second wealthiest divisions in the kingdom. His mother was an escort woman in the slums and had given birth to him out of wedlock. He was raised primarily by his mother until he witnessed his mother being murdered because of her species by three mercenaries, with her body parts were eventually sold off because of demons being a main target in the large black market trading network.   

His father had then took custody of him and raised him for two years before realizing he was a demon. His father then took him to Estelar and abandoned him when he was only five due to not wanting a child who was a demon after many of the other officials questioned him about Hideko being his legitimate son despite not being married.   

During his time in the slums, Hideko was a destitute child, lacking the resources to survive and was nearly impoverished because of the lack of jobs in Estelar and had little to no knowledge about the world around him. He would at times go days on end without any food or water, often resulting in him eating off his own skin due to being starved to near death and sometimes having to drink his own blood, or having to eat other parts of his body for the sake of his survival.   

Hideko's demonic features had never developed during this time period, and he often perceived himself as a human, meaning he would not be rejected or discriminated against. This had allowed him to be taken in many shelters, but most of the time he would be kicked out of them for not having the capability to steal goods due to his weak body and the lack of stealth he possesses.    

Constantly being transferred from shelter to shelter, Hideko slowly started to develop survival skills throughout time, and was taught about the concept of stealing from the capital, where the most enhanced thieves from the slums go at night and steal from there as they are known as the breadbasket for resources and supplies because of lack of funding in the third district, the area where most of the poorer cities lie under.     

Instead of wandering aimlessly, he started to observe each thief and started to copy their methods to sneak in the capital, usually practicing in forests behind the slums or near abandoned areas.  After only two months, Hideko became an advanced thief and started to steal with some of the other thieves without having to get kicked out or being stuck on the streets for too long. Later in his life, he eventually took in many of the children that were crammed together in an alleyway during the heat-wave season, beginning to raise them as their own and started to act more mature, despite only being twelve at the time.           

When raising the children, Hideko began to realize the purpose in his skills of thievery and started to steal for the sake of them, and begun to steal masses of supplies that were not easily accessed in the poorer areas. With his skills, he started to raise the children and did whatever he could to support them and give them a life not many children had in the slums. Eventually, he discovered an old house hidden in the woods and began to raise the children there, making sure they were fed and nurtured. He started to become more of a father figure to them more than just a caretaker and did everything he could to raise them as best as he could.                            

When asleep one night, he heard the sounds of a child crying and quickly went outside to find the source, to which he found his to-be younger sister, Shizuka, and took her in. During their first interactions, Hideko did not perceive Shizuka as his daughter, but considered her as his sibling due to the both of them being demons and also because of Hideko never meeting with a demon before. After taking her in and cleaning her up, Hideko started to tutor her in math, science, reading, literature, and combat in order to educate and allow her to defend herself. He treated Shizuka much differently than he did with the other children by acting more like a sibling to her and not a father figure.                                 

As Shizuka was being trained under his wing, she was taken on missions to steal with Hideko and both became a tag team duo. Shizuka used her telekinesis in order to stop the guards from attacking them and Hideko would make weapons from his flesh to knock the guards out cold, resulting in them bringing more supplies and resources. With her as an addition to his shelter, the children grew fond and curious of her because of her demon physiology and unique personality.                                 

== Appearance ==
''(NOTE: this character has two appearances: one Animal Jam model, and one Gacha Club model. The Gacha Club model is supposed to give a more accurate sense of what they would look like as a person, and not in Animal Jam. The Animal Jam Models and Gacha Club Models are used to show them both In animal jam and as an actual person.)''  
===Gacha Club Model===
Hideko is a tall, slightly muscular man with long, brown hair in a ponytail that is similar to [[Ashton Khanh|Ashton's]] and yellow eyes. The front of his hair is rather disheveled and messy with one long strand of his hair being put in between his face. He, at times, can get confused as Ashton because of their similar hairstyle and facial shape.  
 
Hideko's attire is lighter in contrast to his younger sister [[Shizuka Ikami|Shizuka's]]: He is usually seen wearing a tan shirt with yellow and brown chest armor, being supported with a long, tan coat with the rimming being a cream yellow, and a brown hat with a navy blue brim that slightly hangs in front of his face, and around his waist is a sword with a brown sword-holder that holds up a pair of baggy, off brown pants with that are then sported by dark brown boots. 

=== Animal Jam Model ===
Hideko's Animal Jam Model consists of a brown arctic wolf with a brown outer fur and a beige inner fire, along with yellow eyes. His fur also is covered with light brown swirly patterns.  

Hideko's attire consists of a brown musketeer hat, brown spartan armor, a black long spiked collar around his neck, tail belts and huntress boots.  

== Personality ==
On the surface, Hideko is a hardened and rather stoic individual. He often acts rather harsh and brutally honest around [[Locaster Helios|Locaster]] and his group about the ways they had been talking about his sister and often tends to get hostile and aggressive around Soul Kawasaki, who attempts to tell him the truth about her but resulted in him using physical violence against Soul and demonstrates a distaste for him. Being a freelance mercenary, Hideko shows little to no emotion and often keeps a cold expression whenever around other people.        

Hideko is an incredibly brash individual and does things his own way without having to think of consequences due to his position as a freelance mercenary, breaking the law and taking justice into his own hands when needed. With his brash disposition, he is also perceived as both refined due to his polite mannerisms, but also having a way with his words whenever interacting with others, having the ability to charm others without difficulty. Because of his brashness, he often got into trouble with his boss due to him not being aware of the consequences in the end.         

Along with his brashness, Hideko has a soft spot for children; Having to raise over thirty of them in his sanctuary, he has demonstrated to be excellent around younger children and acts rather protective around them. According to Ashton, Hideko is like a baby sitter and used to watch other's children before becoming a freelance mercenary.         

Being abandoned by his father at a young age, Hideko has a habit of getting attached to others around him with a fear of those leaving him, sometimes projecting this onto his younger sister, Shizuka, and is very protective of her. He often has a desire to keep her safe after the incident where she was captured by the Black Sun when she was young, and can sometimes act overly protective of her because of his immense fear of losing the people he loves the most, including his acquaintances. He starts to express care and compassion for the other members of the group, specifically his sister, Ashton and Shay. He perceives himself as a bastard child because of being abandoned by his illegitimate father and is also facing extreme flashbacks from when his mother was murdered because of her specie.        

Despite being a flesh demon, Hideko has shown to hardly eat certain kinds of meat due to him having a problem with the texture and quality of it and is often teased for being a vegan, though he has shown to eat meat on the occasion because it is in his diet. He finds meat somewhat disgusting and often gets a disgusted feeling when attempting to eat it. Like Ashton, he has proven to be quite cynical and pessimistic, taunting Veena about the nickname "Vegetable," and repeatedly calling her that until she was annoyed in a playful manner. He also does this to other people like Locaster when he joking calls him "Longlaster," A nickname commonly used by Shizuka.          

== Abilities ==
'''Overall Abilities:''' As a freelance mercenary and formerly a thief that lived in the slums of Lyakon, Hideko proves to be a very powerful demon and combatant. His skills were exemplified in the group's battle against Crow, being one of the first flesh demons to craft a flesh gun and using it effortlessly and was able to go head on with Locaster during their time as being rivals. With his combat powers comes his intelligence, as it is exemplified during their battle with the dark entity where he was able to successfully ambush him before he could make a move, but it was only for a brief amount of time before he was thrown off of him. 

Against Akuji and the Lyakonian soldiers, his skill level starts to become on par with Akuji and went head on with him in a gun match and played a pivotal role in nearly defeating them before Cassian had ordered the soldiers to overwork them so they can get tired.

'''Immense Speed &amp; Reflexes:''' Like all demons, Hideko has demonstrated to be incredibly fast, outrunning Shay during one of their many battles and is near the same speed level as Ashton. He was able to out-pace Crow without difficulty and knock him down to the ground without any trouble, and was also able to evade many of Akuji's attacks as he dodged many of his bullets with ease to an extent where he found it boring to keep up with him. 

'''Enhanced Smell:''' As a flesh demon, Hideko has a unique sense of smell, being able to detect the scent of mammals, demons and humans alike. With this ability, he can track down many individuals at the same time and can pick up scents from further ranges, such as mountains and highlands. His scent of smell is strong enough to pick up subtle movements and even eye twitches. 

'''Immense Durability:''' Hideko possesses a decently durable body, being able to uphold himself after being injured severely. He was able to withstand the bullet wounds that Lyakonian soldiers threw at him and managed to resist Locaster's attacks during their time as enemies. He was also able to withstand Akuji's punch to the stomach after he cursed at him for mistreating Ashton. He also exemplifies his durability after shielding Shizuka from an oncoming attack and taking in several bullet wounds.  

'''Regeneration:''' Hideko, like some of the demons, has the ability to regenerate any part of his body if he drinks blood from another person. He was able to drink some of Akuji's blood and regenerate his wrist that he shot off with his gun. He was also able to make a dent in Cassian's wrist so he could drink his blood in order to regain some of his arm that was nearly falling off. If he drinks too much of their blood, his abilities would increase significantly, as seen when drinking more blood from Akuji than expected and his strength increasing from it.    

'''Keen Intellect:''' Raising and educating himself, Hideko has proven to be exceptionally intelligent, being able to navigate the slums of Lyakon and having the capability of stealing without getting caught, with the occasional help of Shizuka. His intelligence is further proven by his knowledge in combat and the demon gems. He has also proven to be a good mathematician and was able to solve a difficult math equation effortlessly and managed to correctly predict the number of Lyakonian soldiers.    

'''Unlimited Stamina &amp; Endurance:''' Hideko possesses superhuman-like stamina and endurance: He was able to keep standing after receiving a large bullet wound from a Lyakonian soldier and managed to withstand many of Akuji's attacks, despite his wound starting to act up and not having enough time to heal it.      

== Magic Abilities ==
'''Biokinesis:''' Hideko has demonstrated to possess powerful biokinesis, having the capability to manipulate his own flesh to any given extent. As he did not discover his abilities until later on in his life, he has proven to be slightly inexperienced in manipulating some of the flesh in his body.

'''Weapon Creation:''' Hideko has the ability to make flesh weapons by cutting a part of his wrist and manifesting a weapon out of his blood. This is seen when he makes a hammer out of his own blood effortlessly. He is advanced in this field to an extent where he was able to make a flesh double-barreled shot gun in order to shoot Crow in the head with to stop him from trying to kill [[Locaster Helios|Locaster]]. 

'''Wound Expansion &amp; Shrinkage:''' Hideko is not only able to manipulate his own flesh, but he is also able to manipulate others flesh by expanding or shrinking their wounds. He can also use this ability in order to make weapons. He is able to manipulate the wound by either expanding it to make it more severe or shrinking it to make it less severe. He is seen using this on a Lyakonian soldier when he makes a dent in his arm and expanding the wound in order to weaken them. 

'''Healing:''' Not only is Hideko able to regenerate his missing limbs by drinking someones blood, he is able to use his blood in order to heal others by tracing a blade across his hand and feeding his blood to the injured person. He is seen trying to heal most of Locaster's wounds from his back after Akuji rips his wings off by using his blood. However, if the wound is a large one, it would require for him to use more blood to heal the wound entirely.  

== Weaknesses ==
'''Overuse:''' As a demon, Hideko is prone to overusing his powers. Being a flesh demon, his main abilities are blood-dependent when having to create a weapon or attempting to heal a wound with his blood. When he overuses his abilities, he will show visible signs of fatigue because of blood-loss and sometimes dizziness.  

'''Acid:''' Hideko is prone to acid burns, and when attacked with acid can cause extreme amounts of damage to his skin, as seen when Crow launched an acid attack on the group and a portion of his skin turned red. Acid can also hinder his biokinesis due to it being less effective after.   

'''Blood Loss:''' As a flesh demon, Hideko's magic mainly requires him using his blood in order to make weapons.

    <title>Veena Lu</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162254</id>

      <text bytes="9606" sha1="m05u9ixamj8fh713wpzhbgrbncx7v8j" xml:space="preserve">''This page belongs to Auryze, and this page is currently being worked on. Please do not edit this page without permission.''{{Character idk|title1=Veena Lu|nickname=Vivian Lu &lt;small&gt;(full name)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Veena &lt;small&gt;(main nickname, by everyone)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Vee &lt;small&gt;(By Locaster &amp; Soul)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Vivi &lt;small&gt;(By Hikage)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Vegetable &lt;small&gt;(By Ashton &amp; Hideko)&lt;/small&gt;|age=18|height=5'9|species=Human|status=Alive|job=Unknown|residence=Azuren|alignment=Good|relatives=Unnamed Grandmother&lt;br&gt;Unnamed Father&lt;br&gt;Unnamed Mother &lt;small&gt;(deceased)&lt;/small&gt;|allies=Yuna Hanamura, Shay Hanamura, Hikage Ishuko, Hideko Inazuma, Shizuka Ikami, Soul Kawasaki, Nabi Haluška, Damion Halloreen, Fēng Xu, Locaster Helios|enemies=Crow Watanabe, Ashton Khanh, Akuji Hasegawa, Cassian Packard, Misaya Myat|image1=&lt;gallery&gt;
Veena.jpeg|Gacha Club
Vee so cool.png|Animal Jam
&lt;/gallery&gt;|gender=Female|Ethnicity=Chinese 🇨🇳}}
 

'''Vivian "Veena" Lu'''  is a supporting character in a Good Vs. Evil Roleplay. She is an owner of the spirit shard that came from the Spirit gem. In the roleplay, Veena is one of the most knowledgable individuals that has gathered information about the demon gems and was able to obtain Crow Watanabe's murder book, which listed all the shard users that he would target next or later.  

== History ==
Not much of Veena's past is told, and little is known about her early upbringing. Her mother had died when she gave birth to Veena and her father was never in the picture of her life because of her parents marital problems. She was primarily raised by her grandmother for an extended period of time after her father had given her up to his grandmother due to not wanting to be reminded of her deceased mother. When she grew older, she learned how to take care of herself and how to help her grandmother because of her being too ill to take care of her.   

When she was a young adult, Veena had moved out of her grandmothers home and settled in western Azuren, a mostly watery climate with many ponds and waterfalls and built a small cottage for herself to live in. Before Veena became a shard user, she lived a relatively quiet life as a young adult and did not have much to do other than explore the new environment that she settled in for a brief period of time.    

Veena had discovered her shard when noticing it sitting on a rock that was near a nearby waterfall. Soon after taking it and attaching the gem to her choker, she realized that it had spirit-like abilities and started to experiment with the powers until she was proficient enough to use it in dire situations. After years of self training, Veena begun to defend herself with her shard's new found powers. Eventually, Locaster had found her roaming in the northern and southern kingdoms and recruited her, making her one of the first and earliest shard user members.       

Veena was discussing the Founding Demon gems with the group, along with Locaster and many others being fascinated that a human was able to possess a shard. Kahori had, however, cut the moment short as she signaled that both Damios and Esper were in incredible danger. As Locaster, Soul and Kahori went to assess damages, Veena quickly located both Esper and Damios who were both restrained. She transforms into her spirit form to unlock their restrains and heal them both as Locaster, Kahori and soul were fighting enemies.          

== Appearance ==
''(NOTE: this character has two appearances: one Animal Jam model, and one Gacha Club model. The Gacha Club model is supposed to give a more accurate sense of what they would look like as a person, and not in Animal Jam. The Animal Jam Models and Gacha Club Models are used to show them both In animal jam and as an actual person.)''

=== Gacha Club Model ===
Veena is a tall woman with a peach complexion, silver-white eyes and long, silver hair that is the length of her ankles. Around her head is a flower crown with white roses and on her left ear is a white earring that is connected with two beads. Her spirit form resembles Pangur Ban from Secret of Kells, except a lighter blue color and slightly longer in length.    

Veena don's a light blue shirt with darker sleeves and a white, diamond-shaped armor with a mute blue diamond in the middle. She also wears a white skirt and white stockings Around her neck, she wears a thick, black choker that has her shard dangling down from the center, a white flower crown decorated with white roses, and gray boots with white diamonds set in a vertical pattern and a white earring that dangles down her ear. Veena wears bandages around her arms due to being injured in a fight with another child when she was younger.    

=== Animal Jam Model ===
Veena's Animal Jam Model consists of an arctic wolf with a dark gray outer fur and pale inner fur with lighter gray swirl patterns. 

== Personality ==
Veena has been shown to be a calm individual, mainly keeping her cool in intense situations and has little to no reactions in dangerous situations. She often assists Locaster in his group when needed and has shown to be knowledgable about the Demon Gems and their history. Though, Veena has demonstrated to be stoic, but not completely emotionless; She speaks in a refined and posh tone while having a rather cold expression. Despite her rather stoic and inept demeanor, she can be quick to anger, screaming at Cereza for coddling Arcana because of how she is young and displayed as vulnerable. She does, however, regret saying certain things easily and often doubts herself after saying certain things she does not intend to let out and has a hard time articulating her worlds in a more kinder manner.             

According to Hikage, Veena has a craving for both maternal and paternal love: Having her mother die when giving birth to her and her father leaving her, she has little to no understanding of parental love and had to take care of herself a majority of her life while having her grandmother assist her through all of it.             

Veena is described as very honest, hardly sugarcoating anything she says and only tells people the truth; She does so by telling Locaster that things can get more complicated overtime and he cannot expect everyone to come back alive from their battles. With her honesty also comes with her difficulty of lying because of how she is only used to being rather down-to-earth, often stammering on her words when trying to deceive someone and has a hard time coming up with believable lies. She has also shown to have a large distaste for being called by her first name or nicknames like "Vegetable," which both Ashton and Hideko call her in a teasing manner, and prefers simplistic nicknames that are not insulting.               

However, despite Veena's tranquil and calm disposition, she has shown to loosen up when she is around Hikage or any of her friends, as seen when she starts to actively socialize when in the Luckyside Tavern. She begins to become more loosened and dropped her usual calm nature and opted for a more talkative, energetic disposition. She begins to actively socialize with the group, laughing and smiling while still keeping her distance from them at the same time, but can also become slightly hostile; This is seen where Ashton decides to call Veena "Vegetable" as a nickname and nearly punched him in the face.                 

== Abilities ==
'''Overall Abilities:''' As a spirit shard user, Veena is a powerful and skilled combatant. It is stated by Hikage and Nabi that she is incredibly talented despite her only being eighteen. She was able to easily overpower Crow when he had attempted to steal her shard in the past and many non-shard user demons, like Hideko and Ashton. After managing to flee from the Lyakonian soldiers for a brief amount of time, her skill further increased when she managed to quickly heal Hikage's wound and hide her in a tree for a little bit of time so she can rest and not get injured further.  

'''Enhanced Speed &amp; Reflexes:''' Veena possesses enhanced speed and reflexes, swiftly out-pacing Shizuka during their time as enemies and effortlessly running away from soldiers while having to carried an injured Hikage. She had also managed to evade several of the Lyakonian soldiers attacks that were being launched at her, despite their fleet being the most enhanced of all kingdoms.    

'''Enhanced Strength:''' Veena has also proven to have enhanced strength, kicking down soldiers effortlessly and managing to land a hit on Akuji with a single punch that ultimately let his guard down. Her strength is further proven when she casually punches Ashton in the face as a joke for teasing her about the nickname "Vegetable," and also managing to knock down many of the Lyakonian soldiers effortlessly with the help of Hikage.    

'''Enhanced Durability:''' Veena's body is incredibly durable, being able to withstand many crucial injuries when in battle, as seen when her arm is nearly cut off by The Dark Entity during their final battle and getting shot in the leg by a Lyakonian soldier. She was also able to hold Hikage while spinning around a spirit shield to protect her and Hikage from the soldiers without getting tired.          

'''Enhanced Stamina &amp; Endurance:''' Veena possesses above average stamina and endurance, resisting many attacks being inflicted on her effortlessly and managed to stay in the same physical and emotional state as she was before.

    <title>Lyakon</title>
    <ns>0</ns>

{{Kingdom Info|title1=Lyakon|image1=&lt;gallery&gt;
Flag_of_Lyakon.png|Current Flag
Illyria.png|Illyrian Flag
&lt;/gallery&gt;|caption-image1=|Location=Ezarva, Lyarik|govtype=Constitutional monarchy &lt;small&gt;(formerly)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;Autocratic absolute monarchy|HOF=Royal Council|Rulers=Caius Astrada|Inhabiters=Akuji Hasegawa, Cassian Packard|Formerinhab=Ashton Khanh, Hideko Inazuma, Shizuka Ikami}}

'''Lyakon''', officially known as '''The Kingdom of Lyakon''' and formerly known as '''Illyria''', is a kingdom located in the center of Lyarik's island of Erzarva and borders Azuren to the east after being split to create a border to display Lyakon's independence from their rule. Despite being connected to Azuren via the border, they are one of the kingdoms who do not recognize themselves being apart of the [[Five Kingdoms]] due to being a separate continent that is connected via a border.      

The Lyakonian-Azurian border is connected by the forbidden forest that leads to western Leiden that is both heavily sectored and guarded daily due to Lyakonian defectors attempting to escape. Formed by the Astrada clan during the Azurian-Illyrian War, the kingdom quickly rose to power after using several war tactics against Azuren, leading to their technology to become more advanced than the kingdoms located within Azuren.    

The kingdom is separated into three divisions: The first division, Ilya, one of the wealthiest, highly urbanized divisions where the main kingdom (sometimes called the capital) is located, The second division, Lysa, the middle class division that is also highly urbanized and wealthy, and the third division, Isaya, the third class.    

The economy of Lyakon is the second largest due to their exports of natural resources and fishing, along with gold and copper exports that help assist nations that are in need of an alliance. Due to their exporting of goods, they have been seen as the bread basket of all the nations.     

Despite both Illya and Lysa being highly developed, the island of Isaya's development is very low due to poverty and a lack of jobs in the area. Without much funding, both sectors do not have proper education or jobs many could get as they are often left to starve and to fend for themselves. Human rights issues in Lyakon further grow because of their use of child soldiers and the extreme abuse towards them.    

== History ==

=== Early History ===
Not much is known about the early history of the kingdom, but it had originated during 1275 BC, during the great war between Lyarik, formerly known as '''Illyria''' at the time as it was one of Azuren's colonies, and was at war with them due to wanting to become an independent nation. The kingdom of Lyakon was formed by the Astrada clan, a somewhat aristocratic family that consisted of powerful and extremely talented combatants that had assisted in defending the ailing soldiers that were quickly getting defeated by the Azurian soldiers because of their technologically advanced weapons and magic.         

Though, it is unclear how the war had ended, it has been implied that they had managed to outsmart them through psychological warfare and taking advantage of the environment that Lyarik has, such as high mountains and rather damp forests that Azurian soldiers were unable to adjust to because of their rather flat lands and smooth mountains. With this, Illyria was changed to Lyarik to symbolize that they were not simply an Azurian colony, along with them changing their flag.            

=== Rise to power ===
After the war, Lyarik had established their kingdom and slowly started to climb up the ranks and recovered from the and became a nationwide power because of their quick advancement after independence. Many individuals had started to immigrate in order to have a more sustainable life. Most migrants came from parts of Azuren, such as Etherin and Leiden at the time, and they started to build homes and sustain themselves. Businesses begun to flourish and jobs had begun to open up for everyone, including hybrid creatures that many did not want accept.     

The citizens enjoyed equal amounts of freedom under king Osias' rule and were able to travel to Azuren and to other countries like Soraya freely. As the citizens enjoyed their freedom, Azuren was attempting to fix their relationship in order to form an alliance with Lyakon. Though, things had still remained sour, but Azuren would still help and assist them as reparation for the damage they had caused and issued a formal apology to the kingdom for their misdemeanors and hoping to mend their disputes in the future     

Even though Azuren had apologized to them formally, their feud was still fresh and soured by the minute. They did provide assistance and Lyakon accepted it, but they still did not want to be associated with them because of their actions. Despite their souring relationship, the people had lived freely and had little to no restrictions whatsoever. Being abundant in natural resources, Lyakon's economy started to flourish after opening up about the idea of trading with other kingdoms. Because of their immense uranium and gun powder stock, Lyakon was at some point called the gun powder kingdom.        

Lyakon was once a parliamentary constitutional monarchy, where the king would not make the decisions alone and had a parliament in order to help him and to not allow him to have full rule. This proved to be useful because of how the citizens had equal freedom, including demons, a very rare occurrence for the time. After the war between humans and demons, demons were frowned upon in Azuren, but were seen as good in Lyakon because of how they recognized them as human and not what the taboos and bad omens said.                  

=== Banishment of Caius Astrada ===
Despite all of Lyakon's praise for being one of the freest kingdoms, one of their major scandals was banishing Caius Astrada, one of the older sons next in line to the throne. Because of his authoritarian mindset and his distaste towards demons, the Astrada Clan did not want him ruling because he would impose a tyrannical rule upon the kingdom, much to their disdain.            

As a result, he was removed from the lineage and banished, but still having a strong claim to the throne. As Caius served as a general for Etherin's army, he was easily influenced by the politics that surround it about authoritarianism and dictatorship. The family had no choice but to banish him because of how much of a threat he imposed on the kingdom; Though they still loved and cherished him, they did not have any other resolution and made his claim to the throne illegitimate.           

As he was banished, Caius was angered by being abandoned by his own family. In an act of revenge had decided to plan an overthrow, where he and many of Etherin's soldiers started to prepare a coup d'état that would overthrow his brother from the throne and make him next in line. While planning, Caius started to coordinate how they would get rid of his brother from the throne and he will be the next ruler via usurping the throne.

    <title>The phantom forest (choose your own adventure)</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162259</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259769</id>
      <parentid>259747</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-04-03T13:40:42Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>DuckCat1234</username>
        <id>54779948</id>
      </contributor>
      <comment>Used (Y/N) Instead of Silver/Pearl, And (Y/P) Instead of She Pronouns</comment>
      <origin>259769</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="10270" sha1="ievtds8mqt3686cjxesvc44e5zkawzy" xml:space="preserve">This was my first story ever, I Deleted Everything in this Page once, but now I am thinking of Making an Actual Choose your Own adventure, Keep in Mind this is not Finished Yet. 

NOTE - I am Sorry, But i don't think I will be Continuing this, I have added some more things but only the Story will be Actually Completed, Oh and Also, I might still Edit this Sometimes to Correct Mistakes and Add more Details. 

If you Die as a Consequence of a Choice, Don't Worry, You can Restart!   

This CYOA's Story Version - [https://wildworks-writing.fandom.com/wiki/The_phantom_forest_(Story)?so=search] (I Recommend Playing this First, Or the it will Spoil everything.)   

== Prologue ==
You are a (Your Gender) Gray and White Fox With Blue eyes, Wearing a Spiked Collar and your Name is (Y/N). 

One day Pearl/Silver Was on a Trip, And was Sailing a Boat, (Y/P) Stopped Near a Island With a Mountain, Covered In a Forest (Y/P) had Never Seen Before. 

Out of Curiosity, (Y/P) was Just About to Enter the Island Before (Y/P) stopped and Thought :

'''Is it Safe?''' 

What do you do? continue or Sail away? 

== Continue ==
Out of Curiosity, You Stepped on the Island, You Walked For a Few minutes Before Approaching Purple Trees. 

As soon as You Enter the Strange, Purple Forest, You see Phantom Goop. 

For one Moment you hesitate to Continue and Think of Going Back, But your Curiosity Again Wins, As You Continue Through the Forest, You Trip Over a Branch, You Fell down and Fainted Before you could see how it Looked, But You Knew that It Was a Spiky Purple Branch, Which Didn't Look Natural. 

You wake up at a Cage. (Check "Into the Fortress" For Continuing)

== Sail away ==
You approach you Boat, And Quickly start Sailing, But a Blurry Figure From the Corner of Your Eye Quickly Hit You with Something Spiky, Strange Dark Creatures With tentacles, You Realized They were Phantoms, About 10 of Them, One of them Zapped you, And You Fainted.

You wake up and Find Yourself in a Cage.  (Check "Into the Fortress" For Continuing)

== Into the Fortress ==
You Wake up, And Find Yourself In a Cage, You sit up and See the Door for your Cage was Locked, The phantoms Guarding were Luckily, Sleeping.

You See Two Cages Beside Yours, One In the Left, Where there Was a Brown Bunny With White Patches, With Green Eyes, Wearing  Orange Crystal Pegasus Wings And Green Heart Leg Warmers, She Looked Calm Yet Scared. 

On the Right, There was a Black Horse, With a Pink Mane and Tail, Wearing a Cowboy Hat, Rare Heart Scarf and Elegant Boots, She Looked Aggressive and Overconfident. 

You Decide to Talk to One of Them, But Which One? And For what, Trying to Make a Plan to Escape or Get to Know this Place better?

Options :

Talk to the Bunny - Make a Plan

Talk to the Bunny - Get to Know more

Talk to the Horse - Make a Plan

Talk to the Horse - Get to Know more

== Talk to the Bunny - Make a Plan ==
You Decide to Talk to The bunny, She Gets on Defensive Before Realizing you are not a Threat, You Ask her in a Quiet Voice. 

"Hey, Who are you?"

"I am Flora, An Experienced Prisoner, But who are you?" Flora Replies in a Quiet Voice too. 

"I am (Y/N) Do you want to Get out of this Place?" you reply

"Yes, But I Won't Make a Plan, We Might Get Caught"

"Okay..." You Reply in Disappointment, But you can Still Continue The Conversation and Get to Know more about this Place, Will You talk to the Horse or Continue talking with the Bunny? 

== Talk to the Bunny - Get to Know more ==
You Decide to Talk to The bunny, She Gets on Defensive Before Realizing you are not a Threat, You Ask her in a Quiet Voice.

"Hello, (Y/N) , I am New Here Could you tell me Some Information about This Place?" you asked. 

"I am Flora, I have been Here for a Long time, So Sure! What do you want to know first?"

What Would you Like to Know? 

Options : About this Place, Which Room is where, What Rooms are here, etc. 

Or About the Phantoms, Their Goal,etc.?

== Talk to the Horse - Make a Plan ==
You Quietly Greet the Horse, But the Horse is Loud. 

"Oh hey" You had said. 

"Hello! what are you Doing Here? Do you also Dislike the Phantoms?-" The Horse Started Talking Loudly Before The Phantoms Woke up. 

"Too Bad i know this Trick, GET BACK TO YOUR OWN WORK" One of the Guards said. 

"YES GET BACK TO YOUR WORK UNLESS YOU WANT PUNISHMENT" The other Guard said. 

The Horse,  Even Though Mad, Sat down Quietly and You did the Same. 

Would you like to Wait for the Right Moment and talk to the Horse again? Or do you talk to the Bunny? 

== Talk to the Horse - Get to Know more ==
You Quietly Greet the Horse, But Unfortunately The Horse was Loud. 

"Hello, Could you Please tel-" you Were about to Finish the Sentence before being cut of by The Horse

"Oh Hello! I am Stone! What do you want? Are you on the Phantoms Side?" She Said the Last Sentence a Bit Warily.

Just after a Moment, The guards Woke up. 

"GET BACK TO YOUR OWN WORK" they Said. 

You Two were Annoyed, But Sat down Quietly.

Do you Wait for the Right Moment and talk to the Horse again? or do you Talk to The Bunny?

== Get to Know more - About This Place ==
"So you want to Know more about this Place? Sure" She pointed to a Map of The Fortress Hung At the Wall in Front of The Cages, You were Surprised at How Big it was, Yet knew you Shouldn't have Expected any Less. 

"Here at the Center are those Cages..." She Started Telling all about this Place, But the Guards Woke Up for a Moment, You and Flora Quickly Pretended to be Asleep Before The Phantoms Got Back to their Sleeping again.

Flora waited a Few Minutes Before Continuing, you Could Tell She Was a Careful and Wary Bunny, And that's what Kept Her Safe from The Threat, Whatever the Threat was.

"Just at the Left of the Cages Room, There is the Throne room, At the Right of The Cages Room, There is the Lab, at The front of the Cages Room there is the Maze that Leads to the Entrance, I was about to try it before I Just got Scared."

"A Maze? Sounds Smart but how Do the Phantoms Remember the Way?" You asked. 

" I Don't Know Honestly, But anyways At the Back of the Cages Room is Where the Phantoms hold Meetings, Just beside the Room is the Ladder to The Next Floor, Where There are Bedrooms, The Next floor is the Dining Room, The Workers and The Royalty only Eat together on Special Occasions, And only high rank phantoms get to Spend the Special Occasions with Royalty." She Said. 

" And the Next floor, The Highest floor is Where the Announcements are Held. " Flora Said. 

"Woah..." You were Surprised, At Jamma You had never Seen anything like this. 

"Want to Know Anything Else?" Flora asked. 

Would you like to Know more about the Phantoms? Or Do Something Else? (If you choose to not talk more, You Can either Directly go to "2nd Day" Or Try to Talk to the Horse.)

( I will add an Image of 1st Floor's Map when I learn how to add images, If you know, Please Tell me how to add them, I am on a Mobile By the way) 

== Get to Know more -  About the Phantoms ==
"So, You want to know More about the Phantoms? sure." Flora Said. 

" I don't know Everything, But I know the Phantoms are Up to Something... Possibly to Take over Jamma, Whoever tries to Escape Or do Something to Threaten whatever their Goal is, They Force the Jammer to drink a Potion that Makes them Forgot everything about jamma, And Make them Allies of the Phantoms." Said Flora. 

(Go to "2nd Day" for Continuation, Oh and it will be the the one of the Last Chapters of this CYOA. )  

== 2nd Day ==
It was Midnight, You were Sleeping, But suddenly you Heard a Noise. 

You Woke up, And saw some Phantoms heading to where Flora told was the Announcement Room. 

'''Hmm... If i followed, I would get Useful Information, But might also get Caught.'''

Do you Follow the Phantoms, Or go Back to Sleep? 

== Follow the Phantoms ==
You Followed the Phantoms, Your Darkish Coat Blending in with the Darkness of the Night, You Silently Walk to the Announcement Room, and see the Phantoms Gathering up. 

Do you Hide Somewhere to Listen, Or just Stand and Listen? (If you want to Go back, Go to "Go back to Sleep")

== Go back to Sleep ==
You Go back to Sleep, And Sleep till the Morning.

The Horse/Stone woke you up, You saw the Bunny/Flora  Hiding in a Corner from Fear, And the Phantoms Strengthening the Locks of the Cages. 

Some Phantoms were Also Holding Weapons, And Entering the Maze one by one.

You Realized, They were now Attacking Jamma, You were too Late.

'''If i had Spied on the Announcement last night, I could have Done Something, I Could have Warned everyone, And we Could Have Saved Jamma....'''

But you Pushed the Thoughts away, You couldn't have Done much in a Few Hours anyways. 

(That's All, I will only be Working on the Story now, But feel Free to Imagine what Happens Next Or Replay this, Or Check out the Story [https://wildworks-writing.fandom.com/wiki/The_phantom_forest_(Story)?so=search])

== Hide and Listen ==
You Hid in a Dark Corner, Where there Were no Seats Nearby. 

A Huge Phantom, With a Purple Crown Maybe made of a Gem you studied that is Found near Phantom Places, Climbed on a High Place, The Phantom was Maybe their King. 

The King Began his Speech, "Phantoms, Finally after Countless Decades of Preparing for the Attack on Jamma, It is Time to Attack."

The Other Phantoms Cheered Loudly, You Covered your Ears so the Noise won't be So Loud. 

Finally, After the Noise Stopped, You Took off your Paws from your ears again.

"The Prisoners might be up to Something, so I would like to Command some of you to Strengthen the Locks of the Cages, And the rest Please Be prepared with yours Weapons to Go and Attack Jamma." The King Continued.

One of the Phantoms, With Blue-Gray Splotches on Him said "Of Course, You can Count on us."

"Good, Now you all Can go back, And Remember, Be prepared to Attack." The King said, And Floated away, The Other Phantoms Slowly Floated away too, Until only you were Left.

You waited for Everyone to Go back to their Bedrooms, and Quickly got back to your Cage. 

(That's All, I will only be Working on the Story now, But feel Free to Imagine what Happens Next Or Replay this, Or Check out the Story [https://wildworks-writing.fandom.com/wiki/The_phantom_forest_(Story)?so=search])</text>

    <title>Akuji Hasegawa</title>

''This page belongs to Auryze and is a work in progress. Please do not edit without their permission first.''{{Character idk|title1=Akuji Hasegawa|nickname=Aku &lt;small&gt;(By everyone)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt; Bastard &lt;small&gt;(By Ashton)&lt;/small&gt;|age=22 &lt;small&gt;(currently)&lt;/small&gt;&lt;br&gt;18 &lt;small&gt;(When meeting Ashton)&lt;/small&gt;|height=6'1|species=Human|status=Alive|job=Bounty Hunter|residence=Lyakon|affiliation=National Army of Lyakon|alignment=Evil|relatives=Unnamed Mother&lt;br&gt;Unnamed Father&lt;br&gt;Three unnamed siblings|enemies=Ashton Khanh, Locaster Helios, Shay Hanamura, Vivian "Veena" Lu, Hikage Ishuko, Hideko Inazuma, Shizuka Ikami, Soul Kawasaki, Nabi Haluška, Damion Halloreen, Fēng Xu, Yuna Hanamura|image1=&lt;gallery&gt;
ITS_GETTIN_SPOOKY...jpeg|Drawing
Akuji_.jpg|Gacha Club
Akuji meanie.png|Animal Jam
&lt;/gallery&gt;|allies=Caius Astrada, National Army of Lyakon, Cassian Packard, Ashton Khanh &lt;small&gt;(formerly)&lt;/small&gt;|gender=Male|Ethnicity=Japanese 🇯🇵}}

'''Thank you so much to Phxcon for drawing him!'''    

'''Akuji Hasegawa''' is a major antagonist of a Good Vs. Evil Roleplay. He is a bounty hunter that works for the National Army of Lyakon. He is responsible for blackmailing Ashton into joining the army due to him being a demon. He has been shown to be a clear favorite of the king, as he is mainly sent out for missions very frequently, usually to capture defectors and send them back or hunt down hybrids for the black market economy of Lyakon.     

== History ==
Akuji was the oldest of three siblings and grew up in the same district of Lyakon as Ashton. He worked as a thief in order to support his family due to Estelar's extreme famine and lack of funding from the capital. He often had to work long hours to get the supplies his family needed and deeply cared for his parents and three siblings by prioritizing them over himself. Even when they had food, Akuji would give larger portions for his family instead of himself.     

Due to being the only one in the family that is physically fit, he usually was seen as the breadwinner of his family because of him being able to steal an abundant amount of food with little to no effort, and managed to keep his family afloat by stealing what he could to ensure survival for him and his family.  

One day when stealing, he had gotten into a fight with a group children from the second division of Lyakon, but he had quickly overpowered them after nearly being assaulted and almost had his food taken away. Being beaten by a third division individual, The fight had resulted in him getting followed home without his knowledge after they had tipped the soldiers of Lyakon about him stealing as an enactment of revenge.        

After he had walked home to give food to his family, many guards from Lyakon had shown up at his home to simply take Akuji away to draft him into the military. Despite his attempts of refusal for the sake of his siblings and family, the guards proceeded to drag him out, ignoring his pleas to release him. Even though he resisted, he was still heavily outnumbered, and was taken away from his family, and his struggling was intense enough to a point where the soldiers had to sedate him. Afterward, he was sent to the Lyakonian army base to train to be a soldier, permanently separated from his family and unsure of when he can see them again.       

At the base, Akuji was both physically and psychologically abused by his trainers, often berated harshly for mistakes he would often make and was constantly overworked. His trainers would often beat him with a stick to force him into submission if he ever attempted to fight back or when he did not give a satisfactory performance. He was forced to go on long shifts without breaks and often was exhausted. He was constantly stressed and was also homeless, as he would often have to sleep in a tree when his shifts were over, though at times they wouldn't be over until the morning. Because of all the stress and abuse he faced, his personality slowly shifted into a rather cold and malevolent one and started to take pride in his job, despite knowing how wrong it felt.              

At some point, Akuji had became the favorite of Caius for a brief period of time, always standing by the throne and often sent out on missions on his behalf and even alluded to being "more than a favorite" of him once, also being seen as an object and nothing more. Though, after he was sent out to hunt hybrids, he had eventually found Ashton and recruited him via blackmail. Ashton then replaced Akuji as the favorite a couple of years later after he begun to outshine Akuji. As he viewed Ashton as himself when he was younger, he treated him the exact same way he was treated when being forced into the military.               

Akuji's personality further took a shift as he started to physically, emotionally and verbally abuse Ashton and frequently took his rage and anger out on him without showing it on his face. As a result of his abuse, Ashton started to grow a fear of Akuji in his later years. The two were still partnered up together despite of Ashton's fear, and Akuji would often pressure him into killing the innocent by using coercion to do so. He often resorted to canning him if he did not excel in his training and forced him to hold boulders on his shoulders for hours on end in order to make him miserable. Akuji had also killed a girl that Ashton had feelings for all for the sake of making him lonely and without anyone that can help him. As Akuji's behavior began to escalate, Ashton developed an extreme fear of being near him whenever having to do partner work.                 

== Appearance ==

=== Gacha Club Model ===
Akuji is a tall man of Japanese descent with gray-ish skin and white eyes with a scar on his face. He has long, raven-black hair that goes down to his back tied in a braid and a dark blue musketeer had that is slightly tilted. Underneath his left eye is a beauty mark and his right eye has a scar that expands across his face.    

Akuji wears a typical mercenary outfit:  A gray, body armor like shirt with rolled up sleeves, a green cape with two black pieces of fabric that dangle in the front, a belt with two leather straps curled, black military pants and gray boots with light blue decals. On the left side of his waist, he wears a gun holster that holds a double barrel gun inside.    

As a child, Akuji's hair was down and rather messy and the scar on his right eye is absent. He wears a tan shirt with ripped up gray pants, bandages around his arm and brown boots.     

=== Animal Jam Model ===
Akuji's Animal Jam Model is an arctic wolf with a black outer fur and a dark gray inner fur. He has white eyes and star patterns that are all over his fur. Akuji wears a huntress hat with a black spike collar around his neck, hunter boots, tail belts, and hunter garb. He often carries around a double barreled gun that is concealed in a sack.   

== Personality ==
Though appearing rather smooth-talking and polite on the surface, Akuji is an apathetic and condescending individual, having little to no attachment to anyone around him and has a hard time forming bonds, only seeing them as a role to merely fufill. When on duty, he often displays a peppy, yet playful demeanor, but often teases his targets and can be rather sadistic when doing so, taunting Locaster about killing Soul Kawasaki after ripping off his wings without any qualms. Being the king's right hand man, Akuji is a swift and agile individual, having the ability to kill targets without any hardship or difficulty and is heavily favored by the king, being able to say what he pleases to Cassian and other high ranking officials in the kingdom.         

According to Ashton, Akuji is both intimidating and ruthless, often displaying abusive behavior towards other people and viewing his vile behavior as normal. Since Akuji abused Ashton during their time training, he finds satisfaction for mercilessly taunting and teasing Ashton in a crude, yet playful manner about personal events he had gone through and showed little empathy towards him. Akuji is a psychopath and did harmful actions to others simply for the reaction, taking Cassian's earring in order to anger him just to see if his reaction was worth seeing, even going as far into killing a girl Ashton had liked solely to see his reaction and make him miserable.        

Akuji has shown to be less prone for when people attempt to expose him for his actions, slapping Ashton across the face after he had confronted him on his abusive behavior and how he did not help him after a certain event, leading him to often use threats and his physical prowess in order to scare them into submission. Along with his intimidating appearance, his choice of words are described as harsh, bordering on cruelty, often using profanity without any restraint and can come off as severe.          

Akuji has shown to be delighted whenever he has opponents, praising Locaster for his use of his dark magic, complimenting Ashton on his improved technique and going as far into sparing him because he views Ashton as a "fun opponent." However, this side of him is hardly shown, as he banters about how he was able to kill many demons without having to fight them because of his prowess.          

Akuji is both arbitrarily cruel and harsh and shows little to no concern for those who do not abide by Lyakon's rule. He perceives newer recruits to the army as weak with no potential whatsoever due to his superiority complex of being stronger than others. With his superiority complex comes with his behavior towards others, as he switches his personality depending on the person he is around, whether it is for deception or to have a simple conversation with. Akuji is also rather disrespectful, taunting Cassian about his fear of landmines and making crude remarks about his fathers death, but can only be respectful if he is threatened or is near someone higher in command.           

As a child, however, his personality was the exact opposite of the cruel and rather harsh persona he now adapts: When he was younger, Akuji would always put others above himself and was described to be sweet, helpful and very protective of his family, going to the extremes to ensure their survival and does not take care of himself because of him caring for other people around him. He was described by Hideko during their brief conversation as children as generous and caring to those around him before being dragged into the army.             

== Abilities ==
'''Overall Abilites:''' As a soldier, Akuji is a very powerful, yet dangerous combatant. It has been stated by both Ashton and Locaster that he is one of the more stronger opponents the both of them have faced. He was able to withhold many attacks from Hideko and Ashton as the both of them attempted to surprise attack him but failing, He was able to put up a fight with all members of the group without difficulty. His combination of both his skilled use in weaponry and combat makes him one of the more larger threats the group had faced, the second big threat being Crow. He, at first, does not fight seriously in order to ease his opponents in and only gets serious when his opponent is fooled.  

'''Deception:''' Being trained in a harsh environment, Akuji has incredible deception skills, having the ability to fool others around him by displaying a friendly, smooth-talking facade that is able to fool all but the more keen observants. Ashton and Hideko were quickly able to see through his facade, the other members following up. His ability to deceive becomes an advantage he often uses because of how he gained the trust of many other individuals before killing them of. This was shown when Akuji had managed to fool Locaster into eating a drug-laced brownie in order to save Ashton from being executed and his secret of being a quarter of a demon come out.  

'''Enhanced Speed &amp; Reflexes:''' As a soldier for one of the largest armies, Akuji is extremely fast, being able to catch up to Ashton effortlessly and outpacing Shizuka in her tracks; His speed is sometimes described as being inhuman-like, sometimes being fast enough it appears he teleported. His impeccable speed was further exemplified when he managed to catch up to Ashton and nearly slam him into the ground. His reflexes are also equally as fast, dodging many of Locaster's powerful spells and attacks and managing to evade Shay's many ambushes, despite him being a Lieutenant.    

'''Enhanced Strength:''' As a soldier in the National Army of Lyakon, Akuji possesses incredible and nearly inhuman-like strength. This is shown when he manages to punch down Ashton and nearly knock down Shay with only a simple kick. According to Yuna, Akuji's strength is on the caliber of a demons and nearly surpasses Ashton in strength because of Akuji being in the military for a longer time than him. Even when he was a child, his strength has been described to be unmatched, so much so that he was able to save himself from getting beaten by upper rank children. He was also strong enough to rip Locaster's wings out of his back without difficulty.     

'''Enhanced Durability:''' Akuji has proven to have an incredibly durable body. This is shown when Cassian nearly smothers him for taking his earring, but still remained unfazed. This is further proven when Hideko had attempted to shoot his arm with the bullet, cutting his skin and creating a huge dent, but proved to not flinch when being faced with this. His durability is further proven when Ashton used his metal pipe to nearly break his wrist, but managed to resist the pain that came with it.     

'''Menacing Aura:''' Akuji has demonstrated to have a menacing and rather overwhelming presence, managing to scare Locaster into taking his drug-laced brownie in order to save Ashton from both being outed as a demon and being killed. His aura is further exemplified when Hideko, one of the more brash members, falls into silence when he gets punched in the stomach by him during their awaiting trials.      

'''Keen Intellect:''' Being both harshly trained and carefully educated by both Cassian and Caius, Akuji has demonstrated to be incredibly intelligent. He was able to ambush the group with ease by carefully preparing and planning out how they were going to send Ashton back by making a mass ambush. He has also proven to be knowledgable in combat, as seen where he correctly predicts every move from Damion. He was also aware that he was a former Founding Demon, and while not being a shard user, possesses knowledge on some of the demon gems.     

'''Enhanced Stamina &amp; Endurance:''' Akuji has proven on several occasions to have inhuman-like stamina and endurance, shown when going one on one with Ashton and not showing an inch of exhaustion or being tired. This is proven during his one on one battle with Ashton, nearly knocking him to the ground and nearly pouncing on him when he realized he was overusing his abilities and barely flinched when Ashton and Damion used more of their larger spells on him, continuing to fight in a nonchalant manner.       

== Equipment ==
'''Double Barreled Shotgun:''' Akuji's main weapon of choice is a double barreled shotgun, used for hunting down hybrids and designed to be used at further distances, as shown when he was able to shoot Damion through the shoulder from a faraway angle. He has also used his gun multiple time around Ashton during his training by making him run through a forest and shooting him at far distances so he can attempt to avoid the many bullets flying at him. 

== Weaknesses ==
'''Reliance:''' Akuji's main weakness is reliance on his weapon, as he is beater with weapon-to-weapon combat instead of hand-to-hand, despite being efficient in the two. This results in him having to rely on his gun too much. Without his gun or being out of bullets, he is considered much weaker. 

'''Expose:''' Akuji is not prone to being called out for his heinous and lecherous actions. If called out, he will ultimately lash out and use physical violence as a threat or as a way to keep things on the low. This is seen when Ashton calls Akuji out on not trying to help him, but he had eventually slapped Ashton across the face due to him calling Akuji out for his abusive and crude behavior. 

'''Hand-to-hand Combat:''' Those exceeding in this category of combat, Akuji has proven to lack some skill in it, easily being knocked down by Ashton due to not having his gun. While he still exceeds, this type of combat can greatly hinder his ability to fight because of his weak hand muscles. 

'''Underestimation:''' Having a superiority complex, Akuji mostly undermines the individuals he fights because of his view on being the superior out of all soldiers. He is seen underestimating Ashton by taunting him before he nearly lands a hit on him, cutting him with his sword. Because of his underestimation of individuals, it can greatly weaken him, especially when challenging proficient fighters. 

== Relationships ==

=== [[Ashton Khanh]] ===
Being Ashton's trainer under his wing, Akuji has a very strained and hostile relationship with him. As he blackmailed Ashton into joining the army in order to not get killed and sold off, Akuji physically and emotionally abused him from when he was fourteen up until he was seventeen, beating him for not achieving the above perfection standard that was common in the military. Because of the abuse, Ashton harbors an immense amount of hatred towards him, while Akuji harbors both envy and hatred. His envy can stem from when he was able to surpass him in talent and combat because of his naturally advanced physiology. 

As a result of Akuji's abuse, Ashton exhibits an extreme fear of him and often freezes whenever he is near or even in close sights. Akuji finds this as a normal reaction because he is supposed to be scared of him. Akuji often taunts Ashton about memories he wanted to forget and traumatic moments in order to psyche him out and put him in a more vulnerable position to ultimately weaken him. When he was younger, he would often beat Ashton as a way to force him into submission whenever the two had an argument or a conflict with one another.    

=== [[Cassian Packard]] ===
Akuji was Cassian's trainee who works under his fleet. When first being introduced to him, Akuji was frightened of him because of his abusive behavior, but was also fascinated by him because of his many talents, such as having the ability to train soldiers effortlessly. Even though he does have a sense of hostility towards him, he perceives Cassian as a puppet he can manipulate because of his vulnerabilities. He enjoys seeing him in a frustrated or agitated state, such as when he took off one of his earrings and made him fight for it back until Akuji was nearly smothered by him or intentionally taunting him for not having a father.  

Taunting him about his father's death, Cassian harbors an immense hatred for him, but cannot retaliate due to Akuji being Caius' right-hand man. He is frequently seen with Akuji because of him being sent on missions the most on Caius' behalf.   

=== [[Locaster Helios]] ===
Though their interactions are fairly limited, Akuji demonstrates to show a disdain for him. He taunted him about Soul's death, bragging how his body parts sold for "a good million runes" and dropping his mask on the floor. However, despite his hatred for him, he shows a particular interest in Locaster because of his empathy and selflessness, taking advantage of it and giving him a drug-laced brownie instead of killing him in order to see how far he would go to save a person.   

=== Caius Astrada ===
Caius Astrada is the current ruler of Lyakon. Being his right-hand man, he shows to maintain a business partner-like relationship with him, often being sent on missions under his name. It is noted by Ashton that Akuji and Caius' relationship is seen as odd by both soldiers and politicians alike because of how they act more like close acquaintances than just a soldier and a king. He is always standing by his  

== Trivia ==

* Akuji is one of three characters with a braid, the other two being [[Misaya Myat]] and [[Cassian Packard]].
* Despite forgetting his old self, Akuji remembers his family vaguely and has not seen them in over four years, but hopes to visit them. 
* Akuji's hatred for Ashton was caused by envy and pure spite: As he saw Ashton improve and surpass him, his envy grew to a point where he made it a goal to make Ashton miserable in any given moment because of his deep envy for him. 
* Akuji is one of the tallest members outside of Locaster's group, being around 6'1 and Cassian being around 6'2. 
* He has a skin condition known as argyria, where instead of his skin being pale like most of his family, his skin is an off gray tone, caused by people who ingest silver. Unlike his family members, Akuji's is the least severe from them. 
* Many soldiers despise him for not only his talents but also his personality. 
* As Akuji is proficient in weapon-to-weapon combat, he was able to kill as many as thirteen people with his shotgun alone.
* Akuji's favorite foods are fried squid and daifuku, along with spicy foods. He, however, is not used to sour or overly-sweet foods. 
* Akuji likes hunting, feeling superior among others and hot springs, but he dislikes Ashton, people that claim to be superior and bugs. 
* According to Cassian, he finds Akuji "stupid" because of his superiority complex.

      <text bytes="87191" sha1="q0eysb3gxy0s3dmwnoi7gtf17vp2wxg" xml:space="preserve">= Fireworks =
''A link to the first book: [[Fireworks]]''

Hi again, everyone! Welcome to the second volume of my gay romance miniseries, ''Fireworks.'' In case you were wondering, this volume is just a follow-up to the first: it pretty much focuses on the queer rights movement that Isaac, Simon, and Luka start. I have mentioned my idea for ''The Moon Was High Enough (For Us To Live)'', but this isn't the Luka-and-Kara love story quite yet, hehe. 

==== Fireworks Vol. 2 ====


&lt;u&gt;INTRODUCTION&lt;/u&gt;

"Simon! Simon, get up-- we're going to the studio! We're filming the interviews! We need to get the petitions! Simon, come on!" Isaac's joyous anticipation woke me up with a jolt. Today was the day!

The petitions and everything... At Johnston Summer Boarding School (surprise-surprise, Mr. Johnston was in charge because it was property he inherited), I hadn't expected to have actually made any of that happen. But with just a few words, I did. Which... wow. Pretty amazing. 

And now, we were at a hotel near a news studio, pre-paid rooms (Luka got their own, smaller room) and all, being interviewed.

AND we had made five full petitions- one, for CHECKS to be removed- two, for Mr. Johnston to be fired- three, for Teddy to face charges for all the s*** he did- four, Mr. Johnston would also face charges (Luka surprisingly knew a lot about the law- apparently, their uncle has his own law firm and told Luka all about it)- and five, the Johnston Summer Boarding School would create a zero-tolerance policy for discrimination, assault, and bullying.

Turns out that a lot of kids attending summer school with us were having a hard time. Some of them, like Luka, were staying year-round- they'd been harassed for varying reasons. One autistic boy, Mars, spoke up about how Mr. Johnston didn't do anything when he reported ableist bullying from Teddy. And apparently, the bullying got ''really'' bad.

I mentioned the time Teddy and his goons (who supposedly felt sorry and regretted everything, saying they wanted attention and wanted to be popular and that they didn't realize how much harm they were doing, they were in it for stupid fun and a laugh and they claimed they didn't enjoy any of it either, that they felt super terrible, which even if they did  feel that way doesn't mean they're innocent)--

Okay, yeah, a lot, but I'm upset at them- as I was saying, though, I spoke up, too. It was kind of tricky. But I brought up the time when Teddy had somehow obtained an airsoft gun (weapons, fake or not, and drugs weren't allowed on the school property, but Mr. Johnston excused it and said there wasn't evidence or witnesses), and what he'd done to Isaac and I that day.

Luka even spoke about Kara. And f***, I wasn't ready for that, because I didn't even know about Kara. And... God. To think that Teddy ever even had a real gun? And that it was simply... excused? He had attempted to murder someone. And nearly succeeded. 

It was so much. Almost too much. But this was important. This could be it. This could be a way to recognize queerness and celebrate queer joy and smite discrimination. Isaac is excited. I am, too. Of course I am. This is huge. And even if I wasn't, it's still too important.

We'd been rehearsing for forever- the news company got us a hotel room to stay at in the mean time, while they interrogated Mr. Johnston- and today was the day. But God, I was late already, I'd slept in until 8:39... forget that, though. 

Seeing Isaac, him waking me up in the morning... it was kind of cute. Really cute. Yeah, I was a fan of it. A big fan.

"Uh- um--" I sputtered nervously, trying to get out of bed without looking like a total doofus in my high-contrast Spongebob pajamas.

I was tired. Everything I've been thinking of, or well, thinking of then, I'd been thinking of last night. So of course I selected the most humiliating clothing choice I could've.

Isaac, of course, laughed at me immediately.  

The embarrassment had already started, but I had prepared an emergency button-up shirt and necktie. Blushing, I stood, and turned to the bathroom to change. 

"No way," Isaac said insistently, still chuckling, "you're wearing those."

"Isaac, noooo! It's an interview. I don't want to publicly humiliate myself!" I groaned, pleading for the sake of my one operating fragment of dignity.

"Come on.  Reporters swarmed over your little rebellious act against Mr. Johnston- they've found a lot more out about him, too, thanks to you. You're a rock star to Jamaa. An attractive one, at that," Isaac smiled, leaning in for a peck on the cheek.

"You are not making me wear Spongebob pajamas. I don't love you that much," I said stubbornly, still blushing as I hugged him, letting all of my feelings pour out, letting him know how happy I was. 

I had sort of just told him I loved him. But he didn't even react to that part of the sentence. Did that count? 

Well, it didn't matter. He looked cute, already dressed in his tuxedo. 

Maybe, just maybe, I ''would'' wear Spongebob pajamas. 

He did seem to think I was cute in them...

"Oh shoot, we're really running late now. Can we make out later?" Isaac called, already flying through the door, though with a smile on his face, at the very least- so I knew he was OK.

"Um- Isaac, wait! I--"

Luka rushed up behind me, grinning from ear to ear. I'd never seen her happier myself, even if she was probably about to make an embarrassing comment. 

"Haven't you already told him that you loved him?" Luka said, softer than I'd expected, with a little bit of a chuckle.

Yep. Embarrassing.

"Well, I-- I mean, we have the interviews, so I just-- and- but- no, I- I mean--" I stammered, shocked that Luka had known what I wanted to say, ''really'' say, so easily.

"Of course, Simon. Of course. You know he loves you, though- and you two don't have to hide anymore. Heck, two thirds of Jamaa's population is hoping to see you make out, no matter how weird and creepy that sounds," Luka said reassuringly, though it really only made my nerves spike further.

== 1. Lights ==
The taxi ride had been long and draining.

Now, I didn't get carsick often, but the trip into the heart of Jamaa Township was a certain exception to the honest statement of mine. The path was riddled with bumps and bends, only increasing my worries. 

If I was going to tell Isaac, what was I going to say?

My original goal of changing earlier that day was to just practice via the mirror technique- but he would have heard that anyway.

And was it too soon? Was it too soon to say that? Would I just be making a fool of myself? Or would I hurt Isaac's feelings somehow?

I sighed to myself, staring through the glossy window of the bright yellow taxi. 

According to the cabman, we were only twenty minutes shy of the city, meaning twenty minutes away from trying to set a romantic scene in the middle of an interview and tell Isaac that I love him.

So, basically, a total train wreck. 

Because what was he going to say? 

''"'Look, it's not that I don't... I mean, that I don't want to go out with you... but I just... I think it's a bit too soon for me to say... &lt;u&gt;that.&lt;/u&gt;"'''

Or worse. Or worse. God, none of those outcomes sounded good at all. 

"Simon? Simon... earth to Simon! Simon! Simon, look!" Isaac practically shouted, his voice even more excited than when he'd dragged me out of bed earlier that morning.

I jumped up in my seat, facing the pains of my overly-fastened seatbelt, and then whipped my head around to Isaac, already terrified of just opening my mouth- because what if I said something? Let something slip? And I did it wrong? There were so many ways to do it wrong...

"Simon, you big idiot... look outside! Through the window!" Isaac called, playfully nudging me, resulting in my face being uncomfortably pressed against the window. 

Though everything felt better with him. With Isaac. How was I supposed to tell him that...?

And finally, my saving grace: a distraction. My family had never been big on vacations or sightseeing, but this... this was more than I'd ever imagined. 

That's saying a lot, since I made up an entire theme park the first time I thought of coming out: the holy Gay Rainbow Pride Greatness Land, which conveniently had all my favorite sports (which there were few of), arcade games (which there were more of), foods, and music (David Bowie, Mariah Carey).

The city was more than that, though. Sure, it wasn't pride flag streamers covering every square inch of wall or gay pride flags held high on golden poles, but it was just... angelic, almost. 

Hanging lights like stars circled the trees, the sunshine dappling their vibrant, luscious green leaves, all reflecting upon dozens of clear, florally-decorated windows, which claimed lurid flowers and elegant vines. The sight of it all, the brightness, the beauty, was amazing.

"Wow," I breathed, not realizing Isaac had slipped his paw into mine. 

"Wow," I said again, feeling even more shaky, yet still strong, with him by my side, seeing this with me-- it made me nervous that I was doing something wrong, or offending him- but he made me feel... wanted. 

My parents never really did that, haha. 

My stomach plummeted. Usually my thoughts didn't turn that way. I was just feeling down because of the Isaac thing- this was just stress getting to me. Once we got to the studio, we'd get some fresh air and a lunchbreak. 

I'd feel fine after that... probably.

&lt;nowiki&gt;*****&lt;/nowiki&gt;

Isaac burst out of the car, clearly having pent-up energy. His smile, though, it was incredible, shining like the sun... and he turned to me, and squeezed me, and smiled even harder as he pulled away from another kiss. 

I smiled back, not knowing what to say-- he was the brightest light in my life, always shining. On that day, though, he was shining for more than just me... which I liked. 

I liked everything about him. I loved him. 

I wasn't ready to say it to his face, to admit it. But it was true. It was going to make spending time with him a bit harder...

But what if he loved me back?

What if I was a light to him, too?

There was a chance. I had to remind myself that there was a chance. Isaac Malcher wasn't just some guy that made out with me on the down-low, or some kid saying he pitied me for being gay but he was willing to spend time with me. 

Isaac Malcher was going out with me. That meant that... we were boyfriends. 

I had a boyfriend.

Thinking that satisfied me. But how would I say something? How would I ask ''him'' out?

The question was only bothering me more. 

The thought that had come across me about my parents... that was weighing down on me, too. But I had to stay strong. We were going to do the filming soon- then, it would be time for lunch.

&lt;nowiki&gt;*****&lt;/nowiki&gt;

We walked into the studios. It was time. 

We were introduced to a cougar with a beige underbelly and a tan overcoat, that wore Socks &amp; Sandals, a Black Short Collar, a Founder's Hat, and a dark green tuxedo, whose name was Jeff. 

Jeff was supposedly going to give us a tour of the studios and introduce us to the interviewer, Aeros. 

"It's a pleasure to meet you three! Luka, Simon, Isaac-- the circumstances, I know, are bittersweet- but I've heard clips of your story, and some comments on your experiences-- so I know a little bit about all of you already. Speaking of, what are your pronouns today, Luka?" Jeff asked warmly, looking to Luka expectantly.

"Oh! Today I'm using she/her. Thanks for asking," Luka replied, somewhat surprised, since this wasn't a question she was often asked.

I cracked an awkward smile. It was weird, to be there, at an actual news studio. 

And for everyone around me to have acted like we were best friends, or I was their idol... was also weird. Daresay, weirder than my prior observation.

I hadn't known this Jeff guy. I hadn't known who the heck Aeros was, only that he was supposedly trans, which no one should have told me, since that's something Aeros should say on his own-- so, OK, maybe it would have been kind of impolite to point that out to Jeff. I just...

Lunchtime is before the interviews. Thank God. I need time to process this, still. Maybe, though... maybe I could set aside some time. To talk to Isaac. Maybe...

But then, a turquoise polar bear enters stage left, and has a seat right next to Isaac. Um. What.

"Isaac?" I asked, concerned, "there room for me? I kind of wanted to, uh..."

"Oh," Isaac said, "yeah. Yeah, um. Uh--" he looked to Aeros apologetically, "Do you mind? Sorry, just... You know. Simon's my.... Well. Simon and I just wanted to talk."

Aeros' face reddened. He was embarrassed. He was leaving, though. But Isaac... didn't say we were dating. Which meant we weren't on the same page. Which meant he didn't... oh. 

Oh, s***. Was he... was he breaking up with me?

&lt;nowiki&gt;*****&lt;/nowiki&gt;
