The purple lizard was in her winged form – scarf, eyes, and crescent-shaped alpha mark glowing like Mira herself – fending off a small group of armored phantoms from three lizards who were crumpled behind her. With a jolt Bella recognized them: Raimu, the stand-in tech alpha; Vatra, a gatherer; and Halo, Audrey’s friend.

“Audrey!” Bella crashed through the line of phantoms that harassed her friend, sending several bat-shaped phantoms with wings sprawling onto the purple brick floor. “What’s going on? They’re alive, right?”

A shout carried itself from the interior of the throne room to the archway. The phantoms facing Audrey that hadn’t been knocked away floated in the opposite direction in a hurry like they were being summoned, leaving Audrey to wearily land on the floor again and fold her silvery wings.

“I don’t know,” Audrey rasped. “They’re breathing… ''ever'' so slightly. I tried taking Halo’s pulse and I don’t know much about medical business, but I’m pretty sure it’s slower than it’s supposed to be.”

Bella looked the three lizards over, then held up Halo’s wrist to check his pulse and realized she was right. This was something Millie had taught her. “They just fell down like this?”

“When we arrived at the phantom fortress, the Defenders who were marching in their rows said they just collapsed. Vatra and Halo blacked out right here, next to each other, but Raimu was further back. I had to move him up here so that they’d be easier to protect.”

By now most of the phantoms stood behind their general – the same purple-helmeted phantom who had chased the Defenders out of their Sarepia Forest home weeks ago. ''That’s definitely General Lido. But… why aren’t any of his troops fighting?''

In another minute, every last one of the phantoms were clustered behind General Lido, eyeing the Defenders with wary gazes that traveled around the massive room and dared them to attack. The Defenders just blinked at them in confusion with no clue what to expect from the phantoms’ sudden withdrawal from the battle.

“Leach,” said General Lido, his deep and weathered voice seeming to make the fortress rumble. “Complete the circuit.”

An eight-tentacled phantom shoved his way through the crowd. “Yes sir.” His voice was a giggly growl, hideous fangs visible beneath his determined eye. Leach raised his tentacles and let his cocky expression slip into a stony mask of concentration.

Halo twitched. Audrey leaped back, startled by the sudden movement, before Raimu and Vatra began twitching as well. All three of the inert lizards’ eyelids fluttered and limbs spasmed for a few seconds, Audrey and Bella slowly backing away from the arch, until each of them stood on their own, no longer helplessly scattered in the snow. Hissing like zombies they formed a short row, Raimu in the middle with a non-alpha at either side of him.

When the tech alpha opened his eyes, they were blaring purple.

==Chapter Thirty-Three - Free - Dragon’s POV==
Dragon couldn’t stay still while he crouched just above the phantom stairs. So many times a boomseed would crash close to the wall or a lizard’s cry would split the air and he had to restrain himself from checking to see if Bella was still okay. Not to mention he had no idea whether there were any guards behind him or not and, racked with paranoia, he kept glancing between the base of the stairs and the shadow-cloaked corridor behind his tail.

It took several minutes before anyone came, but once they did, Dragon couldn’t be more relieved. A hatchling, her scales like the colors of a strawberry donut, popped into view, followed soon after by a bigger black and neon-yellow lizard who hurried her up the stairs. “Quick, Cakepop, we can’t have anyone wonder why we’re staring!” the black lizard whispered loudly enough for anyone in a ten-foot radius to hear.

The two lizards clambered up the stairs and Dragon made room for them so that they could reach the top. Both were winded once they finally reached the flat ground of the hallway, heaving hard enough Dragon feared they might spit up a few of their higher-located organs.

“Hi!” said the bigger lizard with a grin. He extended his claws for Dragon to shake before remembering the situation he was in. “Oh, right. Sorry, sometimes I forget we’re in the midst of fighting a big bad army of octopus ghosts. My name’s Toxic, and this is Cakepop!”

“Friend and/or adopted sister,” Cakepop announced proudly. “Marlenka said we’re here to free Haylee, where’s she at?”

Dragon had mapped out the path from the stairwell to the room with the cell that contained the Defenders’ leader in his head. “Oh, uh, Dragon,” he introduced himself when he realized he’d been staring in silence. “I’m retracing the path right now. Follow me, it’s down this hall and then we need to make a right. No, left. I ''came'' from the right…”

What he could appreciate most was that the two lizards never audibly doubted him. The smaller one didn’t ''particularly'' take care to be light on her claws as she navigated the twists and turns of the prison wing, but otherwise they silently let Dragon lead, taking in the drab, repeating purpleness of the fortress halls without so much as a mumble.

“She should be right up here.” Dragon once again exhaled with relief once he recognized the spiral staircase that Skip and Julie had guffawed their way down earlier. Haylee’s cell was unguarded – but still very much secured. The leaf mark on the pastel lizard’s forehead flickered dimly in the absence of light.

“Toxic? Cakepop?” Her head lifted instantly once she recognized her friends’ scales. “Are- are the Defenders still fighting?”

Cakepop bounded up to the cell and smushed her claws against the bars. “Mhm! Everybody looks so cool zipping around with their wings and using their elemental powers! I’m kinda shocked no one’s had a head-first collision yet, they were moving so fast.”

“And they won’t as long as ''you’re'' not there,” Toxic teased her. Even Haylee in her worn-down state, dark bags under her eyes from lack of sleep since being dumped in this dark, untouched corner of the fortress, couldn’t help but chuckle.

Dragon stood back awkwardly until Toxic took a hurried step back. “Whoops, don’t let us get in the way of you working your magic, bro,” Toxic told him. He was about to pull Cakepop back when she didn’t move, but within his next blink the hatchling had summoned her tiny ice-colored wings and was doing loops in the air just above her friend’s reach.

Meanwhile, Dragon was hunched over the phantom lock, rotating it back and forth as he worked through the symbols. “I wish I could’ve gotten out on my own,” Haylee admitted. “That’d have been a lot more dignified. But this cell… it must be enchanted somehow. None of my alpha powers are working as long as I’m inside of it, so I can’t even, like, rip a vine through the ground to bust through the bars and make an exit that way.”

At last the lock clicked and the bars slid aside. Haylee stepped out – carefully at first, then surely once she was all the way out. “Thank you.” She looked Dragon in the eye and showed him her graciousness in a more earnest way than Julie ever had. He thought of all the distasteful things he’d done for the phantom that she had hardly even muttered a scrap of appreciation for. “I don’t know if I would ever have stopped worrying about my friends if I’d been stuck in here until the phantoms let me out for this big battle they’re supposed to be planning, if you know anything about that. What’s your name?”

Dragon’s heart rolled into his stomach. He knew exactly the battle Haylee was talking about – Julie’s own idea to punish and humiliate her in front of the entire ranks of the Defenders. He couldn’t decide whether it would be more horrible for her to find out who she’d be fighting now or once she inevitably returned to the scene of the battle, so he just skipped over her mention of it entirely. “My name’s Dragon. I used to work for the phantom who trapped you in here, but… I’m not with that alliance anymore. Also, I’m a friend of Bella’s.”

Haylee gasped. “I hope Bella’s still alright. I’m definitely going back to fight if there’s still fighting left to do, so if she’s doing fine then I owe her an apology. I should’ve listened to her when she warned me about the trap.”

“Now that you’re free, it doesn’t even ''matter'' that you got trapped,” said Cakepop. “I wanna see when you use your cool leafy magic on those icky-wicky phantoms! Please please?”

“Audrey and Marlenka did a great job leading us here on their own,” Toxic informed Haylee. “No one can replace you, of course, but it wasn’t total chaos heading out here is what I mean to say. Although, uh… three of them kinda sorta… passed out when we reached the fortress.”

Before Haylee could exclaim her concern, Cakepop whizzed past her face. “We’ll explain after,” she growled. A shimmer of diamond-colored sparkles rained down impatiently from her back. “Dragon, do you still remember the way out?”

Dragon nodded and dashed down the stairs, determined to waste no time. ''So Haylee’s an alpha… even though the real ones are still alive, I think. Maybe she’ll use her powers to win the battle before she even needs to humiliate herself with the one-on-one fight Julie’s laid out for her.''

When he reached the final stairwell descending into the throne room, the Defenders behind him suddenly thudded into his tail. “Eek! Hey, why’d we stop?” Cakepop squeaked. Dragon couldn’t even answer her.

Toxic tiptoed over to his side to spectate the battle before Dragon’s party just charged in, and he too stopped and pulled himself back out of sight.

“What? What is it?” Haylee sputtered.

“Raimu,” Toxic whispered. “And Vatra, and Halo. They were barely breathing outside when we left, b-but-”

Dragon shook his head in disbelief. “They’re being possessed by the phantoms.”

==Chapter Thirty-Four - Magic - Audrey's POV==
With the speed of molasses dripping down ice, Raimu, Vatra, and Halo – all three of their eyes wide and purple and as vacuous as a bottomless well – advanced toward Audrey and Bella. The sense of conflict in the two lizards’ eyes was clear enough from their disturbed expressions and the ambivalent tension with which they backed away.

''How am I supposed to fight them if they jump out at us?'' Audrey knew she wouldn’t hesitate to keep Bella from harm if the creatures attacked, but what if by fighting back she hurt the real lizards whose bodies were being controlled?

She couldn’t rip her eyes off of Halo. The teal-and-cream lizard looked no less eager to rip her to shreds at any sudden move than the other two, but seeing her friend completely submitted to the phantom Leach’s will destroyed her inside more than anything else ever had, except perhaps for witnessing Loafie get ripped away before her eyes. ''I couldn’t fight him. I could run… but then he would just attack someone else.''

Even the phantoms seemed to be holding their breath. In the corner of her eye Audrey saw the base of a stairwell that hosted Toxic, Cakepop, and- ''Haylee’s alive!'' Audrey couldn’t keep her tail from lashing with pure relief when she saw the pastel lizard safe and unharmed. The purple-eyed Raimu snapped his head toward her with a snarl.

“Pin them down!” Marlenka bellowed. The Defenders acted with speed, surging forward and attempting to dive onto the backs of their mind-controlled companions. But the three phantomized lizards weren’t fooled. Just as fast, they spun and trampled over whoever they could, lashing out with uncoordinated but dangerous movements of their sharpened claws. In seconds, several of the Defenders had scratches on their faces, yet none of them were able to push Halo, Vatra, or Raimu to the ground.

Haylee sprung to action. She leapt from the air, the feathers of her pale-blue angel wings splayed out, and waved her wrist around in the air with practiced movement. The brick floor of the throne room rumbled and Haylee landed at the joint where the stairs met the wall. There, Audrey stood in front of her with silver wings unfolded and guarded the other lizard with her wings while she focused her alpha magic on the ground.

Both of their alpha marks were a furiously bright white now. A patch of bricks in front of them jolted in the ground like they were about to come loose, quivering more and more violently as Haylee glared at it with increasing intensity. At last, a thick green vine burst through the bricks and wrapped around Halo, who squirmed and screamed in its grip.

“Don’t hurt him!” Audrey yelped.

Haylee shook her head. “No thorns. I just need to hold him still for a bit.”

Soon the vine was joined by half a dozen lookalike friends. The original one, the thickest of them, dropped Halo, while the others weaved themselves into a dome shape that trapped the lizard underneath. Its sides budged every now and then as he tried to escape, but the vines didn’t let him through.

“Forget that one,” General Lido growled to Leach, the phantom who was controlling the phantomized lizards. “Focus on the others.”

Vatra and Raimu seemed to move with greater acuity after the command was given. The green dome didn’t have big enough openings for Audrey to peek inside and catch a glance of Halo’s bright scales, but once the vines stopped moving, she guessed he returned to his former state of unconsciousness now that Leach no longer maneuvered his brain. ''Unconscious is much, much better than dead,'' Audrey thought to herself, although it was impossible for her to confirm he was even that with or without a clear view of her friend.

Cakepop shouted to distract Vatra, who whipped her head around to try and catch the source of the noise. While Vatra was off her guard Marlenka lunged forward and pushed her spine into the ground, where the orange lizard could only wriggle under the unbearable weight.

“Oh, please can we ''take care'' of her?” Cakepop snickered. Behind and beside her stood a faction of hatchlings her size, practically populous and mischievous-looking enough to be an army of their own.

Marlenka grinned at them with a sharp set of teeth and stepped off of Vatra’s back, keeping one arm on the nape of the lizard’s neck. Before she could try and get out from beneath the larger lizard’s grip, the hatchlings piled on and held her there while Marlenka lifted her arm. They hissed things like “Stay down!” and “One more move and I’ll give you swimmer’s ear!” until Vatra gave up trying to escape their hold at last.

Audrey was surprised to see the timid Wooyoung among the group, although he wasn’t quite partaking in the jeering. Light as a raindrop he scampered off of Vatra’s back and up to her pinned snout, then sprinkled his claws over her head. Microscopic globes of water appeared, dripping down tiny floating mint leaves that hovered between his arms, and landed just between her furious amethyst eyes. “Fight another day,” Wooyoung whispered. “Sleep now.”

When Vatra’s eyes fluttered closed and she appeared to do just that, Audrey couldn’t be prouder of him. She’d have gone over and congratulated him on his proficient use of magic, had one more phantomized lizard not still posed a threat to anyone who moved quickly.

Now Eira was in motion. The star on her forehead blazed like a true inhabitant of the night sky. Audrey had wondered what Eira’s powers as the magic alpha would look like when she used them – and now that curiosity was satiated as she watched waves of lavender and pink sparkles coalesce into a great orb from the other lizard’s claws.

Raimu leapt at Eira, his tongue hanging like a flag from the side of his mouth between two rows of pointed fangs, but she didn’t even slow down. Without pressing her claws to the shimmering sphere directly, she thrust her arms forward and the orb passed through him, encompassing him like a bubble so that he never landed. Snarl as he did, there was nothing he could do to break free of it.

“Stop,” General Lido murmured to Leach. The lesser phantom nodded hastily and just like that, Raimu’s eyes rolled back in his head and he collapsed inside the magic sphere.

The general cleared his throat and stepped forward on his seven tentacles. “Lizards.” He grumbled it like the name of a plague. “You are awaited by a destructive end. We are able to access the mind of this… ''replacement'' alpha-” He gestured toward where Raimu lay unmoving behind the sheen of Eira’s magic. “-and unleash his power for ourselves, a type that is unfathomable to your kind, to escape this hold and effectively explode all of you in the process. We are well aware it could cause great destruction to this very throne room, but also that its use poses a much greater danger to your fragile scales.

“Produce your leader and allow her to face the opponent that has been chosen of her – if she wins, you all may go free, but if she loses, she will be the first of every single Defender to die in this hall.”

The contempt and plain annoyance in his voice was lost on no one; despite his threatening words, he sounded more like a disgruntled soldier than the great general who had led several raids on the Defenders’ barracks back in Jamaa. Haylee’s eyes were as narrowed as slits of winter sky, but she stepped forward without an ounce of hesitation syruping her limbs. Before she could nobly submit herself to Lido’s plans, however, someone else came forward first. Audrey looked on with a gaping jaw as Bella marched in front of the general.

“You’re lying,” she growled at him with more venom than Audrey would ever have thought lay dormant inside of her. “A phantom could never harness alpha power for himself, even through a lizard host. Alpha magic comes from an animal’s own spirit and goodness, and a phantom would be able to gain neither. You couldn’t use his powers if your life depended on it.”

General Lido just stared at her with a singular eye whose pupil couldn’t seem to rest in one place.

Bella jerked one forearm forward and watched the helmeted phantom flinch. “You’re going to let Haylee and the Defenders go free or else we’ll have to fight our way out.”

The moment she finished speaking, Bella’s claws were enveloped with purple and pink light. General Lido staggered backward with a gasp, bursting into a puddle of shadow-colored sludge at the sight of it, while as she was lifted up into the air by seemingly nothing – ''nothing'', Audrey realized, except the might of Mira herself.

==Chapter Thirty-Five - Love - Bella's POV==
Stars passed through Bella’s mind, brighter than those of the bubble where Raimu was held. She was rising off of the bricks on her own, General Lido’s helmet clattering to the floor atop the dark goopy puddle that used to be him, and her phantom tentacle wings unfolded from her sides.

Memories flashed through her mind. Recent memories, like freeing herself from the phantom prison and outwitting the phantom general’s scare tactic, but memories from longer ago as well: wrenching herself from Dragon’s grip and escaping the fortress, befriending Millie and Haylee and Audrey, flying for the first time and feeling like she could never touch the ground again and still be happier than she had ever been.

''My wings don’t resemble phantoms because I’ll never be able to escape them. It’s because I overcame them.''

Her wings were spread wider than before when she lowered to the ground after no amount of time that she could know. Otherwise, she didn’t feel any different – except for something between her temples.

A voice flashed behind Bella’s bright green eyes that she had last heard in Sarepia Forest after the Defenders’ last battle with the phantoms. She was able to discern the words ''phantom alpha'' before Mira’s projected presence faded entirely.

Dead silence had the entire throne room in a chokehold. It took about half a minute before Haylee emerged once again from behind Audrey’s silver angel wings and stopped in front of Bella. “Mira has chosen the final lizard alpha,” she announced. “And speaking of alphas…”

Haylee swiveled toward the remaining phantom troops, who were just as starstruck as the Defenders at what they had just witnessed. “You said an opponent’s been ‘chosen of me’? Don’t leave me hanging. I’ll fight him for the freedom of the alphas ''and'' our owners.”

The phantoms remained speechless, their twitching eyes still fixed on Bella, the very sight of whom had caused their general to bust, but it wasn’t quiet for much longer. A lizard bounded through the archway from the snow-laden grassland outside into the throne room and strolled to the head of the phantom ranks. Bella realized she hadn’t seen this lizard at all during the battle, even though she was part of the Defenders.

Even though she was the sister of its functional leader.

Kaylee nearly blended right in with the dark, rugged fortress walls, but there was no mistaking the leafy green of the scales on her face or the furious blue of her eyes when she stared Haylee right in the pale face.

“Concerned about everyone getting their owners back all of a sudden, are you?” Kaylee snapped, inches from her sister’s nose. “Three years of training, hiding, moving out, and doing ''nothing.'' And ''now'' you care about the happy reunions you can only ever emptily promise every Defender in this room?”

Haylee said nothing.

The purple-and-green lizard began to circle her. “You act like this group was some great big plan to get Kendall back.” Her voice broke when she mentioned the name. ''Is that her and Haylee’s owner?'' Bella wondered, not sure what to do. ''Would Haylee want help? What’s going to happen?''

“But you’ve been so stupid for the ''entire'' time she’s been gone. You never even ''questioned'' how I could’ve found out the phantoms were building more prisons in Mt. Shiveer. ‘Rumors?’ Seriously?” The level of Kaylee’s voice had risen to a shrill yell. Haylee’s eyes only watered as she continued.

“I have been ''so'' fed up with you. I gave the phantoms our new location every single time we got ‘discovered’ in the past year, and you ''still'' never bothered to figure out why we were moving every other week or whenever.” Kaylee stopped pacing in a circle and looked her sister directly in the eye. “I would say that at least you’ve got the spirit to be a leader, ignoring how you oh-so-humbly refuse to call yourself one, but you don’t even have ''that''. The Defenders are supposed to be all about getting Kendall back – and all of ''their'' owners, you would probably lie and say – but you won’t even try that for three. Whole. Years.”

Marlenka stomped her way through the Defenders, her lips drawn back in a deep growl, like she was about to do to Kaylee what she’d once done to Bella – but Haylee lifted her claws. “Marlenka, don’t.”

The pastel lizard wiped a tear from her eye and finally met Kaylee’s smoldering gaze. “That’s ''not'' what the Defenders are all about. They’re about keeping Jamaa safe, teaching armadillo lizards to protect themselves because now that their owners are captured or gone they need to be able to look after their own tails. When you think of warriors with the power to hold back a phantom invasion, we lizards were never first to come to mind. And part of why I founded the Defenders of Jamaa is because I wanted to change that. Lizards have so much power and heart within them, and when we come together-”

“Come together to do ''what?''” Kaylee sliced her claws across Haylee’s cheek.

Haylee let the beads of red roll down it. “To keep the phantoms out of the lands we love, and once we had enough power, rescue our owners. I didn’t know how soon we’d be strong enough to get there, not until Mira began granting alpha power to us.”

Kaylee barked in her face, “And if little white symbols from a bird in the sky ''didn’t'' fall into your lap one after another?”

Her sister held her stare. “There’s no way I can say when we’d have been able to launch a raid like this if the true alphas hadn’t been captured. But just because we fight doesn’t mean we charge in and get ourselves killed if we don’t have the right amount of strength. Trust me, I have never lost sight of Kendall or wanting to get her back-”

“If that’s so true, then fight me.” Kaylee flexed her dark-green claws. “Fight me with all the care you have for Kendall and we’ll see who really loves her more.”

Haylee shook her head stiffly, keeping it high. “No, Kaylee. I’ll fight phantoms if I have to, but I won’t fight you.”

“The phantoms were right,” sneered Kaylee. “You act like you’re all big and tough and in charge of these lizards, but since they captured Haylee you’ve only gotten softer. Kendall would hate you. She would cry if she saw you now.”

“I think Kendall would cry harder knowing how much she tried to keep us safe before the phantoms took her away, and now you want to tear us apart like we were never sisters,” Haylee replied quietly.

Kaylee didn’t respond, only blinked. Bella couldn’t be sure from how far away it was, but the green-and-purple lizard’s eyes were glistening.

“Why are you working for them?” Haylee whispered. “They’re starving our owner in a cage so that you’ll rip me to shreds. Why do you think they’d give her back if you did that?”

“That’s ''exactly'' what they’ve promised me, actually,” Kaylee shot back.

Her sister shook her head again. “You want to do that so that you can go home together, without me, in the middle of a war and live a happy, peaceful life free of phantom threat? You think when they’re tossing their ruthless patrols into Crystal Sands and they see Kendall’s den among all the others, they’re going to make an effort to spare it just because you made a deal with them months ago?”

Kaylee finally couldn’t hold up her bristling exterior and broke down in a series of sobs. Haylee put her claws on her sister’s shoulder comfortingly, but withdrew when Kaylee shook them off her shoulder. Wooyoung tilted his head toward Haylee, offering to come over, and she nodded.

“She loves us equally, Kay,” Haylee said to her. “And she wouldn’t want this. We’re going home together as soon as I can get us both out of here.”

While Wooyoung soothed Kaylee with the same magic he had used to subdue Vatra, who was still snoozing beneath the Defender hatchlings who were using her like a bench, Julie arrived from the direction of the prison stairs. Skip was still at her side, snarling as usual at everyone except himself and the phantom he worked mindlessly for. “I wouldn’t be so sure.”

==Chapter Thirty-Six - United - Audrey's POV==
“You’ve all been very annoying throughout this whole war,” Julie snapped. She scowled at the phantom general’s helmet, laying on the floor with no head to fill it. “But I’m pretty sure the final straw has to be killing Lido before I could get my tentacles on him myself.”

Her eye began to shimmer with a pale purple light. Audrey recognized it: she was about to use her fire. “Good thing you spared enough of his idiot supporters that a good show’s still possible… and I suppose that makes that nitwit’s figurehead position as the king’s right-hand phantom definitively mine now. As a courtesy I’ll kill you lizards later once I’m done turning every last one of them into mush.”

Julie splayed out her tentacles, waving them in the air, and enormous bursts of purple fire exploded from them. The throne room was engulfed in seconds, her colorful blaze burning away tapestries and phantom flags, and roaring up to block all of the exits. Audrey dived away from the corner she was in to dodge a flame that now blocked the stairs to the prisons; even if she had wanted to escape by going deeper into the fortress, she couldn’t. No one could, no matter which exit they attempted to take. Some of the phantoms from Lido’s army tried to frantically put out the fires by throwing their sludge on it, but anything of the sort only made them grow higher.

“Get Vatra away from the arch!” Haylee ordered the hatchlings.

As soon as she finished the sentence she coughed hard and stumbled on her claws, but Marlenka caught her side. “C’mon,” growled the red-and-gold lizard. “Urgh, stupid impulsive pyromaniac phantom. If only I could fight her fire with mine.”

Audrey’s eyes widened. “Maybe that wouldn’t help anything, but… I think I have an idea.”

Raimu, his eyes now back to normal, scrambled over to them. “I just woke up,” he gasped. “Did… did I miss anything important?”

Over in the back, vaguely recognizable among the sea of phantoms who all resembled each other, was Leach – clearly too panicked, and likely too traumatized, to try taking control of Raimu or the other two phantomized lizards again.

“Raimu,” Audrey addressed him. “Did the book say anything about what happens when the alphas combine their power?”

The older lizard appeared frustrated as he racked his mind. “I can’t remember much from that book at all, but… I think I once heard that if all six alphas focus their magic together, it can briefly create a force of pan-elemental purity.”

“Brief is all we need. You three stay here – I need to find Eira and Bella.”

Bella heard Audrey and dived down herself. “Don’t fly,” Bella advised her with a cough. “The smoke’s much worse up there. What do we need to do?”

Just as Audrey had finished explaining her plan to the other four alphas, Eira came over on her own and leapt right into Raimu’s arms. She kissed him on the head, right on his gear-shaped alpha mark, while he sobbed with relief into her shoulder. Audrey wished she could let them stay there like that for as long as they wanted, but Julie’s fire was growing and the smoke that came from it only thickened.

“I’m so sorry to interrupt you,” said Audrey.

Eira shook herself out. “No matter. There’s plenty of time for the two of us once we return home.”

The purple-and-silver lizard admired her confidence that they’d be able to escape for sure. “Alright. We need to summon as much power – alpha power – as possible, starting with you, Eira. So Eira makes an orb, a reasonable size to contain five other forces of magic inside, and then each of us contribute to it by using our own powers. Once there’s enough inside the orb, we can whirl it around the room, put out the fires, and take out Julie.”

“I doubt Julie’s fire is normal fire,” Raimu said, nodding in approval of Audrey’s plan. “Like all phantom magic, it’s a source that comes from pure hatred and sadness. Even if there was water within miles of this Mira-cursed fortress, a force of purity may be the only thing that can put it out. Luckily we don’t have to waste our time trying the former.”

He rose to his claws, unbalanced from what Audrey guessed was a mix of the thickening smoke and being the one in control of his own legs again. “Prepare yourselves,” Eira told the others through gritted teeth. From her extended palms, sparkles twinkled and grew larger, swirling with one another until it created an orb as large as any of the lizards’ heads.

Marlenka added her magic first. An orange beam shot out from her sun-shaped alpha mark, followed by a dark-blue beam from Bella’s mark, which Audrey realized resembled an eye now that she could see it up close. Raimu was nearly knocked to the floor again by a particularly nasty cough, but Audrey helped him get up and aim his golden wave of power while Eira was busy keeping the orb intact with her own sheer focus.

Then it was Audrey’s turn. Purple light – not pale and sickly like the color of Julie’s flame, but the bright courageous shade of Liza the panda alpha’s eyes – flashed out of her moon-shaped mark, adding a layer to the sloshing magic inside the sphere that looked like liquid tanzanite. Finally Haylee took her place in the semicircle of lizard alphas and let green glow out from her leaf mark, filling Eira’s sparkling bubble so that it almost looked like a rainbow marble made by Mira’s wings.

“I need all of your help in order to maneuver it around the throne room,” Eira said, her voice hoarse from inhaling the smoke. “Counterclockwise. Go!”

With the pure force of their minds, the six lizard alphas blasted the orb forward and swept it through Julie’s fires, each one dying instantly when touched by the magic. Audrey could only suppress a cheer as the fires dissipated one by one all throughout the room, the smoke generated by each one evaporating to clean air that flowed through her lungs and felt as rejuvenating as a breath of new life.

However, as it collected fire, the orb shrank and shrank. It just barely made it all the way through the throne room, disappearing into nothingness before it could even tap Julie where she stood in front of the throne.

“So you want me to turn ''your'' sorry scales to ashes too?” Julie screeched at them. Her deep angered frown shifted into an ugly grin. “Well, that’ll be just fine. Gosh, won’t the king be proud to get ''that'' as a little present for… what do you idiots call it? The Jamaally-days?”

The brick floor shuddered as violently as if a volcano had erupted right on top of it. The bowl-like shape of the phantom king, his head topped with spikes that ringed around him like a crown, appeared on the throne in a puff of darkness and narrowed his eye at Julie. “Try to destroy ''my'' throne room, did you?” he rumbled. “What a shame. You had such promise, Julie.”

“I did it to catch those vermin! And I have!” Julie, outraged, flailed one tentacle at the wide-eyed Defenders, who were very much not caught. “I brought the whole stupid group here, just like you asked of Lido’s entire army, but they never came back with ''any'', did they?”

“A disappointment from both of you. I should not be surprised.”

The phantom king slowly hovered higher in the air, sweeping his tentacles underneath himself before slowly extending them out again. Audrey watched as a circle of purple energy formed and intensified underneath him, but all she knew was she didn’t want to be inside of it. Julie forgot that she ''was'' within the circle’s bounds until the king slammed down in front of her.

Julie the phantom was dead.

==Chapter Thirty-Seven - Unshackled - Bella's POV==
Bella had seen the phantom king slam before. It was his signature tactic in combat, the famous move that decimated even the most courageous animals who ventured inside the phantom hives. Although he hadn’t fought any battles himself in quite a long time, Bella still imagined the receiving end of such a blow was not too painless.

Like he always did after slamming, the king became dizzy – but the second he realized where he was, vulnerable and in a room full of lizards that had just kicked his army’s behinds, he vanished in a swirling black plume. Now only Skip the lizard remained, quivering in the corner like a twig on a windy winter day.

Haylee stepped up to him once she was sure the king was gone. “Take us to the prisons and set the alphas and our owners free,” she ordered him.

“''Now'', you floppy fish,” Marlenka added with much less noble composure, “or we’ll break in there ourselves and feed your bones to Greely.”

Skip didn’t need to be told twice. Haylee ordered the Defenders to stay in the throne room while she, Marlenka, Bella, and Audrey ascended the prison wing until, at last, they arrived at what Bella identified as the highest cell on this side of the fortress: the miserable place where the alphas were being held.

Of the six cells in the room, all but one of them were full. There stood five of the alphas, covered in grime and pushed up against the bars to be as far away as possible – just a few feet, that is – from buckets of disgusting contents Bella didn’t dare take a peek at. When they saw the lizards their eyes went wide as individual moons; Peck nearly tripped over herself trying to get as close a view of them as possible, made worse by the purple ribbons tied around her hind paws.

“Uh, hi,” Audrey said awkwardly. “We’re here to rescue you… and stuff.”

“No way! Rescuers! OMG!!” Peck squealed. Her pink nose poked through the silver bars and sniffed at them. “Oh my wow, Mira and Zios heard us. GUYS! Mira and Zios ''heard'' us! Look at their foreheads!”

Self-conscious but sparing with words in the presence of five of Jamaa’s greatest heroes, Bella showed the others how to open the phantom locks while the former alphas marveled at their marks.

“Thank you.” Sir Gilbert nodded his heavy head once Audrey opened his lock. “Your courage will not be forgotten.”

Greely was more wary as he stepped out of his own cell. “Will we need to fight our way out?”

“We shouldn’t have to,” Haylee told him with a shake of her head. “It’s a long story, and if you want to hear it I’ll save it for when we’re all safe and out of here – but first, where’s Liza?”

As soon as he was free, Cosmo stretched and crawled over, his leaf skirt rumpled from weeks of endless sitting. “They kept her in a separate cell. She should be somewhere down there.” Then he grinned warmly at them. “Thanks for setting us free. Wow, lizard alphas! That’s gotta be the first time since… since…”

“Since Baylee,” Audrey volunteered. She smiled too.

Luckily, they didn’t have to go far to find Liza’s cell. The panda gasped lightly when she turned around, instantly locking eyes with Audrey, whose moon mark was only glowing brighter.

“Are you… the alphas?” Liza asked.

“Three of them,” explained Marlenka. “The others are resting or something, they’re alright. Ish.”

Audrey opened Liza’s lock. The bars growled against the stone mechanism as they were drawn aside, but otherwise all was silent. The two moon alphas simply stared at each other. Bella wondered if Audrey was sending messages to the panda alpha just by looking at her – there were so many words floating in her eyes when Bella turned to see them.

“I’m Audrey,” the lizard introduced herself. “I think… I think I’m supposed to be you. The moon alpha.”

A couple seconds later, Liza shook her head with a friendly look. “That can’t be right,” she said. “''I'' think you’re supposed to be Audrey the moon alpha.”

Audrey leapt at the panda in a hug, and Liza embraced her right back before setting the smaller creature back down on the prison floor. “Alright, everyone,” Haylee announced. “Let’s head on down before any more phantoms come as backup. Prepare yourselves, alphas… I don’t know if you’ve met many of the Defenders before, but they’ve been growing up with stories about you and idolizing you all their lives, so don’t be too surprised if they’re not all completely calm.”

About halfway back to the throne room, Graham stood up straighter suddenly. “Uh, guys? What’s gonna happen to our stuff that the phantoms confiscated?”

The other alphas stopped so suddenly they nearly started a domino chain. A few of them exchanged glances, and then Liza finally said, “Cameras are pretty replaceable.”

“Who says I only needed that specific paintbrush?” Peck shrugged.

“I can always just get another enchanted candle-and-horn staff forged with the magic of Mira herself,” Cosmo added happily. The others murmured their agreement.

Finally they were about to descend into the throne room when Haylee stood in their way. “Bella, would you and Dragon mind coming with me to handle the cells where they’re holding all of our owners?” She dropped her voice and gazed up apologetically at the six former alphas. “I’m… not totally sure I want to be there when the Defenders… erm, show you their gratitude.”

Audrey laughed, and the dying chatter of the Defenders in the next room finally went silent. “Don’t worry, Marlenka and I will handle them. There’s a whole story the alphas have got to hear, you know.”

“I didn’t agree to that,” Marlenka yelped. “Dibs on not being the one to take care of it if the hatchlings get out of hand. These muscles can only take so much, ya know.”

“I’ll come with you, Haylee. Dragon probably won’t mind, either; he’s not really the best in social situations. Especially with a hundred lizards who were prepared to kill him a day ago.” Bella poked her head out from the entrance to the throne room. Countless pairs of colorful eyes blinked back at her, but Dragon understood he was wanted and made his way over.

Then the alphas finally emerged from the stairwell, marveling at the wild sea of lizards who stared at them. Dragon, Bella, and Haylee managed to disappear just before the throne room erupted into a zoo.

==Chapter Thirty-Eight - Stars - Audrey's POV==
The Defenders were having the time of their lives washing in the streams near the Jamaa Township barracks, washing the clean water gray with all the grime their bodies had accumulated in the last day and a half. The river hadn’t frozen over yet, but a plunge into it was as shockingly icy as if it should’ve gone solid a month ago.

The six former alphas had decided to wait until they were in the safety and comfort of the bunker area to hear what had gone down. Audrey enjoyed hearing Halo and Raimu and Bella and Dragon cut in to add their own versions of the story or details that were taking place behind the scenes.

The former alphas were entertained, too – the first thing Peck and Cosmo did when returning to Jamaa Township after weeks in the phantom prison was run into Jam Mart Clothing and ask the deer at the drink station if they had any jumbo marshmallows for sale. Now they munched together as the sky began to flush pink and the steady snowfall eased into flurries being tossed between the trees.

Behind Audrey and Halo, who sat side by side, Loafie listened to the lizards telling their tales with a quiet sort of pride. By her were Panda and Kendall, whom she had come to befriend during their time locked up in the same cell, all of them taking in the fresh, snowy air of the town tinged with the smell of bonfire and letting it soothe their souls.

“I hardly have the words to describe how incredible I find your journey,” Sir Gilbert told the lizard alphas once the story had dissolved into separate chattering conversations. “You have proven something to a lot of us, Defenders of Jamaa. Perhaps you can be as mighty as a tiger trooper and no taller than its knee.”

“Yeah!” Peck bounded over the bonfire and landed in front of the lizards with an outstretched palm. “Little people power!!” They began smacking their claws against her paw all the way down the circle while a tiny orange flame gasped for air at the tip of her tail. ''Boy, do I miss normal fire,'' Audrey thought graciously.

Somewhere across from Audrey, the fire blurring the air and obscuring each other’s faces, Bella sat beside Dragon. Finally Audrey had recognized him as the lizard she tackled during the Mt. Shiveer mission, but after hearing everything that he – and Bella – had to say about himself, she believed that he had a good heart and could change. She knew he wanted to; before the Defenders had even left the fortress he had asked Haylee if he could join the group and learn to fight the lizard way.

Bella had also gotten a chance to explain herself.'' I’m glad that I never totally doubted her,'' Audrey thought to herself. ''She just wanted to see her friend again. And she saved us. It’s been tough trying to convince Marlenka to be open-minded and considerate when it comes to other lizards’ situations, but I can see that she wants to try that too.''

At some point, Bella got swept out of the rest of the conversation by Greely, who rested on his blue paws near her and Dragon and spoke to them in a hushed voice. Audrey couldn’t hear most of it, but the two lizards appeared to be at ease, and she heard the wolf ask more than one question about the phantoms and their fortress.

At last the sky was deep and speckled with glinting dots that were difficult to tell apart from the flakes that still whirled in the night breeze. Haylee was the one to ask the question that all of the Defenders had been thinking about since the former alphas had first been freed: “What happens now? Will Mira grant you your powers back?”

Liza glanced at Sir Gilbert glanced at Greely glanced at Peck glanced at Cosmo glanced at Graham. “Well, do you six ''want ''to give up your powers?” Liza asked.

“You guys have been really cool with them,” Graham added. “You, ah, know how to use them responsibly. Yes.”

“Mira ''clearly ''made the right choice!” Peck agreed with enthusiasm.

It was the lizard alphas’ turn to exchange glances. “Do you mean you no longer want your powers returned to you?” Eira asked Liza.

“I have fought alongside enough valiant animals – tigers, lizards, and otherwise – to know that you don’t need alpha power to protect Jamaa.” Sir Gilbert bowed his head before the lizards. “As long as I can continue doing what I love and leading the tiger troopers in battle, it does not matter to me.”

“I’d be able to focus more on my work,” Graham pointed out. “I’ve gotten a little bit of, ah, separation anxiety from not being able to work on my latest high-tech hat rack project.”

Greely gave a chuckle so deep it sounded more like the rumble of a volcano. “I was planning on resigning soon anyway.” Peck’s gasp was as dramatic as if someone had shoved a vacuum into her windpipe and sucked out every last molecule of the air inside it.

“We’d be happy to carry on the alpha responsibility with Mira’s approval,” Audrey said. Her verbena-colored eyes scanned the clearing and she couldn’t help but smile. “More than that. We’d be honored.”

She could’ve sworn that the bonfire at the heart of the gathered Defenders flickered, for just a splintered shard of a second, into a pair of heron wings.


When Kendall had offered to adopt Bella and Dragon, they couldn’t have been more ecstatic. Audrey had seen Dragon smile on a couple occasions once he sat by the bonfire with Bella, finally able to be warm and away from the phantoms for the first time in his whole life, but that next morning he was full-on grinning while Marlenka helped him summon his wings.

“We want to know what it’s like to be loved by an owner,” Bella explained to Audrey when she was giving the news. “And who better to live with than Haylee? Dragon also wants to learn healing magic, and Haylee happens to know some. He wants to be there to help Kaylee get better too.”

“That’s beyond amazing!” Audrey hugged her friend. The iridescent threads of Mira’s scarf brushed under her chin. “How ''is ''Kaylee?”

Wooyoung, who had been whizzing about the air so fast Audrey could hardly even see him before that moment, landed in front of her and pushed his nose into her arm. “She’s resting,” the small hatchling informed her in a muffled voice. “She said… she forgives Haylee. And Haylee forgives her too.”

“I hope she means it,” said Bella.

Audrey nodded and rested her head on Wooyoung’s. “Me too. She has the capacity to. I think the ability to forgive is inside everyone, even if it’s locked away. The key for each is just shaped differently.”


Audrey got the chance to apologize to Halo right before he went to sleep that night. “I should’ve paid more attention to you,” she said. “You’re my friend, Halo. I never meant to replace you.”

Halo sneezed and his cream tail-tip drifted off the top of his nose. “No, it’s okay, Audrey. I shouldn’t have acted like I was the only friend you were allowed to have.”

“I saw that you made a friend too. Vatra, right?”

“Yeah, Vatra! She’s really cool. Our first session hunting for leaves got a little… interrupted… but I think I wanna be a gatherer, and she wants to show me how.” Halo frowned. “Do we ''need ''gatherers anymore? Now that everyone’s owners are free, what’s gonna happen to the Defenders?”

A few paces away, the tunnel to the bunker was blushing gold with the artificial light coming from underneath. The ends of Audrey’s silvery scarf drifted toward it in the light breeze with the weight of feathers. “Well, a lot of the Defenders ''are ''gonna go home now that they’ve been reunited. But Haylee says the group’s got enough members to remain intact, and Kendall and some of the other owners want to stay as helpers and travel with the group.”

She glanced down at Halo. His red x-shaped eyes were just barely open. “Actually, Loafie wanted me to ask you in the morning since she was interested in staying too. Do ''you ''still want to be a Defender?”

Halo thought about it for a moment. Then his eyes fully closed. “If we can bring the pillows from home.”

Audrey snorted and curled up next to him. Even in near-sleep the moon mark on her forehead was softly glowing like the globe in the sky. Fields of dazzling stars twinkled overhead, watching the lizards sleep, the bustle of the next-door town ever slowing as she slipped into a peaceful slumber, dreaming about her feathered wings carrying her so high, so far into the open sky that the stars winked up at ''her''.

'''THE END'''

==Credits==
*Written by [[User:Teddbeary|Teddbeary]] from 10/5/2023 to 12/28/2023.
*Cover drawn by [[User:Teddbeary|Teddbeary]].
**The lizards on the cover are deliberately drawn similarly to [[User:Loafie|Loafie]]’s style because they created the original Defenders of Jamaa.

==Trivia==
*The story is based on [https://ajpw-lizard.fandom.com/wiki/Defenders_of_Jamaa_~_Loafie Defenders of Jamaa], a story originally written by [[User:Loafie|Loafie]], and shares many of its initial plot and world elements.
*On the cover, Bella was mistakenly given the colors of Kaguri, a character from the original Defenders of Jamaa who wasn't carried over into this remake. The error was caused as a result of a lack of full context and information during the compiling process before the remake was written.

      <comment>Created page with "== Chapter 1: A normal day (or not) == Today i woke up on animal jam witch seemed normal until i realized that... I WAS IN A PHANTOM CELL!?! I started to panic and thought 'its probally all just a dream... Right?  After what i thought was a few hours or maybe minuets, a phantom guard came up to my cell and said in a deep gurgle sounding voice "The phantom prince would like to see you."   TO BE CONTINUED IN PART 2"</comment>
      <origin>258893</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="416" sha1="dneirljcw8c3mli3l7sch8q6pfut2vi" xml:space="preserve">== Chapter 1: A normal day (or not) ==
Today i woke up on animal jam witch seemed normal until i realized that... I WAS IN A PHANTOM CELL!?! I started to panic and thought 'its probally all just a dream... Right?

After what i thought was a few hours or maybe minuets, a phantom guard came up to my cell and said in a deep gurgle sounding voice "The phantom prince would like to see you."


TO BE CONTINUED IN PART 2</text>

    <title>The Phantom Bride</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162956</id>
    <revision>

      <parentid>259357</parentid>

      </contributor>
      <comment>Completely cutting the normal animals, I can’t find any inspiration for a single chapter about them, but they will appear in Interweaving!</comment>
      <origin>259364</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="3914" sha1="l0ivtmnmh463nw8jux22lcqj320qwkk" xml:space="preserve">Oof…been a while since I’ve been back on the wiki, huh? But don’t worry, I’ll post more AJ related things here now!

'''Warning!: Blood, Gore, Physical (and possibly more than that °~°) Abuse'''

Inspired by Good VS Evil, Royalty and Experiment RPs!

==Blurb==
Precious has been stuck in the Phantom Kingdom’s Laboratories for months now, hoping someone could call the alphas for help…

Except ever since Greely resigned, the alphas are being pure stupid.

The Phantom King, Emperor Fang is trying to make Precious the next Phantom Queen, with some erm…sacrifices to make.

Who will win? Will Precious be free?

== Characters ==
Precious/Shanshuo

Jade

Ai

Keke

Chichi

Wing

Lik Lik

Dong Tian

Songshu

Ting

Emperor Fang

==Chapter 1 Kidnapped by Phantoms==
June 203X

It’s been a while,

Precious was trapped here for ages already.

She was kidnapped, somehow,

by the phantoms she had found.

They have taken her to a lab,

filled with monstrosities she’s never seen.

She knocked on the cages,

screamed in pain.

The phantoms didn’t notice her a lot,

until one day.

The Phantom King,

came and looked at her in the eye.

”She shall be my queen.” He said.

”Make her like a phantom, please.”

And they did, injecting her with medicine.

She twisted and turned,

crying in pain.

The phantom’s venom is lurking,

within her blood.

Why did he chose her,

For this strange game?

== Chapter 2 War Refugees ==
October 202X

It was the War of the Phantoms,

The alphas aren’t doing well after Greely resigned recently,

animals are suffering from their injuries.

The phantoms too.

A young fox was looking for shelter in the midst of the war,

she had lost her entire family to it.

There she saw, a young phantom.

She didn’t scream, she didn’t run.

”You’re hurt.”

It raised its head.

”Don’t worry, I don’t meant any harm.”

She padded towards it.

They sat together,

by the fire the phantom made.


She remembered now,

he was the phantom she met,

Whom she had spared his life.

He is the King.

== Chapter 3 The Wedding ==
31 October 203X

What has that little phantom she met become?

An innocent to a heartless soul?

She thought as she continued to lie on her bed.

”Ai! Jade! Can you come here? I can’t find the dress!” One of the phantom maids squealed.

She looked up. Two more phantoms, one ghostly white and the other night blue.

”You sure Emperor Fang chose her? Why does she look…so different?”

”Same, perhaps he likes her? I don’t know!”

She was then forcefully pulled out of bed.

”C’mon! We have to make sure the bride dress fits! We’ve never seen anything…that’s not round and with tentacles!”

The moment she wore it, her vision went hazy.

The longer she spent in that gown, the more phantom-like she grew.

First her fur went from orange-brown to purple, then tentacles,

then…

she couldn’t even recognise herself from the mirror.


The wedding, it’s time.

”Emperor Fang, do you wish to take erm…” The priest halted, staring at her.

”Shanshuo, that will be her name in the Phantom Kingdom.”

”I shall call you husband and wife, you may now kiss the bride!”

She stepped back, ”I…don’t belong here…”

”…” The crowd went from cheering to silent.

”For years…I have been trying to convert you animals to phantoms, it all started from when I met you. I thought the only way to make peace is to make animals…like us…” He muttered out of the blue.

His gaze went sorrowful, Precious’s pity for him gave in.

And she went for a smack on the lips.

”I don’t care what you want from me, but all these years since we went part, I’ve still remembered you. Just please don’t leave me in a cage next time.”

And from then on, she became the Phantom Queen, Shanshuo.

== Chapter 4 ~Saviour~ ==
203X December

      <text bytes="989" sha1="9vs3l7u7ke6b2x3rg5yyjvybtgoh0eb" xml:space="preserve">'''Please note that ''Count on Us'' is not intended for kids. It includes violence, abuse, death, and lots of mental health issues. If you are sensitive to these things, please do not read this. There might be other things you’re interested in!'''

==Blurb==
As three friends drift apart in Sarepia High, would their friendship before over? Can they save it before it’s too late?

==Characters==
'''Names aren’t final! Please expect constant changes :/'''

===The Silvers===
Whisker

Viola

===The Blacks===
Shadow

Rocky

===The Browns===
Cynthia

Ace

===Others===
Gem

==Chapter Overview==

===Chapter 1===
Whisker is going to school as normal and meets her friends Cynthia and Gem at their usual spot. However, Gem, being the one who can't keep secrets, accidentally spills some tea. On the other hand, Shadow is also experiencing a few difficulties at home...

== Chapter 1 Boyfriends?! Isn’t That Not Allowed?! ==
[[Category:Romance]]
[[Category:Drama]]
[[Category:Suspense]]</text>
      <sha1>9vs3l7u7ke6b2x3rg5yyjvybtgoh0eb</sha1>
    </revision>
  </page>
  <page>
    <title>Interweaving</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162961</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259366</id>
      <parentid>259365</parentid>
      <timestamp>2023-12-14T12:50:33Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>RosyBecca54</username>
        <id>53430140</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>259366</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="1946" sha1="a2ihfq0hltucrhinjz7ldt77s8efhj8" xml:space="preserve">== Blurb ==
A troubled teen at school,

a wild carefree fox, spying in a bunch of wolves’ pack,

What does Miki’s life have in store for us?

== Characters ==
Miki

Summer

Jake

Iorek

Frosty

Dusty

Nanook

Ash

Nixie

Tahoe

Jett

Denver

Cinder

Spaz

Misty
== Log 1 ~School~ ==
January 2019

Dear Diary,

Hi, I am Miki, I don’t have much to say about myself,

but I do have a friend, Bates, who always help me with my stuff.

Oh did I mention Anna, his girlfriend, aka the start of my chaos?

My life has been tortured from start to end,

And I’ll tell you from the beginning,

I know, not everything is fine, but it’s not bad.

Don’t worry, I’ll see you later.

== Log 2 ~Wild~ ==
I woke up,

it’s a sunny Sunday,

Wait! why am I an artic fox???

I ran out of the den, someone is waiting.

From the star on his head, and the stuff I know,

he’s the alpha.

He told me to kill a pack, which is harming us.

Us? What do you mean?

He called me bird-brain for that.

Is there something wrong?

I later swapped places with another wolf.

What should I do to get in that pack the alpha told me to kill?

Massacre?

One by one?

Spy?

Oh yes! Spy! That should do it!

I offered to be in the pack of theirs.

And I was introduced to the alpha…

That’s it.

That was all I remembered.

== Log 3 ~School~ ==
Was this a dream?

All that haze?

I’m back at my chaotic school again.

But hey, ever since Bates left me, I got some new friends!

After meeting them at the lunch table near the trash, that is.

Summer, Jake, Iorek and Frosty.

I told them about my strange dream.

Iorek told me a legend in Jamaa:

Wolfchangers.

During the day, they’re fine. At night, they’re wolves, or foxes, sent to another place.

One problem, those worlds appears as dreams, but they can affect Jamaa, since the wolves also live there.

Maybe there’s more wolfchangers like me? I wonder if the dream is true or not.

== Log 4 ~Wild~ ==</text>
      <sha1>a2ihfq0hltucrhinjz7ldt77s8efhj8</sha1>

    <title>The Hated Child</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>162962</id>

      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="4250" sha1="pehahhz494pix8aeot213qr5xv5be9c" xml:space="preserve">[[Category:Trollfics]]
[[Category:Comedy]]
I have brought the Gacha Life cliche, no one can stop me now-

== Characters ==
Elina

Wynter “Wyn”

Mei Lee

Riley

Target

== Episode 1 The Life of A Very VERY Sad Artic Fox ==
Elina: Another day of school, another day of getting bullied by my sister, again

Wyn: Time to see that loser again. Ugh! Out of my way!

Elina: It’s my turn!

Wyn: I’m the younger one here! *slaps Elina*

(Wyn walks down the stairs in a flower crown, while Elina came with a simple cape around her.)

(Mom brings two plates, one pretty and the other half-broken.)

Mom: Here you go.

(Wyn receives a milkshake, Elina has mouldy pizza.)

Mom: Eli, eat this or you’ll get grounded.

(Elina throws the pizza unnoticed.)

Wyn: Elina threw up, Mom! I think it’s the mould!

Mom: Ok, only because of the mould!

School.

Wyn: Don’t try to embarrass me with your ugliness! *walks towards two birds* HI GIRLSSSS-

Birds: OH MY GOSSSSHHHHHH HIIIIIII-

meanwhile,

Elina: Mom gave me mouldy pizza…

Mei Lee/Average Greely Fangirl: What on Jamaa’s name is your mom so-

Riley: *covers Mei Lee’s mouth* We have children here playing this game, what did I say about swearing?!

Elina: Welp, let’s just hope I’ll get a job and move out of the house within these few years.

&lt;nowiki&gt;*&lt;/nowiki&gt;Bullies (with Wyn) pops out of nowhere*

Riley: Is that your sister?

Elina: Y E S

Mei Lee: Oh *BEEEEP*

Elina: Yup, the jerks trying to show off their popularity.

Wyn: I swear I’ll tear you down to itty bitty pixels if you don’t shut your mouth up! Courtney! Jesse!

Elina: I’ve had enough of you trying to be a try hard and yeet us on walls everyday just to humiliate us!

Wyn: WHAT-

Elina: I said that.

&lt;nowiki&gt;*&lt;/nowiki&gt;Target pops up*

Target: What did I say about your anger issues, Wynter?!

Wyn: But she’s the-

Target: Enough! DETENTION FOR YOUR CLIQUE!!!

Wyn: NNNOOOOOOO!!!! I THOUGHT YOU LOVED MEEEEEE!!!!!

After school,

Mei Lee: Well that was close.

Riley: Same.

&lt;nowiki&gt;*&lt;/nowiki&gt;B I R D S*

Riley: Mei?

Mei Lee: Yes?

Riley: There’s bird poop-

Mei Lee: OH *BEEEP*

== Episode 2 Grades &amp; Garbage ==
Mom: Darling Wynnie, you have a B+! You’ll have the greatest scores in no time!

(Wynter gives out this mischievous grin.)

Mom: ELINA!! WHAT DID I SAY ABOUT GETTING A B+?! YOU NEED TO DO BETTER!

Elina: But-

Mom: YOU’RE GROUNDED!

Elina: I’m already grounded for my entire life-

Mom: SIX MONTHS!

Elina: UGH! I HAVE THE SAME GRADES AS HER!!! WHY DO YOU HAVE SUCH HIGH EXPECTATIONS ON ME?!?!

Mom: GET. TO. YOUR. ROOM. NOW!!!

(Elina storms off.)

Wynter: …don’t you think-

Mom: Don’t you talk to your lovely mom this way about your trashy sister!

Wynter: Eh, fine. Whatever.

Mom: You’ll have cake for dinner! And Elina will have biscuits, or she’ll be grounded again.

Later,

(Elina starts choking somehow.)

Wynter: …you can handle this, I’ll leave.

Elina: *loud wheeze*

Wynter: *smacks her on the back* There, saving your life like usual.

Later again,

Mom: Sweetie, go do your homework, and you trash can, clean the room!

Elina: That’s what you call me every time! What do you expect? A Cinderella-type Mary Sue?

Mom: Go clean the chimneys! You dirty mouth! And darling, have this!

(Wynter receives a jewellery box, she peeks inside.)

Wynter: EEEEEEEE A DIAMOND NECKLACEEEEE!!!!

Mom: And you!

(Elina gets scraps of paper.)

Elina: You sure they’re books?

Mom: SHUT UP!!!

(Elina leaves again.)

Wynter: You sure I deserve all this, Mom? Eli is just the same as me and you-

Mom: What did I say about that trash can?!?!

Wynter: Sorry. But I’m no fairytale princess! Eli-

Mom: (leaves server)

Wynter: …

Elina’s room

Elina: Oh, you again. And you’re gonna call me “stupid big fat loner dummy stupidity dumb sister who does nothing at all”?

Wynter: That’s because Mom told me to.

Elina: WHAT?!

Wynter: It’s the birds or Mom’s fault, you’re my sister -and I would never do such a thing! You know I helped you at dinner!

Elina: (runs out of room and looks down the stairs for Mom) Oh, she left, good. I accept your apology, or else that wouldn’t make sense. For some reason I just have to be a Mary Sue, but just this once.</text>

    <title>Jewel Tiers</title>

      <text bytes="9034" sha1="2crhpa0pzppber8ridd6vje6cgu611a" xml:space="preserve">A story about Jewel Tiers on pets, and how stupid they actually are &gt;:/

''Based off the series The Neon Common by Mrs. Wolfy on Adopt Me!''

== Blurb ==
Enigma the grey tabby, unlike any of her owners’ pets, simply has no tier! Rainbow and Racer, the sugar glider and lizard duo are harassing her! Will Enigma find her powers and finally gain her own Jewel Tier?

(For the sake of convenience, pets have tiers according to their players’ exp, magic and such things, not by literally merging them-)

== Chapter 1 ==
“GUYS I GOT A NEW PETTT!!!”

A young bunny’s shriek echoed the room, she ran in, holding a tabby in her paws.

”Kids, this is Enigma, our youngest daughter’s first pet! Be nice to her, she is pretty shy!” A taller ladylike bunny hopped in.

The youngest bunny jumped in joy, Enigma in her arms. They put her on the floor with some kibbles before the rest of the family leaves the room.

”Eww! She’s a Non-Jewel!”

“Look at her! She has no glowing trail! No red, no green, nothing!”

”Jewel-less?! YUCK!”

The bunny heard that, “Be nice to my first pet! You’re only here because of my older siblings!”

”Yeah yeah, Hopkins. Can you leave us?” The sugar glider moaned.

The petite grey tabby slowly climbed herself up the beds for a nap. A lizard threw her off.

”Do we really need to have a Jewel-less on our fancy beds?!”

“I said no pushing!” The bunny picked the poor kitten up.

”Sorry!”

”Mama! Can we take them to the pool?”

”Of course!” The mother shouted in the living room.

At the pool, Enigma trembled, she never made a single sound other than that tiny screech from earlier.

A highland cow smirked, “Guys, I have something to show you! Cannonball-”

And SPLASH!

”ENI!!” Cried the bunny.

”Spike! What did I say about manners?!” The father was mad, “Hopsy dear! Let Dad get Enigma, stay here!”

The young rabbit didn’t notice, darting off immediately into the pool, scooping Enigma up. They’re all soaked.

“Mama! Did someone pushed her in there?”

Enigma went quiet.

”Surely she doesn’t know how to swim, dear. She seems like she wants to play with you in the pool, but don’t know how.” The mother looked at her, curling in her owner’s arms.

“We should go home for dinner now.” The father started packing.

At home, the bunny put Enigma on a brand-new bed, “Good night, buddy.”

Enigma is ready to shut her eyes too, but-

“Rainbow! Have you heard of the rainbow tier?”

”What?!”

”The pets with them have glows in all sorts of colours!”

“I wish I’m one of them, should be soon. I’m the eldest Emerald Tier in Jamaa as of now!”

“Same!”

The next morning, the bunny came in, squeezing Enigma tight. She ran to her room with the kitten in her arms, plopping her a comfy cushion.

”Stay here, I wanna show you something!”

She then ran back up, to the pet room. Her siblings are cleaning the food bowls.

”Mama’s holding a welcoming party for Eni! Can you help me with presents, sis?”

The lizard and the sugar glider growled, they don’t seem pleased.

”Gosh, they’re so mean to Eni!”

”Of course, Hops! It’s a tradition whenever we get a pet!”

“Guess we’re doing on our own!”

The youngest came back with Enigma, giving her a yarn ball. The three of the bunnies walk down with their mother watching news.

”Hops! Prance! Frolick! The alphas are having a conference about their new discovery: Rainbow Tiers!”

“Rainbow Tier?! Oh yes! That’s it!” The bunnies screamed, “Thanks mom!”

”Anything for a welcome present!”

The day of the party, the kids cheered for Enigma, the others though…aren’t really in the mood.

“Probably gonna be the worst party ever!”

”I know, right?”

The youngest picked Enigma up, and the family went on their car to the Lost Temple of Zios. Even though Enigma’s confused, she only purred in excitement for the party.

”Rainbow Tiers! Rainbow Tiers!” The three children chanted.

The Hall of Icons was a magical place, Enigma looked in wide eyes.

”You ready?” Asked the mother.

”Yes! Yes! Yes!” The youngest cried the loudest.

The magic began, the kitten now glowed in pink with a tint of white.

“BEST DAY EVERRR!!!” The kids squealed in joy.

Back at home, the bunnies showed her to the others. They were shocked.

”She’s…she’s a RAINBOW TIER?!?!”

The highland cow admitted, “I’m…sorry I pushed you by accident, I was showing off and I didn’t notice you-“

”It’s okay. I forgive you.” Enigma muttered her first words, “What’s your name?”

”Spike.” He replied.

“Enigma.” She added.

“Wanna go to the ball pit? I can teach you how to do cannonball!”

And they ran towards the room next to theirs.

”Hey I wanna be a Rainbow Tier! It’s no fair! Why is she treating a common creature that appears in shops way better than us, rarest pets of all?!?!”

“Hey, Racer! I have a plan!”

“What?”

”We’re taking that weenie down.”

== Chapter 2 ==
“Wow.”

“Yeah. I know, right?”

The duo giggled at the plan and let out a devilish grin.

Meanwhile, Spike and Enigma are playing at the ball pit.

“Can I get some water?”

“Sure!”

Enigma went to the kitchen and was looking for the water bowl when-

“Hey, Rainbow and I want to say sorry.”

“Yeah, we feel so bad for ourselves.”

“WHAT?! But they are meanies to me once!” Spike yelled.

“Not anymore. They’re really sorry!”

“Are not!”

“They are!”

“Are not!”

“I forgive you guys.”

“You’ll regret this in five minutes, I swear.”

“Prance is taking us for a bungee jump! You going?”

“YES!”

“Then what are we waiting for!” They all ran out of the house.

Coral Canyons.

“Wow, new clothes.” Enigma looked at Epic Wonder’s windows with wide eyes.

“Bungee jump, remember?” Rainbow shouted in annoyance.

They went up after Prance’s turn, who was told to wait at the souvenir shop.

“Now let me tie this rope.” Racer helped.

“Good, but I’m scared.”

“I can help if you’re scared.”

“Great idea.”

And Rainbow pushed, and watched as Enigma fell down and down.

“Now let’s scram before Prance sees this!” Rainbow whispered in Racer’s ear.

At the house, Hopping is worried. Enigma hasn’t been back for four hours straight.

“Have you seen Eni?”

“Nope, she went with Prance earlier.”

“Surely they’ll be back soon, it’s getting late.”

On the phone,

“Enigma! She’s missing, Mom!” Frolick called on the phone after listening to Hopping’s sobs.

“Oh dear! I’ll call the neighbours to ask if they’ve seen her.”

A treehouse near the playground in Jamaa Township.

“Where am I?”

“In a treehouse. Oh heavens, you’re alive!”

“Who are you?”

“Flash the squirrel at your service, my lady. HONEY!!! THE CAT IS AWAKE!!!”

“Oh thank goodness my bees saw you in time, or else you’ll be dead meat! I’m Honey by the way, and you…?” A Meagyn’s bear barged in the treehouse through a window.

“Enigma. Thanks for saving me.”

“I swear your owner could’ve tighten that knot of yours.”

“But she didn’t! Rainbow and Racer did!”

“THOSE TWO?!?! They keep teasing the non-member pets in the playground!”

“Well we have to do something!”

“But how?”

At the bunnies’ house,

“Mom! Pa! Eni’s gone!” Hopping bursted in tears once the rest of the family came back.

“I’m sure Racer and Rainbow are behind this! It’s not my fault, they took her after it’s my turn and told me to wait at the souvenir shop!” Prance insisted.

At Prance’s room.

“Rainbow! Racer!” Prance screamed.

“What is it?”

“Where. Is. Enigma?” Prance repeated.

“We don’t know, and neither do we care.” They rolled their eyes.

“That’s it, you meanies! You keep harassing our new pets all the time! Down the basement, shoo!” Prance shouted in anger.

“Come on, kids! We have to go find Eni!”

At the treehouse,

“I think I hear something.” Enigma’s ears flicked.

“Your owner?” Flash asked.

“Yes, let’s go down!”

“Eni! Where have you been? I’m so worried and scared!” Hopping hugged Enigma tight.

“I’ll tell you back home. Spike? I’m sorry, I should’ve listened.”

“It’s okay, glad you’re safe now.”

Back at home,

“Prance took us for bungee jumping. Rainbow and Racer didn’t pull the knot tight enough, but Honey and Flash saved me!” Enigma explained.

“Oh thank you guys so much. What’s you say about being Prancer’s new pets? She just kicked out Racer and Rainbow and they’re in the basement.”

“That.”

“Would.”

“Be.”

“So.”

“AWESOME!!”

“THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!” Flash and Honey cried in unison.

“But what about-“

“They’re on the basement, Mom’s taking them somewhere else, a hospital if I remember right.”

“Did I smell DINNER?!?!” Flash shrieked.</text>

    <title>Lost - A Short Story by puppygrl</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
