  <page>
    <title>How To Fill The Silence</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163003</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259556</id>
      <parentid>259554</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-02-24T20:13:36Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Puppygrl</username>
        <id>46410937</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>259556</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="36896" sha1="4wfedme8h4zzcus281iggvfr54kx7ps" xml:space="preserve">= How To Fill The Silence =

'''WARNING: &lt;u&gt;This story is PG-13. It contains swearing, mentions of queerphobia, self-harm, verbal/physical abuse, alcohol abuse, violence (but not particularly gory), character death,  and (somewhat) child neglection. PLEASE DO NOT READ THIS IF THESE THINGS WILL TRIGGER YOU. THIS STORY IS WRITTEN FOR AWARENESS PURPOSES, BUT IS NOT ENTIRELY CHILD-FRIENDLY AND WILL INCLUDE THE MENTIONED WARNINGS. TAKE CARE OF YOURSELF!&lt;/u&gt;'''

A Brief Note Before I Start The Story. 

''This story is entirely fictional, but the problems between the characters are indeed real. I wanted to write this to bring up these often-overlooked issues, especially mental health, abuse (in all its forms), and self-love. Note, this is mostly based on my perspective, and not so much research. It is partially written in verse, as I wanted to be a bit more liberal with the formatting in an attempt to invoke more emotion.''
 
Most importantly: In life, not all stories have a happy ending. But you won't know which ones will or won't. So, enjoy it as much as you can. But never pretend it's amazing, especially if it isn't. If things are going downhill, please reach out to someone, anyone that you trust.

I know it can feel impossible, but there is a way to find love.

I wrote this story to prove it.

So, enjoy it as much as you can.


'''&lt;u&gt;One: When I Had A Skylight&lt;/u&gt;'''

''When I had'' 

''A skylight,'' 

''Everything was'' 

''fine.'' 

''I could see the stars,''

''I could see''

''Wishes for miles,''

''I could smile''

''I could have something so bright''

''Just be mine.'' 

&lt;nowiki&gt;*****&lt;/nowiki&gt;

I SAT DOWN IN MY CUSHIONED CHAIR, LISTENING TO MUSIC ('''the first way to fill the silence''') to try to get my mind off things.

Everything had happened so quickly: My brother, my parents, the move, new school, new peers, new house, new neighborhood.

No more ice cream truck just around the corner. 

''But no more Elio to beg for ice cream in the first place.'' 

No more kindred, omniscient librarian with the perfect book for everyone. 

''But she had to go to the hospital anyway.''

No more perfect mom and dad who were married just because they loved each other.

''But neither of them were ever perfect.''

No more friendly, philosophical old man who shared words of wisdom and a cup of tea with anyone who asked.

''But he was wheezing between every word of every saying.''

No more big, beautiful house with plenty of space and a pool to dive into ('''the second way to fill the silence''').

''But I couldn't try out for swim team, anyway.''

No more friends to turn to when things got bad.

''But I only ever had one friend.''

No more just '''knowing''' what to say, because you know your classmates and you know your teachers and you know your neighbors and know the whole wide world in your head that's just a tiny little insignificant dot in the real whole wide world.

''But I never said much to my classmates, anyway.'' 

The truth is, I never said much at all.

So how am I supposed to start saying things when my whole wide world has turned upside-down? 

('''See ''Five Ways To Fill The Silence''''').

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

My little brother Elio used to fill the silence. 

His laughter was so loud and vibrant, like a buoy being cast into a stormy ocean, a tether to half a chance at life.

But Elio was so much more than half a chance.

And now all he is...

Is gone.

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

I tried to turn the volume up. Sometimes it worked, sometimes it didn't. 

But nope, my mom was still yelling at me.

"Ezra, get downstairs! Chris is here for dinner!"

After she repeated the sentence for what felt like the millionth time, I heard an unignorable ''BANG'' on my door. ''BANG BANG BANG.'' Just turn the volume up. Chris doesn't really want to have dinner with me anyway. He glared at me whenever I corrected him for misgendering me. ''BANG BANG BANG.'' 

"Ezra, honey, you're being rude! ''Please'' come down for dinner."

''BANG BANG BANG. BANG BANG BANG.''

When the banging got too loud, I put my headphones on. Even clearer, and I wasn't being rude anymore. Perfect.

But when the banging finally stopped, Mom and Chris were opening at the door, Chris not even bothering to mask his disgust as his eyes found my wall of pictures with Aiden. 

Mom smiled tightly and looked at me, hard. I could feel her stare but didn't feel like staring back. I sat in my cushioned chair, listening to music, as Mom and Chris whispered things to each other indistinctly until finally Mom came, tapped me on the shoulder, and with no further warning, slammed my computer shut, picked it up, and swept it away.

But she wasn't just taking my computer.

She was taking my music.

She was taking one of my ways to fill the silence.

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

"Jesus," Chris muttered, "what a f****** b****.  Don't you ever get tired of her?"

''Her.'' 

I wanted to scream so, so, badly. To smack Chris across the face. But what would my Mom do? Because she couldn't believe he was bad news. She never believed ''any'' of them were bad news.

Chris was her tenth boyfriend, and it seemed like they had only gotten worse after each breakup. Because Dad was fine. He was nice. The only problem was? He didn't love her. He didn't love my mom. He still doesn't. 

But they were ''friends''. He never cheated on her. He wasn't a massive A-hole like Chris was. Dad was ''good''. He ''accepted me''. 

But Mom wanted someone who loved her, ''really'' loved her, but Chris's love looked like poison to me, like a sly anaconda coiling up for the final strike, like our untamed ancestors with their bloodstained teeth, like mom was the rabbit and Chris was the fox, but everyone says we aren't like that anymore, we can't be predators because Mira and Zios and Jesus and Allah and whoever else they believe in blessed us.

Mom saw Chris as a handsome tough guy, who was persistent, made good money, and complimented her excessively, and his flirtatious tendencies weren't weird or creepy, they were just him, they were him being nice, him saying she was pretty and looked good in a tight skirt and not him being disgusting.

I saw Chris as wrong, wrong, wrong.

Mom saw Chris as right, right, right.

Mom liked believing she was right.

So she stayed that way and so she let Chris stay and so she shut me out.

She shut out her kid, not her daughter. Not ''her''. I'm not a her. Not a girl.

But then she let Chris in.

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

I ended up coming downstairs for dinner. I didn't want to. Not at all.

I knew it would end horribly. It always did.

But this wasn't the end.

Not yet, it wasn't.

&lt;nowiki&gt;**&lt;/nowiki&gt;

"So," Chris said sluggishly (he seemed drunk, but Mom also seemed drunk, because Mom did whatever Chris wanted her to do), "I was thinking we could head out tonight, Emelia. Wouldn't that be nice?"

''Emelia''. Mom's real name, because no mom's name is actually Mom.

I never called her that. Why did Chris get to call her that?

Mom giggled. She ''giggled''. She hadn't laughed in ''years.''

She was definitely drunk.

I hated what I was watching. It screamed wrong, wrong, wrong, and it felt gross and squirmy and weird inside of me, and I wanted to throw it away, I wanted to burn it to the ground, but I didn't want to break my Mom's heart because it had already shattered into a million pieces a hundred thousand times.

"I agree," she slurred giddily, "let's go, honey."

''Honey.'' A nickname. Already.

''Wrong, wrong, wrong.''

Mom and Chris fumbled out of their chairs and lousily bumped into the table about seven times before they managed to grab their coats and leave the house.

Before Mom left me.

Before Elio left.

But Elio never chose to leave.

We prayed to God every second of every day that Elio would come back to us perfectly healthy, and instead of helping like everyone says He's supposed to, God gave me a curse. 

He cursed me so that everything and everyone I ever loved would be hurt.

And each time someone I loved got hurt,

I loved myself a little less. 

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

Believe it or not, Chris wasn't in my life for so, so many years.

Believe it or not, I once had a happy, healthy little brother named Elio.

Believe it or not, Dad, my ''real'' dad, was a good man.

Believe it or not, I haven't prayed to God since Elio died. Not even to bring him back.

Believe it or not, my one friend in the whole wide world was my love, my ''real'' love, Aidan, but the whole wide world (or maybe God) tore me apart from him.

Believe it or not, the nurses tried everything they could to save him, to save Elio, even praying.

Believe it or not, it's the world who's crazy, the whole wide world who thinks so childishly that everything can be fixed by a higher power instead of themselves. That all they have to do is be a good little servant and then their life will be magical.

Believe it or not, no one's life ever stays magical.

Believe it or not, my life was magical until my parents got divorced.

And to be honest, I predicted this one: 

Chris and Mom didn't come home until 10:49 PM the next night. 

Believe it or not, they had left the house at 7:00 PM the night before.

Believe it or not, my Mom didn't even bother to bring her phone or any device at all, in case of an emergency.

''...Did she not even think about what I could've done (to myself) in those twenty-eight hours and forty-nine minutes?''

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

At exactly 10:51 PM, Mom hung her coat up.

I was sitting in the living room, waiting for her. Right in front of her.

Then Chris came in. He was laughing a little. He slipped his paw into Mom's, grinning.

Mom blushed. She was smiling.

"We should do something like that again," she whispered, but before I could even imagine what bribery Chris had seemingly succeeded at executing, I looked at Mom dead in the eye and she was so blatantly lovesick that it stung.

He couldn't tell her Chris was a terrible person, even if he was- even ''though'' he was.

Because he had ''lovesick'' written all over him six months ago, before the move.

And he was still in love.

&lt;nowiki&gt;**&lt;/nowiki&gt;

"Ah. You," Chris murmured, irritated upon simply seeing me.

A part of me was tempted to spit at his paws or sock him in the head or poke him until he imploded or just ''something, anything'' because I ''knew'' he was bad.

But I didn't.

Because I couldn't.

And because no matter how evil he is,

...I shouldn't.


Chris growled, glaring daggers at me. "Look, kid, ignoring me isn't doing you ''any'' favors. I ''told you'' to ''clean the house'' while we were gone. So ''why'' isn't it clean?"

"You didn't tell me," I responded matter-of-factly, trying my best to maintain a polite composure.

"Why, you little--"

"Chris, sweetie, take it easy. Ezra is going through a lot," Mom interjected pleadingly.  "I'm sure sh- ''they'' don't mean to cause any trouble. I'll tidy things up later."

"''She, "'' Chris muttered under his breath.

I took it all back. I ''really'' wanted to punch him then.

But I didn't, because I couldn't, because I shouldn't.

"Chris, babe... I thought we talked about this," Mom muttered, trying to be subtle, but, well... it was obvious.

At least she was trying.

But not hard enough.

She and Chris walked into the kitchen to talk. News flash: I heard all of it.

&lt;nowiki&gt;**&lt;/nowiki&gt;

"Oh, ''please.'' You really expect me to give up all my faith for some snooty kid I don't even ''want?"''

''"''I ''know'' you don't want kids, Chris. But whether you like it or not, I have a kid of my own to take care of. That kid just happens to be nonbinary," Mom said, exhausted.

"The Lord gave every creature in Jamaa a gender, attached to his or her body an soul. He did not wake up one day and decide to create a psychotic spectrum that made everything impossible to understand. He did not decide to give a thirteen-year-old ''girl'' a ''sacred'' religious celebration because she ''said'' she was a boy."

"You're allowed to believe what you want, Chris, but the way you're treating Ezra isn't fair. At least respect them," Mom retried hopefully.

"Oh, should I start asking flowers about pronouns? Should I try to figure out if my dog's barking means it's coming out to me?" He scoffed bitterly.

"Chris, that's not how it works, it's more complicated than--"

"Am I supposed to respect a petty, antisocial psychopath who calls my ''religion'' a ''hate crime''?" Chris yelled, his anger tripling.

"N- No! I mean, Ezra doesn't say that! They just- They just wish you were more open-minded," Mom answered, clearly anguished.

"No. No, this conversation is over. I am not about to throw away the teachings of ''generations'' of my own family for your pathetic little girl. If you bring this up again, it ''will not'' go well, do you understand?"

"W- What? Chris, I just-- This is a misunderstanding, okay? That's not what I meant. I want you to be happy. But I don't want to hurt Ezra! I just want-- I want to give Ezra a good family. A good father," Mom pleaded, her voice breaking midsentence. 

She finally saw Chris's poison, but she didn't do anything.

Because she couldn't.

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

After Chris and Mom talked, Chris left, telling her he needed &lt;nowiki&gt;''time to think.''&lt;/nowiki&gt;

I tried to be gentle. Mom was breathing heavily, her eyes wider than I thought was possible. 

"Mom..." I said softly, striding toward her as carefully as I could.

"Chris is a good person," she whispered to herself, "we had a wonderful night and this won't happen again. We aren't going to fight over stupid things."

But I stopped, and I froze, and I felt hot tears welling up in my eyes, because she had called my identity a stupid thing, she had called Chris's threat a stupid thing, she had given up and she was so scared and so anxious but she was trying to be perfect, and now she was seeing ''me'' as an imperfection.

And I ran up to my room, shut the door, and started writing ('''the third way to fill the silence''').

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

I looked towards the wall. Plain off-white, times infinity.

But plastered on the bland color was pictures of Aidan and I, filled to the brim with joy, cheeks flushed red, snickering and grinning and smiling and giggling and beaming and laughing and playing and joking and ''living'', ''breathing,'' being in the moment with no silence to fill.

How was I supposed to do those things with him, feel those things with him, when he wasn't by my side?

We hadn't ever talked about going long-distance. We hadn't even expected it. 

And now that we were...

What would happen?

''Were'' we? Aidan had never explicitly said so.

But of course we were, because we weren't 20 minutes away anymore, we were a three days' trip away, by car.

And I didn't even have a car of my own to drive.

Neither did Aidan.

At least, not when I last saw him two months ago.

I hadn't texted him since then. But I needed someone to lean on. Someone like Aidan. 

And he was only a text away, in that moment. But I scrolled up, and there were so, ''so,'' many unanswered texts.

Aidan knew that I had...

relapses

sometimes. 

And there were so many words

''So many words''

I wanted to scoop them all up, scoop ''him'' up, and hug him as tight as I could, as soon as I saw everything:

AIDAN:  ''Hey Ezra, how are you?''

AIDAN:   ''I hope things are going good''

AIDAN:  ''How's your new high school? Make any friends yet?''

AIDAN: ''No worries, I'm sure you will if you haven't''

AIDAN: ''You're incredible after all''

AIDAN: ''I was lucky to go on ONE date with you''

AIDAN: ''I'm pretty sure there were a few other kids pining for you, no matter how emo you were''

AIDAN: ''Too bad for them, now that we're officially going out.'' 

AIDAN: ''I sent you a present in the mail for our first anniversary. You should open it :3''

AIDAN'': I know it's only been a few weeks, sorry if I seem clingy. I love you though''

ME: ''It's fine. I miss you, too, Aidan.'' 

ME: ''But I'm not opening the present yet bc it's too early''

AIDAN: ''Whaaaaatt''

AIDAN: ''Rude''

AIDAN'': I feel betrayed''

ME: ''You KNEW it was too early''

AIDAN: ''Maaaaaybe''

AIDAN: ''So what if I did?''

AIDAN'': Seriously though open it! I wanna know what you think''

ME: ''We still have a month to go doofus''

AIDAN:  ''don't care if you call me a doofus because I know you love me too :)''

ME: ''hmmm do I tho''

AIDAN: ''Wow am I getting rejected??''

AIDAN'': Too bad for you you'll never get Valentines Day chocolates''

ME: ''WAIT NO I WAS JOKING PLZ''

ME: ''I miss youuuu''

ME: ''We're so far apart now''

AIDAN'': Yeah I guess you're right about that''

AIDAN: ''We can handle it though''

ME: ''I don't know it's hard without knowing you're right there''

AIDAN: ''What do you mean?? I'm always here Ezra''

AIDAN: ''I care about you I'm not going to ditch you just because you're a few hours away''

ME: ''Seventy-two hours isn't a few hours''

AIDAN'': Ezra is everything alright?''

AIDAN: ''I really mean it I DO care about you''

AIDAN: ''If something's wrong you can reach out to me, I LIKE talking to you even when it's hard''

AIDAN: ''I'm not going to let any amount of miles, any amount of kilometers, break us apart''

''AIDAN: I'm not messing around when I say "I love you." It's just the truth. It's how I feel about you. I don't want to throw those feelings away. You mean so much to me Ezra. Please reply. I just want to know you're OK.''

ME: ''Aidan let's face it neither of us can do this''

ME: ''You should just move on and find someone else''

''AIDAN: What?? Ezra where in Jamaa did this come from?? I'm REALLY worried about you. I can't just move on from that. You're acting really out of sorts all of a sudden. Please can we Facetime or something?''

ME: ''Look I'm sorry I just hate seeing your face without being able to touch it''

ME: ''It just feels like I can't even give you a hug anymore, ever again, and I don't know why but that hurts me, it feels like I can't really know what you're feeling, I'm sorry I just can't''

''AIDAN: I'm not a different person Ezra, I swear. I've had a crush on you since eighth grade. Is that not a big enough feeling for you??''

''AIDAN:  I'm sorry that was a bad question it sounded demanding''

''AIDAN: You don't owe me anything seriously, I just want to know you're alright it will make me feel better''

''AIDAN: And if you're not alright then we can still talk! If you want me to try to come over I can try and find a time. I'm just really busy lately. I wish I could see you though, I really do. I want to talk to you. I want to be with you. I love you''

''AIDAN: Ezra you are incredible, you're beautiful and talented and adorable and handsome and your identity is valid and I care about you so, so, much, please just respond, I'm getting really anxious''

''AIDAN: I'm sorry if I'm pressuring you I never wanted to hurt you''

''AIDAN: I know it's hard now that we can't just automatically be near each other but that doesn't mean I don't love you anymore, it doesn't change any of my feelings at all. I know this is unexpected and you hate the unexpected but just this once please try to embrace it. Difference can be challenging to understand but that doesn't mean it's impossible to.'' 

''AIDAN: If there's anything I can do to help just let me know. I want to be there for you so, so, badly.'' 

''AIDAN: Ezra, please just send me a text or call me or something, at least let me know if you want to break up at least tell me this is really messing with my head''

''AIDAN: I keep on thinking about you I don't know how to make it stop. My gut is telling me something's wrong and all I want to do is fix it. If I made a mistake you can tell me. I won't back away. I just want to make things better Ezra, that's all''

''AIDAN: Is something wrong?''

''AIDAN: I'm really sorry if I'm bothering you I just don't know what else to do, you haven't replied to anything, every time I try to call you you hang up or don't even pick up at all.'' 

''AIDAN: Ezra please don't feel bad about yourself, I'm still here for you, I always will be. If you need a break just say so. If you just want to be friends now that's fine too I just want to hear your voice again, I want to know you're alive, I want to know that everything is fine, it's okay if you're hurt or don't feel good there WILL be better times''

''AIDAN: Just keep trying Ezra, and I know you'll get far. You mean the world to me. And I know I'm not the only one who loves you. Elio does. Your Dad does. Your Mom does. You have a family. I hope that you're talking to them if not me.''

Just

Talk

Just

Talk

Just

Talk

Just

Talk

Just

Talk

Just

Talk

Just 

Talk

Just 

Talk

Just

Talk

Just

Talk

Just talk

Please talk

''Please''

I did it. I texted him. I texted Aidan. Two tiny, pathetic words that I flimsily stitched together to make up for everything in a way that made up for nothing at all. 

ME: ''I'm sorry.''

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

Aidan doesn´t reply for the first five minutes. So I decided to open up my journal. I poured everything into my journal, in one place, all at once. 

All the things I felt and longed for and believed in and thought of and cared about and hated and said and did and saw other people do and heard other people say and tried to do and failed to do and succeeded to do and gave up on and dreamed about and turned to and abandoned and did wrong and did well and did right and everything in the world that ever happened, every moment and minute and second and hour and week and day, centuries of nothing, so much nothing, glorified to become something, history and reality and personal opinion and imagination abolished and remade and transformed and all of it, every single thing in existence

in 

one

journal.

When I reached

the seventeenth page, 

I realized I was panting and sweating and I needed a break.

Some of the ways to fill the silence are hard in the moment, but in the long run, they help. 

&lt;nowiki&gt;**&lt;/nowiki&gt;

But then I flipped the page again and I saw a drawing from two months ago, crumpled up and yellow-ish and smack dab in the middle of it was a poorly-taped half-wilted rose that was a red darker than blood, free of thorns, the one rose with no thorns I had ever been given in life

The drawing was of Aidan.

Aidan, in his Phantom Beanie, Gold Chain, white Skullys, dark gray Topcoat, and Blackout Boots. With his deep brown eyes that reminded me of warm, gooey chocolate in a brownie, his extra-fluffy tail that he tucked in so shyly when we first met, his sharp-angled fox ears that bent down when we kissed, his soft, strong paws that constantly coerced me to hug him until we both couldn't breathe, his heartbeat that sounded like an orchestra, his hilarious raps and his somewhat-ironic love of ballet, the way he walked with such casual confidence, the way he lowered his voice when he tried to impress me, but he never had to, he never had to try, because he was always amazing to me, he was already defying gravity, he didn´t need to do anything

I was going to draw myself in that picture, but I wasn´t sure how. I like drawing ('''the fourth way to fill the silence''') but I´ve never drawn a self-portrait before. I like drawing people in my life, and I like making the paper seem alive, and I draw little doodles of everything I write about. 

But I´ve never drawn myself

because

when I look in the mirror

I see what other people think.

You might think

that doesn´t make any sense, because you can´t see thoughts, but if you think that, you´re stupid, because of course you can, you can look at someone´s face and their posture and the little tiny movements they´re making and know what they´re thinking.

I´m not telepathic, just observant.

Aidan told me to stop comparing myself to other people. That´s the one thing he never understood. I´m comparing myself to myself. 

Every version of me in everyone else´s eyes.

Chris sees demon, 

Aidan sees incredible.

Mom sees

blinding light

filled with so much hope

and so much regret

that it´s kind of hard to tell

which one, or which one more of, she´s feeling.

But after the conversation we didn´t have, ´I´m pretty sure that all she sees me as is an imperfection. A burden. 

And then I start thinking about the way Aidan sees me might´ve changed, after I didn´t reply to months of texts, after I blocked him on every app I could, after I shut him out so I wouldn´t get hurt and I wouldn´t hurt him, but of course I knew and I know now that I ''was'' hurting him.

I thought if I ignored the problem, it would go away. Aidan and I would get the golden opportunity of reuniting in-person, seeing each other´s faces, and in an instant, knocking the wind out of the world with our love. 

And just as I looked down at the drawing, which my phone was next to, it rung. I looked at the name. 

Aidan.

''Aidan.'' 

'''Aidan.''' 

I took a deep breath and wished that music would start playing so I could drown out the inevitable, so anything that might hurt would fly away for the night, but Mom had taken my music, Mom had taken my music and I couldn´t get it back. 

And I clicked the green button, and I picked up the phone, and I put it to my ear, 

and before I could even breathe, 

Aidan started talking. 

¨I thought you´d never answer,¨ he whispered. 

¨I am,¨ I breathed, ¨I´m listening now. I´m sorry. I´m so, so, sorry.¨

¨I heard about Elio. I thought-- I thought that--¨

I winced. I tried to say something. The silence hurt. It was too vast to swim through, too vast to sing through, too vast to write through, too vast to draw through.

¨...I just wanted to know you were okay, Ezra. I´ve been worried sick for the past six months.¨

It was my turn to start whispering. ¨I know. I know. I´m sorry.¨

And Aidan said the inevitable.

¨I couldn´t even say hi to you. I didn´t even know if you were still alive. Do you know what that was like?¨ 

¨I know,¨ my voice broke, ¨I missed you.¨

¨Then why?¨ Aidan pleaded. ¨Why did you push me away?¨

¨I´m sorry,¨ I repeated pitifully, ¨I didn´t want to hurt you. But I did. I know I did.¨

¨For six months, you disappeared. For six months, I wondered if you´d been beaten to death, I wondered if you´d relapsed, I wondered if you hated me, if you were punishing me, if you'd broken up with me, if you'd forgotten about me, if you were burying your feelings, if things were getting worse, if you had anyone to reach out to," he panted, exasperated. "But you didn't tell me anything. You didn't tell ''anyone''."

"Aidan, I'm sorry. I know I messed up," I cried, willing the conversation to end, to turn back in time, to dive into an ocean, to write until I had no words left, to paint every inch of every wall, to break my ears with broken records, 

And then it was quiet

and the quiet

hurt so much

like 

it

never had

before,

a river of blood

scissors on my desk

I had started cutting the rose petals

the petals of the one rose in my life with no thorns

and the scissors were so close to my arm

and I wanted to cry

And Aidan whispered, "Ezra, I just wanted to know you were OK.

"I just wanted to know that you were OK.

"Please just tell me

if you're OK."

I grazed my fur with the scissors, the dark purple that didn't fit with any other color, the purple too dark to be painted, the painting of myself in my mind that I wanted to burn to the ground because I was scared it would look bad if it ever became real.

"Please," I sobbed, "please come over. I think-- I think I'm going to--"

''C  R A C K'' 

I started throwing up about then. It happened when I got really, really stressed--

too stressed

and it started affecting me physically.

I knew Aidan wouldn't be able to come, and even if he could, even if he did, it would be too late. But he was still there, listening on the phone, even though he could've given up, even though he could've said goodbye, even though he could've ignored me. 

"I'm going to get to you, Ezra, I swear. I will. I have to go right now, but-- I'm going to be back. Don't hang up yet. Please. I'm still here for you. I'm going to see what I can do. Trust me. Please, please don't hurt yourself. It might not feel like it now, but it's going to be OK."

''It's going to be OK''

''is like saying calm down''

''It's going to be OK''

''when I'm being ravaged by a hurricane''

''Of course, of course five words, seven syllables, can fix everything,''

''of course they can fix me-''

Chris opened the door.

"The hell are you doing, f*****? It's the middle of the night!" He yelled

too loud, too loud

I needed anything but Chris

Anything but him

telling me I was worthless

telling me I was a monster

telling me I was delusional

"Chris--" a voice

Mom's voice

too late

too late

"No, I want an explanation. What the hell is going on? Why are you on your phone right now?"

''You DON'T care so WHY are you asking''

I started shaking and trembling and my feet weren't on the floor and Chris's voice was too loud, too much, too angry, too bitter--

And Mom looked terrified, and I knew she was terrified, and I knew she wouldn't do anything, and I knew she wasn't just scared of Chris

She was scared of me.

&lt;nowiki&gt;***&lt;/nowiki&gt;

Eventually, Chris stormed off in frustration (again) but only after he 

slapped

Mom

across

the face

And she didn´t do anything

even though she could´ve. 

Aidan had been on the phone for

One Hour, Forty-Five Minutes, And Seven (Now Eleven-Twelve-Thirteen-Fourteen-You-Get-The-Point, Now One Hour, Forty-Six Minutes, And Thirty-Two Seconds). 

Which, if you don´t know, is a long time to be on the phone.

At least I sort of felt like

Maybe Aidan cared,

But there was no way he would´ve been able to come to my house, I hadn´t even told him my address, but I wanted him, I needed him, but I didn´t know how to talk to him, because I had hurt him, and it made me want to

___________.

Don´t try to read that as morse code, it will probably translate to gibberish. 

The only reason I won´t spell it out

write it down

is because

I don´t want to.

That might sound like a stupid reason, but you try reliving 

Trying to _____________, 

and see how it feels.

Not good.

But you might not even have a memory of 

''that''-

Because 

you aren´t me,

but that doesn´t necessarily mean

you´re my exact opposite.

But the main reason I´m writing this is because it´s for me.

And because I need to be more selfish.

And I know what I did (and I knew then) to Aidan wasn´t a good thing, and it was selfish, 

but in my head, there are two different types of selfish:

1,  '''Greedy-Stupid-Unnecessary Selfish.'''  That´s the kind of selfish where you´re being so self-centered and egotistic it´s obnoxious, where you´re only worrying about yourself and disregarding others,  constructing an air of superiority when really you´re just being a snob. You´re not thinking straight and you probably aren´t doing the right thing, either. You might mean well, but your meaning-well reasoning might also just be a reason that you subconsciously know is just another petty cover-up, when really it´s bad for you AND other people.

2, ''Self-Love''

''S e l f  l o v e'' 

Self-love. Self-love is not bad-selfish. It isn´t you being stupid. It´s you taking care of yourself. The other selfish doesn´t actually help you. This selfish, self-love, can sometimes be called out as snobby or unfair or ridiculous or dumb, but it isn´t. 

You need to give yourself a break sometimes. You need to remember that you deserve a chance. You need to remember that you´re not all bad. You need to remember that mistakes can be fixed. Failure isn´t inevitable, but it happens, and you shouldn´t be upset about it, because it´s normal.

Perfection is a load of bull****. Go on, say it out loud.

That´s not selfish, OK?

Because when you´re ''really'' being selfish, you´re being irrational.

When you´re loving yourself, you´re healing yourself.

And if you don´t try to heal yourself, the scars will disappear- but not in a good way. They´ll just turn back into fresh wounds.

This is why I´m writing this story. 

You get to figure out why you´re reading it.

Also, sorry for calling you stupid a few times. 

I´m working on it.

But maybe I shouldn´t work on it, because I shouldn´t expect of myself to be an angel all of the time.

I´m not. No one is.

Maybe we shouldn´t think in black-and-white.

Maybe I shouldn´t tell you Chris was completely awful.

I guess I´ll pause for a minute

and make you a list of things that happened to Chris

that might´ve made him

the way he is.

But I´m still mad at him,

Because he chose a path of hate

instead of a path of love.

'''Here´s a list of things that happened to Chris.'''

# When he was five, his parents got divorced (like my mom´s).

2. When he was eight, his dad got sent to jail for the murder of a 16-year-old transgender girl with ADHD and anxiety.

3. The church he went to taught that queer people and disabled people were bad. 

4. He started going to church when he was five. A pastor told him that having divorced parents was bad, too. That because she was divorced, his mom wouldn´t be able to provide for him, and though God may pity her for that, He might not pity her if she was the one to file the divorce (because that would disrespect men, the ´´upper class´´ according to God-- according to the pastor). 

5. Chris believed everything the church taught him, because no other adults told him anything when he was at an impressionable age.

6. Chris never actually learned anything from the Bible. Just the pastor that told him who and what was good, and who and what was bad. So what the pastor said turned into his religion.

7.  Chris never actually met an openly queer or disabled person. He just knew that his father didn´t like them and the pastor didn´t like them.

8.  When he was eighteen, his father escaped jail. His father went to meet him. His father only told him one thing: I did it, I did kill someone, but they misunderstood, because I killed someone who God told me to kill. 

9. The next day (after when he saw his father when he was 18), he learned from the news that his father had killed a cop that had found him, and then ran away again. But he decided that he would stop thinking about his father after that.

10.  When he was 25 years old, he decided that he didn´t want to have kids, because he didn´t know what (or how) to teach them. And he didn´t want to let them down, either. 

'''Now Chris is 34 years old.'''

&lt;nowiki&gt;*****&lt;/nowiki&gt;

Back to all the things I´m avoiding telling you. 

Chris and Mom eventually left my room. But Aidan didn´t come, because he couldn´t.

Not because he wouldn´t.

The truth is, I love him. And I did then.

But I couldn´t reach him, because life isn´t always fair.

I stayed in my room that night, trying to solve my problems, despite the fact that I couldn´t, not then, not when they had reared their ugly face in front of the people I´m closest to. 

Not

Now.

Instead of doing anything about the humongous EVERYTHING that was happening, 

I decided to write some more. 

It was the first time I wrote about

Aidan.

I wanted to focus on him, the way I missed him, the way he made me feel, for one more minute.

One more minute, sixty seconds, into sixty-five, sixty-six, sixty-seven... three hours. 

''You´re'' 

''Beautiful''

''in every way''

''Your eyes''

''Have a light''

''That surprises me each time''

''Thoughts of you''

''Make my day''

''You´re the king''

''of my heart''

''And without you,''

''There´s a missing part''

''When I´m with you,''

''It feels like a dream''

''And I don´t want to be seen''

''Anywhere else''

''Because that would mean'' 

''I´m not standing by your side.''

''With you, I´ve laughed and cried''

''Every time I see you''

''It knocks my breath away,''

''But I try to breathe''

''Anyway''

''Because there you are''

''With your golden smile''

''Perfect like the sun''

''I can't even try''

''To not like you''

''Every mile'' 

''I walk towards you''

''is worth my while''

''You are nothing short''

''of incredible''

''With complimenting you, I´m never done''

''Because my feelings for you''

''Are just what´s true.''

''These three little words''

''Are what I long to say''

''Each and every day''

''Whenever you´re away''

''I think of how to say''

''Those three little words,''

''The truth and nothing but the truth''

''Would make me feel''

''As free as a bird''

''If you felt them, too''

''Those three little words''

''Are:''

''I''

''Love''

''You.''

      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="38227" sha1="ryrguziyc8s1vnyfdunpcmokk0cjkxj" xml:space="preserve">!!! Friendly Warning: This story is PG-13, as it contains swearing, alcohol abuse, drug abuse, violence, and child molestation. Read at your own risk !!!

== &lt;big&gt;Prologue&lt;/big&gt; ==


Kai held his breath in as he looked into the pool below himself, off of the diving board. The blue, large ripples of water going back and forth and the splashes of other kids playing made him hesitate longer. For a small, black arctic wolf, he wasn’t afraid of water, but after watching the 1970’s movie Jaws the other night, he felt a little nervous.

“Move already!” An impatient female sheep behind him cried. “You’re holding up the line, idiot!”

He let out a worried growl, and let himself fall into the water. As he submerged, he imagined sharks all around him, waiting to bite into his flesh, or even possibly worse, swallow him whole. He could imagine their big, reddened teeth and their large, thick bodies making their way to have their next meal. But instead, he just saw other kids’ bodies playing mindlessly. He swam up to the surface, and took off his fogged up goggles and finger-brushed his hair out of his eyes. Although he knew there wouldn’t be any sharks inside this public pool, he always thought there could be., and, by the time you wonder why it’s in there, you’d be eaten. 

After a few seconds, Kai dipped his goggles into the water, cleaning out the fog. Then, he made his way through the growing crowds of kids, who were splashing, yelling, and being inconsiderate to anyone around them. 

Almost there, almost away from this nightmare. He told himself as he got to the steps. But, to his luck, a man outside the pool brought out an ice cream stand and a wave of kids came rushing towards the exit to get a taste of the frosty snacks. Before he could exit, a bear stepped on his foreleg and pulled him under, and his head banged against the second step. He felt a massive headache, and saw blood when he opened his eyes. He tried to get up, but more animals trampled over him, pushing his entire body against the steps and floor, the taste of chlorine and blood surging through his mouth. 

Fortunately, one of the kids stopped, and grabbed his arm and helped him up. She was also an arctic wolf, about Kai’s age. She was pink, darker pink, and yellow, with beautiful, ocean blue eyes, looking in his. 

“Are you okay?” She asked, with a look of genuine concern in her eyes, still holding his arm.

“Yeah, getting dragged underwater by a mob of kids is an everyday occurrence for me.” Kai snorted, wiping the blood off his forehead, which- surprisingly- wasn't too much to be concerned with.

The pink arctic wolf chuckled slightly, then they both got up to land, away from the crowd of kids.

“I’m Cornelia… What’s your name?” She asked, once they've gone to safety on the cement.

“The name’s Kai. Nice to meet you, Cornelia.” He responded. “I like your name, by the way.”

“Oh, thank you!  I love yours, too. Both of ours sound like names from The Hunger Games, haha.” Cornelia smiled.

Was that a compliment?

“Thanks…” Kai forced himself to respond in a grateful tone, although he felt slightly confused.

“So, are you new around here or…?” As soon as the words left his mouth, he instantly regretted it. He obviously didn’t know every kid in the highly populated town of Corriodia, and didn’t want to act like he did.

“Yeah! I moved in last Saturday. How’d you know?” Cornelia chuckled. 

“Um, you just… Well… It seems like you’ve recently moved in,” Kai stuttered quickly. “Do you want to get some ice cream?” Moving on from that awkward subject, he gestured to the man selling ice cream. In fact, Kai had been craving ice cream since that morning.

Cornelia’s eyes beamed. “I’d love that!”

However, by the time they got up to the man, there was no more ice cream left.

“Sorry, kiddos,” The man shrugged. “We’re all out.” 

He then simply walked away with his little, pink ice cream cart.

Kai felt disappointed, and then turned to Cornelia.

“Aw, it’s okay. Who cares about ice cream, anyways? It’s just cream that is cold.” Cornelia said comfortingly.

However, that didn’t comfort Kai. He often got disappointed at small, petty things like this. But he had to respond with something.

“Of course,” He muttered unconvincingly, “Ice cream doesn’t matter.”

“Well, I have ice cream at my house, if it matters that much,” Cornelia giggled.

Kai was about to say a sarcastic remark, but then considered her offer and brightened up.

“Wait, seriously?”

“I mean, why not? I only live 2 blocks away... I need to get home anyways, my mom is expecting me to do my chores.”

So this was an invitation.

“I’d love to go to your house to eat ice cream.” Kai finally replied.

They went to her house and had ice cream, and it was the start of a beautiful friendship. 

Kai and Cornelia became so close, they had a (platonic) ship name “Kaielia”, given to them by their classmates a few days after Cornelia joined the school he went to. However… This happiness was short-lived. After 4-6 months, Cornelia disappeared randomly. No note left behind, no one to tell Kai what happened. It was as if she never existed.

== &lt;big&gt;Chapter 1&lt;/big&gt; ==
[[File:Kai.png|thumb|Kaing "Kai" Blamecar]]
The loud intro to “Bad Reputation” by Joan Jett alarmed Kai, on the morning of his 18th birthday. He tiredly snatched his phone off his nightstand beside him, and turned off the alarm. Then he stretched out all over his bed, and felt like something was off. He looked at his spray painted bedroom ceiling, and still couldn’t figure out what it was. Then, he remembered. The room wasn’t the problem, it was himself. He was hungover the other night, and was experiencing the after effects. 

“F**k.” Kai said in exasperation under his breath. He then got up from his bed while not bothering to fix it, slipped on some clothes, and went into his kitchen. He grabbed a banana from the fridge, and a cigarette lighter from his back pocket. 

“Now where are those damn ci-” Before he finished his sentence, he realized they were in his front pocket. He grabbed the casing and found that there was only one left. He decided to save it for later, when he’s at school.

He finished his banana, and then looked through his contacts on his phone. It was empty, due to a falling out with his parents a few years ago. He loathed his parents- his dad, who did inappropriate things to little girls and got 40 years in prison, and his mom, who decided to pretend she did not know of that, like a coward. Kai never knew where his mom ran off to after his dad's trial, and didn’t want to learn.

After a few somber moments, he closed his phone, packed his dark red backpack, and went out the front door to wait for the school bus.

He had to wait only a few seconds for it to arrive. If he could count on one thing, it’d be that the bus never kept him waiting. When it stopped and the door opened, he got inside and got strange looks from everyone inside. He heard a couple gossiping girls whisper, “Ugh, it’s that emo a** kid… Wanna bet he’s high as f*** right now?” And the other giggled.

Kai simply took a deep breath while walking into the back. He had to do this every single school day, and it got tiring quickly. He sat in the back of the bus with the other emo kid, who is known as Triple D- “Demon Deer Dairold”, and just tried to relax.

After a few minutes, the bus arrived at the school. He wasn’t quick to get out first, but didn’t want to be last, so he got out as soon as the gossiping girls left.

His first class was precalculus, which was led by Dr. Cowell Firstbreath, a small, brown tiger with a worse temper than Kai’s. They had a strong, mutual hate relationship. 

Kai sat in the back of the class, with his back-feet on the table, but was quickly disrupted by Dr. Firstbreath glaring daggers into him.

“You keep this attitude up, I’m failing you,” Dr. Firstbreath hissed, while slamming a book down on his own desk. But Kai simply rolled his eyes, and sat up straight. Surprisingly, Kai had good grades. At least, in the other classes. Apart from getting drunk or high, homework helped him waste away the years, with “useless” knowledge. Though, if answers got too hard, he’d consider Google to be his best friend. The most helpful and sober one, anyways.

A few minutes into the most boring class, he swiped an airpod into his left ear. A calculator was more reliable than a single class of Dr. Firstbreath’s. However, Firstbreath kept looking at him, blew a whistle, and howled, “Kaing Anatanoff Blamecar, go to the principal’s office! I’m not getting paid just so I can be ignored!”

Kai felt furious suddenly. No one has ever said his full name out loud. It was always “Kai”, or “That Emo Arctic Wolf”. And how was that a valid reason to go to the principal’s office? He never felt such anger seething through his fur. He couldn’t possibly let that creature get away with that. Suddenly, he backed out of his chair, and with all eyes on him, he went up to the teacher, grabbed his shirt’s collar, and pinned him up against the chalkboard wall. He wanted to slam his head in over and over, but the terrified look in his teacher’s eyes made him want to deliver an “intimidating message” instead.

“DON’T say my name EVER again, b****.” Kai dropped him, and stormed out of the classroom.

Instead of going into the principal's office, or going back to apologize, he went outside the school, into this secluded, hidden wall area where the potheads would often intoxicate themselves. Surprisingly, no one was there aside from himself. After waiting a few minutes, just to make sure no one was looking for him, he grabbed the cigarette and lighter from his front pocket, and lit it.

He always knew smoking caused cancer, but he didn’t exactly care too much. In fact, he got this unhealthy habit from his dad, who gave him his first cigarette when he was 15. Another reason why he hated him.

After a few minutes, he heard someone approaching. So, he dropped it on the ground and hid it over his shoe. He saw who’s mild face it was. The principal’s.

“Hello, Kai.” The principal greeted him calmly. He was an understanding, middle aged Direwolf. 

Kai looked into his eyes, but didn’t say anything.

“So, I assume you do know what you did was wrong?” The principal prompted.

“Don’t you have some other kid to expel, Professor Summerhollow?” Kai finally muttered.

“Maybe, but you gotta face the music,” He blinked. “Now, why don’t you tell me your side of what happened.”

Kai stood his ground for a second, considered telling him, then looked at bird passing by, not saying anything.

Summerhollow empathetically sighed. “You have issues, son. Whether you open up or not will always be your choice.” He made eye contact with Kai. “But right now, it’s that time of your life for you to decide who you wanna be. You can’t stay an angsty teen forever. And do you want to be some hurt addict with anger issues?”

Kai felt anger towards him, but held his tongue. 

“You don’t have to talk, but I want you to think about this.” He put his paw on Kai’s shoulder. “In fact, you can think about this in detention.” 

He took him back into the main school, and into detention. In there, it was a bright, white room with 6 chairs with desks on each one. 

Kai sat himself in one, and Professor Summerhollow put a few empty sheets of paper and a new pencil on his chosen desk. Kai looked at the paper, and counted 6 empty sheets.

“What is this?” He grabbed the pencil, staring at Summerhollow.

“Instead of doing busywork, I’m allowing you to reflect on your actions. The paper is to keep you occupied while you think about this.” The professor walked out of the office, leaving Kai to himself.

The clock on his desk was set to 1 hour, which was surprisingly low, for violence and disrespect. He didn’t exactly know what the principal expected. Reflection? Did staring at a piece of paper for an hour help someone reflect? However, he decided to color all the pages in black pencil lead, which took roughly 20 minutes, and made an origami snake. If he could remember one project from his childhood, it’d be making origami creatures. Snakes, for the most part.

Time flew by quickly, and when the clock rang, he excused himself out of the office and walked into chemistry. 

As fate would have it, the class started a few seconds after he walked in.

He paid no attention to the teacher, Ms. Kemi Heatedheart, because the books- and Google- explained chemistry better than this stuttering, jittery brown bunny. It was just another, unspecial class to him. Then, after a bit, the bell rang and he walked into the Jamaasian history class.

This was a class he had a love-hate relationship with. Love the interesting parts, hate the boring ones. For example, The Vampire Wars vs The Appondalian Republic Rebellion.

As he seated himself, the history teacher, Mr. Clark Wildworks, had a new, strange expression on his face. 

“Hello class,” He greeted everyone. “Today, we have not 1, not 2, not 3, but 4 new classmates. The school in Montaz- a town a few towns away- had flooded, and most of its students had joined this school. So please give them a warm welcome.”

He gestured towards the door, and four animals walked in.

“Please, introduce yourselves to our very fine class.” Wildworks smiled.
[[File:Karma.png|thumb|Karma]]
The oldest looking one, a male, dark blue and brown arctic wolf stepped forward. “I am Karma Midnighthaze, pleased to be here.” There was an edge to his tone.

The class greeted him, and he sat on one of the newly placed chairs in the back.
[[File:Chris.png|thumb|Chris]]
“I’m Chris Luckyground,” another arctic wolf stepped up, with red fur, and then sat down beside Karma. 
[[File:Owenn.png|thumb|Owenn]]
Then a blue arctic wolf stepped up to the class, and cheerfully beamed, “Hey guys! I am Owenn Luckystyle- he/him.”

''What is up with these arctic wolves?'' Kai thought skeptically. Yes, he was an arctic wolf, but it was a little confusing. Must’ve been a racist friend group.

Then, the last arctic wolf stepped up. She seemed so familiar to Kai, but he couldn’t place it. She was pink, darker pink, and white.
[[File:Cornelia.png|thumb|Cornelia]]
“Hello everyone!” She said positively. “I’m Cornelia Afterlight!”

== &lt;big&gt;Chapter 2&lt;/big&gt; ==
Kai stared at her in disbelief. He suddenly remembered her, their friendship, her disappearance without telling him, the anger he felt, all at the same time. Once, he convinced himself that she never existed, which was the final blow, into his darkness period.

All of the new arctic wolves sat next to each other in the back. 

He kept looking over at the new classmates throughout the class, not just because his long lost best friend was over there, but he kept feeling like that group itself was watching him. He tried to convince himself he was just being suspicious, as he always was, but something wasn’t right.

After a while, the bell rang, and as soon as everyone, including Kai, left the class, he got up to Cornelia, and latched on to her arm. She curiously looked at him, then asked, “Kai? Kaing Blamecar, is that you?”

He didn’t know how to feel, or what to do, except just to nod his head yes.

“I knew it! Do you remember me? I’m that little g-” Before she could finish her sentence, Kai interrupted, “I know. I still remember you from all those years ago. Why’d you leave? What happened?” He felt anger rising inside of himself, but he needed to ask that first.

Cornelia looked surprised, then responded, “Why don’t we talk about this in the cafeteria? It’s lunchtime.”

Kai wanted an answer ''now''. Not when she could run off on him again, but the look in her eyes told him something. He wasn’t sure what it was, but he just nodded.

“Great. See you there,” Cornelia seemed relieved for some reason, but then stared at Kai’s paw gripping onto hers. “Uh, could you…?”

Still shocked with confusion, he let go of her arm, and she zoomed off into the crowd of kids. He tried to see where she was going, but the crowd was too thick.

Later, he went to his locker and searched for any cigarettes he might’ve thrown in there. No luck. Then he made his way into the cafeteria, where he was surprised to see that Cornelia already got her food, and was eating at a table with those arctic wolves from earlier. Yep, must’ve been a racist friend group.

He waited in line, hoping not to be noticed by her, until he got all his food, which was peas, hash browns, and chicken- or at least, he hoped it was chicken. Although it had a green tint to it and smelled horrible.

Then, he walked up to the wolves’ table, and was immediately noticed by Cornelia.

“Oh, hey, Kai!” She smiled. “Please, sit with us.”

He felt a little suspicious of her  friendliness, but then sat down next to her and the light blue arctic wolf, Owenn.

“Um, I’m Kai.” He said bluntly.

“Hey, Kai.” The others responded with, unblinkingly, and somewhat carefully.

That somewhat unnerved him. What was going on?

“So, me and Kai were best friends when we were little,” Cornelia spoke up, then everyone began eating whilst paying attention. “That was, until… That thing happened.”

“What’s 'that thing'?” Kai asked, staring right into her eyes.

“Well,” She looked cautiously into Karma’s eyes. “I had to go away. My parents didn’t think we belonged there- well, here.”

Now, he really wanted to talk to her in private.

“Why didn’t you say goodbye? Or at least told someone where you were going? Or, hell, left me a f**king note?!” Kai felt that betrayal all over again. Not even he himself thought it was worth getting himself worked up over, but he ''had'' to say something.

Cornelia looked to the floor, a sad expression on her face, “I didn’t want to see you hurt… I know, I know, it was stupid, but…”

After a few moments, Karma put his paw on her shoulder, stared deep into her ocean blue eyes, then changed the subject, “So, what’s it like here?”

Kai paused for a few seconds, then answered, “The teachers are world class idiots, the food is sh*t, and there’s no shortage of mindless b*tches.” 

Owenn laughed, and commented, “That’s how it was at our school, too!”

No one else laughed, and then Owenn randomly asked, “So, Kai, what’s your favorite song to ever exist?”

Kai gave him a “seriously?” look, “What does that have to do with anything?”

“Oh, because you can tell a lot about a person just by their favorite song.” Owenn replied. “For me, my favorite song is ‘Roar’, by the queen Katy Perry.”

“If it matters that much to you, it’s ‘Bad Reputation’ by Joan Jett &amp; The Blackhearts.” Kai exasperatedly answered.

As he was watching Cornelia, he saw her put her head on Karma’s shoulder, and he put his arm around her.

For some reason, that upsetted Kai. He could’ve sworn he never had a crush on her, but inside, he was seething with jealousy.

“Hey, uh, I gotta go now.” Kai looked at the watch on his wrist, got up, and threw the food he had away in the trash bin. Well, it was just the chicken left. And he was convinced it had been infected by something. 

Throughout the school day, he kept trying to avoid that group of arctic wolves… But they seemed to have every single class he had. Jamaasian? Yes. Critical Thinking? Yes. Guitar Class? Yes. *** **? Yes.  But since in Jamaa every class is only 30 minutes long, unlike on some planet where they are unnecessarily long, he was free to go around 2:00 PM, and when that group all went outside, Kai approached them.

They were all at a wooden table that had 6 chairs shaded under a tree, talking, but Kai couldn’t hear what they were saying until he approached them.

He saw Karma, who was facing him, kick the top of the table with his foot, probably signaling the others someone was coming.

“Ok, what the hell is up?” Kai demanded, with his arms crossed. 

“Oh, hey, Kai! Surprised to see you h-” Owenn got cut off by his growl, “How the f**k do we have the same classes? At the same time? More importantly, how’d you convince the teachers to let you guys *have* the same classes at the *same* time?”

“Well, it-” Chris was cut off by Karma’s counter.  “That’s none of your business, is it?”

“I see how it is. I know something is up with you four. And I’ll make it my business to find out.” Kai growled again. Just as he was about to turn around, Cornelia spoke up. “Wait! Just sit down with us.”

Now we’re getting somewhere. Kai thought, as he sat down next to Chris.

“Cornelia, do you really think it’s time? Are we sure about this?” Karma asked her. 

“About what?” Kai butted in again. 

“Yes…” Cornelia nodded. “Now’s the time. We can’t wait until tomorrow.”

“About what?” Kai pushed.

“Well, in a way, we’re not here just because our old school got flooded.” Karma began to explain. “A few months ago, in January, there was a prediction that a curse, dated back to the Appondalian Empire, would activate this year. You see, the curse was that an unspecified amount of arctic wolves would get supernatural powers from the inactive god Juno, on the night of their 18th year of living, these few being called Delupus. It was Juno’s way of saying “f**k you” to the other animal gods for destroying him. He designed these wolves for chaos and the destruction of Jamaa. And, there is an ancient map that has mystical, red dots on where both the pre-activated and activated Delupus are, and this morning, we found out that there was a pre=activated one right in this very school.”

There was a silence that was too loud between the five of them.

“And what do you mean by that?” Kai asked too casually. He never believed in the gods, so this was nothing to him.

“Don’t you see?” Chris urged, as if it was too obvious. “You’re the Delupus we found.”

== &lt;big&gt;Chapter 3&lt;/big&gt; ==
“Right…” Kai wanted to withdraw himself from that conversation. “And you think I’m gonna believe your f**ked up fairytales? Or, what next, Mrs. Santa Claus is Sir Gilbert in drag?”

“First of all, don’t be too sure,” Owenn responded. “And, you can not believe us now, but in around, say, 5 hours, you’ll start to hallucinate, like, horribly, and then, in whatever hallucination you have, you’ll eventually kill yourself. Then, at midnight, tonight, you’ll feel, quote unquote, reborn. And then you will get a certain, unique power.”

After a few moments of silence, Kai wanted to know what drug Owenn- well, the whole group, was on.

“It’s true.” Cornelia spoke up. “When I was hallucinating, I thought everyone around me was shriveling up from sickness except for me, and I ended up accidentally killing myself. Turns out, I am immune to any sickness or disease.”

“Wait, so you guys are saying that you are Delupus? Delupuses? Delupusi- anyways, you have fun in your sh*tty land of make believe.”

Just as he was turning, he heard Chris whisper to Karma, “So, Plan B? We don’t want this to happen like when I was activated.”

Before Kai could question that, Karma pulled out a dart gun, and shot him in the neck. Kai fell to the ground, almost immediately as he lost consciousness.

About an hour later, his mind was waking up again. He was laying on a soft surface, probably a couch, with a horrible headache. However, he overheard a conversation. 

“I bet 50 sapphires that he will try to escape somehow.”

“Seriously? I’m not betting against you.”

“Yeah, yeah, anyways, do you think he believes us?”

“Honestly, nope. If anything, he thinks we’re a cult, or escapees from a mental institution.”

“Haha, I’d think that too.”

Kai heard someone approaching him. 

“Oh, he’s still asleep.”

It was Cornelia’s voice. She was up against his head, probably on her knees.

“I’ll go get the taser and water.” Karma’s voice responded.

“OK I’M AWAKE, GOD.” Kai shot up, glaring at Cornelia, who backed up a little. 

He saw all the arctic wolves from earlier staring at him. From his surroundings, he guessed he was in a house, as he was in the living room with Cornelia &amp; Karma, while Owenn &amp; Chris were in what appeared to be a kitchen, making their way to them, then sitting down on the living room  furniture.

“Yay, he’s conscious.” Owenn made his way to them.

“SERIOUSLY? KIDNAPPING?” Kai lashed out in anger.

“You wouldn’t come with us, so…” Cornelia explained.

“And besides, you’d want to be in a safe area when you, well, turn.” Karma said as he sat on the couch, next to Kai. “So far, do you feel… strange? Seeing anything out of the ordinary?” 

''Hmm, maybe I’m surrounded by 4 idiots who think I’m some mystical creature?'' Kai thought spitefully, but just said, “No.”

He thought for a minute. Ever since he knew about this, only Cornelia said that she couldn’t get sick. But what about the others? Why haven’t they shown him their powers, if they’re telling the truth?

“I’m sure you’ve got quite the questions,” Karma asked, as if he was reading his mind. “Why don’t we see if we can answer them?”

Right on cue. Kai thought.

“Well, if you are what you say you are- demiwolves? Direwolves?-”

“Delupus.” Chris corrected.

“Yeah, that,” Kai continued. “Why haven’t any of you shown me your abilities?”

Karma answered, “We didn’t have enough time, would you like to see them now?”

Kai nodded doubtfully, then Karma gave a signal to Chris. 

He got up, and held out his paw.

Kai was confused for a second, then he was amazed to see that a beautiful, glowing fire was slowly rising out of Chris’ paw. It looked as if it could blend in to Chris’s red fur, if they were in a bright room.

“How did you…” Before Kai could finish his sentence, Owenn, who was sitting behind Chris, splashed water at his inflamed paw.

“Hey-” Chris gave Owenn a friendly smile as he turned back to him.

Before Chris could do anything more, water came flowing out of Owenn’s paw, like a high pressured hose, and hit him in the face.

“How is this even possible?” Kai said in amazement, trying to see if they were tricking him, by looking in their sleeves for anything, such as wires.

“Because,” Karma stared deeply into his eyes. “It’s supernatural; strictly from the god, Juno.”

“Okay, so Cornelia is immune to sickness, Chris has fire, Owenn has water, what do you have?” Kai asked, still kinda shocked that magic- gods- exist.

“I can walk in others’ dreams,” Karma answered. “In fact, I tried walking in yours, but you weren’t dreaming of anything.”

“Wait,” Kai looked around the room, a little confused. “How is Chris red, and has fire, Owenn is blue and has water, and you are a midnight-y color, and can do that?”

Karma let out a soft chuckle, “Sometimes, Juno creates other’s color patterns to fit their power.”

“How is Juno dead, but somehow is still creating you… creatures?” Kai asked.

“Well, in the place where all the unborn arctic wolves are, which is eternal, contains all the ones he created when he was alive, with a very, very small amount being future Delupus.” Karma explained, still making direct eye contact.

“And is this… All of you?” Kai asked, looking at everyone in the room.

“All the ones that are alive,” Owenn said, staring at the floor. Kai could see regret in his eyes.

Before Kai could ask another question, Cornelia answered it for him. “The other school we were at, the one that flooded, 2 of us died there.” She then sat up next to the couch, holding Karma’s paw. He looked like he was reliving a terrible, sad memory.

“And, throughout this year, we’ve seen a few more, but most died only hours after they turned.” Chris added.

“What were their names?” Kai asked curiously. 

Before anyone answered, Karma got up and walked out of the room, and Cornelia followed him, trying to get him to come back.

They was silent for a minute, then Chris sat on the couch next to Kai, with Owenn on the other side, and responded in a low voice, “The 2 that died in the flood’s names were Maren and Castiel… And the others were named Foreign, Mintonia, Clownar, Fence, Courage, Rodeo, Smoke, and Heaven.”

“Karma and Heaven were a thing, I believe.” Owenn made sure both Karma and Cornelia were out of earshot, and besides, the walls looked thick. “Her power was to change texture, and she tried to turn into the wind, but she got ripped apart by the air currents. Then he met Cornelia a few weeks later, and now they’re dating.”

“And honestly, I wouldn’t ship th-” Kai looked at Chris, to see why he was cut off, but he wasn’t. Chris was still talking, but Kai couldn’t hear anything. 

== &lt;big&gt;Chapter 4&lt;/big&gt; ==
He looked to Owenn, but he was paying attention to Chris.

“What the f…” Kai drifted off, as soon as he could hear Chris talking again.

“-and I think Cornelia is tired of his-” Chris was cut out again, but then he looked to Kai, and just from reading his jowls, he could make out that Chris was asking him, “Are you ok?”

“No, I can’t hear you.” Kai shook his head. 

Chris gave Owenn a concerned look, then Owenn raced out of the room.

He looked back over to Chris, but he wasn’t there. 

“Uh, Chris?” Kai called his name, starting to feel concerned. He got off the couch, to see Owenn returning with Karma. 

“Where did Chris go?” Kai asked, but then realized it was useless.

Karma grabbed his shoulders, and started talking, as if he was yelling. Then, he could hear him, and he yelled, “You’re beginning to hal-”, and he was cut out again. Kai felt his own heart racing, as he noticed Owenn wasn’t there anymore. Kai tried to release himself from Karma’s strong grip, but Karma started pushing him into a different room. He saw Chris right behind him, as if he just magically reappeared.

“He shouldn’t be hall - ating just yet! Ka - are you gon - in the cellar-” He heard Cornelia’s voice cut in and out, yet she was nowhere in sight.

Suddenly, he couldn’t see Karma’s arms around him anymore, yet somehow, he was still being pushed.

Then, a door opened on his left, as if by itself, and he was shoved into the room, with the door supposedly closing itself. 

“F**k!” Kai yelled, as he tripped over wooden stairs, which led him to a cellar, full of wine, preserves, canned food, and books. It was dimly lit, but he couldn’t find the source of light. He stumbled, but got back onto his feet. His head was spinning, but he tried to find his way through the room. Then, a wall, full of preserves on his left, disappeared. He jumped back a little, but then tripped over a broken wine bottle, and fell onto a pile of broken glass. Screams of agony sounded like they came from upstairs, when he was screaming himself. Though, as he stopped screaming, more shrill screams joined in, like a drill pounding into his ears. He put his paws over his ears to block out the noise, but it didn’t do anything. Then, he looked down at his shins, and noticed they weren’t there anymore, and his thighs were quickly fading. He tried to get away from whatever he thought was making him turn to air, but he just bumped into a wall of trays, and a bottle got knocked over, and hit his head.

He screamed louder in pain, grabbing the bottle and throwing it at the ceiling, which backfired, as it landed on his chest and broke, covering his shirt in red wine. He then leaned up against a beam, which was only a few feet away from the wall of trays, and he looked up at the ceiling, and triangular shards of glass were falling, right onto him. Kai tried to move, but he couldn’t, and so the shards pierced through his face, collarbone, shoulders, and chest. He let out a ferocious scream, and tried to remove the shards from his face, but they broke in half, leaving the other half still in his flesh. Then, just to his horror, the floor broke, and started to cave in. He made more of an effort to move this time, yet he still could not. Then, the floor underneath him started cracking, and everything started rumbling, preserves and wine bottles exploding everywhere, as if they were sticks of dynamite. He was sprayed with more glass, and just as he was able to move his legs, the floor beneath him gave in, and he started to fall into a deep, dark pit.

Kai looked up, and noticed some glass started to fall in, as well, as if it was chasing him. He looked back down, and hit a giant, dark pit of water. The surface tension contracted the muscle in his right arm, and he closed his eyes. However, he knew there was movement all around him. Rough skin brushed up against his back and legs, followed by a fin bumping into his stomach. Kai knew what it was, but he couldn’t bring himself to open his eyes. Then, a single clear thought entered his mind: get to the surface. He swam upwards with his left arm, but as soon as he thought he was just above the water, his paw hit cement. There was no way out. He opened his eyes, looked behind himself, and saw a white shark, and it sunk its bloodstained teeth into his chest and stomach, biting off all of his insides. He sank down, and about 5 other sharks finished off his floating, dead body.

== &lt;big&gt;Chapter 5&lt;/big&gt; ==
After a few hours, Kai woke up, with a giant headache. The sharks and water were nowhere to be found, as he was still in the dimly lit room, his clothes were dry, and everything was organized neatly, as it was before anything happened.

“The hell…” Kai grunted, as he pushed himself up, and messaged his head. He noticed that his heart was gradually beating faster, but he was confused as to what just happened.

“Hey.“ A female voice sounded from the corner of the room. Cornelia.

“What just happened?” Kai demanded, though the fierceness wasn’t there due to the headache.

“You were hallucinating, and your heart stopped. Don’t worry, it happens to most Delupus.” She explained as she neared him, but Kai backed up a little.

“What? I can’t sit next to you?” She sarcastically remarked as she sat next to him, but Kai still didn’t say anything.

“Ok, well, do you feel any different?” She asked, facing Kai. As he thought about it, he did in fact feel stranger, but it hurt his head to even think.

“Yeah, but…” Kai drifted off, as he rubbed his forehead.

“Pounding headaches are also normal after 1st death, don’t worry,” Cornelia reassured him.

“First death?” Kai asked, casting upon her a sidelong glance.

“Yeah, I mean, at least we call it that. You die, you see a glimpse of your destination, possibly Juno, and then you come back to life.” She explained in a kind manner.

“Uh huh,” Kai rubbed his eyes. “Why don’t you-” He opened his eyes again, and Cornelia started to look around the room confusingly.

“Whatcha looking for?” Kai asked, getting closer to her.

“Kai? Kai! KAI?!” Cornelia got up and started searching the room.

“What’s wrong?” He sighed, but as he got up and walked towards her, it was as if she was ignoring him. Cornelia frantically raced down every aisle of preserves and bottles, shouting his name, and then raced to the upstairs door and hit it twice.

“Ok, y’all done in there?” Kai heard Chris’s voice ask.

“No, he escaped somehow!” She answered quickly.

As Chris was locking the door, Kai raced up behind Cornelia, and as soon as he opened the door to let her out, Kai raced out, accidentally tripping both of them.

“What the hell was that?” Chris exclaimed.

Kai didn’t bother to hear the rest of their spat, so he searched for a door that possibly led out of the house.

Suddenly, an alarm started blaring, both Owenn and Karma, who were sleeping, met up with Cornelia and Chris.

“I’ve got to get out of here,” Kai muttered to himself. Then, he found the door to the front porch… But, to his luck, it was locked. He looked around the area for a key, but there wasn’t one anywhere. That was, until Kai saw the group entering the room he was in, so he had an idea. 

He began hitting the door with his fist, which got their attention, but before he could move, he noticed a key around Karma’s belt. It was small, and he thought it could fit.

Carefully, he went up to him, but before he could do anything, Owen suggested that Kai might’ve been outside, so Karma raced to the door and unlocked it. Kai ran through them, pushing Owenn and Cornelia over, and breathed in a gasp of fresh air as soon as he hit outside.

Keeping it brief, he started running away from the house, but the address- “JT-D13-10754” (Which meant Jamaa Township, District 13, Area Number 10754), was seen visibly by their mailbox.

From the looks, it was like they lived in a cul-de-sac, and fortunately, he recognized this area, as the school bus he takes goes here every day.

In the dark, he followed the asphalt road, thinking about what just happened. ''So, I’m invisible? How is that- ANY of that, even possible?''

For a few minutes, these questions bothered Kai, until a bus was heading his way. He waved at it to stop, but the bus kept going, then he reminded himself that he was invisible, but this gave him an idea.

He only had to wait a few seconds for a slow paced car to come his direction, so as soon as it went by, he grabbed the door of it, then flung himself onto the back window. Fortunately, the car driver hadn’t noticed him, and they were headed to town.

== &lt;big&gt;Chapter 6&lt;/big&gt; ==

      <text bytes="2170" sha1="dsxkwp0wxoa70cjdv7d8tovnqi7t907" xml:space="preserve">Im very aware everyone want to make all of these cool stories, and interact with other people on this site. But be careful , as you don't know if a groomer, or hacker could be on the other side. be limited on what you say, and the information you share.




Stay anonymous , and you will be much safer online. Internet safety has been an issue for a long time, groomers find it easiest to manipulate children into doing horrible things. And they are everywhere, likely including this site...


And if you are underaged, and on here.. yes you may not be groomed, but you are exposing yourself to topics that are not so appropriate, thus grooming yourself in a way. 




examples of how a predator would manipulate you..



Lets say it was a sunny happy day. and you hopped on to this site to make some freinds! and you make one. Over time you guys become very close , and decide to tell eachother's ages, and names! so you go first and say.. Im 12! " then he goes on to say.. Im 14!  ...... But in reality he is a 46 year old man who wants to groom you...These people will lie about their ages so that you trust them more! ........ Some time later he ends up grooming you. ( i cant be too specific lol) .. And he made you send a picture that was... Well bad, and he threatened to blackmail you if you don't send more. Eventually this problem will escalate..... 


you don't know who's on the other side....



I wanted to write this for awareness purposes, as i have been groomed, and have survived SA myself, I think its important for others to avoid the situation..  




if you every feel uncomfortable please tell anyone! if you cant tell your parents, or a trusted gaurdian, you may want to 

tell one of the moderators, or a freind...



For help 

* Never share your age. age range may be fine, but never your age.
* your location/ area must never be shared. obvious reasons )
* never say something personal.

DO NOT SEND ANYTHING INAPROPRIATE! 


do's 

* share pictures that do not show you.
* say things that don't correspond to your home life.

share things about your state! ( if your comfortable..)



Stay safe! sorry for grammar issues)

== It's Fun To Stay At The! Ho-spi-tal Ward! ==
Cressida looked at the ceiling, and then the wall. She was drenched in sweat, and had just taken another nap- Fourth this day. After two days, homework had piled up. She'd done a ''lot'' of spells that day, and was almost at full strength, but in order to go back to class, she needed to rest a little more. Turns out, her old parents had probably been draining her- The downside of being placed in such a bad situation was that as your mood dropped, so did your magic. Thankfully, she always kept her head up... But now she was bored.

She turned to her side, her wings getting a breath of air. She'd been laying in the same position for too long, and they were starting to cramp. She plucked a stray feather out of her hair, and sighed. She didn't like the hospital; it was cold, reeked of medicine, and no-one wanted to talk to her. (WIP)
