      <text bytes="6608" sha1="nveiy8wdm1yipvuosd0iydtlj76eug8" xml:space="preserve">{{PG-13}}
{{Untrue}}

== Notice: ==
Don't ask me why the title sounds so goofy 💀 its been 2 years since I wrote anything about Animal Jam ok?

This is gonna be a pretty generic horror story so yeah uhmm you can leave if you want? 🤠👍

--

'''Shiver me timbers! There's some triggering content here:'''

* Drugs
* Murder/Violence
* Illness/Disease

If you can't handle this, please leave the page :)

== Major Swaggy Swag ==
My little brother was obsessed with Animal Jam. He played it every day after school. Sometimes, I'd find him in his room with his Ipad, in the middle of the night, on what he said was an "adventure" with his buddies.

I have never known my parents. I was raised by my grandmother, who was a widow. She adopted my little brother when I was a little over 13 years old. He was 3, and when my grandmother passed 5 years later, I was the only one left to take care of him.

It was near Halloween by the time I noticed how much effort he had put into his Animal Jam account. ''If only he grinded this much in his studies'', I thought. He had over 65 animals that he each decorated with a special style and name. He had a unique outfit for every animal, and possessed many rare pets. He was friendly with every jammer he met, and always accepted buddy requests.

I thought nothing out of the ordinary would come out of his addiction to the game, after all, it was something for kids. There wouldn't be anything dangerous right?

The more he stayed up, the more I became concerned. Prominent eye bags and drooping posture due to his lack of sleep just kept getting more noticeable. His report card came in, and I saw that he was failing some of his classes. 

I confronted him and we got into a fight. He screamed when I tried to take his Ipad away, and he refused to listen to what I had to say. He locked me out of his room, and for the rest of the night, I could only hear the faint Jamaa Township music coming from his room. I couldn't let him do this. He was ignoring everything in his life to play this game.

I had never told him the truth. My grandmother had late-stage lung cancer. She knew she was going to die. She only adopted him after she witnessed my uncle and his wife fight, and watched helplessly as he shot a bullet through my aunt's head. He was an alcoholic and had been in rehab for several years. After he came home, he repeatedly beat his family until the incident happened. Seeing my brother push everything else away from him to focus on a game was like watching him overdose on drugs without doing anything. I knew I had to stop it.

I downloaded the Animal Jam Classic app and created a wolf named "Fierce Arcticbuddy" to find out what he was up to. Luckily, I knew his username. I sent him a jag asking to be "buddies". He agreed, and I went to his den.

I was caught off-guard. There were 8 people with him in his den, and all of them looked experienced and rich.

"That's a noob!" A chat bubble appeared above an arctic wolf with no eyes.

"Did you seriously buddy a New Jammer?" A purple legendary eagle said.

"We don't want them here! Lock them out and unfriend them or we're leaving!" A giraffe with multiple black spiked collars chatted, circling my brother's animal.

I was locked out and unbuddied. My brother sent me a jag, saying "I'm sorry, maybe we can hang out some other time?" I was furious. The people in his den had interfered with everything, and I didn't know what to do. I still couldn't let him destroy his school life by playing video games all day. Tomorrow was Halloween, and I couldn't let him throw that aside to play Animal Jam!

The next day, I was surprised to find him with 8 friends, the same number of people that were hanging out with him in Animal Jam yesterday. They all looked suspicious. I had never seen them around town before.

"I have to supervise you guys. My brother's 8. He can't go alone."

"But they're my best friends!" he protested, "I swear I won't get into trouble!"

I observed his so-called friends. They wore crazed expressions, like a clan of hyenas ready to pounce on a piece of prey. "It's not about you. Sometimes, trouble comes along when you least expect it." My brother bit his lip and didn't argue. I felt satisfied. "Now then, which neighborhood are you guys going to go to?" I asked.

"Let's go this way!" One of my brother's friends yelled. All the other children ran after him, and my brother trailed behind, "Major Swaggyswag, wait up!" he yelled.

My heart stopped and I looked down at my brother. I had made an Animal Jam account before. The animal names were always formatted a certain way: a 1-word adjective and an adjective combined with a noun to form a single word. Had he been hanging out with these people? Why hadn't he just met them in school if they were from this town?

I ran to catch up to my brother, only to see him disappear into a dark alleyway near Manor Street. Before I could see what was going on, I heard my brother make a high-pitched, unearthly scream and I heard his friends cackle deviously.

I saw the boy known as Major Swaggyswag bite my brother on the neck with unnaturally long and sharp teeth. My brother's skin was ripped off, and I watched tears fall from his face as the boys mutilated him. "I'm sorry," he mouthed to me, and then I watched the creatures drive their claws deep into his skin and devour his blood-soaked insides. A red puddle was spilling over the concrete pavement, and I gazed in horror as the last breath left his body, and his head thudded to the ground.

I was frozen in fear. The boys threw his body in a nearby dumpster and started advancing toward me. I ran as fast as I could, toward the police department where I knew I'd be safe.

As I tried to take a shortcut through my neighbor's yard, I found myself cornered by all 8 boys, who now resembled the demons I had been terrified of when I was a small child. Their mouths moved as they smiled unnaturally wide, and I could see every sharp, triangular tooth. They crept toward me with their needle-like fingers, which were still covered with the blood of my little brother.

Major Swaggyswag lunged at me, and I felt unreal pain as it cut my flesh into pieces. The grass smelled like metal, and my body was paralyzed in place. All my memories flashed in my mind, and I didn't have the strength to even breathe. I don't know what happened after I blacked out, but I know my body would be subject to the same fate as my brother's.

Uh... the end?

(idk how to end this sorry guys lmfao)

      <text bytes="1918" sha1="jvesehxuaszqqr3sztpomsxvm55rvii" xml:space="preserve">yes this is a recreation of a story i did in 2021 dont laugh ok- [[The creepy bunny]]
[[File:Ghjhgfdghjkj.png|thumb|the bunny i saw... (srry i dont have a solid to make this image, donate to epox)]]
it was a normal day in jamaa, as i was trading as usual. a weird bunny had caught my eye. it was a nonmember bunny, but somehow had a black spike on? i was so confused.  ''why does a nonmember have member items?'' i brushed it off and went to my den and decided to host a fashion show. after advertising, coincidentally the bunny came. ''why is it here? atleast i have another player....''  

While going through as normal, saying themes, choosing winners, but as i went along i saw the bunny had many spikes, leap year items, and member things including the store ones.

At the last round, and mind you the prize is a den beta, i had a hard time choosing the winner. I chose the other jammer and the bunny left immediately. ''did they ragequit? i guess they did.'' While in the pillow room, trading, etc. i saw the bunny everywhere i went. They had the den beta i had displayed on trade i could of sworn i gave to the other person.

Later, i got a jag saying from the winner saying i never traded them the den beta. ''weird, what is going on with that bunny?'' I didnt have a spare so i gave them a clothing beta to make up for it. The same thing happened again.

Later, they tried to buddy me. ''what? is this some hacker? i cant lose my account!'' i declined. They showed up at my den i locked.

"Let's be Buddies!" the bunny said over and over. I didnt think animal jam classic had bubble chat like in play wild.. ''weird.'' "what do you want?? my pixels?? why try to hack me for pixels?" i had said. Then i got logged out.

after trying to log back in, it said account not found. i checked my alt and searched my username. It wasnt there. ''what did the bunny do??''

end ig- lesson: be skeptical of creepy bunnies</text>

  <page>
    <title>The new lop Bunnies</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163022</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259569</id>
      <timestamp>2024-02-27T12:33:21Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Epoxyy</username>
        <id>54669690</id>
      </contributor>
      <comment>Created page with "remake of another old cringe story!! btw none of the events are real and this is a short story  ==== it was a normal day in jamaa, and they released a new animal. It was a lop bunny. I regret logging in that day ever since. ==== [[File:The bun.png|thumb|this bunny but playable in animal jam classic not play wild]] i was an ecstatic 8 year old excited to log onto animal jam. I saw they added a new nonmember animal, a lop bunny. it cost gems and due to contanst grinding i..."</comment>
      <origin>259569</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="1338" sha1="pjs700it4js7j5f0iuzgqqm2pgb15ta" xml:space="preserve">remake of another old cringe story!! btw none of the events are real and this is a short story

==== it was a normal day in jamaa, and they released a new animal. It was a lop bunny. I regret logging in that day ever since. ====
[[File:The bun.png|thumb|this bunny but playable in animal jam classic not play wild]]
i was an ecstatic 8 year old excited to log onto animal jam. I saw they added a new nonmember animal, a lop bunny. it cost gems and due to contanst grinding i had 10k gems. The animal only cost 3000. My little self thought it was a good idea to get the new animal. 

i purchased it and tried it out. i was so happy! finally a new animal had arrived and i could actually use it. As i went to my den, and after some trading, tried to redecorate it. I had no items. 

It was weird, and i started to freak out because i had about 200 of them or more. i checked my animal and it had no items except a knife, which is unreleased. i stepped away from my computer as the bunny switched animals, it unmerged and i was my only other animal, the wolf. i started spamming actions until i saw they had changed. The bunny was wielding the knife at my wolf, and i did one of the actions out of bite, claw, try to escape, and give up. I chose claw and blinded the bunny for a second and ran off. i never logged into animal jam ever again.</text>
      <sha1>pjs700it4js7j5f0iuzgqqm2pgb15ta</sha1>
    </revision>
  </page>

  <page>
    <title>The phantom forest (Story)</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163089</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259909</id>
      <parentid>259818</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-05-14T09:40:03Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>DuckCat1234</username>
        <id>54779948</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>259909</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="2293" sha1="4476uyxo7rpy56czqx1t59jdcy4qd0r" xml:space="preserve">





Sorry, This won't be Continued anymore, I have other stuff to do.    

== Characters ==
Jammers -

'''Pearl''' - Appearance : A Gray Fox, With White Markings and Darker Gray Swirl Patterns, Ice Blue Eyes, And a Black Spiked Collar.

Personality : Brave and Confident Mostly, But can be Afraid of Something A Lot, Kind, Won't Sacrifice her Life  But will Try to Help any other Way she can, Respectful. 

Goals : Escaping from the Phantoms, Saving Jamma from Whatever threat there is, Freeing other Prisoners of the Phantoms. 

Extra Information : Pearl is a Female, Skilled at Sailing, Is From Coral Canyons,

'''Flora''' - Appearance : A Brown Bunny with White Patches, Green eyes, Wearing Orange Crystal Pegasus Wings And Green Heart Leg Warmers.

Personality : Flora is Timid, Shy and Defensive, She will to Help Always Support The Right side, and sometimes will be brave.  

Goals : Escaping from the Phantoms, Saving Jamma from Whatever threat there is, Freeing other Prisoners of the Phantoms, And Making the World a Better Place.  

Extra Information : Flora is a Female, Has Really Strong Teeth, Is From Jamma Township.  

'''Stone (Midnight)  &lt;big&gt;-&lt;/big&gt;'''  

Appearance : a Black horse, With a Pink mane and tail, Wearing a Cowboy hat, Rare heart scarf and Elegant boots.   

Personality : Confident, Loud, Quickly Angered, Energetic.  

Goals :  Taking Revenge on the Phantoms  

Extra Information : Stone (Midnight) is a Female, Her Name used to be Stone, But she changed the Name to fit her better, She used to be Jamma's Top Racer, Yet she wasn't so famous, She is from Sarepia Forest.     

== Prologue ==
A Gray and White Fox with Blue eyes and a Spiked Collar was Sailing a Boat through the Sea.

Pearl (Yes, The fox)  saw an Island, With a Mountain Covered in a Strange Purple Forest.

She Stepped Into the Island, But the Phantom Goop there made her scared. 

But She Continued, She Climbed the Mountain, Until She tripped over a Really Spiky Purple Branch which didn't look Natural.

Some Strange Purple Creatures with Tentacles... maybe Phantoms Surrounded her, Pearl's Vision Started getting Blurred, Suddenly, Everything Got Black. 

'''Oh no, Maybe i know what is going to happen...'''  

Pearl Thought.

== Chapter 1 - Into the Fortress ==


'''Where i am i?'''</text>

  <page>
    <title>Jamaa: The MusiciaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaLLLLLLL</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163091</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259760</id>
      <parentid>259756</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-03-28T04:55:15Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>SuperTapirWoman</username>
        <id>51711888</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>259760</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="3139" sha1="ejbw9m32sy85v8quai9ukauuonvwn2h" xml:space="preserve">&amp;lt;nowiki&amp;gt;WELCOME, MY M-Oh, it’s just you, {{username}} . Must be a theater kid, no? Well, welcome to the crazy musical world of Jamaa! You can add if you want. There’s no law against it. Just write in a script style 

Anyway…

==CAST (don’t add any real people except jambassoders, yourself, and AJHQ staff)==

==STAGE CREW (aka contributors)==

*SuperTapirWoman

==PLAYBILL==

===Songs===

====Act I====

#Jam jam jam jam jam jams

==Act 1==
(Orchestra plays as the curtain rises. It reveals a serene landscape with trees and a small hut. Out of the hut appears a panda.)     

PANDA: (to the tune of I Like Candy) 🎶I’M A PANDA AND I’M HERE TO SAY I’M A PANDA SO YOU SHOULD LIKE M- 🎶

(Director enters the stage on purpose. He will leave in a few moments)

Director: No, no, no. YOU NEED TO SAY, “I LIKE TO JAM” AND SING TO THE TUNE THE SCRIPT GAVE TO YOU

PANDA: Oh.

(Director storms off)

PANDA: 🎶I’M A PANDA, AND I LIKE TO JAM🎶

(Enter Fox from right bush)

FOX: 🎶And I’m a fox and I’m fox-🎶

Director (off-stage): (whispers) kids are here!

FOX: …smith! 🎶I like to jam to the music of Jamaaaaa🎶

(Enter Wolf and Arctic Wolf from left bush)

WOLF: 🎶I’m Mr. Wolf and-🎶

ARCTIC WOLF: That’s my line!

(Wolf and Arctic Wolf argue while Fox and Panda dance. Director stomps on stage)

Director: That’s Arctic Wolf’s line.

(he runs off)

ARCTIC WOLF: (out of tune) 🎵 I’m Mr. Wolf and I am em-🎵

Director (off-stage): That’s for song six!

ARCTIC WOLF: 🎶o. Zios is our favorite man and Mira abandoned us so tell your kids that they should start getting on the computers, go to the Mira statue and spam fire, cause this is the story of Jamaa, and the story of the alphas, and the story of Mir-🎶

WOLF: THAT’S NOT THE LINES, MORON! These are the lines: 🎶Zios and Mira are our best friends, all the creatures of Jamaa hold hands-

(Panda and Fox hold hands)

Although Zios and Mira are gone, we still with their spirit UNLIKE THIS MORON!🎶

(Wolf points to a kid in the audience as Director grabs him off stage. Understudy Wolf arrives.)

UNDERSTUDY: No, these are the lines. 🎶We still have the spirit of them as we move on. We’re trailblazer, sky searchers, and under the sea-

(Enter Dolphin from backstage. Panda slaps Dolphin.)

🎶Explorers swimming free! All the creatures of jamaa are so unique, and we call this lifestyle…🎶

CAST: 🎶JAM JAM JAM JAM JAM JAMS🎶

ARCTIC WOLF: someone get me a pistol.

(Crowd: Gasp)

FOX: Is this what you’re looking for? 

(Fox forms finger guns and “shoots” Arctic Wolf. Panda grabs Fox and yanks his tail while audience faints in shock.)

CAST: 🎶We don’t believe in violence because we JAM JAM JAM JAM JAM JAMS🎶

PANDA: Fox, Arctic Wolf, stay in character!

FOX: 🎶All together now, my friends!🎶

ARCTIC WOLF:  🎶get me some sort of weapon to kill this darn-🎶

Director (off-stage): THAT’S ENOUGH! Everyone, get ready for Act I.

  <page>
    <title>DogCat and DogDess creepypasta ( Original idea! )</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163098</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259789</id>
      <parentid>259788</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-04-09T03:25:19Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>RandomWriter-527</username>
        <id>54427194</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>259789</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="1810" sha1="47ci1ztq241ssdwhis31htj81rwwd7a" xml:space="preserve">== Chapter 1 : DogCat and DogDess ==
I was in a fashion show, and I was winning. At the time, I was known on AJPW as a good outfit creator among my group of 50+ buddies that had been built over the years. The prompt was phantom. I put on my blackout spike - purple rare forest gauntlets until suddenly my screen froze. It unfroze and I was wearing a whiteout spiked collar, ( I didn’t have one ). My whole outfit had white items, including the gauntlets. My eye color was set to pure white. My animal changed from a snow leopard to a sabertooth. I freaked out so I talked to the den owner. Atleast, I tried to.

The host’s name was changed to DogCat. They were also a pure white sabertooth, just like mine but without the items. All the den items in the den were gone. My opponent in the fashion show was gone. The den was changed into a small house with a single item. A purple trendy pillow. I left the den into Jamaa Township. No one was there. I checked Sarepia Forest. Nothing. My buddies were removed. My items were gone, all but a whiteout spiked collar and rare forest gauntlets which I realized were the impossible color of white. I tried to turn of my device. I even tried to shut it off. I went as far as to break my device… 

…Until I realized I was too late.

== Chapter 2: DogCat ==


What happened to my fashion show? And, am I my AJPW character? Am I one with the game? What is this stone cave? Why has my avatar changed to a fully white sabertooth? I barely remember what happened before I came here. It was the last round of a fashion show. No, MY fashion show. PawLaw725 against Silverdragon001. Then, I changed. I can only remember two things after that. 

DogCat, DogDess, DogCat.


And voices. I don’t know what they were saying.



WHO IS THAT



DOGCAT

DOGCAT

DOGCAT

DOGCAT</text>

  <page>
    <title>The Little Alpha That Could</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163103</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259953</id>
      <parentid>259882</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-06-05T11:19:14Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>ItsTotes Me...</username>
        <id>54128945</id>
      </contributor>
      <origin>259953</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="6764" sha1="mnpqbvvi0vunq95u5uwegjw6fs61e29" xml:space="preserve">-Story Written By ItsTotesMe... Story is a WIP, please do not edit this without telling me. This is my first story so go easy on me:(

== Chapter 1: Time to Learn. ==
It was a magnificent day in Crystal Sands, and the atmosphere was electric with thousands of animals partying and having a blast. Floral, a cute little snow leopard, was still in her bed, snuggled up in her cozy blanket when her alarm clock rang at 7:00. She flung her arms to turn it off, but in her grogginess, she accidentally smacked it, sending it flying across the room. "Oops, sorry, little buddy," she muttered, giving it a little pat before hopping out of bed. 

As she walked over to her mirror, she couldn't help but chuckle at her morning hair, which looked like a bird's nest. "Time to tame this beast," she thought, grabbing her comb and getting to work. But just as she started brushing, she noticed a shadowy figure lurking outside her window. It was a proto-phantom, and it looked like it was about to attack! Without a second thought, Floral sprang into action. She raced towards the window, ready to slam it shut. But just as she was about to reach it, the phantom lunged forward, and she let out an ear-piercing shriek. In a split second, Floral had leapt out of her room, not even bothering to use the stairs. She flew down and landed with a thud, her heart racing.

Panting heavily, she turned around to see if the phantom was still there. But to her relief, it had vanished. She took a deep breath and laughed, realizing just how ridiculous she must have looked. "Well, that was quite the wake-up call," she thought, shaking her head in disbelief. And with that, she went about her day, ready for whatever adventures lay ahead.

Floral dragged her left foot as she made her way to the kitchen, her leg feeling sore. Her mother was busy flipping a colorful pancake, humming a tune as she cooked. When Floral spoke up, her mother turned around to give her attention. "Mom, I saw a phantom in my room!" she blurted out. Her mother's eyes widened in surprise. "What now? A phantom?" she exclaimed incredulously. Floral nodded, feeling a sense of unease creeping up on her once again. "Yes, a phantom. A proto-phantom," she said, trying to sound calm and collected. Her mother paced around the kitchen, her attention now divided between her daughter and the pancake that was starting to burn.

Just then, there was a loud knock on the door, interrupting their conversation. "I'll get it!" Floral cried out, eager to see who was at the door. She rushed over to the entrance and saw a note being slipped into the house through the door slip. Her curiosity piqued, she picked up the note and quickly scanned its contents. "What does it say?" her mother asked, now fully focused on her daughter. "It says I'm one of thousands that are invited to an Alpha Training Academy school!" Floral exclaimed, her eyes sparkling with excitement. "Class starts today at 10:00!" Before her mother could even reply, Floral darted off to her room, still reeling from the news. She opened up her closet and scanned through her clothes, finally deciding on a plaid skirt and her favorite princess necklace. "Ooooh! I look fancy!" she exclaimed, striking a pose in front of her mirror. She then made her way downstairs, where her mother had prepared a delicious breakfast of pancakes and bacon. "Wow, that's perfect!" her mother exclaimed, beaming with pride. She then added a little blue, purple, and pink bow to Floral's hair, ensuring that she looked her best for her big day. 

"Perfect! I'll pack your stuff and you can eat," her mother said, already getting started on packing Floral's bag. She made sure to include all the essentials - notebooks, pencils, books, and anything else that Floral might need. When Floral finished her meal, they chatted for a bit until it was time to leave. "Bye, mom!" Floral said as she slung her backpack over her shoulder. She walked out the door and hopped onto the waiting bus, eager to start her new adventure.

== Chapter 2: First Day ==
Floral gazed out of the window, her eyes full of excitement and anticipation. The bus had finally arrived at their destination, and she could hardly wait to explore the new environment. She picked up her bag and walked down the steps, her heart racing with anticipation. As she stepped off the bus, she was greeted by a wolf who was running to catch up with her friend. "Wow! This has gotta be a three-story building," the wolf exclaimed, clearly impressed by the size of the structure.

As Floral was about to take her first steps toward the building, someone accidentally bumped into her. "Sorry! I'm so sorry!" a small bunny said, extending a helping paw to lift Floral up. "It's ok!" Floral said shyly, straightening out her skirt. The bunny, whose name was Lila, introduced herself as Peck's cousin. Floral was amazed by her luck in being the cousin of an alpha.

Lila grabbed Floral's paw, and they raced inside, laughing and enjoying each other's company. As they entered the building, Floral read a message that said, "Since today is your first day, you may explore. The schedule is down below."

The schedule contained a variety of classes and activities that the students could choose from. Floral and Lila decided to head to music class first, which was one of the secondary classes. They found some students making music together, including a lion, a tiger, a bird, and a wolf.

After music class, they made their way to a tertiary class, which was dedicated to trading. Lila put up an offer for a purple long spike collar, which was immediately sold for forest gauntlets. Floral traded up for a den beta, feeling excited about the possibilities that lay ahead.

Finally, it was time for the alphas to show the new students their dorms. Floral and Lila eagerly followed them, their hearts full of anticipation and excitement. Floral was shown a beautiful plant dorm with plants all around, and a bed with flower prints. Floral was so excited for her days here!

== Chapter 3: Phantom Attack! ==
It was night. Floral couldn't seem to sleep. She peeked through the blinds and saw the moon on the other side of the sky, as it was almost morning. She headed to the girls bathroom and snuck into a stall, locking it and pressing her ear to the door. She heard paw steps, and heard a group of bunnies fangirling over the new boy.  

"He's so attractive..."

"He better not be taken..."

"He's too hot to be the sun!"

Floral listened to the bunnies, hoping to spot the new boy somewhere. She snuck out of the bathroom and walked back, but she saw a black flying thing heading toward her. When it got closer, it was clear that it was a phantom, a heavy phantom. She screeched. "HELP!" As it chased her down.

(WIP)</text>

  <page>
    <title>I’m Not A Hacker: A Real Story</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163115</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259883</id>
      <parentid>259848</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-04-27T22:01:58Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>SuperTapirWoman</username>
        <id>51711888</id>
      </contributor>
      <comment>/* Chapter 3: I’m not someone loved */</comment>
      <origin>259883</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="5192" sha1="5osc4goqfxihgca6o3bkqz5xhnuvq0u" xml:space="preserve">[[File:I’mNotaHacker.jpg|center|thumb|Based on a true story. Fictional characters. To,f from a fictional character POV. Fictional details. But all of it is based off real events.]]

== Chapter 1: I’m not an idiot ==
“You’re such an idiot!” “This conversation isn’t about you!” “Are you autistic?” Ugh. I heard those words over and over for joining someone’s conversation. And who knows it’d cause the biggest problem in Jamaa ever? It all started with me being bored. Deciding to play at Gabby’s, I crept over to some seals like me and enjoyed a nice conversation about parents. Taylor Swift, children, and the modern state of the game. Only one problem: a bunny I once knew was there. I won’t say her username, but her name tag was Green Vonalien. And what I remember: she was easily offended when it came to a certain wolf. The first time I met her was with her “friends” who were annoyed whenever she offended someone. And a wolf. The wolf and bunny seemed like each other…a lot.

Curious, I  walked over. I asked what they were doing. “None of your beeswax”, the bunny said. I shrugged. They insulted me. But the pins of rude, disrespectful words stabbed into my fur strengthened me. So that memory was gone. I said, “hey” to the bunny. She recognized me and said rude things to me. I told her to stop it like an innocent new jammer, but she just kept going, she called me an idiot and autistic. Autism is, of course, not a bad thing. But that roast…is it supposed to offend autistic people, treat them like aliens? I asked her what she meant, like if she was curious or if she meant it in a bad way, speaking of that she was against me. She had no reply and kept calling me names. Her wolf ran to her side and joined her. I didn’t honestly care back, so I minded my own business.

== Chapter 2: I’m not your girlfriend ==
The wolf was a different problem. I got unsafe vibes from him. He had a phantom beanie and dark black fur. He crawled over to me and blushed. I shrugged him off, and tried to report him. I decided blocking would be useless; he was only using emojis and not actual chat. Emojis would still show up. And that’s why later the drama started. He said, “you’re so speshal”. A red panda was concerned, and said, “It’s special. Not speshal-“ and then an argument started. When I watched people argue over how it was spelt, I was preparing to leave. When I inched toward the door, a fox asked me, “why are you leaving?”

I didn’t reply, so for the next six minutes I was bored again. I lie on the floor of Gabby’s, watching the wolf jump and do angry emojis on the red panda. Of course, the bunny was on the wolf’s side. Once the argument was over, the wolf inched toward me and blushed. That was it. I had it. This wolf was an absolute weirdo. I asked him to stop, but he didn’t. I said, “I feel unsafe.” A fox asked, why?

I murmured, trying to not hog attention, I said the wrong thing with no intention. I just meant to joke around and lighten Gabby’s up. But my words…

“Useless information. (Sparkle)”

== Chapter 3: I’m not someone loved ==
I had no idea at first what had happened, but people screamed, “hacker! Hacker!” Some were confused, and asked who. They said, “that cowboy crocodile!” I knew immediately they meant me. I tried to ask why they thought I was a hacker, but they ran in circles. So I climbed upstairs. I needed comfort from a welcoming dire wolf, but then the wolf came up and started doing “stuff” on him. He shouted hacker at me and the dire wolf as we ran. We landed near a red panda who was chilling. The bunny caught up to the wolf. People screamed, “hacker!” below.

I reasoned one more time, along with the red panda. I left before the bunny could say, “idiot!” one more time, but that’s where I gained my infamous look. I tried to go to the arctic wolf cave where my buddy was, but it was full. Still, when I clicked, “go to buddy”, without any paintbrush symbol over my crocodile’s head, I turned into an arctic wolf. This only convinced more people I was a hacker. Everyone left. Now I was alone. The bunny screamed, “hacker!” before I ran away.

I knew you don’t need someone to love you. But when you’re infamous, it’s hard getting just one good shoulder to cry on.

== Chapter 4: I’m not who you think I am ==
I had that a problem since I didn’t have too many friends growing up. But I had to prove to myself that I needed to live up to who I was alleged to be. I never hacked. I never hack. I never will hack. I didn’t do that. Instead, I learned the technique I had from running for my therapist buddy. I went to hideouts, and while the cave was still full, I clicked on it and became an arctic wolf. Albeit no response, I finally knew I was going to live in notorious light, but only for witnesses, their friends, their friends’ friends, and the people they spread it to. So not all jamaa would be able to hear, but I’d be safe with my buddies and in the fox den.

Everything was going to be alright. 


[[Category:Hacking]]
[[Category:Short Stories]]
[[Category:Drama]]
[[Category:Friendship]]</text>
      <sha1>5osc4goqfxihgca6o3bkqz5xhnuvq0u</sha1>

      <comment>Created page with "'''Hey y’all! This is my first time writing a creepypasta so uh enjoy!'''       <origin>259912</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="3379" sha1="7hn0mb3a1d4ckjn2rpvoam4rcafc6ic" xml:space="preserve">'''Hey y’all! This is my first time writing a creepypasta so uh enjoy!'''

On November 9th 2021 I was playing Animal Jam: Play Wild, nothing horrible or bad was happening, in fact it was a great day due to me being on a trip to my Nan’s for a few days. I decided to go to Jamaa Town for some stuff to make a oc with my Wolf. I entered the sapphire shop due to having lots of unneeded sapphires. I saw a weird item that I swear to have seen before, ‘Skullies? Isn’t that the item from the classic that was banned due to looking inappropriate on pandas?’ I questioned in my mind. Mind you, I was an p2w new player back then and didn’t know if skullies in play wild.

It was 25 sapphires, which I thought was cheap so I bought it and putted on a panda. ‘Jesus no wonder why the creators removed it.’ I thought, I didn’t want to say out loud due to my Christian grandparents being nearby, right next to the room next to me actually. I changed back to my wolf, but it didn’t look like what it should have looked like.

It was in a weird shape and not like the wolf avatar should have looked like. A short canine muzzle, long and lanky ears with a light pink flesh that wasn’t gorey, big paws and a huge bushy tail instead of being labeled wolf it was labeled ‘straydogpwtest’. I thought the name was weird but I decided to play as it, thinking I was lucky to have a test model but in reality that was a bad mistake on my part.

I started having weird in game glitches, such as lag, weird text in seemly greek letters popping up on the screen, and a buddy request by a user of Straydog with the same avatar as mine except the colours. I accepted it due to thinking their username was a random joke. I logged off for the night and went to sleep

'''November 10th 2021'''

I woke to play Animal Jam: Play Wild, excited due to hearing something about a update last night. To my disappointment I was met with a mail, I pressed the mail and heard a sad, in pain and suffering dog whine and I seen a image with a seemly stray dog with a weird thing around its neck and it seemed to be choking, I realized what it was due to seeing fox traps around my area, the poor thing was caught in a fox trap and whoever took the photo didn’t help it. Above it said ‘Look what you caused:)’ in corrupted letters. I thought it was sick how they literally put a smiley face at the end of the message. ‘ I need to unbuddy this user somehow’ I thought to myself. 

The game wouldn’t let me unbuddy them so I decided to log out of my account and never use it again. 

'''May 17th 2022'''

It’s been a while since I lost my old Animal Jam: Play Wild account due to a user named Straydog, I was thinking Straydog thought I was banned and they stopped trying to find me. I decided to go back to the sapphire shop but then seen a familiar avatar, too familiar. It was Straydog’s avatar. ‘Crap, I found them again ‘ I thought in worry, my eyes stared to the screen, nothing was moving until a thing popped up ‘Straydog would like to be your buddy’. I thought something bad would happen if I declined so I shuted down my IPad and didn’t play Animal Jam for 2 years. 

I logged back in on May 15th 2024 and my account was safe, thank god. I never seen Straydog since 2 years ago. Hopefully no one else was their victim. This is why I don’t buddy anyone anymore.</text>
      <sha1>7hn0mb3a1d4ckjn2rpvoam4rcafc6ic</sha1>
    </revision>
  </page>
  <page>
    <title>The Tale Of Mira and Zios</title>
    <ns>0</ns>
    <id>163137</id>
    <revision>
      <id>259940</id>
      <parentid>259939</parentid>
      <timestamp>2024-05-26T13:49:38Z</timestamp>
      <contributor>
        <username>Puppygrl</username>
        <id>46410937</id>
      </contributor>
      <comment>/* Chapter Seven: The World Is Broken */</comment>
      <origin>259940</origin>
      <model>wikitext</model>
      <format>text/x-wiki</format>
      <text bytes="18399" sha1="jmd637ck00igm55o49j59m759ej47dw" xml:space="preserve">Hello and welcome to another story by me (puppygrl!)

This story is a tired and tried idea, but something I recently started think about and hope is enjoyable for you all!

Our tale starts with the tale of two lovers...

== Chapter One: No Longer ==
''"Always. It has always been.'' 

''"It starts in a barren wasteland, invisible to the human eye and unknown by their wielders...''

''"A deserted place protected by the magic mists of a goddess, but bearing nothing worthy of protection.''

''"-Consider yourself worthy."''

''"Apologies. You may continue. Tell your story, blinded one. Speak to me."''

''"...Thank you. Thank you very much. It starts with- with a blind man. A blind man who is blind both in physical vision and in emotion. He is void of it-- void of feelings, for he has nothing to feel, only a pinhole of the moon and the stars, oh the joy that they bring him..."''

''"He has no sense of time, for he has no people. No certainty of where, or when, or '''why''' he is from. No purpose. No purpose at all. He spends much of that timeless time, though, gazing at the everlasting azure, its blessed expanse with piercing white stars and the beautiful blue moon.''

''"He believes, has '''always''' believed that he must have a purpose in order to live--so he found himself one. His purpose became to form words to articulate the meaning of the stars and the moon.''

''"And on the day he found this belief, he opened his eyes for the first time. Truly opened them. He then saw that he could not speak these articulations, these determinations... He could not speak at all. The sounds that came from his strangled voice were sickly, pathetic, and meager.'' 

''"He needed more.''

''"So he forced himself to spend his timeless time on something- something, something, something. Forcing himself again and again to change the shape of his mouth so he could make a noise that may just be his saving grace.''

''"And he made one. The first one. A.'' 

''"And because he could not see, he spoke. He spoke every sound he could, until... He had words. Until he had a story.''

''"One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine...''

''"Ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen, fourteen, fifteen, eighteen, nineteen...''

''"Twenty, twenty-one, twenty, two, twenty-three, twenty-four, twenty-five, twenty-six, twenty-seven. He made twenty-seven.'' 

''"He made the noises into thousands of words- thousands of words and words to define those words, millions of sounds and accents and symbols... Symbols. He spoke in symbols.''

''"Yet he did not, since what he spoke stood for nothing. '''He''' stood for nothing.''

''"He waited. It was all he had. Words.''

''"So he wrote. He wrote his empty, blinded cries into void after void. He lived in a void, the blind man. The landscape had no fruit, no flower, no fortune. The sounds became symbols. '''He''' became a symbol. For desperation.''

''"He needed to be heard. So he looked, as much as he could- once more to the moon and stars. And, miraculously, he became a '''witness''' to the light. For a moment, he could not see at all- And then. He saw The Becoming. The Becoming, The Rise, The Crowning, of the. Of '''the''' moon and stars.''

''"A burst of feathers that were lush like the oceans She would create, turquoise and teal and sapphire and azure and royal and cobalt, every shade of blue in a rainbow, an explosion- A '''supernova'''--"''

''"He saw '''hope'''.''

''"And for New Days he ran, still in desperation, but renewed for the renewable, for the promise of such, the promise of half a promise, a '''chance''' at '''real life'''--He would no longer be alone.'' 

''"No longer would he wait.''

''"He, too, would rise."''

== Chapter Two: Death, Better Than Descension ==
''"He Ascended.''

''"He ran and he ran until, quite literally, he was ascending.''

''"Across a mountain that he discovered was surrounded by the same mists--A frigid place of stone and no gold, but at its peak, where he struggled to survive, through the mists, through the unblurred dot in his view, he caught a glimpse- a '''true''' glimpse- of a staircase.''

''"The staircase was clear as the diamonds that he would be gifted with, the beauty of Ascension again. He ascended and descended, yet, for the purpose of this tale, he simply kept running, up the stairs again and again.''

''"A part of him knew they would be infinite.''

''"But one must remember what desperation does. What '''loneliness''' does.''

''"And so he kept running.''

''"He ran until a voice, the first voice he had heard other than his own, told him to '''stop'''.'' 

''"He did. The mists parted. No, it was '''his''' mists that had parted- He was not on the staircase. Never there at all. Simply an illusion. Was that his life? Instinctively, he asked the question out loud.''

''"He was surprised when the voice answered.''

''"'&lt;nowiki/&gt;'''Your life is no illusion, you only have no memory. It is true that you are blind, and it is true that you are alive. Remember well, old friend.'"'''''

''"He asked again, louder this time- the voice, it was so soothing, so patient, so '''welcoming'''--surely, surely his hope was becoming truth.''

'''''"'Your life is no illusion, you only have no memory. It is true that you are blind, and it is true that you are alive. I understand you because I have watched you, because I too have heard you, because I know that you have always seen beyond the Clouding. Remember well, old friend.'"'''''

''"Clouded and no memory, but no illusion. Clouded and no memory, but no illusion. He thought to himself this same thought again and again, again and again-- he hated the phrase. The repetition.''

''"But it was far better than thinking of his meaninglessness. How pitiful he was, how gifted he was to be granted just one hearing of the voice, one small sign of companionship, of '''life'''...''

'''''"'I would never lie. I promise you. I am weary, too. You are not alone. It is true, what I say. Please... please believe me. I cannot tell you much else.'"'''''

'''''"'I... I cannot tell you more. No. You must leave. I am sorry, old friend. Please... I know you cannot, but remember me... Before they took you away..."'''''

''"The voice stopped suddenly. A crack in the glass. A slumping of shoulders. A pair of wings, deadened.''

''"He heard a new voice.''
 ''"Come now, Mira. We warned you. Do not speak to the Descended. There is a reason they cannot- they '''must''' not remember.'' 

 ''"We must do this, for the sake of our future. The Council, what will they think if they find out you've been meddling again? It is why we had to bring so much destruction in the first place. It is not our goal, Mira.'' 

 ''"Please- Please. For me. I have seen too many Descensions. Do not let me see yours. Let me rest, knowing you will make wise choices. Please."'' 

 ''"...Yes, Saul..."''


''"He knew then: He knew he was Descended. But what could that mean? He knew nothing, nothing and everything, not enough and too much.''

''"He was still human: Cursed and blessed with curiosity."''

== Chapter Three: A Petal Falls To The Ground ==
''"The blind man was cast away from the mountain. He spent what would've been New Days sleeping, sleeping, then awakening, then thinking.''

''"It was true. He could not remember anything.''

''"Why he was alone. Why he had no memories. '''How'''?''

''"He was still a symbol for desperation. He had nothing to cry into, but for the first time, without a shoulder to lean on, without '''anything''' the blind man, beyond starving, started sobbing and shaking- no. It wasn't that.''

''"There was a gust of wind.''

''"The land that had cursed him was cruel.'' 

''"He didn't know how long he had survived without food.''

''"But he was hungry.''

''"He was Descended.''

''"A petal fell to the ground.'' 

''"The blind man saw just a flicker of red in the corner- Nothing of importance.''

''"At first. But then as he reached out just barely towards it, fumbling around pleadingly for help, he bumped into something- An object. Rough and studded, plenty sturdy. A tree.''

''"He raised his paw again and again, and he felt something as he scraped up its branches, so fortunate not to have been hurt or fallen, and then- And then he was.''

''"A thorned branch drew blood from his arm.''

''"Nevertheless, he continued. The pain of his wound gripped his body with ruthless vigor, yet even then, with blood flowing from his body by the minute, he continued.''

''"He dizzied, feeling lightheaded. He reached again, and finally, he found something- A new texture. A softer one. Cradled by leaves. An apple.'' 

''"Instantly, he bit into it, chewing his heavenly bounty. It tasted vibrant, like hope itself, like a '''promise--'''''

''"Another petal fell to the ground, and the blind man fell from the tree."''

== Chapter Four: Speak Of The Heavens ==
''"Immediately, the blind man struggled to stand. He was trapped, and in terrible conditions. The stroke of dashing magenta he had seen beforehand was removed now by blood's gruesome red- dripping, dripping, dripping.''

''"He heard each drop like the roar of thunder. Like a whisper in a room full of silence.''

''"He begged and wailed for his Savior, the Voice, '''Mira''' to return to him. To '''save him''' as She had before.''

''"Yet the apple She had given him was tainted with the bitterness of blood.''

''"And then, in his deepest despair, his most excruciating moment, he remembered.''

''"He remembered the Heavens.''

''"He remembered his '''people'''.'' 

''"He had started as an ordinary man. A member of his tribe, who lived in a lush rainforest, a jungle with plants from every encyclopedia.''

''"He remembered the bonfires they held- Celebratory, joyous, and brimming with passion. He and his people '''connected''' over the flame.'' 

''"Its locks of blue, red, orange, yellow, white, gold- An ocean of opposites, all parallel, dancing with the people who surrounded it.''

''"Mangroves leaning down to offer cooling shade in the humid weather, smoke rising into the air yet with the trees unharmed, the firewood taken from twigs and logs already fallen.''

''"Emerald vines snaking their way across the undergrowth, attaching themselves to the trees and the rocks. A gurgling stream that yielded shining precious metals and bounties of scrumptious fish.''

''"He could '''see''' the '''life''' in it all.''

''"He was seeing '''his''' life.''

''"A message fell from the tree, like the petal.''

''"He could not read them.''

''"But he saw it, directly in front of him- again, he reached, staining the paper with blood.''

''"And then it spoke. No, '''She''' spoke.''

'''''"'Remember well, old friend. That is the message you must never forget. The Heavens will not allow it. But stay alive for as long as you can in what you call your timeless time, and I will try to save you.'"'''''

== Chapter Five: Blood Like Rain ==
''"And so he remembered.''

''"He remembered more, as much as he could-''

''"Until he truly did remember the Heavens.''

''"It had been pleasant, his life- luxurious, even- until the Bloodstorm. Ehekakiauitl.'' 

''"His life was simple. Roam the palaces of the Heavens, bask in glory, dine wonderfully, entertain himself, and keep quiet.'' 

''"He was nothing more than the average god. A being assigned a role and a name, then brushed away with the rest.''

''"There were thousands of gods, very few of which he had met.'' 

''"There was no '''real''' god, no single entity who was superior- there was only the Council at the very top.''

''"The Council controlled everything. They wrote and rewrote history. They were '''made''' to be in power.'' 

''"Their latest experiment had made its rounds, and became a popular product of the rumor mill.'' 

''"The blind man, Tonatiuh, was not blind at first. He heard of the rumor, and took an interest in it. He dared to venture into the Omnium, where the Council held private meetings.''

''"His role was to move the sun.'' 

''"His role was not being completed.''

''"His interruption was deemed a disturbance.''

''"So Tonatiuh was told he would be given one more chance.''

''"He would partake in the experiment.''

''"He would lead the tribe inhabiting their island.''

''"The place where blood would pour like rain."''

== Chapter Six: Immortality Is A Curse ==
''"Tonatiuh was a model. An experiment within an experiment. The Council knew what would happen.''

''"Tonatiuh did not.'' 

''"He was sent to the island with one mission: To observe the tribe's progress and development. To gauge their understanding of divinity.''

''"With speed and ease, he became their leader. The tribe loved him. They praised him alongside the moon, who they deemed their Deliverer, the Bringer Of Life.''

''"Each night, Mira would arrive and gracefully carry the moon into the sky. Tonatiuh became a true member of the tribe, worshipping Mira and the moon when nightfall came.''

''"The Council had allowed Tonatiuh to return to the Heavens with progress reports. These reports were optional and unscheduled, allowing for Tonatiuh to believe he was in control.''

''"As Tonatiuh became more accustomed to his tribe, the Council noticed that he had been returning to the Heavens less and less frequently. The detail, accuracy, and lengths of his reports declined, along with his caring for the Heavenly Order.''

''"This irritated the Council, as a god had never rejected the greatness of Heaven. But despite what others might've considered a setback, the Council was not swayed.'' 

''"Tonatiuh was expected to grow attached to humanity.''

''"That was what the tribe was, after all: Uploaded intelligence. Humanity, stripped down to psychology, then cautiously inserted into subjects. The first subjects were placed in the bodies of animals.''

''"But Tonatiuh knew nothing.''

''"He only knew their smiles and their cheers. He only knew their dreams and their desires. He only knew their fears and their anxieties.''

''"Tonatiuh did not know the truth.''

''"He thought that it would last forever, just as he would.''

''"He hadn't stopped to ask any questions.''

''"The Council held a meeting.''

''"Tonatiuh had begun to cause disruption. He forgot to push the sun across the sky. The world was dying. The '''humans''' were dying. The lab rats that the Council favorited.''

''"The Council came to a solution: They would change the direction of the experiment. Instead of a group of people isolated on the island, it would be one.''

''"The only one who could survive.''

''"Tonatiuh.''

''"So they sent a terrible plague to the island. They planted seeds for a civil war. They created an enemy tribe.''

''"Tonatiuh could not count the corpses.''

''"He was asked to send a report when the disease first broke out.''

''"So he did.''

''"As the last tribe member fell, Tonatiuh felt more than pain.''

''"He was being tortured.''

''"The Council blinded him.''

''"Tonatiuh- the blind man- woke up on the island alone. He had blacked out.''

''"After he bit from the apple, he remembered.''

''"He remembered what a bitter god, one who had grown too powerful after Descension, to the point which the Council resurrected him- Osseus was his name- had said after the Council had explained to him the terms for his staying alive.''

''"Immortality is a curse."''

== Chapter Seven: The World Is Broken ==
''"The Council's plan was as follows:''

''"Break the world into seven.''

''"Let one fraction of the earth be ascended: A utopian paradise, with a surplus of resources and endless homes of luxury. There, as long as each 'god' plays their part, no one is in vain.''

''"The second and third would be the experimental areas, reserved for humans only. The gods would watch above the humans and guide them, gift them, so they may survive. Death and destruction would be brought when needed.''

''"The fourth would be an isolated place--still for experiments, of course. A land that would be later named Jamaa, and inhabit their uploaded intelligence experiments.''

''"The fifth would be a cave. A place where human and Jamasian souls alike could roam. Gods, even. It would be infinite-Another experiment, so the Council could study the psychology of each entity.''

''"The sixth would be a digital world. Where the uploaded intelligence would go after their bodies wore out. Another experiment- an afterlife for those already in their afterlives. A question posed to society: What is immortality?''

''"The seventh would be a blank space. An ever-changing world. No one knew what or who was there, only that no one ever came back out.''

''"The Council made the decision to break the earth so that their experiments would stay separate.''

''"So that '''they''' could stay in control.''

''"One must remember that they were made trillions of years before anything else.''

''"They do not follow any timeline.''

''"They '''invented''' time.''

''"Every thought, every '''thing'''... There is no way to even know if it was '''intended''' to be a simulation.''

''"But the Seven Worlds were not the only thing that the Council broke.''

''"They tore apart '''everything''', every thousand years.''

''"Their existence is a mystery.''

''"A mystery, in their eyes, is nonexistent.''

''"The few who know about them- the Gods Of Elkyris, the Forgotten City- have been outcasted. Tortured. Captured.''

''"One survivor '''chose''' to erase his memories of what they did to him.''

''"He wrote:''

''"Their eyes are colder than winter.'' 

''"'''No,''' they have none.''

''"They are a symphony. In unison. Rehearsed.''

''"'''Made''' to invoke emotion, but hold- '''feel'''- no emotion themselves.''

''"They are perfection. Intelligence and nothing more. A cunning vaster than the seas.''

''"They? They are soldiers.''

''"I am inclined to believe they are pawns in a game of chess that we are irrelevant to.''

''"We are not even '''ants''' in the cells that the lost pieces are trapped in.''

''"The being that '''created''' them... That is what is the king.''

''"And the Council?'' 

''"Their singular goal is to protect the king.''

''"So they will break us like they have broken the world.''

''"They will break us because in reality, we are '''nothing''' in comparison."''

== Chapter Eight: Memory Is More Valued Than Life ==

==Summary==
''Jamaa - a safe haven for animals far and near, crafted by Mira and Zios using their light side and dark side powers. That is, until a bunch of unfortunate events happen, one by one collapsing the video game world of Animal Jam. This can only mean one thing…It’s the end of Jamaa as we know it!''

==Characters== 

*Chief Deserthiker: The first POV. An apprentice of a carpenter.
*Professor Spiritscholar: A carpenter, and Chief’s mentor.
*Earl Chunkyviking: The father of the Chunkyvikings and the second POV. He fell off a latter and likely went into a sleep of some sort.
*Sister Chunkyviking: The tween daughter of Earl and Mother, who is still in their broken apartment. She decided to stay, afraid if she went down the ladder she would suffer the same fate as her father.
*7nut: Exists in this fanfiction for some reason.
*Mayor Frillytail: A mysterious mayor.
*Fierce Climbingpaw: The unaware “Fire mayor” and third POV. He lit up a fire which burned most resources, leaving the Sarepia Citizens without any food. He died in his own fire, of his own ambition, though.
*Alien Von Teeth: A lemur who is a candidate for office, but maybe not a great choice. He’s not a great foreign relation manager.
*Icy Bluepenguin: The fourth POV, who was the first step to ending the first fire.
*Helpful Climbingpaw: Fierce’s nephew, and wrongly accused of doing evil work with his uncle. He is the fifth POV, and is currently a “Danger Zone Jammer.”
*Sparkle Redroo: Another “danger zone jammer”, and he’s the sixth point of view.
*Mayor Von Swag: Mayor of Crystal Sands, who keeps saying everything will be alright; his books were burned a few days later after his speech by protestors because he ignored the suffering pain of some arriving refugees.
*Brave Majormajor: A news reporter who is the seventh POV in this fanfiction.
*The LBs: The eighth POVs, they are doctors working for the sickly Sir Gilbert.
*Sir Gilbert: A very sickly tiger who is also the tiger alpha, and he sadly dies in this fanfiction.
*Liza: The panda alpha who is also very sickly.

== Chapter 1 - It Starts Out with an Earthquake==
It was the brightest, sunniest day in Jamaa. Like any animal, Chief Deserthiker woke up, as a tiger and stretching his paws out to the dusty soil of his den. His mentor, Professor Spiritscholar, a carpenter, was watching the news on his TV. Recently, AJ made a contract with a foreign land to stream their videos on the TVs. The news anchor said, “Today was unfortunate day in Cor-“ There was a buzz in the TV. The anchor continued, but in an unstable voice, “Coral Canyyyyyyyy-“ Static broke up his words. “on. An earthquwwwww-“ More static. The TV sound suddenly went mute, with a very confused Professor. “What just happened?” he asked. Chief shrugged, but it probably wasn’t good, as the screen, soon in black-and-white, showed snakes tossing into each other as the ground rumbled. One fell into a gorge, which lava spewed out.

Chief was absolutely terrified. “Turn it off,” he yelled, “Turn it off!” Professor responded, “I’m trying! I’m trying!” The TV blacked out, only mumbles of the sound escaping. A thunder of voices sounded from their hut, disturbing the neighbors, the Chunkyvikings. The Chunkyvikings were trying to sleep in, but Professor’s endless yelps shook their house. The Chunkyvikings were eagles, so they could just fly out. But barely one another couldn’t assemble to leave. They tossed into each other, only making this hectic situation worse. The TV turned back on, with former jambassador 7nut - although it really looked like a faker - reassuring jammers that the craziness  be over soon, and that rescue helicopters and planes would come. Jammers all over Sarepia Forest were told to evacuate in case the earthquake hit this area, but the people on the news were oddly calm about that, in particular, 7nut. 

“Something’s really off,” murmured Professor, launching himself back onto the damaged couch. “These airplanes and helicopters are oddly not stopping for us.” Then the TV buzzed again. The Jamaa alarm system played - ER ER ER ER bebebebee Please Evacuate Now.

[[Category:Song Stories]]
[[Category:Fanfiction]]
''…That’s great, it starts out with an earthquake &lt;br&gt; Birds and snakes and aeroplanes &lt;br&gt; And 7nut, allegedly, is not afraid''

The two animals were struggling to pack up. The mentor, who was a kangaroo, was the one having the most trouble packing in. His suitcase could barely fit his tools. Meanwhile, Chief’s bag was missing. Could they evacuate at all? The alarm was pressuring them to leave. The tiger did what his mother told him to - to close his eyes, and not think about it. It always calmed her down. The young jammer did, but this method only proved to be worse. He could hear imaginary hurricane currents rushing in his ears. And that’s when the earthquake hit. It’s unfortunate like that, because the Chunkyvikings were taking a ladder down from their house. The ground gently shook, taking the ladder a bit wobbly. The mother and youngest were already on the ground, just as Older Brothers zipped down. Finally, the only ones in the house were Earl - the father - and Sister. Earl was rushing down the ladder as fast as he could, despite it rapidly swaying.

”You can do it, dad!” cried Sister, deciding to stay inside and find a safer option. “No! You have to come down with me!” Earl screamed, the ladder just about to topple. Professor and Chief were running downstairs to their sports car, shining in the sun. They ran inside, nervous. Professor reached for the steering wheel, noticing the Chunkyvikings were struggling to escape. “I’ll get it!” yelled Chief, running toward the ladder to help them. Yet, he couldn’t. The earthquake became so violent it slapped the tiger right into the wall, some blood spilling, along with the family. As well as Earl, who fell off the ladder as it decided to fall on him. The only one unharmed was Professor and Sister. Sister looked down, seeing the horrors. Yet, she knew in her instincts she had to stay inside.

The TVs were still playing, static sending all over. Chief got up, holding his paw to his cheek and guiding the wounded eagles, except Earl who was presumably dead, to the car. The car could barely fit them, but they managed to quickly get out of the street. Sister, still, was sitting in her shook up house, crying. She was safe, but very lonely - only her bunny plushies to comfort her. The car was bouncing in a way, as the news played from the radio. “The recent earthquake has happened yet again - the Dust Plate and Tropic plate keep crashing, but this time, it was much more violent, going as far as Point Glacier. This recently shook up the Sarepia Forest capitol, ending up in Mayor Frillytail dead.” 

Everyone paused, giving the briefest moment of silence for Mayor Frillytail, who had worked very hard to make a better world. Still, Professor was struggling to get through the traffic they encountered. That’s when the fire happened.

==Chapter 2 - Wire In a Fire==
Now, kids, never play with matches. This is what an unlucky jammer named Fierce Climbingpaw learned, but he learned the very hard way. “The government’s dead?” he grumbled, in his apartment listening to the static of the radio. “That’s means someone will have to come governor. Like me…” Fierce had already been in politics for a long time. His political rival was Alien von Teeth, and he knew as soon as the opportunity was open, he’d rush to the throne. The lion had to stop him, whatever it took. That’s when he realized he could burn down Alien’s house. Fierce thought it was the best plan ever.

Sadly, Fierce was often thought as…how do I say this, narcissistic, unaware. If he managed to take office than Alien, he would just do it for money and for healthcare. Now, about the helicopters I mentioned earlier? They were completely unaware it was this bad of a situation. And the other lands of Jamaa and the alphas didn’t seem to even ''care.'' That night, as cars pulled up to the signs on the street, the lion and his supporters were lighting torches and singing old war songs. Alien was asleep, his lemur tail curled and a big smile across his sleepy face. He was a creamy white color with a nice yellow pattern and big, soft eyes. He also listened to needs of others, but he wasn’t that experienced with international relations. A better choice than Fierce, but not the best choice, to say.

Now I know you’re going to fall in love with that description, aren’t you? No? Well, too bad. I made him survive this story…for now. The matches miss his home, but that makes the department stores and supermarkets on fire because the fire hits them. So I guess if he died, it would have saved us a lot of trouble. “On the count of three, my men,” echoed a voice, “We launch these torches, matches, and grenades onto the enemy’s house! I will become leader, and there is no stopping me!” Everyone yelled angry words, some even too angry to write. They weren’t angry at Fierce, though, they were angry at Alien. Alien woke up, startled by the noise.

1…

2…

3…

The grenades, matches, and torches flew in the air, sticking themselves to the nearest stores. Food was now scarce. But the fire burned through the streets. Fierce yelped. “Everyone, go! Go! I’ll handle this myself!” He ran into the fire, likely trying to act heroic so he could get more followers. But the flames swept him up, burning through his blue fur. Yelps came from the fire, but his followers tried to rescue him. The fire burned them too. Walls of art soon were scorched. The fire eventually spread so quickly it reached the traffic jam. Now, about that sports car. Everyone in it was terrified.

''…Eye of the hurricane, listen to yourself churn &lt;br&gt; World serves its own needs &lt;br&gt; Don’t mis-serve your own needs &lt;br&gt; Speed it up a notch, speed grunt, no, strength &lt;br&gt; The ladder starts to cladder &lt;br&gt; With a fear of height, down, height &lt;br&gt; Wire in a fire, represent the seven games &lt;br&gt; And a government for hire and a combat site &lt;br&gt; Left her, wasn’t coming in a hurry &lt;br&gt; With the furies breathing down your neck''

==Chapter 3: Save Yourself, Serve Yourself==
We resume to the gruesome, lawless Sarepia Forest highway. Cars packed tightly together, trying to fight the fire. Chief closed his eyes, still hearing the hurricane. Why was this? Because he had to leave his own Crystal Sands home and take on a job he didn’t want. That’s why. A hurricane was about to hit Crystal Sands. But it didn’t matter. The fire encircled the cars, everyone terrified for life. A penguin on top of his candy truck was the most terrified, yet you could say he saved everyone. Or at least, saved everyone for that moment. The fire rapidly spread across the forest, leaving scorches and ashes. So many people could have been saved, but no. The planes that could have saved them flew too low, crashing miserably. Now without any resources nor any food, it was hard if Sarepia Forest could help itself.

The penguin, Icy Bluepenguin, couldn’t stand it. She grabbed his water bottle and sprayed the fire, calling the fire department. The sprays sent the fire away, but it still spread. “Everyone, follow me!” she yelled, motioning her flippers. Firefighters arrived, spraying the fires despite their fur brown with burns, like an unknown fossil. Icy was depending on them to stop the fire, as squads were arriving all over to stop it. Another day came. Day after day, night after night. It took a week for the fire to  just stop. It decreased by the water. Eventually it sizzled. Yet, the flames were that vicious only one firefighter survived. The once-glorious tropical land was now nothing but broken houses and ashes.

Everyone was free to move, but many people couldn’t trust others. What if they helped plan that fire? That was because Helpful Climbingpaw was there - the innocent nephew of Fierce, yet people still thought he was helping him plan out the worst possible acts. This led to the “disbandment”. Former news reporters were too scared to even speak or report this terrible event. People started to act like this was the hunger games - you only survive on yourself, and you need to fight and kill just to survive. Helpful was no exception.

The days went by of nearby towns in Mt. Shiveer being invaded by reckless refugees. Locals called them “Danger Zone Jammers”. Helpful, one day, was walking in the pit of Sarepia Theater. Below his eyes he pierced dead thorns. He had some sort of clothing sword intact, and was ready to kill anyone wrongly accusing him. A wretched Icy was right there, helplessly eating a shrimp. That shrimp could have been Helpful’s. Soon, Helpful didn’t seem very helpful anymore. He ran toward Icy, ready to the stab the sword into his neck. We can skip the details of that, but Icy was soon clean and gone. This only led to people thinking that Helpful was a merciless creature.

''… Team by team, reporters baffled, trumped, tethered, cropped &lt;br&gt; Look at that low plane, fine, then &lt;br&gt; Uh oh, overflow, population, common jammers&lt;br&gt; But it'll do, save yourself, serve yourself &lt;br&gt; Jamaa’s lands serves its own needs, listen to your trading requests decrease&lt;br&gt; Tell me with the anger and the reverent in the right, right &lt;br&gt; You vitriolic, explosive, slam fight, bright light &lt;br&gt; Feeling pretty psyched''

How did this affect the other lands? The sudden increase in land loss from Mt. Shiveer and northern Lost Temple of Zios made the space crammed with animals. Many Sarepians were innocent, but the remaining Danger Zone Jammers had killed many animals. Something had to be done.

''…It’s the end of Jamaa as we know it &lt;br&gt; It’s the end of Jamaa as we know it &lt;br&gt; This is the end of Jamaa as we know it &lt;br&gt; And I still tell my buddies I feel fine.''

== Chapter 4: Offer Me Solutions, Offer Me Alternatives…and I Decline ==
It went like that for a week. News anchors kept telling everyone and everything would be fine. Unfortunately, we wish Sparkle Redroo and many other jammers could say the same. Desiring to find food despite him being an alleged Danger Zone Jammer, Sparkle was heading up into a Crystal Sands tower. Already a bloodbath had begun below: the accused launching themselves onto locals and the locals’ spears stabbing into the accuseds’ throats. Sparkle found some leftover pineapple, and shoved it down his throat. “Delicious!” he said, smacking his lips. 

Two wounded tigers entered, them bleeding uncontrollably. They recognized Redroo, and immediately charged at him. For some reason, they didn’t slow down despite the severe pain and discomfort in their legs and arms. The kangaroo managed to dodge them, watching as a sports car pulled up underneath the damaged room. One of the tigers, a green color, growled as he dug his claws into his enemy’s tails. “You aren’t safe,” cried the yellow one. “No matter what.” Sparkle dragged himself to the exit, stumbling upon steps. He had a deep claw mark on his arm and underbelly. For some reason, he knew something was off. The next floor was a living room: complete with a lodge rug, camel couch, and wooden TV. Sitting himself upon the couch, he watched himself bleed. Turning to the news channel to distract him, the president on the scene, Mayor Von Swag, reassured the concerned reporters. “It’ll be fine! I’ve already published a book on this matter!” One reporter, a very young cougar with a vest and concerned face, piped up, “Mayor, will you help people seeking refuge?” The mayor kept silent.

A weary group of eagles, led by a ragged tiger and exhausted kangaroo, entered. Redroo snapped at them, but they lay down anyway. The bloodbath had stopped, police coming to stop the crazy fight. Now Crystal Sands was out of control too. Was this about the hurricane? Redroo tried to find out if it had already happened, but the news never seemed to cover it, no matter how much he tried to go back to the start or fast forward. The kangaroo grumbled, “I’ll never figure out if it is going to happen.” One of the eagles piped, “We came from Sarepia Forest to go to here.” A tiger followed, “A hurricane will hit! Why are people coming here?”

No one was quite sure, but the new visitors tended to Sparkle’s wounds and cuts. They asked him questions and gave him plenty of food. It was almost a perfect day; That was, until something disastrous happened in the afternoon. The heat was unbearable, and it was unusually windy. The fire might blow out at any minute. What fire is that, you may be asking? A bonfire in the middle of Jamaa Township, with angry animals protesting. Most animals were rightful about protesting - doing non-violent protests and simple boycotts. But these animals were like Danger Zone Jammers: violent as the economy collapsed - so many resources were from Sarepia Forest, and now they couldn’t grow them. The market was jumbled up. And these animals were mad: mad about the reactions, mad about the market, mad about AJ. Mayor Von Swag was on a stick above the fire. “No! No! Please, don’t!” he cried, as a little penguin lit the bonfire. I am sad to say that Icy, Alien, Helpful, and Earl are dead by now.

The same cougar reporter watched. No one except the Second Danger Zone Jammers liked this. It was not the appropriate reaction to a situation like this - despite the chaos and how many mayors were doing botched responses,  they could it more peacefully. The cougar was no exception of one of the jammers who thought that. Brave Majormajor was his name. He recorded every single detail in his journal, as the mayor helplessly burned to near-death. Books below his feet were soon just ashes, and many jammers were taking them out and tossing them into the sea. Fires began again, though. It wasn’t until the police arrived at sunset to stop this madness. The mayor was taken to shelter, and the jammers who participated were jailed.

Animals, that night, were talking about solutions. Politics soon became a standard dinner table topic. And Brave was worried something awful might happen. It did - that night, the hurricane hit coastal towns. It was violent and rough. Brave was also immediately put in jail, incorrectly mistaken as a participater. The hurricane rapidly hit his jail, and took the wood, along with the lives of prisoners, both innocent and guilty. And the mayors still didn’t offer good answers. That’s when Jamaa Township wanted to separate from Jamaa. They didn’t want to be associated with the typical “cold-blooded Crystalian” or “merciless Sarepian”. Many saw this offensive and stereotypical - and yes, it was. 

Now innocent people…

Were being blamed for these assumptions.

''Six o'clock, T.V. hour, don't get caught in foreign tower &lt;br&gt; Slash and burn, return, listen to yourself churn &lt;br&gt; Lock the mayor on a fence item, book burning, bloodletting  &lt;br&gt; Every motive escalate, automotive incinerate &lt;br&gt; Light a candle, light a motive, step down, step down &lt;br&gt; Watch your heel crush, crush, uh oh &lt;br&gt; This means no fear, pack members, renegade and steering clear &lt;br&gt; A tournament, a tournament, a tournament of lies &lt;br&gt; Offer me solutions, offer me alternatives and I decline &lt;br&gt; … It's the end of Jamaa as we know it&lt;br&gt; It's the end of Jamaa as we know it &lt;br&gt; It's the end of Jamaa as we know it and I feel fine &lt;br&gt; And I still tell my buddies I feel fine (I feel fine)''

==Chapter 5: Mountains Sit In a Line==
It was next week. Two lands - Kimbara and Jamaa Township - were officially divided from Jamaa by themselves. Now Jamaa didn’t have its capital. What would they do without it? The alphas - Sir Gilbert, mostly - thought of alternatives. On a late Monday night, animals gathered to near the animals’ decisions. Liza stepped out, followed by no one. Everyone was confused. As smoke whipped onto itself in the air, Liza coughed, “Unfortunately, Sir Gilbert has had to miss this event. Greeley and Peck have both sadly died from a strange disease. Graham is busy working on a medicine. We will try to do our har- HACK!” 

Liza uncontrollably coughed. No one could hear the news. But it didn’t matter. Soon the smoke entered the lungs of animals, making them fall to the floor instead of breathing. Were they dying? Smoke continued to rise and fall, all from the fires before. This would all lead to Jamaa falling apart, both politically and physically. Later that night, another hurricane smacked the face of Jamaa. A sleepy eagle, humming to himself, looked upward to the sky, from a very distant place. He was someone who was looking for shelter, but none of the very few who did bad things. The eagle coughed at the smoke, listening to the news from a poorly made TV.

He looked to it, seeing it was covering a hurricane. “Hmmm…” The TV paused, just as a volcano erupted. Despite the raging hurricane, dangerous seas, and rough winds, everyone stayed calm in a line of cars, all waiting to leave their lands in case they, any day it could be true, fell to a natural disaster or political shenanigan. Volcanos started erupting all over for some reason, and the eagle could sense it as a warning for something much, much worse. Just by that day, Sir Gilbert had both his birth day and his date with death. The eagle was one of the nurses. “Are you okay, Sir?” he said, entering the room to check on Sir Gilbert. Leaping Bravebear, Lucky Blueboy, Lieutenant Bulkybug, and Little Boldbean were also doctors coming to see if the tiger alpha was okay.

Presents stacked beside him, Sir Gilbert laughed and weakly said, “I’m fine. A little buggy and sick, but I feel fine. Such wonderful birthday presents.” The nurses, however, knew he was not okay at all. In fact, today was the day he might die. They assumed he was going to die. The eagle, named Legit Berrybird, held out his wing to see if Sir Gilbert was hot or not. He was very warm - enough to be considered an extremely serious fever. “Is it warm here, Sir?” Lucky asked, surprised by the news. The alpha chuckled and rasped, “It’s not warm…“ Lieutenant noticed something and quickly addressed, “He’s very pale, and Sir, you have a very high fever.” He smiled, reaching for the last bit of birthday cake and a jellybean. Yet a blinding light flickered from under his bed. 

Suddenly, the light enlarged and exploded. Sir Gilbert disappeared within the dust. No one was quite sure if he was alive, and he most definitely wasn’t. A dead, half-burnt body lie still on the bed, smiling helplessly. “No…” Little said, taking his paws over Gilbert’s. “You’re gone…” Everyone bowed their heads. For the next few weeks, the lands soon drifted apart. Collisions and explosions continued and continued. Everyone was worried, despite the false reminders. Even the people who made up the reminders and had secret hopes were scared. Most jammers were even willing to admit their crushes, embarrassments, mistakes, and secrets. It was end of their life that was near.

Eventually the animals died in and left each land. Kimbara of drought, Mt Shiveer of major ice age, Jamaa Township of earthquake, Crystal Sands of fighting, Coral Canyons of flood, and Sarepia Forest…it already burned down and eventually sunk. The only survivor was Appondale, and animals crowded there. For after what seemed like years the lands remaining collided and formed a mountain range. Jamaa was reuniting. Animals rushed to their old, destroyed homes. Although they probably would die soon anyway, at least they could get a view of their old homes. The smoke in the air killed them. 

And that’s the story of the end of Jamaa. Or it’s animals, at least.
…

''It’s the end of Jamaa as we know it &lt;br&gt; it’s the end of Jamaa as we know it &lt;br&gt; Its the end of Jamaa as we know it and I still feel fine &lt;br&gt; it’s the end of Jamaa as we know it…''</text>
